title: Hasbro Wordle The Party Game for 2-4 Players, Official Wordle Board Game Inspired by New York Times Wordle Game, Party Games for Ages 14+, Word Games
description: PLAY WORDLE IN REAL LIFE WITH FRIENDS: Inspired by the popular digital version, Wordle: The Party Game features the same gameplay fans love, but players compete in real life to solve the Wordle    THE WORD IS PARTY: Swap solo play for social with this analog version of the Wordle game Players take turns writing down a 5-letter Secret Word. The others try to guess it in the fewest tries to win    UNLIMITED PLAY WITH DRY-ERASE BOARDS: No more waiting for a new Wordle game Use the Wordle dry-erase boards and markers to play as many rounds as there are players. Replay again and again    4 WAYS TO WORDLE: Try the classic play or 3 variations In fast mode, players race to solve the Wordle first. In timed mode, beat the clock—or receive more points. Or compete in groups with team mode    FRIENDS & FAMILY GAME NIGHT: Break out this fun game for evenings with friends or family game nights. For ages 14 and up, it’s a great gift for adults, teens, Wordle fans, and word puzzle lovers

Laurie4.0 out of 5 stars
A New Favorite in Game Night: Hasbro's Wordle The Party Game
Reviewed in Canada on February 20, 2024Verified Purchase
As a lover of word games and a connoisseur of party entertainment, my anticipation was high when I heard about Hasbro's adaptation of the wildly popular New York Times Wordle game into a board game format. "Wordle The Party Game" promised to bring the addictive challenge of the online sensation right to our tabletops, and it has delivered magnificently. This game has quickly ascended to the top of my list for group activities, merging the joy of word puzzles with the dynamic fun of playing with friends and family.From the first game night we introduced it, "Wordle The Party Game" became an instant hit among my circle. Designed for 2-4 players and suitable for ages 14 and up, it has proven to be a versatile game that appeals to a wide range of players, from casual word enthusiasts to more competitive puzzle solvers. The game beautifully captures the essence of the digital version's daily challenge, encouraging players to deduce the secret word with as few guesses as possible, but adds a communal twist that elevates the experience.The gameplay is intuitive yet stimulating, requiring each player to guess a five-letter word within six tries, using deduction to narrow down the possibilities. What makes the board game version stand out is the way it transforms a solitary guessing game into an interactive competition. Players take turns being the "Wordle Host," setting the word for others to guess, which adds a delightful element of strategy and anticipation to the mix.The quality and design of the game components are top-notch, as expected from Hasbro. The board, tiles, and playing pieces are durable and well-crafted, ensuring that the game can withstand the excitement of countless game nights. Additionally, the game setup and rules are straightforward, making it easy for new players to jump right in and for veterans of the digital Wordle to feel right at home.One of the aspects I appreciate most about "Wordle The Party Game" is its educational value, subtly woven into the fun. It's a brilliant way to expand vocabulary, sharpen spelling skills, and enhance critical thinking, all within the context of a highly engaging game. Moreover, the social interaction it fosters, from the shared triumphs of guessing a word correctly to the collective groans of a miss, brings a heartwarming sense of connection and camaraderie to our gatherings.In conclusion, "Wordle The Party Game" by Hasbro has been a fantastic addition to my collection of party games. It strikes a perfect balance between challenging and entertaining, making it a suitable choice for a wide array of occasions, from casual family nights to more spirited gatherings with friends. If you're a fan of word games or looking for a fresh way to spice up your game nights, I highly recommend giving this game a try. It's not just a game; it's a celebration of words, wit, and the joy of discovery shared with those you enjoy spending time with.

description: Duo, the number 1 selling multi-cooker, combines 7 kitchen appliances in 1, Pressure Cooker, Slow Cooker, Rice Cooker, Steamer, Sauté, Yogurt Maker and Warmer, prepares dishes up to 70% faster to support your busy lifestyle    Features 14 Smart Programs - Soup, Meat/Stew, Bean/Chili, Poultry, Sauté/Simmer, Rice, Multigrain, Porridge, Steam, Slow Cook, Keep Warm, Yogurt, Manual, and Pressure Cook. Now, your favorite dishes are as easy as pressing a button    Healthy, stainless steel (18/8) inner cooking pot made from food grade 304, no chemical coating, 3-ply bottom for even heat distribution, fully sealed environment traps the flavours, nutrients and aromas within the food    Built with the latest 3rd generation technology, the microprocessor monitors pressure, temperature, keeps time, and adjusts heating intensity and duration to achieve your desired results every time    UL and ULC certified with 10 safety mechanisms to provide you with added assurance, designed to eliminate many common errors    Accessories include, stainless steel steam rack with handles, rice paddle, soup spoon, measuring cup, condensation collector and recipe booklet

user_reviews:
JS5.0 out of 5 stars
Instantly Turns Janes And Joes Into Pros!
Reviewed in Canada on January 2, 2019Size: 8QtStyle: Instant PotVerified Purchase




                    The media could not be loaded.
                



 I am an admittedly terrible cook when it comes to traditional means of using a stove and I imagine that my cooking is a slight step up from eating canned dog food, but the Instant Pot has entirely changed this.This thing is friendly for cooking dummies like myself.  There are tons of delicious recipes online that are easy to follow and once everything is in the pot, you simply start a timer and that's it. Once the timer is done, open the valve to release the steam and once the steam has released, dinner is served. There is literally nothing to screw up during the cooking process; it's simple and ingenious.The Instant Pot works by using pressure from steam to significantly shorten cooking times meaning more time for you to do other fun things like hanging out with your significant other, or watching TV, or both!  We've made 'fall off the bone' ribs in about 45 mins (including creating the sauté and taking into account warming up and steam release) that were comparable in taste to ribs that had been slow cooked for 4 hrs. We've also used it to make homemade soups as it takes much less time for the flavour in the ingredients in the soup to trickle into the soup vs traditional boiling over a stove. Chicken in ten minutes? You bet. Perfectly cooked hard boiled eggs in under 5 minutes and delicious cheesecake in under an hour (including steam release) were all no problem for even a simpleton like myself to make, and best of all, everything actually tastes great too!!  I've included pictures of a few of the things we've made using the Instant Pot.  Yes, all of the food pictures in this review were made using the Instant Pot!When it comes to cooking, there aren't too many things out there that are game changers, but an air fryer, a sous vide and an Instant Pot are, and if you happen to have all three, congratulations for having the trifecta of cooking greatness in your kitchen!PROS* So easy to use that even guys that literally can't cook (me) can look like a rock star. Once everything is in the pot, you set the timer and go. Once it's done, open the valve to release the steam and dinner is served. There literally is nothing to screw up and best of all, the food is delicious!* The Instant Pot significantly shortens cooking time of most things, freeing up your valuable time to do other fun things! :P* There are literally tons and tons of delicious recipes online. Guaranteed you will discover there are things that you can make in the Instant Pot that you never knew could be made in an Instant Pot.* Goodbye slow cooker. That was so the 70's.* Easy to clean. The pot is stainless steel and the lid can be removed and fully submerged. The seal on the lid comes off and replacement seals for the lid can be purchased when it eventually wears out.CONS* Too many models just make for mass confusion.  Have a look at my TIPS section for some help.* Expensive, so wait for a sale if you can as they do on sale, especially for big events like Boxing Day, Black Friday, etc.TIPS* Don't get too caught up with the "x-in-1" features. They just add a preset cooking time for a type of food to the Instant Pot and up the "in-1" number. You can just manually input the cooking time yourself.* The most important thing is determining the size of the Instant Pot that you need. For our family of 4, we went for the 8 quart esp. since the wife likes to make home made soups.* The Lux model does not have low pressure cooking while Duo models have both high and low pressure. Low pressure cooking is typically used to make delicate foods like yogurt, eggs and veggies. If you don't think you'll make yogurt, eggs or veggies in the Instant Pot, just get the Lux model which skips the low pressure. Pro tip: Cooking rice uses high pressure.* Take the Instant Pot outdoors to release the steam when doing a quick release or it will quickly smell up the house of whatever you're making. Use a glove or mitt to be safe.* When making a lot of food, esp. soups, mind the max line. If you want less chance to have a mess on the bottom of the lid, go an inch under the max line.* Be careful when releasing the steam.  I've included a video of what a fast release of the steam looks like.  You don't want your bare hand anywhere close to that hot steam.  Read the instruction manual!!!  Seriously, read it.
Read more

The Ultimate Kitchen Multi-Tasker!
Reviewed in Canada on July 26, 2023Size: 6QtStyle: Instant PotVerified Purchase
As an occasional and budding home cook, the 6-quart Instant Pot Duo 7-in-1 Electric Pressure Cooker has been a complete game-changer in my kitchen! This versatile kitchen appliance has become my go-to for whipping up delicious meals with minimal effort and maximum flavor.First and foremost, the 7-in-1 functionality is mind-blowing. It's like having a team of kitchen gadgets in one sleek and compact device. From pressure cooking to slow cooking, rice cooking, steaming, sautéing, yogurt making, and warming, this Instant Pot does it all!The pressure cooking feature is the real star of the show. It significantly reduces cooking times, making it a lifesaver on busy weeknights. Whether I'm preparing tender stews, fall-off-the-bone ribs, or flavor-packed soups, the Instant Pot never fails to deliver perfectly cooked meals in a fraction of the time.The slow cooker function is equally impressive. It lets me set it and forget it, making it incredibly convenient for days when I'm occupied with other tasks. The result? Melt-in-your-mouth pulled pork, rich and hearty chili, or tender pot roasts that are sure to impress.Rice cooking has never been easier. The Instant Pot consistently produces fluffy and perfectly cooked rice, taking away the guesswork and hassle from traditional stovetop methods.I was initially skeptical about the yogurt-making feature, but it turned out to be a pleasant surprise. Homemade yogurt is not only healthier but also more cost-effective, and the Instant Pot handles the process like a pro.The sauté function is perfect for browning meats and sautéing onions and garlic before pressure cooking. It's a fantastic all-in-one tool that reduces the number of pots and pans I need to wash.The 6-quart capacity is ideal for feeding a family or having leftovers for the next day. The stainless steel inner pot is easy to clean, and the exterior stays cool to the touch during cooking, ensuring safety and convenience.The user-friendly control panel with pre-set cooking options and a delay start feature makes meal planning a breeze. Additionally, the included accessories like the steam rack, serving spoon, and measuring cup are thoughtful additions that add to the overall value.In summary, the 6-quart Instant Pot Duo 7-in-1 Electric Pressure Cooker is an absolute must-have for any kitchen. Its versatility, efficiency, and convenience have transformed the way I cook, saving me time and effort without compromising on taste. If you're looking for a kitchen multi-tasker that delivers exceptional results, look no further than the Instant Pot Duo - it's truly a game-changer!

title: Hismile v34 Colour Corrector | Tooth Stain Removal | Purple Toothpaste | Colour Correcting Tooth Stains | Hismile V34 | Hismile Colour Corrector | Tooth Colour Corrector
description: V34 Colour Corrector utilises colour correcting technology. Purple is directly opposite yellow on the colour wheel and is therefore its complementary colour, so a water-soluble purple dye is applied to your teeth to cancel out any yellow undertones.    HIsmile's V34 is a non-invasive brightening treatment. Simply apply the v34 Colour Corrector to your toothbrush like a regular toothpaste, and brush!    V34's Colour Corrector's combination of two water-soluble dyes allow for any shade of yellow to be cancelled for the brightest smile, without leaving behind any residue.    Hismile V34 is intended for people who are looking to further brighten their teeth post-whitening, or already have a very white tooth shade and don’t require a full treatment from the Teeth Whitening Kit. Oxidising tooth stains with PAP+ increases the lightness and reduces the saturation of yellow stains, whereas V34 balances the warm and cool tones (hue) in your teeth to reveal a more vibrant shade of white.    1x V34 Color Corrector. Total Net Contents: 30ml | 1 fl oz

"This thing was hyped up online, but after using it for almost a month, I haven't seen any results. However, I've experienced quite a few side effects. It causes dilation of blood vessels in your head, leading to a throbbing headache, and this throbbing sensation lasts for a long time, after taking the medication every day, after exercising, and after sweating on the head. If I were to rate the pain on a scale of 1-10, I'd say this throbbing pain could reach level 2-3 not negligible, not unbearable, but its prolonged presence still significantly affects one's mood and emotions. I've also heard that this thing can indeed cause low blood pressure, so friends with low blood pressure, please use it with caution. I'll continue using it for six months, and if there are no results, I'll reconsider my rating."

Report
Adam5.0 out of 5 stars
New iPhone used and seriously impressed
Reviewed in Canada on November 25, 2023Style: USB-C ConnectorVerified Purchase
I was a Samsung android user for about 15 years and finally decided to make the switch to iPhone with the new 15 Pro lineup, as I love my  M1 MBP and I have been following Apple  products from afar since. Now that the 15 lineup is USB C, I decided to go all in on the Apple ecosystem.I am blown away by these airpods. Thankfully the second gens come with XS ear tips, because that's the only size that doesn't slowly push themselves out of my ear.But let me get to what I really love about these things:- the seamless transfer of connection between my M1 macbook pro and iPhone. It happens in about 1.5 seconds flat as soon as I begin playing audio/video on another device. And somehow it also knows when I don't need it to transfer?! I don't even know.-the charging speed of the pods themseld. I think I just popped them into the case for 10 mins, less than 15 for sure, and they jumped from 18% charge to 80% just like that.-transparency and noise cancellation. Remarkable and I use both depending on my environment. Haven't really found a use for Adaptive mode after a while, but that's ok. When you're walking on a busy street, noise cancellation is so soothing. Drowns out like 90-95% of the traffic sounds.-conversational awareness is great too, but I generally leave it off unless I'm in a grocery store or somewhere that I might need to interrupt the audio by speaking to someone for a few seconds. Only time I use it.- Con: they're super slippery! I have dropped the pods a couple of times because of this, especially when you get any skin oils on them, but no damage so far. I also just got a silicone cover for the charging case, in hopes that the pods don't just eject themselves when you drop the whole case on the floor. I think that fixed my concern in some quick tests from a 2 foot drop on carpet, because I've seen them eject from that height before.BONUS: These airpod pro 2s with USB C have a special feature that lightning cable pro 2s do not! Lossless audio, but this only applies to using them with the Vision Pro. I probably won't but the Vision Pro any time soon, but it's good to know that I will have that feature should I ever get them in the future.Buy these at full price or especially buy them when you see them 10-17% off. You will NOT be disappointed.

The best earbuds I’ve ever owned
Reviewed in Canada on March 16, 2024Style: USB-C ConnectorVerified Purchase
I was using Google Pixel Buds Pro with my iPhone 11 for less than a year, and I was satisfied, until they stopped holding a charge last week. I was pretty upset when they stopped working because I use earbuds most of the day while I’m working, and even at home. This week I was reading reviews on several top quality earbuds and I was almost sold on Bose because I have always enjoyed the sound quality of Bose products, in my opinion they are one of the highest quality speakers in the industry. Bose and Apple AirPod Pro 2nd generation are nearly identical in quality and performance from the dozens of reviews that I read. The only reason I chose Apple is because I am an iPhone user, and the functions and features of these earbuds work seamlessly with iPhones. Where as, the Bose earbuds require an additional app to control the features on an iPhone, such as spacial audio, noise cancellation, transparency mode, etc. I also really like that the earbuds themselves, as well as the charging case are able to be tracked or located with Apple’s native FindMy app, this is huge, no more loosing my earbuds when I fall asleep while they are in use. Overall, I am very happy with this product, and I look forward to seeing how well the noise canceling system works on the shooting range, my shooting partner swears by his Airpod Pro 1st generation, so I can’t wait to see how 2nd generation compares.

These game-changing items trigger spectacular moments you have to see to believe…Witness pipes coming alive, wreak havoc as a giant spiky ball, and see even more unexpected events called Wonder Effects.

Highly recommended for its ability to deliver joy and excitement to players of all ages.

title: Nintendo Entertainment System NES Classic Edition
description: Ideal for collectors or anyone who enjoys video games, the Nintendo entertainment system: NES classic edition lets you live out the good old days of gaming like never before    The system comes bundled with an HDMI cable, an ac adapter, one NES classic controller, and all 30 games, installed and ready-to-play    The system is also compatible with the classic controller and classic controller pro, but additional NES classic controllers will be sold separately    Each NES classic controller can be plugged into a Wii remote controller for use with NES virtual console games on the Wii u system
nav: Video Games › Legacy Systems › Nintendo Systems › Nintendo NES › Consoles
user_reviews:
Keith5.0 out of 5 stars
Nostalgia at its best!!
Reviewed in Canada on November 15, 2016Edition: NESVerified Purchase
Great little console to relive your childhood memories.  Like everyone else before me stated the controller cord is annoyingly short but I will get an extension when they are back in stock. As for the games, there are many classics on board that helped to define the gaming industry as a whole and it is definately a solid lineup. I own an original NES with many of the games that come in this but the convenience factor of not having to switch cartridges, blow in them, or replace 72-pin connectors is a huge help.  So not pay these scalper prices and patiently wait for more stock.On a side note even the best interface is highly polished. If you leave the system on the main menu and walk away for a minute it starts to demo clips from all of the installed titles in a cool way. The 4 save states for the games is a huge help as well and has a lock feature so it's harder to overwrite a save.  Definately worth the price and I wish everyone luck in the restocks.

Report
Josiah5.0 out of 5 stars
A great product that should be purchased at $79.99, rather than the reseller prices. Wait for them to come back into stock.
Reviewed in Canada on November 26, 2016Edition: NESVerified PurchaseNintendo Entertainment System NES Classic Edition
Quick Look: Excellent system that comes with 30 games. Great value at $79.99 CDN. Worth a look for anyone who likes retro gaming, or wants to experience these old games for the first time.When the NES Classic was announced, I was very excited. I actually still have my original NES with many games, but there were quite a few on here that I do not own outside of the Mario games, and thus I was very pleased with the selection. Plus it is nice to have backups just in case the originals stop working at some point.The system itself is small and can be held in the palm of your hand. This is a great advantage for storage or transport, but unfortunately the cable length for the controller is rather short.As far as how the system works, the dashboard that displays the games is fantastic and very easy to use. Each game has several suspend points (otherwise known as save slots), so you can have multiple saves. This is especially useful if you have more than one player in the household, and it allows everyone to maintain their saved game.As mentioned before, the selection of games is wonderful. It has several that are hard to get original cartridges of these days, and so it fills a nice gap in that regard. I was overjoyed to own Mega Man 2 again (a game I lost as a child and never found again), and have spent extensive time playing through Final Fantasy. The emulation of the games themselves is essentially flawless.Overall, if you are a gaming fan, this is a must buy. However, don't buy it at the inflated prices of the resellers. Wait for it to come back into stock.Pros:Great game selectionDashboard is very easy to useSave points/save states/suspend pointsHDMI hook up makes it easy to game with newer televisionsPerfect emulationDifferent display modes for more retro looksCons:The HDMI cable is shortThe controller cable is shortAll things considered, this is a must buy for any gamer, and especially those who are Nintendo fans.

Maqbar Ackbar5.0 out of 5 stars
WAVE OF NOSTALGIA
Reviewed in Canada on December 16, 2016Edition: NESVerified Purchase
This is a truly amazing product.  Hardly anything is ever so simple anymore.  You just plug it in and turn it on.  It boots up almost instantly thanks to everything being solid state.  The main menu is straight simple and well designed.  Simply scroll left or right to the game icon you want and select it.  Games start up instantly and everything is exactly the same as I remember.  Same graphics, colours and sounds.  Like...exactly the same, rendered in that signature Nintendo 8 bit sound.  It is no surprise to me that this is the Hottest Christmas Item of 2016.  Too bad it's almost impossible to find in stock anywhere.  But once that changes, just go ahead and buy it.  What a faithfully made product from a very elegant idea.

Report
Mr. Ir4.0 out of 5 stars
Good but not great
Reviewed in Canada on May 14, 2017Edition: NESVerified Purchase
Before I get into the review of the product, I would like to point out that out of all of the online retailers, Amazon handled the very limited restock of the NES Classic the best. They restricted it to Prime members and it was a limit of 1 per customer for a specific period of time before you could re-order. The restock was also staggered and more units were released bit by bit on the same day instead of all at once. This gave many different people a chance to grab one. Many other online retailers released all of the stock at once and this led to many people not being fast enough to compete with the dedicated bots or canceled orders after purchase was confirmed which led to many disappointed Nintendo fans. I believe Amazon deserves some praise for enforcing restrictions for the re-stock.Now on to the NES Classic:There are 30 games built into this plug and play console by Nintendo and there is no way to expand the game count officially. Some people criticized Nintendo for this but I think 30 games was a good choice and an expansion would have made no sense since Nintendo claimed that this product would only have a limited release window. However, you did receive Nintendo's best first party titles for the console such as Mario, Zelda, Metroid and Kirby but you also got some well-regarded third party titles such as Mega Man 2, Ninja Gaiden, Castlevania, and Final Fantasy. Overall, the selection is just okay. Personally, some of the weaker titles such as: Castlevania 2, Balloon Fight, Galaga, Ice Climber, Mario Bros and Super C should have been removed and been replaced with: River City Ransom, Dragon Warrior 4, Contra, Bionic Commando, Duck Tales, and Gun Nac. Also, the Donkey Kong games should have been bundled as the Donkey Kong Classics game to save a slot.The build of the product is good for the most part. The console itself is solid with a working power and reset buttons. The controller is fantastic and has an excellent directional pad and very responsive buttons. The only problem with the build is that the cord for the controller is too short. If you are playing on a TV, you will need to either buy an extender for the controller or a USB or HDMI extender for the console if you want the console close to you so you can change games or use suspend points on the fly. I was disappointed that it only came with one controller. Nintendo could have saved on packaging if they just bundled an extra controller in and raised the price by $10. The Nintendo Classic was meant to be played with friends and many of the third party controllers available for the NES Classic cannot compare to the one Nintendo made.All the games are emulated on this console and if you do not enable Game Mode on your TV, you will encounter input lag which will make it very annoying to play games that require high precision such as the Super Mario Bros series. While the emulation is much better than what we saw on the Virtual Console for these games, it is by no means perfect. There are sound issues with Mega Man 2 that are very noticeable but the biggest issue is that anti-epilepsy protection in the emulator which makes one of the games, Punch-Out, too slow and therefore unbeatable. This has been tested extensively and the final boss cannot be beaten in that game. The menu interface that the emulator runs is great - it is aesthetically pleasing showcasing the game art and basic information for each game and the music is catchy. There are also different video options you can enable. Personally, I think you get the best experience with the 4:3 default setting.Pros:-Aesthetically pleasing (both the box and console)-The best first party titles are built-in-Easy to set up-Suspend points for tough games-Responsive controllerCons:-Emulation accuracy is the biggest con making one game unbeatable-Input lag if your TV does not have Game Mode-Third party titles could have been better-Controller length is too short (2 feet) but this can be remedied at a low cost-Second controller must be purchased separately (authentic Nintendo Classic controllers were rarer than the console itself)Overall, the Nintendo Classic is definitely worth the MSRP of 79.99 CAD but since it has been discontinued, it is next to impossible to find it for that price. Realistically, if you want to buy it from a re-seller, it is not worth more than $120.00 CAD. Out of the box, the accuracy issue with the emulator itself is very hard to overlook and the game selection for the third parties definitely needed to be better if you intend to play this console. If you are a collector and only collecting it for the aesthetics, then it might be worth more to you since it is an officially licensed Nintendo product and it looks very nice.

Fredo5.0 out of 5 stars
The real deal
Reviewed in Canada on July 10, 2023Colour Name: Retro GrayVerified Purchase
This is a genuine Miyoo Mini Plus, and I'm glad I finally got my hands on one. The screen on this is very good, with a sharp and vibrant image quality.My unit came with an up-to-date Bios already pre-installed along with the default operating system, as well as a pile of games. The provided carrying case is good quality as well.----------Definitely switch the OS to Onion though. I strongly recommend going to "Joey's Retro Handhelds" on Youtube and looking for his video titled "MIYOO MINI PLUS Ultimate Setup Guide - OnionOS, Roms, Box Art and Tweaks" for a really good run down on how/where to get Onion OS up and running (I have no affiliation with this youtuber, I just found his video to be excellent).----------The price with exchange rate here in Canada is a bit more than MSRP, but I did get a case and a hefty library of ROMs, as well as a screen protector. With that in mind I'm happy with my purchase. This emulator is good quality all around, and plays everything I want to play really well.One thing to note, the provided screen protector is slightly smaller than the screen itself, but once installed it's obvious that it covers the actual screen, so long as you install the protector dead-center.I definitely recommend. It's just the right size for portability and usability, and the d-pad is top notch.

title: Meta Quest 2 — Advanced All-In-One Virtual Reality Headset 128 GB
description: Experience total immersion with 3D positional audio, hand tracking and easy-to-use controllers working together to make virtual worlds feel real.    Explore an expanding universe of over 500 titles across gaming, fitness, social/multiplayer and entertainment, including exclusive releases and totally unique VR experiences.    Enjoy fast, smooth gameplay and immersive graphics as high-speed action unfolds around you with a fast processor and immersive graphics.    Travel universes in blockbuster fantasies, scare yourself witless in horror adventures or squad up with friends to save the universe.    Come together in incredible social spaces and multiplayer arenas as you take in live events with friends and family, find your new workout crew or join adventures with fellow players. Be truly free to explore in VR with a wireless headset, intuitive controls, a built-in battery, easy setup and no PC or console needed.*    Play without worries by setting your designated play space and get alerts if you move outside it.    With no extra equipment needed, Quest 2 is portable to take with you, wherever you go in the physical world.    See child safety guidance online; Accounts for 10+. nav: Video Games › Virtual Reality › Stand-Alone Hardware › Accessories
user_reviews:
Simon D G5.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent VR headset. I highly recommend for beginners.
Reviewed in Canada on March 17, 2024Style: Meta Quest 2 128GBVerified Purchase
It's a very affordable VR set that offers hours of fun if you have a few VR games to go along with it. I recommend getting a link cable and connecting it to your PC if you have a strong enough PC that can run VR games, like on Steam VR. The headset's games aren't bad, but they don't really come close to games like Skyrim VR with mods, Subnautica or Alien: Isolation. You can do many things with this headset, from visiting people in the Meta Verse to Netflix to training your cardio with apps and games available in the integrated app store.It's very intuitive and the tutorial game that comes with the headset covers pretty much anything you need to know. If you never used a VR headset, don't worry about it. It's more organic than a regular PC or console game. You get to learn how it works almost naturally.It seems quite durable. If you respect your self-imposed VR zone, you shouldn't hit anything with it. Be mindful of obstacles, pets and people in your environment. Personally I recommend having an outside noise as some kind of safety device ( ex: a fan ) to help you relocate yourself in the real world while you have the headset on, otherwise you may end up somewhere without even noticing it.Once again, you could potentially connect to your computer with a link cable and gain access to your desktop - yep, no need for a real keyboard or mouse - to fully use the potential of your Quest 2. It has an integrated mic that is very good.You may get VR sickness as I did when I first began using it ( it was my first VR experience ) but over time you will get used to it and the more you use it the longer you'll be able to play. You just need to stop when you feel dizzy, don't push yourself. Take a break every hour, especially when playing physically demanding games.Many movies on Youtube VR aren't very good quality but are still fun to watch - some may be a bit pixelised due to their weaker resolution. However you have a decent amount of free movies available within the Meta library itself which are very high quality and very entertaining and relaxing ( swimming with dolphins, traveling through space, and more ).The main question is: what will you invest in it? Because I think a lot of people will buy a VR headset and once the novelty runs off, they'll stop using it. So you need to think if you plan on gaming a lot with this thing to be worth it. You will need to buy at least a couple of games at some point to feel like you have something to do with this headset because the little free games won't be enough after a few days of playing.The only issue I have is the battery that won't last long - personally I'm always plugged in when I used it because otherwise the battery drains quite fast.

title: Salonpas Pain Relieving Patch – 40 Patches
description: SALONPAS provides fast & long lasting relief directly at the site of pain without going through the digestive system.    Topical patch formulated with 3 pain fighting ingredients    For temporary relief of pain associated with muscle pain, arthritic pain, simple backache, sprains
nav: Health & Personal Care › Health Care › Over-the-Counter Medication › Hot & Cold Therapies › Heat Patches
user_reviews:
Amanda Montgomery5.0 out of 5 stars
My go-to for my daily chronic pain & MIGRAINES
Reviewed in Canada on May 10, 2023Verified Purchase
I have been using Salonpas topical pain reliever patches for a few years now, and they have truly been a game-changer for me. As someone who battles both fibromyalgia and chronic migraines, finding effective pain relief has often felt like an endless quest. However, these patches have exceeded my expectations in more ways than one. Plus they are so affordable!First and foremost, Salonpas patches have become my faithful companion in managing the relentless pain of fibromyalgia. The discreet patches adhere securely to my skin, allowing me to experience targeted relief exactly where I need it most. I also like that I can immediately put on any of my braces on top of the patch, unlike topical creams. (see picture) Unlike other topical creams I've tried in the past, these patches provide lasting comfort that extends for hours. This longevity is especially crucial when dealing with fibromyalgia, as the pain can persist throughout the day and night. With Salonpas patches, I can confidently say goodbye to the constant reapplication of creams that never seem to last for me.Furthermore, when it comes to tackling my chronic migraines, these patches have proven to be a true godsend. The versatility of Salonpas patches allows me to apply them directly to the source of my pain, whether it's my forehead or the back of my neck. It may look funny, but it gets the job done! The soothing sensation that ensues is truly remarkable, as it eases the intensity of my migraines and provides a sense of relief that is often hard to come by. I appreciate how the patches effectively target the specific area, enabling me to carry on with my day without being held hostage by migraines. Depending upon where the migraine is I will sometimes cut the patches in half so they fit to the area better.Beyond the incredible pain relief they provide, I also admire the practicality and convenience of Salonpas patches. The packaging is compact and portable, making it easy for me to carry them in my purse or pocket, ensuring that relief is always within reach. The patches are quick and simple to apply, and their discrete nature allows me to wear them comfortably under clothing without drawing attention.Lastly, I must commend Salonpas for their commitment to quality. The patches are designed with a gentle adhesive that adheres firmly to the skin without causing any irritation or discomfort. This is particularly important for those with sensitive skin like myself, as I have experienced adverse reactions to other similar products in the past. The fact that Salonpas patches are gentle, yet highly effective, sets them apart from the rest.In conclusion, I wholeheartedly recommend Salonpas topical pain reliever patches to anyone seeking relief from any sort of chronic pain, like fibromyalgia or chronic migraines or even injuries. These patches have become an essential part of my pain management routine, offering lasting comfort and targeted relief that surpasses traditional topical creams. With Salonpas patches, I no longer have to endure the relentless pain; instead, I can regain control of my life and embrace each day with renewed hope.

Each time it stimulated appetite like other artificial sweeteners and was so unpalatably sweet I couldn't finish the drink.I'm diabetic and don't eat anything sweet at all, not even fruit, but also as a diabetic I need extra magnesium so the gummies were a trade-off. They were OK, soft and tasted delicious if overly sweet. The drink mix is another matter. I tried diluting it in twice the water and it helped a little - it's 2 tsp to a cup of water.The sweetener is stevia which is said to be natural and it is in its pure leaf form, but this is a lab extract and although it beats the other artificial sweeteners on the market, I find it overwhelming.It tastes like raspberry lemonade, refreshing and pleasant and it made the water slightly fizzy which was a nice touch. Most people will love this and the product is of excellent quality. My situation is in the definite minority so do give it a try.

AmazonDailyShopper5.0 out of 5 stars
Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 Release) - Your Gateway to a Smarter Home with Alexa
Reviewed in Canada on January 4, 2024Colour Name: CharcoalConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase
I recently upgraded to the Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release), and I am thrilled to share my experience with this smart speaker that seamlessly integrates into my daily routine. The Charcoal color adds a touch of sophistication to its compact design. Here's why I highly recommend the Echo Dot for those looking to enhance their smart home experience:Intuitive Voice Control with Alexa:The Echo Dot is powered by Alexa, Amazon's voice-controlled virtual assistant. With just your voice, you can ask Alexa to play music, answer questions, provide news updates, control smart home devices, and much more. The intuitive voice control makes interacting with your smart home effortless.Improved Speaker Quality:The 5th Gen Echo Dot comes with improved speaker quality, delivering clearer and more robust sound for music, podcasts, and voice interactions. The audio enhancement enhances the overall user experience, making it a great addition to any room.Compact and Stylish Design:The compact design of the Echo Dot makes it easy to place in various locations around your home. The Charcoal color adds a sleek and stylish touch, blending seamlessly with different interior aesthetics. It's not just a functional device but also an aesthetic addition to your living space.Smart Home Integration:The Echo Dot serves as a central hub for controlling your smart home devices. Whether it's adjusting the thermostat, turning off lights, or locking doors, Alexa's compatibility with various smart home platforms makes the Echo Dot a valuable tool for home automation.Seamless Multi-Room Audio:If you have multiple Echo devices in your home, the Echo Dot allows for seamless multi-room audio. You can create speaker groups, play music in different rooms simultaneously, or enjoy synchronized audio throughout your home for an immersive experience.Drop-In and Communication Features:The Echo Dot facilitates easy communication within your home. Use the Drop-In feature to connect with other Echo devices in your home or make hands-free calls. This is particularly useful for checking in on family members or coordinating activities.Up-to-Date Information:Stay informed with the latest news, weather updates, and traffic reports simply by asking Alexa. The Echo Dot keeps you connected with real-time information, providing valuable insights for your day.Constant Software Updates:Being an Amazon device, the Echo Dot receives regular software updates, ensuring that you always have access to the latest features and improvements. This commitment to updates adds long-term value to your smart home investment.In summary, the Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) stands out as a reliable and versatile smart speaker. With Alexa's capabilities, improved audio quality, and seamless integration into your smart home ecosystem, it offers a comprehensive solution for voice-controlled tasks and entertainment. I highly recommend the Echo Dot to anyone looking to elevate their home with the convenience and intelligence of a smart speaker.

The Tech Guy4.0 out of 5 stars
Amazon Does it Again - Marginal Improvements in Sound, Touch Control and Better Clock Display
Reviewed in Canada on October 25, 2022Colour Name: CharcoalConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase
The Echo Dot continues to be Amazon's most popular and affordable smart speaker  The New Gen 5 speaker looks identical  to the Gen 4 version however there are some key features inside that may be important to you and you should know about before purchasing.••• Design & Size •••This new Echo Dot Gen 5 speaker is the exactly the same size as the previous Gen 4 Speaker100mm x 100mm x 89mm.Both speakers share the same spherical design and are about the size of a softball.  (I’m not a big fan of the baseball shape but it looks like it’s here to stay for at least another generation).The new Gen 5 Speaker is noticeably heavier than the Gen 4 thanks to the new speaker and electronics inside328g - Gen 4340g - Gen 5Speaker:40.6 mm Full Range speaker in the Gen 4 Dot44.9 mm Full Range speaker in the Gen 5 DotThe Gen 5 Dot has a New High Excursion, Full Range Speaker inside, along with an Accelerometer and temperature sensor.••• Sound Quality •••Amazon claims the New Echo Dot Gen 5 has twice (2x) the bass and 50% less distortion.  I would agree that the new Gen 5 dot does have slightly more bass and marginally less distortion but the differences are subtle and certainly not jaw dropping.The Gen 5 Dot continues to compress heavy bass to enable the 44.9mm full range driver to handle the lower frequencies.  Compression increases the louder you turn the volume up and distortion is reduced slightly.  You still can't turn the volume up past 75% before the distortion is too much.The Echo Dot was intended to be a convenient, compact, inexpensive smart speaker … If you’re looking for better sound for music and streaming consider upgrading to the full size Echo Speaker or Echo Studio Gen 2.••• NEW FEATURES •••Temperature Sensor:Both models have a temperature sensor installed which can be used to trigger home automation devices and Alexa routines.  So for example you could turn a fan on when the temperature gets hotNew - Accelerometer:The Echo Dot now supports tap gestures thanks to a new accelerometer inside.  You can tap the top of the dot to pause and resume music, end a call or dismiss a timer or alarm.  Some users prefer tap gestures rather than voice commands.  Tapping is also better in the bedroom for example rather than using your voice to cancel the alarm and wake up your partner.New Processor:The Gen 5 Dot has a new AZ2 Neural Edge processor inside.  This makes the New Echo Dot faster and more responsive.  Many commands are processed locally on the device itself rather than in the cloud.  The new processor also provides more power for audio processing.Echo Dot with Clock:The echo dot with clock has a brand new 5x21 high density LED display which is both brighter and easier to read.  The Echo Dot Gen 5 with clock will display the time and date just like the Gen 4 but will also display the name of a song, artist, the weather, a calculator and more.The Echo Dot Gen 5 with clock is currently $20 more than the Echo Show 5.  The Echo Show 5 has a video screen which makes it an excellent alarm clock and more.  The Echo Show 5 sounds as good as the Echo Dot with Clock making the Show a better deal if you want an alarm clock Smart Speaker.No More 3.5MM Jack:The 3.5mm audio output jack has been removed from the New Echo Gen 5 Dot.  If you need a hardwired audio out jack you will want to get the Gen 4 Dot.  The New Gen 5 Dot only supports wireless bluetooth there is no hardwired output option.••• RECOMMENDATION •••The differences between the EchoDot  Gen 4 and Gen 5 from an audio perspective are minor and not worth paying a premium for.  Even with the new speaker larger speaker most users will not notice the difference and have a similar experience with either speaker.The Gen 4 Dot will quickly become a heavily discounted speaker so watch for it on Black Friday, Boxing Day, Prime Days and Deal of the Days while stock lasts.While the Gen 4 Dot will inevitably be cheaper there are some reasons you may with to purchase the Echo Gen 5 now.The display and features of the Gen 5 Dot with CLOCK are much better than the previous GEN 4 and well worth it.  I do not recommend buying the Gen 4 Dot with clock anymore … Get the Gen 5 Clock Dot or Echo Show 5 instead if you want a Smart Speaker Clock.Another reason to get the new Gen 5 Dot is for the Accelerometer which enables tap and touch controls.  These are very convenient and handy.If you’re just using the Echo Dot as a smart assistant and for background music then pick up the Gen 4 Dot when it's on sale.If you’re using your Echo devices for home automation or value the tap controls then the Gen 5 Dot is the one to get.
Read more

Simply prep your base, freeze overnight, process, and enjoy!    Select the Re-spin function if, after processing, you want your processed treat softer and creamier.    Easily customize flavor and texture. Mix in your favorite chocolate, nuts, candy, fruit, and more to personalize any CREAMi treat.
nav: Home & Kitchen › Kitchen & Dining › Small Appliances › Specialty Appliances › Ice Cream Machines
user_reviews:
Rocky Mountain Entrepreneur5.0 out of 5 stars
Totally Loving This Machine! Wow.  Just Like Gelato in Italy
Reviewed in Canada on October 6, 2022Style: BlackVerified Purchase
I recently went to Italy and part of the trip was to sample gelato at various places.  Funny thing is, everyone makes it differently--some no eggs, some lots of eggs, some small amounts of cream, others more cream.  I was keen to replicate what I had tasted in Italy and thought I would take a gamble on this machine.I already have an ice cream machine at home with the bowl that you freeze.  Had it for nearly 20 years.  Works fine for soft ice cream but requires to be turned while in the freezer for high sugar content ice creams.  Have used it for various ice creams, gelatos, and frozen desserts over the years with good and mixed results. It mostly turns out like soft serve.  This machine is totally different...You start by making a base, adding flavor, freezing it in two specially made canisters, then grinding it (best word I can think of) in this machine, then adding mix ins (nuts, chocolate chucks, candies, etc.).  Some people complain that you have to make stuff a day in advance.  Boo hoo, pony up and plan.  Actually, I found that freezing the canisters in a fridge freezer worked just fine after about 12 hours.So far I've used all the settings except smoothie (I'm not a smoothie guy that much and have a ninja blender for shakes anyway).  Still trying to figure out what a smoothie bowl is.  Last I checked I stopped eating baby food when I got teeth.So here is what I've made:1.  Nutella gelato using a semi custard base (meaning I used 1 egg yolk instead of three and used 1 tablespoon of corn starch to thicken it, used light cream to reduce the fat, and more milk)2.  Another flavor of gelato using a custard base (3 egg yolks, cream, milk).  Essentially this recipe was a frozen custard but called gelato (lots of different versions of gelato online)--so if you are frozen custard person, this machine might be for you--I hate paying store prices for frozen custard.3.  Salted caramel ice cream4.  Rum and raisin ice cream lite (used artificial flavoring and added the raisins as mix ins)5.  Strawberry sorbet (essentially strawberries packed in, no sugar added, ground in the machine)6.  Chocolate orange gelato7.  Maple, pecan ice cream8.  Chocolate malted milk ice cream.  We mixed this one then did a remix and it came out almost like a Wendy's frosty with a similar flavor.  I used malt syrup from the health food store.I have to say, the flavors and textures from this machine were EXACTLY like what I had in Italy for the gelatos (although the other settings aren't that much different).  I don't know how the genius designers came up with this thing but it is amazing!  I'm a skeptic and pessimist but I was shocked at this.Essentially this is how I understand it.  First, the contents get essentially ground then mixed.  This does the same job as a traditional ice cream machine (ice or frozen bowl, doesn't matter) as the intent of the continuous stirring of the bowl prevents large ice crystals from forming.  The grinding aspect of this machine (which is a bit quieter than a blender, but still a bit loud) does the same job but after the stuff is frozen.  You lock the canister inside another canister then lock those into place.  Hit the button and wait about 2 minutes.  Done.  Don't like the results, do it again on remix.Now, for all the flavors I tried, I did different things.  I got a couple off the internet for the machine (their website has some recipes), one or two from other sources, then made up the rest of my own.  I changed the ratios of milk, cream, eggs, sugar, and changed the thickeners on some to starch, egg yolks, full eggs, and guar gum to see how the machine would perform.  Seemed to work well.  Harder contents tend to make the machine sound a bit stressed but it was fine.  I also found that chopping the add-ins helped them mix them in.  The mixing went well with even distribution.  I also followed directions that said leave the canister out of the freezer for a few minutes or in the fridge for 20 minutes or so.  Doing so helped make a creamier product.  Not doing so, especially for lower fat ice cream, resulted in a crumbly texture that had to be remixed (one of the settings).  Then it came out like ice cream.Some people complain that the blades don't touch the bottom and sides of the canister.  No kidding, it would break the machine if they did.  Sounds like a first world problem.  Just mix it in with a spatula then remix if you have to.The size is about the size of a coffee machine.One thing I noticed, is that the products (less sorbets) come out heavier than commercial ice cream.  This is because there is no overwhip (air added).  I actually prefer the product from this machine over commercial ice creams because the product tastes richer, creamier, and thicker.I like the fact that the machine handles different densities of frozen product with reduced fat but keeps the flavor.  You can even make it healthy if you want with reduced cream and reduced eggs.  In fact, the sorbet was just fruit, no sugar, or other stuff.  Worked on the fruit like a Yo Nanas machine (which I also have).  But unlike that machine, you can't grind up big hunks of stuff like cookies in the Creami.I thought, "well if this works to make gelato creamy, maybe it can do the same for hummus like my favorite shawarma place."  Tried it with cooked chickpeas and other ingredients less garlic which I mixed in later (didn't want to flavor the canisters).  Tried it frozen too then melted it.  Didn't work so well for hummus.  The hummus was good, but not quite as creamy as my shawarma place that won't tell me how they do it.I thought that the 500ml canisters would be too small for 5 people.  Not the case, since the product is richer, smaller portions ensue.  I would like to get 4 more so I have a variety of canisters with various flavors but I'm not keen on spending $12 per canister.  That is the only disadvantage.I really love this machine and am glad I got it.

Report
Keith4.0 out of 5 stars
Great sound and build quality but a little uncomfortable
Reviewed in Canada on August 30, 2016Style: HeadphonesVerified Purchase
I bought a pair of these headphone after researching headphones for over a month. I wanted something in the $100-$150 range that sounded nice, was comfortable, didn't bleed noise, and were over-the-ear instead of on ear.I had read reviews saying that these headphones are extremely well balanced when it comes to sound - bass is not over powering, mids and highs sounds great. I've owned them for a month and a half now and after a lot of listening to music on it, I concur with those reviews. The sound is indeed very good. Much better than comparable headphones from Beats, Bose, Monster, and other such manufacturers. If you haven't owned a good professional-type headphones before, you will notice with these that your songs sound different because you can actually hear a lot of little things that get missed out on many other consumer headphones. So overall, for sound, I  really like it and it is more than worth the price.In terms of comfort, these are not quite over-the-ear headphones but they are certainly bigger than on-ear headphones. So they are good compromise in that terms. I did find, however, that wearing them for even an hour or so started to not just hurt my ears but give me a headache. This is mostly due to the fact that they fit tight to isolate the sound better - which it does a good job of. I decided to wait a few weeks to see if the headphones loosen up a little bit from being used regularly - which they did but I still can't wear them for longer than, at most, 2 hours at a time without getting a headache and having my ears hurt from the strong clamping of the ear cups. So if you want a pair of headphones for long sessions of comfortable listening, these may not be for you.In terms of style and build quality, I like them. They don't look attention-seeking, but rather, they have that understated tone to them. I personally quite like the look compared to Beats, for example. I personally like having the coiled cable as you can easily move around without worrying about pulling the cable. Which brings me to a little complaint about it - non replaceable cables. The cable is fixed and cannot be replaced. So if you yank it hard and break it, you'll have to send it in for repair. However, with the coiled cable, I think that would be a little harder to do. The weigh a little heavier than I expected but still not too heavy. I like the thinner headband, which is quite surprisingly comfortable.Packaging is good and easy to open as well. The headphones come with a 3.5mm to 1/4" adapter as well that screws onto the 3.5mm end of the headphone's cable.So overall, this is my verdict:Pros:-Great sound quality-Well priced-Good sound isolation-Coiled cable helps prevent breaking the cable-Good build qualityCons:-Uncomfortable-Non-replaceable cable

Report
Riley4.0 out of 5 stars
The Logitech G920
Reviewed in Canada on May 24, 2017Pattern Name: Xbox/PCStyle: WheelVerified Purchase
Alright let's get startedI put this order in on May 19th, 2017 and the package was expected to arrive the following Thursday. However, it came two days earlier which is great for me.On receiving the package, I immediately noticed that it was left in the box that it would be sold in at a store. The G920 box looked noticeably damaged on the outside, (scuff marks, punctured holes) and it appeared as the box was already opened as the carboard tabs on the lid were ripped off. I was a little nervous that the G920 would be damaged, however to my dismay it was in perfect condition.One thing you'll notice about the package when you open it up, it doesn't come with a shifter, just the pedals and wheel which to me I feel betrayed but at the same time satisfied. I had read online that the shifter felt cheaper and of lesser quality (also looking at online reviews and unboxings) and its prone to be worn out. Regardless of this, I'll be sticking with the paddle shifters on the wheel and maybe in a month I'll buy a thrust master shifter.The wheel itself is very nice, leather and steel which makes it look and feel like a real steering wheel (however the size of the wheel seems a bit smaller compared to a replica size one). Pedals feel like they are the real deal, with the breaks having actual resistance when pushed down onto along with the clutch and gas pedal.Overall quality is high and well received.Onto the gaming portion. For now I'm playing Assetto Corsa for the PC and it's a little tricky to find what settings you are comfortable driving with. I am constantly fine tuning my settings so I am able to get the most out of racing and more importantly; drifting. You can also download the Logitech software that's comparable with the wheel, and have even more access to settings to fine tune your driving experience.In conclusion, the Logitech G920 stands out on the driving simulator market as an entry level of driving gaming, and it's currently affordable as it is/was $100 off on Amazon.

Best thing ever

I got this from my hubby for our anniversary and I use it almost every day now. I've had it less than a month and I've already read 4 books, compared to reading maybe 1 in a year if I am lucky. I still have my paper books, because I love my collection, but if you have children, this is a must! My little one can't ruin books when she wants to climb all over me while I read. It's light weight, small and portable, has a light at the bottom to show it is charging, and you can customize the "sleep" screen to be the cover of the book you're currently reading, just overall a great product.

Pretendo Switch5.0 out of 5 stars
A game changer for book lovers!
Reviewed in Canada on July 31, 2023Style: Without Kindle UnlimitedDigital Storage Capacity: 8 GBColour: BlackVerified Purchase
I've been a die-hard book lover for as long as I can remember, but recently, I decided to give the Kindle Paperwhite 8GB a try to see what all the hype was about. Let me tell you, this little device has completely changed the way I read and interact with books.First and foremost, the 8GB storage capacity is perfect for me. I've loaded it up with hundreds of books, and there's still plenty of space left for more. The Paperwhite's sleek design is not only aesthetically pleasing but also incredibly lightweight, making it effortless to carry around wherever I go. It fits perfectly in my hand and doesn't strain my eyes, even during marathon reading sessions.The E-Ink display is the star of the show. The high-resolution screen provides a crisp and clear reading experience, akin to reading an actual paper book. The adjustable brightness allows me to read comfortably, whether it's in broad daylight or dimly lit rooms. Additionally, the built-in adjustable font size and font type feature are lifesavers for my aging eyesight, making reading a breeze.One of the Kindle Paperwhite's most impressive features is its waterproof design. I can now enjoy my favorite books poolside or in the bathtub without worrying about any accidental splashes ruining the device. It has truly become my perfect companion for vacations and travel, giving me access to an entire library on-the-go without weighing me down with heavy books.The battery life is impressive as well. I can easily go weeks without needing to charge it, and I'm an avid reader who uses the device every day. This extended battery life allows me to focus on enjoying my reading rather than constantly monitoring the charge level.The integration with Amazon's Kindle Store is seamless, allowing me to browse, purchase, and download books with just a few taps. The synchronization feature keeps track of my reading progress across devices, so I can seamlessly switch between my Kindle and the Kindle app on my phone or tablet without losing my place.If there's one thing I'd suggest for improvement, it would be the inclusion of a USB-C port for faster charging. While the micro-USB is reliable, an upgrade to the latest technology would be appreciated.Overall, the Kindle Paperwhite 8GB has transformed my reading experience in ways I couldn't have imagined. I still adore physical books, but the convenience and versatility of this e-reader have won me over. If you're an avid reader or just someone looking to enjoy books on a more portable and modern platform, the Kindle Paperwhite 8GB is an excellent investment that won't disappoint. I highly recommend it!

Unveiling Limitless Possibilities: Amazon Fire 7 Tablet
Reviewed in Canada on August 9, 2023Digital Storage Capacity: 16 GBConfiguration: Without Special OffersColour Name: BlackStyle: Fire 7Verified Purchase
In an era where digital devices have become an indispensable part of our lives, the Amazon Fire 7 Tablet emerges as a beacon of functionality, portability, and affordability. This 7-inch wonder effortlessly marries a sleek design with impressive features, promising an experience that far outweighs its modest price tag.The first thing that strikes you is the tablet's compact form factor. Weighing in as a feather-light companion, it's a testament to modern engineering that portability does not come at the cost of performance. The 7-inch display, while not the largest in the market, delivers vibrant colors and sharp visuals that make reading, streaming, and browsing an engaging affair.Under the hood, the 16 GB of storage may seem conservative, but Amazon's cloud integration and the option to expand storage via a microSD card ensure that your digital world remains expansive. The quad-core processor might not rival flagship devices, yet it performs admirably well for daily tasks, multitasking, and even some casual gaming. The real beauty, however, lies in the seamless integration with Amazon's ecosystem.The Fire 7 Tablet's battery life is a true revelation. Boasting up to 10 hours of mixed-use battery life, this device refuses to bow down even during the busiest of days. Whether you're engrossed in an eBook, binge-watching your favorite series, or fine-tuning a presentation, this tablet's longevity ensures you stay productive and entertained throughout.One of the most remarkable aspects of the Amazon Fire 7 Tablet is its democratization of technology. With an accessible price point, it brings the digital world closer to those who might have been left out due to financial constraints. It serves as an educational tool, an entertainment hub, and a communication lifeline for individuals of all walks of life.Admittedly, no device is without its limitations. The camera quality, while sufficient for video calls, might not impress photography enthusiasts. Additionally, the Amazon Appstore, while extensive, might lack a few niche applications available in other ecosystems. However, the tablet's prime focus remains on accessibility, functionality, and connectivity, aspects where it unquestionably excels.In conclusion, the Amazon Fire 7 Tablet emerges as an embodiment of the company's commitment to enhancing the lives of its users. With its blend of affordability, performance, and Amazon-centric features, it redefines what a budget-friendly tablet can achieve. Whether you're a student, a professional, or simply someone who craves an engaging digital experience, this tablet is an investment that delivers manifold returns.

description: NINJA CREAMI: With the Ninja CREAMi, you can transform everyday ingredients into ice cream, gelato, smoothie bowls, milkshakes, and more.    FROM HEALTHY TO INDULGENT: Easily enjoy a wide array of frozen treats like decadent gelato, lite ice cream, dairy-free, gluten-free and much more. The Ninja CREAMi makes delicious treats that fit your lifestyle.    COMPACT FOR YOUR COUNTERTOP: The CREAMi is compact in size allowing for seamless storage and fitting easily on your countertop.    FUN FOR ALL AGES: Easy-to-use functionality allows for the whole family to enjoy making frozen treats together.    MIX-INS: Customize your flavor and texture by mixing in your favorite chocolate, nuts, candy, fruit, and more to personalize any CREAMi treat.    7 VERSATILE PROGRAMS: (7) one-touch programs allow for the perfect combination of speed, pressure, and time to completely shave through your frozen pint. Choose between Ice Cream, Sorbet, Gelato, Milkshake, Smoothie Bowl, Lite Ice Cream​, and Mix-in.    CREAMIFY TECHNOLOGY: Unlike traditional ice cream makers, Ninja’s innovative Creamerizer System finely shaves and churns ice particles into creamy frozen treats in minutes.
nav: Home & Kitchen › Kitchen & Dining › Small Appliances › Specialty Appliances › Ice Cream Machines
user_reviews:
Rocky Mountain Entrepreneur5.0 out of 5 stars
Totally Loving This Machine! Wow.  Just Like Gelato in Italy
Reviewed in Canada on October 6, 2022Style: BlackVerified Purchase
I recently went to Italy and part of the trip was to sample gelato at various places.  Funny thing is, everyone makes it differently--some no eggs, some lots of eggs, some small amounts of cream, others more cream.  I was keen to replicate what I had tasted in Italy and thought I would take a gamble on this machine.I already have an ice cream machine at home with the bowl that you freeze.  Had it for nearly 20 years.  Works fine for soft ice cream but requires to be turned while in the freezer for high sugar content ice creams.  Have used it for various ice creams, gelatos, and frozen desserts over the years with good and mixed results. It mostly turns out like soft serve.  This machine is totally different...You start by making a base, adding flavor, freezing it in two specially made canisters, then grinding it (best word I can think of) in this machine, then adding mix ins (nuts, chocolate chucks, candies, etc.).  Some people complain that you have to make stuff a day in advance.  Boo hoo, pony up and plan.  Actually, I found that freezing the canisters in a fridge freezer worked just fine after about 12 hours.So far I've used all the settings except smoothie (I'm not a smoothie guy that much and have a ninja blender for shakes anyway).  Still trying to figure out what a smoothie bowl is.  Last I checked I stopped eating baby food when I got teeth.So here is what I've made:1.  Nutella gelato using a semi custard base (meaning I used 1 egg yolk instead of three and used 1 tablespoon of corn starch to thicken it, used light cream to reduce the fat, and more milk)2.  Another flavor of gelato using a custard base (3 egg yolks, cream, milk).  Essentially this recipe was a frozen custard but called gelato (lots of different versions of gelato online)--so if you are frozen custard person, this machine might be for you--I hate paying store prices for frozen custard.3.  Salted caramel ice cream4.  Rum and raisin ice cream lite (used artificial flavoring and added the raisins as mix ins)5.  Strawberry sorbet (essentially strawberries packed in, no sugar added, ground in the machine)6.  Chocolate orange gelato7.  Maple, pecan ice cream8.  Chocolate malted milk ice cream.  We mixed this one then did a remix and it came out almost like a Wendy's frosty with a similar flavor.  I used malt syrup from the health food store.I have to say, the flavors and textures from this machine were EXACTLY like what I had in Italy for the gelatos (although the other settings aren't that much different).  I don't know how the genius designers came up with this thing but it is amazing!  I'm a skeptic and pessimist but I was shocked at this.Essentially this is how I understand it.  First, the contents get essentially ground then mixed.  This does the same job as a traditional ice cream machine (ice or frozen bowl, doesn't matter) as the intent of the continuous stirring of the bowl prevents large ice crystals from forming.  The grinding aspect of this machine (which is a bit quieter than a blender, but still a bit loud) does the same job but after the stuff is frozen.  You lock the canister inside another canister then lock those into place.  Hit the button and wait about 2 minutes.  Done.  Don't like the results, do it again on remix.Now, for all the flavors I tried, I did different things.  I got a couple off the internet for the machine (their website has some recipes), one or two from other sources, then made up the rest of my own.  I changed the ratios of milk, cream, eggs, sugar, and changed the thickeners on some to starch, egg yolks, full eggs, and guar gum to see how the machine would perform.  Seemed to work well.  Harder contents tend to make the machine sound a bit stressed but it was fine.  I also found that chopping the add-ins helped them mix them in.  The mixing went well with even distribution.  I also followed directions that said leave the canister out of the freezer for a few minutes or in the fridge for 20 minutes or so.  Doing so helped make a creamier product.  Not doing so, especially for lower fat ice cream, resulted in a crumbly texture that had to be remixed (one of the settings).  Then it came out like ice cream.Some people complain that the blades don't touch the bottom and sides of the canister.  No kidding, it would break the machine if they did.  Sounds like a first world problem.  Just mix it in with a spatula then remix if you have to.The size is about the size of a coffee machine.One thing I noticed, is that the products (less sorbets) come out heavier than commercial ice cream.  This is because there is no overwhip (air added).  I actually prefer the product from this machine over commercial ice creams because the product tastes richer, creamier, and thicker.I like the fact that the machine handles different densities of frozen product with reduced fat but keeps the flavor.  You can even make it healthy if you want with reduced cream and reduced eggs.  In fact, the sorbet was just fruit, no sugar, or other stuff.  Worked on the fruit like a Yo Nanas machine (which I also have).  But unlike that machine, you can't grind up big hunks of stuff like cookies in the Creami.I thought, "well if this works to make gelato creamy, maybe it can do the same for hummus like my favorite shawarma place."  Tried it with cooked chickpeas and other ingredients less garlic which I mixed in later (didn't want to flavor the canisters).  Tried it frozen too then melted it.  Didn't work so well for hummus.  The hummus was good, but not quite as creamy as my shawarma place that won't tell me how they do it.I thought that the 500ml canisters would be too small for 5 people.  Not the case, since the product is richer, smaller portions ensue.  I would like to get 4 more so I have a variety of canisters with various flavors but I'm not keen on spending $12 per canister. Riley4.0 out of 5 stars
The Logitech G920
Reviewed in Canada on May 24, 2017Pattern Name: Xbox/PCStyle: WheelVerified Purchase
Alright let's get startedI put this order in on May 19th, 2017 and the package was expected to arrive the following Thursday. However, it came two days earlier which is great for me.On receiving the package, I immediately noticed that it was left in the box that it would be sold in at a store. The G920 box looked noticeably damaged on the outside, (scuff marks, punctured holes) and it appeared as the box was already opened as the carboard tabs on the lid were ripped off. I was a little nervous that the G920 would be damaged, however to my dismay it was in perfect condition.One thing you'll notice about the package when you open it up, it doesn't come with a shifter, just the pedals and wheel which to me I feel betrayed but at the same time satisfied. I had read online that the shifter felt cheaper and of lesser quality (also looking at online reviews and unboxings) and its prone to be worn out. Regardless of this, I'll be sticking with the paddle shifters on the wheel and maybe in a month I'll buy a thrust master shifter.The wheel itself is very nice, leather and steel which makes it look and feel like a real steering wheel (however the size of the wheel seems a bit smaller compared to a replica size one). Pedals feel like they are the real deal, with the breaks having actual resistance when pushed down onto along with the clutch and gas pedal.Overall quality is high and well received.Onto the gaming portion. For now I'm playing Assetto Corsa for the PC and it's a little tricky to find what settings you are comfortable driving with. I am constantly fine tuning my settings so I am able to get the most out of racing and more importantly; drifting. You can also download the Logitech software that's comparable with the wheel, and have even more access to settings to fine tune your driving experience.In conclusion, the Logitech G920 stands out on the driving simulator market as an entry level of driving gaming, and it's currently affordable as it is/was $100 off on Amazon.

Report
Andy5.0 out of 5 stars
Good kit printer
Reviewed in Canada on October 13, 2018Verified Purchase
Ordered this as a first 3D printer.I'd suggest this model to anyone that likes DIY and is comfortable with some basic assembly work - this is not a "plug and play" device. Putting this thing together was about as complicated as building a table from IKEA. The included assembly manual *is* lacking - specifically it does not tell you what screws to use where and could use some additional steps when it comes to assembling the X-Carriage/Hot End just to make the belt installation a bit easier to understand. I had to adjust my Y-stop out of the box and there is definitely room for some improvements; but again this is a kit - if you go in expecting to tinker it's fun, not frustrating. Most of the basic improvements can also be printed and files are easily available. I strongly recommend printing a filament guideI'd also suggest taking the time to learn how to assemble this thing and how to level the bed through Youtube or a community forum like Reddit as the instructions could be better there too. Print a calibration cube and temperature tower, not the included "test dog" file, this is a much better use of the included filament.Is this printer worth the extra $80 over the base model? For me it is - the newer hot end model, beefier Y axis and name brand power supply all are definite improvements and worth the extra. The removable bed is okay, but you're only gonna print PLA on it.The printer is open source, highly up-gradable and can grow with your needs - don't expect to print anything but PLA out of the box and don't expect perfect results until you get the settings dialed in. This is a small scale manufacturing device,  not an ink-jet.Oh, and buy at least one additional roll of PLA - you'll need it once you start making stuff.
