Report
Blank4.0 out of 5 stars
Take your time building it and you'll get great results.
Reviewed in Canada on May 16, 2019Verified Purchase
Took about an hour and a half for me to assemble. I followed Tom Tullis's build guide from Fat Dragon Games and I was printing flawlessly out of the box. Some steps were a bit frustrating and I couldn't imagine doing it without another pair of hands, but with patience and someone to hold the pieces while you screw them in it's fairly straight forward. All needed tools come in the box and the only skill you need is the ability to use an allen key and a wrench.Some people have issues with salmon skinning but it hasn't been an issue for me. Coming from a MP Select Mini V2 I was floored with the quality. All I've done to the printer is replace the bowden fittings and the plastic extruder with a metal one and that's it. Layer lines that were very pronounced on my Mini are basically invisible so prints take very very little sanding. Bridging too is much better than my Mini and I'm needing much less support material. The removable build surfaceThe removable build plate is very convenient and makes removing prints from the build surface incredible easy. Just remove it from the steel base, and flex it off. It takes what was a 2 minute job on my Mini to a 2 second job on my Pro. Very nice.The build area isn't massive, but it's a pretty decent size. You can't get anything bigger in this price range and I'm very rarely limited by my build volume. Most figures or knick knacks will fit just fine in here. The only things I want to print one day but can't on this printer is a literal playable violin. Cosplayers may also not find this printer suitable, and you'll really want something like a CR10 to get that larger build volume.One issue I did have was with the included Micro SD card. In two words: it's garbage. Throw it out. I was having problems where the printer would stop printing half way through, and I couldn't figure out why. I replaced the SD card and the problem was solved. If you order this, buy an SD card with it. You'll thank me later.Another preventative measure thing you'll want to do is replace the bowden tube fittings and the extruder with an all metal one. They're not expensive (I payed $10 each) and it'll save you a world of hurt. If the couplings included on the Ender 3 ever fail (which they will because they're crap) then the hot end will fill with molten plastic and create a nasty clog that is hard to fix. Save yourself the trouble and replace it immediately. Now you can use the plastic extruder for a while, but I was about a roll of filament (Hatchbox White PLA) in when I noticed the extruder starting to wear.  Another roll in and the filament snapped going in because the angle was too sharp due to wear. I replaced the extruder and fittings both at the same time and it took 10 minutes. It's easy to do and well worth it.There are many more upgrades that would be considered "nice to have" but not 100% necessary. 3d printing cable chains for the hot bed wiring, a handle for the hot bed, a change to capricorn PTFE bowden tubing, adding TL smoothers to the XY stepper motors, a better spool holder, better bed springs so it needs to be leveled less often, ect. That said most of these are very very easy to do later and won't cause catastrophic failure if you wait a bit to do them like the couplings will.I have tried printing some filaments other than PLA onthis machine, but it doesn't seem to work very well. I tried ABS and TPU and neither worked particularly well. If you want to print those, I'd recommend not buying this printer as it really seems to be a PLA only machine. I've heard the Anycubic i3 Mega is better at printing those, but I haven't used that printer so your mileage my vary.Overall I'm extremely happy with this printer. It is a kit so be prepared to spend an afternoon assembling it. Don't rush this. It's easier to get everything dialed in while it's disassembled rather than it's all put together. Is it beginner friendly? Sure I don't see why not I mean it'll take a bit of research to get going but most printers will. Even printers that are easier to assemble (Anycubic i3 Mega) or don't require any assembly at all (MP Select Mini V2) will have things go wrong, and when they do at least with the Ender 3 you'll have a general idea how to tackle some of these problems since you built the thing. I was absolutely floored with the print quality i got out of this printer and would 100% recommend it to anyone looking to start on their 3d printing journey.

What I tested so far works very well, though I would fall back to my iPad Pro for any writing/drawing needs for now. The touch screen is very responsive and fast. Quite the change from my old KIndle Paperwhite (one of the first models, so I can't speak of the current generation). It's expensive for what I'll use it for, just reading books, but I have no complaints. So far it's met all my expectations and some. If you want a clean, fast and large screen book reader with excellent note taking capabilities, this is it.

D. Smith4.0 out of 5 stars
Well thought out but it needs to grow to be useful...
Reviewed in Canada on December 5, 2022Style: Premium PenSize: 64 GBConfiguration: Without Kindle UnlimitedVerified Purchase
I received the Scribe a few days ago. I was especially interested in the online reviews which I have found have some glaring omissions or maybe gloss-overs -  one omission specifically concerning the notes function might mean I will be returning this unit.Hardware: The hardware is excellent with the exception that there appears to be a slight uneven gap between the metal border and the screen. On my unit, it is wider on one side, and narrow and snug on the other. This may be just my unit and is not a show-stopper for me. Just an observation. The unit is easy to hold. It is lighter than I was expecting.As an eReader: Amazon has this down pat. The larger screen, I have to say, makes reading much more enjoyable. I didn't think it would make a difference but it is huge. If it was a unit with just the larger screen at about 2/3 of the current price it would be a recommended purchase hands down.As a notetaker: The Good - the pen is amazingly comfortable and the screen and pen are as good a simulation of paper and pen as I have ever experienced. It is simply a pleasure to write on the Scribe. No it is more than pleasurable; it is nothing short of perfection. The pen is the best pen I have ever used on a tablet. It has good weight and fits into the hand without error. And the palm rejection is perfect as far as I am concerned. No errant marks.The Bad and needs to be improved: The note-taking is good. And I am not going to dock the lack of writing recognition, as many reviewers have focused on because my experience with it has been hit-and-miss anyway.But once you get more than one page of notes there is no menu that creates thumbnails to enable you quickly to jump back and forth through your notes. You have to scroll through them full-page by full-page until you get to where you want to be. This is a horrendous mistake by Amazon and makes the Scribe, as a note-taker, next to useless. All my notes range from 10 to 40 pages and having no quick way to jump through the document is seriously short-sighted. I am sure Amazon will correct this with a software update but right now the lack of this feature severely hinders the Scribe. The faster Amazon corrects this glaring error the better.As a Gen 1 product, the Scribe is excellent and it ticks almost all my boxes save one. However, the lack of that one feature severely reduces the utility of the Scribe for me and I assume for others who plan on using this as a replacement for pen and notepad.(If this unit has this feature and I have somehow overlooked it, please direct me to it and I will amend my review.)Update: The first major update has been released and my disappointment in the Scribe grew. The only additions to the notebook feature are a Go To page and nested folders. What I was really looking forward to was a thumbnail feature for my notes where I could navigate my notes by thumbnail. Giving me a Go To page feature is not useful at all. So my original review stands - as a larger e-reader it is very good. However, as a notetaking productivity device, the Scribe stills falls woefully short. If I could return it I would and I would encourage anyone thinking of buying it for notetaking to look elsewhere.Update 2: After a couple of updates you now see the pages in your notebooks in thumbnails and can navigate to the page you want. It makes note-taking that much more effective. Amazon is heading in the right direction with this product. It can only get better from here. I have changed my review to 4 stars. A definite buy if it suits your purpose.

title: Zensa 5% Lidocaine Numbing Cream - 30g || Preferred by Ink Artists for Naturally Effective Pain Relief || Less Fillers, No Parabens and Vitamin E combine for a Natural pH Formulation || Gentle on Your Skin
description: Hypoallergenic
nav: Health & Personal Care › Health Care › Over-the-Counter Medication › Pain & Fever › Alternative Pain Relief
user_reviews:
Caper5.0 out of 5 stars
Pleasantly surprised!
Reviewed in Canada on November 23, 2023Verified Purchase
Worked better than I expected.  But doesn't last ... and I have some recommendations for that!!  Let's get to it. I have 28 years of tattoo experience. Currently working on a full back piece. Decided to use this because after a few hours, tats hurt. I couldn't believe the difference it made. You can barely feel it, literally. It only lasts about 1.5 hours after it's washed off.  So here is how the process goes: you want this to be applied at least 1 hour before your start tattooing, so you need to know how long it's going to take you to get there, and get the stencil applied etc.  I haven't time it, but I don't think you want to be waiting several hours before starting. If you live close by and will be getting right into it, then ensure application is minimum 1 hour prior.  HOT SHOWER first, to open pores up (or hot wash ... whatever).  Apply generously to tattoo area but not so much to waste it. Cut Saran wrap (plastic food wrap) and use first aid tape to stick the wrap over the area. When you arrive at your appointment, they are going to remove the wrap and wash you. HUGE TIP: If you are going to be doing a large area, consider using smaller sections of plastic wrap so they can be taken off at different times, say, 2 hours apart.  My last appointment lasted 8 hours, and after the 2 hour mark I started suffering lol. Wish I had done smaller sections that could be taken off as we progressed.  Great stuff. Pricey, but worth it for long sessions or smaller ones if you can't handle it.

Report
sterling 4.0 out of 5 stars
Works, but not very long
Reviewed in Canada on March 17, 2024Verified Purchase
The short review: it worked for 1.5 hoursThe long review:I took these steps - I took a long hot shower and shaved the area in the shower. I got out, dried off and immediately applied a generous, very thick coat over the area and wrapped it tightly with suran wrap 1hr before my tattoo was to begin… I drove to my appointment and once there while waiting for my artist to set up I put a heat pack on the area (over my shirt) for the last 10 minutes before we started… I unwrapped and let it air out for about 5 minutes, then the artist wiped it off and we began…The first line was 100% pain free, it felt like a vibrating ball point pen. From then on it progressively wore off, the first 45 minutes being mostly pain free, then it started to rapidly wear off… at about the 1hr mark it became painful, and by 1.5” hours the effect was almost completely gone…Some other notes:- This was my second session on this tattoo on my stomach/front rib cage, the first session I did not use any numbing agents, so this review is a direct comparison to the same areas of the same tattoo, with and without this numbing cream.- I experienced swelling when using the numbing cream that I didn’t in the first session without it, the artist noted having to work the ink in a little bit more that last time because of this.- after it wore off, I felt the pain of the current needle stokes along with a rapid onset of the pain from all the work done up to that point… if you’re not cognizant of this it can make it seem like the cream is now making the pain worse than “normal”, but it’s not.In conclusion:I’d definitely use it again for short and medium appointments, short appointments will be easy as pie and for medium appointments it will give you a good head start … long appointments I don’t think it will make much better in the end as the swelling it causes may end up making it longer and harder anyway… I’m 35 years old now and not trying to be a tough guy anymore so 2-3 hour appointments are manageable and the logical option for quality work anyways.

description: 18.0 Megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor for high image quality and speed    3.7 fps continuous shooting up to approximately 34 JPEGs or approximately 6 RAW    ISO 100 - 6400 (expandable to 12800) for shooting from bright to dim light    Vari-angle 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor (3:2) for shooting at high or low angles    Improved EOS Full HD Movie mode with manual exposure control, expanded recording [1920 x 1080 Full HD video at frame rates of 30 (29.97), 24 (23.976) and 25.0 frames per second] with new Movie Digital zoom and Video Snapshot features for enhanced movie shooting options
nav: Electronics › Camera, Photo & Video › Digital Cameras › Digital SLRs
user_reviews:
moose5.0 out of 5 stars
An excellent upgrade!
Reviewed in Canada on April 16, 2015Style: IS II ZoomVerified Purchase
I have used a Canon T3 for many years. A local store had an offer for an upgrade and I jumped at the opportunity. Below is my review for the Canon T3 which I had posted elsewhere on Amazon:Was debating between a T3i and this T3. The T3 is excellent for an amateur photographer just learning to use a DSLR. I find it fast enough for my needs (occasional action shooting) but mostly use it to take pics of nature scenes and of stars (lots of time lapse photography). It would have been nice to have the higher resolution LCD panel from the T3i, but this is pretty much the only function I miss. I use the viewfinder to actually take the shot, so only miss it while reviewing photos. The non-swivel display isn't that big of a deal, and 12MP is more than enough unless you plan on having huge prints. If you plan on getting a really fast lens with a large aperture (f2 range) you may want to consider the T3i as it has a better focusing ability for these fast lenses. Overall, very pleased with the camera and would recommend.Now why did I upgrade? The T3 sensor accumulated dust on the sensor multiple times. I do lots of lens changes and travel quite a bit so this was expected. Canon charges $100 for sensor cleaning or you can purchase the kit and do it yourself. I did the latter option but was finding I was doing this almost after every trip. The T3i's autocleaning sensor was huge for me!Over the years, I have missed the articulating screen on some shots when I need to raise the camera or shoot from low angles, doesn't happen much, but having it is nice. The higher resolution LCD screen is also much easier to see in direct sunlight.Points from my previous review that I still agree with are that the 18MP sensor is not really that necessary for me and I don't shoot high speed as often so the increase in focusing speed isn't that noticed (more on this later)Downsides: It's heavier than the T3 by quite a bit but the build quality seems better. Boot up time is almost 2X as much (due to sensor cleaning and not sure why else). Battery life isn't as good (1/3 less the T3).I have upgraded the stock lenses to STM lenses. I use polarizing filters and didn't enjoy the rotating anterior portion of the IS II series. Also the STM lenses focus quietly and quickly and full time manual override which is nice. You can read my reviews of the lenses I own at their respective pages. I have the 10-18 STM, 18 - 55 STM, and the 55 - 250 STM.Now for the important question, do I recommend? In short yes, which is why I upgraded. However, I don't just buy stuff because it has more features; think about whether or not you need the additional functionality. I loved the T3 and it served as a brilliant camera for many years and proved to be rugged enough to handle quite a bit. For instance, the T5i has a touch screen and cross-point focusing for videos and comes with the STM lens out of the box. Personally, I dislike the touch screen, don't shoot video much, and already had an STM lens.For beginners, get a T3 or T5 and save the extra cash to buy better glass (lens). This is a wonderful camera however and I doubt I'll get another unless it's full frame or I break mine somehow.Thanks for reading.

title: PlayStation 4 Pro - 1TB - Console Edition
description: Spectacular graphics – Explore vivid game worlds with rich visuals heightened by PS4 Pro    Enhanced gameplay – Support for faster frame rates delivers super-sharp action for select PS4 games    One unified gaming community – Compatible with every PS4 game. Play online with other PS4 players with PlayStation Plus    Extraordinary entertainment – With up to 4K streaming and 4K auto-upscaling for video content
nav: Video Games › PlayStation 4 › Consoles
user_reviews:
Chris B.5.0 out of 5 stars
A nice compromise from buying/ building expensive rigs.
Reviewed in Canada on November 10, 2016Verified Purchase
Last year I built an i7-6700K, 980TI SLI custom case PC so that I could play Dark Souls 3, ESO and DCUO in 4K. Mostly I play ESO now, and I've swapped to PS4 simply on account of a wider community (at the hours I play) and lack of bots/cheating. So this massive investment was just sitting on my desk and the television that I'd purchased to showcase it was being used as a giant monitor for Word...I mean, ergonomically, it was a functional and quite useful, though practically a waste.When Sony announced that their new PS4 was intended to keep people who were interested in jumping to PC mid-cycle hooked into their ecosystem, I thought they were absolutely mad. But I've played it now, and the hardware is incredibly capable. Does it compare to my rig? No. But in what world would a $500 box compare to a $5000 one? Even with that caveat, the Pro comes irritatingly, passably close. And that's enough for me. If every three years I can pick up a new box with all the benefits of console ownership and all the titles that I love on PC, I don't think I'll ever go through the expense or hassle of building a rig again.Some pros and cons:-Easy setup and transfer of data from one PS4 to the Pro. That said: HAVE TWO LONG NETWORK CABLES ready and available for this process. I guess I'm lucky that I'm a recovering PCaholic, and I have plenty of wires and crap around, but not everyone does. You can do a transfer of data via the old external HDD copy/ recopy, but it takes forever and I wouldn't recommend it.-Make sure you have an HDR ready set. Fully RGB and chroma. Alot of televisions still don't have the proper spec, and you won't get the "wow" factor of HDR in games that support it without the right equipment. Samsung's newest (and late last year's models) and Sony are usually a safe bet.-Be aware that you can only have one "master" PS4, which will probably be the Pro. Read up on account privileges and sharing.-All new titles moving forward have Pro support, only twenty or thirty (and growing) older titles do. Any title that does have Pro support will play just like a regular PS4 game on a standard PS4. The upscale on unpathced titles is decent, though (not to be confused with actual Pro-software bells, whistles and enhanced resolutions).-The power cord is FAT, like launch PS3 fat. I had to cut a wider hole in the back of my entertainment cabinet before I could set up the device.I think those are my thoughts after several hours of owndership. All in all, above my expectations. Price, performance and ease of use are bang-on. If it explodes in the next six months or becomes sentient and starts a man-on-cyborg war, I'll update my review to you know.

It's 100% worth it.

Luke4.0 out of 5 stars
A great buy for the price, and well worth it after it's been out for so long.
Reviewed in Canada on July 29, 2019Verified Purchase
Let's start with the positives, the console is amazing for the price and even though I was reluctant to spend money for PlayStation plus the cost want bad at all and you actually get a deal when you buy more consecutive months. The console came in good shape and hasn't let me down in any way. The game selection is amazing but the lack of a good driving game was a little disappointing. The UI is great and easy to navigate. The themes are good although I wish they were free. The exclusives a great and always garunteed quality. Even though this console came out a while ago I think it's still worth the money. Now on to the downsides. The box it came in felt a little flimsey as it was made of cardstock and not cardboard which I would have preferred as it was being shipped. The Amazon box it came in was cardboard so that kinda makes up for it. The hard drive slot cover is very thin cheap feeling plastic and feels as if it would break easily with little effort. The controllers 3.5 mm audio jack feels like it's in an odd place and I find myself bumping the cable I have plugged in the odd time although I don't know where else Sony would put it so I don't really have a good solution. Overall however, the PS4 is a great console and well worth the money. I originally bought the console as a stand in between computers as my old one recently stopped working. I intended to sell the console when I wanted to buy the new computer but having used it for about a month I've now decided I'm going to keep it. It's won over me and I think it will win over you too.

description: Receive all 3 Episodes of Vader Immortal: A Star Wars VR Series and Lightsaber Dojos when you purchase an Oculus Quest headset between 11/21/2019 and 01/31/2020 (limited time only). Oculus Quest must be activated within 30 days of purchase to redeem offer.    All-in-one VR: No PC. No wires. No limits. Oculus Quest is an all-in-one gaming system built for virtual reality. Now you can play almost anywhere with just a VR headset and controllers    Oculus Touch Controllers: Arm yourself with the award-winning Oculus Touch controllers. Your slashes, throws and grabs appear in VR with intuitive, realistic precision    Easy set up: The world is your arcade. Set up is easy whether you’re at home or someplace new. Oculus Quest works with your environment, so you can play standing or sitting in spaces big or small    Guardian Helps Keep You Safe: Explore the universe without tripping over the coffee table. The Oculus Guardian system is designed to help you avoid nearby objects while you're in-game    Oculus Quest requires your Facebook account to log in, making it easy to meet up with friends in VR and discover communities around the world.
nav: Video Games › Virtual Reality › Stand-Alone Hardware › Accessories
user_reviews:
DS5.0 out of 5 stars
First-Gen VR is here
Reviewed in Canada on May 4, 2020Edition: Oculus Quest - 64GBVerified Purchase
You will find better quality VR gear but this one has no wires or towers - it makes room scale that much more immersive when you don't have to think about a tether. Oculus Quest feels like a VR gaming console mixed with a VR version of your Android smartphone. The dashboard is very fun and snappy to "shoot at" with the controllers. It's very immersive.Setup using the phone was quick and easy. I made an Oculus account and skipped linking it to Facebook because I don't use it. It also let me skip the credit card info which is good because I'm not ready to buy anything else just yet. Then the phone put the headset into update mode and it was done minutes later. The Quest came pre-loaded with quite a few demos to try which was nice. None of the games gave me motion sickness, but the joystick movement and buggy looking menu system in Rec Room eventually got to me. I had to take the headset off for a bit to settle the stomach before jumping back in.The only major con I have been experiencing is with the lenses, apparently the smudgey look in them is normal so I have accepted it as a first-gen limitation of the manufacturing process, it's not usually that noticeable but it's annoying when it is. The headset makes you see things as though they are further away so I had to use contact lenses as a near-sighted person. The headset has enough room for my small rectangle glasses as well but big round glasses don't fit. There is definitely a screen door effect but it's also not very noticeable while you are moving around gaming. Being able to watch TV in VR is very cool and useful but the visual experience is degraded because of the lenses and the screen door effect and in no way compares to regular TV quality. Making the VR TV enormous helps though and laying down and watching on the ceiling is crazy.Overall I have had a ton of fun and, despite its flaws, it feels well worth the price for entry VR. I wasn't sure if this would be a keep or a return since VR is still so early but I'm totally hooked now.

Report
Gary Arnold5.0 out of 5 stars
Oculus Quest is a game changer for VR.  Seriously.
Reviewed in Canada on August 22, 2019Edition: Oculus Quest - 64GBVerified Purchase
I spent a few months trying to decide whether to purchase the Oculus Rift S or the new Quest.  I was initially worried about the quality of the games, running on a mobile processor vs a full pc desktop with a powerful graphics card, but after watching reviews, and then discovering the possibility of being able to stream VR games from my gaming PC, I decided to bite the bullet and purchase the Quest.  A couple of things immediately won me over:1) No cables and 360 degree tracking.  This, in itself, is amazing and a game changer.  Once you try it, it’s really really hard to go back.2) The portability.  I travel a lot for work and I can take this thing with me anywhere.  That’s awesome.The game library is somewhat limited, but games are coming out all the time and there are quite a few great options in the store.  Beat Saber is fantastic, and there are a number of really fun and immersive games that will blow you away.If I have any complaints they would be the following:1) The unit is somewhat heavy sitting on your face.  It’s not too bad, but long sessions you may notice it.2) Battery life - I get about 2 hours right now, which is actually fine as I usually only play for about 30mins to an 1hr each evening so it’s enough for me, but may be a pain for those who like longer sessions (FYI - you can use a battery pack and mount it on the back for extra play time should you desire, there’s a couple guides on the net that explain how to do this).3) Audio.  It has these built in speakers that fire down towards your ears and, while it works quite well, you’ll probably want to get your one earphones to use instead.  A nice feature is that Oculus provide two external headphone jacks on either side of the headset, and they work great.  But it’s something to note.  Also, if you do use the built in ones, everyone will hear what you are playing.All in all I absolutely love this device and am thrilled with it.  I cannot wait to see where this technology goes, the possibilities are endless and I really believe this is the future of VR.

Report
Dane P4.0 out of 5 stars
It’s great but…
Reviewed in Canada on October 5, 2022Verified Purchase
It’s a really great streaming device but I have a few reasons it doesn’t get 5 stars.Firstly, the menu is really laggy. It’s odd for a brand new device to be choppy and take a few seconds to load the Home Screen. So I wasn’t too impressed with that.Next, it has ads. I am really dissatisfied with this. They are few and far between, but I paid in full for my fire stick and I pay my subs. I shouldn’t be getting ads for McDonald’s on my Home Screen. Even if it is just a quick picture on the top, or a quick screen when the screen saver comes up. It’s gross. I hate this ads on everything culture we’re getting pushed into. If it’s not something I can watch or potentially sub to, it shouldn’t be on my fire stick.Thirdly, the Alexa for searching kinda sucks. I was trying to teach my kids to use it to find their shows, but for example, I’ll say search for “Daniel Tiger” and it will bring it up but only the season our subs don’t cover. It’s not even the most recent season, or the first one. So my kids can’t just select and go, I have to manually go in and switch seasons, choose episodes, etc. Same with things like TOTS the kids show on Disney plus. If you say play tots or search tots it doesn’t even bring that up. You have to say the full title “Tiny one’s delivery service” which is a pain in the butt. So we don’t even use Alexa anymore. It takes less time to type what you’re searching in. I thought Alexa was supposed to be a little smarter lol.I wish that the home screen was a little more customizable. Like I almost wish you could just have a screen with your selected apps, instead of having to load all the little pictures of the things I’m not gonna watch.As for the good things, I also have a lot to say! We got it initially to stream discovery plus, as our ps4 didn’t have the app to run it. It runs phenomenally! We don’t get any lag, no “potato vision,” and it rarely buffers. We have the thing hardwired to the modem, which helps. It is so nice to have one convenient remote to access all our services. It can turn the tv on and off and change the volume as well which is awesome. It has live tv (stack tv) for us which is awesome in addition to all the big services. I love the integration of Amazon photos so you can have your own photos as a screen saver, which can be conveniently uploaded from your phone! It really has all we need as a family and we’re overall satisfied!

Report
Duncan McKenzie5.0 out of 5 stars
High quality standards conversion for VCR
Reviewed in Canada on January 4, 2022Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
I had bought an old VCR to convert digitize videotapes, some of which were in the European PAL format. Unfortunately, the VCR came from the Ukraine, and would only play the tapes back in its own native standard, SECAM. After many attempts to change the VCR settings, I bought this little box. After a taking a couple of seconds to lock onto the picture, it had no difficulty digitizing the SECAM signal, and the video quality it outputs is really excellent. That really impressed me.It will work with normal North American devices too, and the quality is just as good. You can display the picture directly by running an HDMI cable (not included!) into a TV. I wanted to copy the video, so I ran an HDMI cable into a "game capture" device, then into a computer, using OBS software to resize the picture and record it.I've been very pleased with the results. The box converts both video and sound. Audio is correctly synchronized to the video. There are no obvious digital artifacts, and the output image is very stable – I suspect the conversion process stabilizes a jumpy picture.If you're playing back from a standard video source, the image will always be stretched to widescreen. Viewing a video image in its normal 4:3 aspect ratio requires adjusting the picture settings on the TV.  I think it manipulates the colour, too – the images seemed more vivid than you might expect from an old tape. (Eg, blacks are black rather than grey. It looks good.) A switch provides two widescreen HD resolutions – 720P and 1280P. The lower one is more than enough for videotapes.You get only the converter box and its USB power cord. You need to buy suitable cables, as well as a USB power supply. The converter uses a USB cable as its power cord – which is likely to confuse a few customers. A clumsy arrangement.However, for the low price, this is an amazing little device. I also own the Elgato Video Capture Card, which is easier to use and set up, and includes friendly software, but can't do the conversion tricks that this converter can do. If you don't mind tinkering to get it set up, this converter is outstanding value.

description: Up to 160MB/s read speeds to save time transferring high res images and 4K UHD videos(2)    Requires compatible devices capable of reaching such speeds    Up to 90MB/s write speeds for fast shooting    Requires compatible devices capable of reaching such speeds    4K UHD and Full HD Ready(2) with UHS speed class 3 (U3) and video speed class 30 (V30)(5)    Rated A2 for faster loading and in app performance (8)    Built for and tested in harsh conditions: Temperature Proof, Water Proof, shock Proof and x ray Proof(4); Get the SanDisk memory zone app for easy file management (available on Google Play)(3)

user_reviews:
Pascal Grenier5.0 out of 5 stars
My expectations were high
Reviewed in Canada on December 28, 2023Size: 128GBStyle: Card OnlyVerified Purchase
I picked up the SanDisk Extreme microSDXC memory card a few months ago, motivated by its excellent reputation for reliability and performance. My expectations were high: a card capable of handling large files quickly, ideal for cameras, drones or smartphones.Using this card was a real pleasure. Its high transfer speed allowed me to move and access my files quickly, which is crucial when you don't want to waste a moment. However, I noted that in extreme conditions its performance may fluctuate slightly.In terms of quality, the SanDisk Extreme does not disappoint. It resists shock, water and extreme temperatures, making it a perfect choice for adventurers. Its performance is up to par, with competitive read and write speeds.Highlights: high speed, durable, large storage capacity.Cons: Slightly inconsistent performance in extreme conditions, somewhat high price.Compared to other microSD cards on the market, the SanDisk Extreme stands out for its speed and reliability. However, for those looking for a more economical option, brands like Kingston or Samsung offer interesting alternatives.To maintain its performance, I recommend formatting the card regularly and storing it in a dry place at room temperature.Technical details- Capacity: up to 1 TB.- Reading speed: up to 160 MB/s.- Resistance to the elements: waterproof, shock and temperature resistant.For optimal performance, use this card with devices that support UHS-I. It is ideal for recording and playing 4K videos.The SanDisk Extreme microSDXC memory card is an excellent choice for those looking for speed and reliability. It represents a safe investment for enthusiasts of photography, videography or simply to increase the storage of their smartphone.

Magik Dust5.0 out of 5 stars
Works great
Reviewed in Canada on September 12, 2023Verified Purchase
This worked great for me. Using it once to twice a day the batteries given with it lasted a year and a half. I still need to sniff the water down my throat to clear my nose properly, but this works out better and cheaper than buying the canisters of salt water. It's gentle on my nose as well, far more gentle than those metal canisters with salt water (which are also over $10 CAD each).It takes a time or two to get used to using it, but it didn't take me long. I use about one third of the water at a time, then just leave it to use it next time, without opening it. This means I only go through a salt pod every other day. It's a little hard to clean because you aren't supposed to get the bottom wet. There is rubber around the battery pack, but they still don't want you to get the bottom wet, just in case.I find this useful and mine has worked great for the past two years, and it's still works great (I just changed the batteries).

title: Sony WH-1000XM4 Wireless Industry Leading Noise Canceling Overhead Headphones with Mic for Phone-Call and Alexa Voice Control, Black
description: Industry-leading noise canceling with Dual Noise Sensor technology    Next-level music with Edge-AI, co-developed with Sony Music Studios Tokyo    Up to 30-hour battery life with quick charging (10 min charge for 5 hours of playback)    Touch Sensor controls to pause play skip tracks, control volume, activate your voice assistant, and answer phone calls    Speak-to-chat technology automatically reduces volume during conversations
nav: Electronics › Headphones, Earbuds & Accessories › Headphones
user_reviews:
Dusky5.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing Noise Cancellation & Great out of the box sound.
Reviewed in Canada on February 24, 2022Colour Name: Midnight BlueStyle: WH1000XM4Verified Purchase
Sound Quality (5/5)These are the first headphones I've owned that when first listening to them I didn't immediately flinch and look for the nearest EQ. I'm no sound engineer, but definitely it has great bass and great quality for mids & highs.Noise cancelation (5/5)Although this is my first set of headphones that support this feature. I'm really blown away by it. I have an air purifier in my office, and even at medium setting. The fan is pretty noisy. But with these things on, I can barely hear it, and that's with no music/movie playing. But as soon as I turn on a movie or song, I seriously can't tell it's on.I read some people say they could hear a waterfall or something in the background. I can't hear anything other than silence, or what I'm listening to.Wireless/Wired (4/5)Being able to use the headphones with them powereoff with a wire, or have them connect wireless via bluetooth is an amazing feature. And it works really well!I was really surprised  however that I don't seem to be able to use this headset with the bluetooth of my main PC. It has a really think glass panel, so I'm wondering if it's not because of that. If you own a case with a glass panel, maybe double check with another set of bluetooth headse/earbuds to see how the conenction goes.Audio Delay/lag on Bluetooth (5/5)I own a mini laptop and it only has bluetooth 4.1. But for some reason when I watch videos or movies, I'm  virtually unable to tell whether there is lag. Unlike any other bluetooth earbuds I've owned. The delay is amazing. Obviously your mileage may vary, but it's something that drove me insane with my previous wireless earbuds. Don't have this problem here!Gestures (4/5)I wasn't really looking forward to the gestures pad. But it turns out to be working really well. Once in a while an action won't register. But it's really rare for me.Play/Pause on a PC can be a little weird though. One day I was listening to spotify while working, and then with the tab still opened I started watching youtube after work. And after pausing said video and unpausing it, using the headset. It ended up starting the playback of both my spotify tab, and my youtube tab.Comfort (4/5)First day I wore them I was a little concerned since, even though I have a small head. I felt like the headphones were pretty tight on my head. But after even just 2 days of use. It's already leagues better. Either I got used to it, or it's 'breaking in'.The cups are pretty comfortable. Wish they would be just a tad larger, not sure if I have big ears. But I can tell that part of my right ear touches the pad. And I'm wondering if I ever end up pulling a really long work, or gaming session if it'll end making my ear feel pinched. One of my older headsets did that.One thing that I was happily surprised was the weight of the headset. With such an impressive battery life and suite of features. I was expecting this thing to be rather heavy. Compared to a Corsair Void (probably a bad example) it's light as a feather.Pairing Headphones with 2 Devices (3/5)First thing, this feature is only possible via the headphone's native app. Meaning you can't perform this type of sync with the physical sync button. Once you have the devices regisered on the app, then you can enable a setting and select which 2 devices you want.On the topic of "2 devices", I guess Is should have read more on this feature. But I use 2 PCs at home, a media and a work/gaming PC. And I really would have liked to be able to on the fly, switch between audio of both. But it turns out that you can only connect to 1 phone, and something else. It can be 2 phones, but not 2 PCs.Included Accessories (3/5)The case it comes with is great. Hard-shell clam design, with some neat nook where you can shove the USB C charging cable, audio cable and airplane adapter thing. But as much as I like the quality and how it snuggly holds on to and protects the headphones. Not sure if mine is a fluike, but whoever decided to sew the elastic mesh bag on the 'bottom' part of the clam. Kind of silly.The audio cable is 'OK' if you use it for your phone. But if you want to use it for a PC you'll for sure either need an extension or a longer cable period. But at least it's a usesable lenght albeit a little conservative.But the USB type c charging cable. I hope you have a USB hub available. Depending on the case/setup you have. I'm pretty sure a lot of people wouldn't be able to use that cable to connect the headphones to their PC's back USB ports. Well you could do it, but depending on your case or setup. The headphones won't be able to rest on either the top of your case, or the desk/floor it's own. They'll end up dangling. (Which I think would be a bad idea.)

Report
Benoit l.5.0 out of 5 stars
Super comfortable, top music quality
Reviewed in Canada on October 23, 2020Colour Name: BlackStyle: WH1000XM4Verified Purchase
I have a pair of Bose wired QC-35 so this is my base for comparison. I bought these because I was tired of having the cable in my way all the time.Context: I use the XM-4 mostly with my laptop but they're also paired with my Galaxy S10. The only noises I have in my environment are my wife sitting about a meter away from me in our home office and she speaks very loudly when she is in a virtual meeting (and she has quite a lot of them and the keyboard clicks. So, noise cancelling is mostly used for surrounding voice.Let's start with noise cancelling: The Sony XM4 have about the same noise cancellation quality as the wired QC-35 but the XM4 have a white noise that is a bit bugging me when I'm not listening to anything, just using them for noise cancellation while the QC-35 do not have a white noise and can cancel noise as well as the XM4. I mostly use noise cancellation because my wife is sitting about one meter away and she very often takes phone meeting and she speaks quite loudly. The XM4 and the QC-35 cancel about 60% of her voice so when I listen to music, even at low volume I don't hear her at all.Sound: The sound is a bit better than the wired QC-35. The bass is deep and all the frequencies are crisp and clear. I can hear every single instruments very clearly so I can enjoy my music better than ever before. These headphones should definitely be able to satisfy the most demanding audiophiles out there. Also they can play loud enough to damage your ear drums which is pretty good for wireless headphones. The sound is as good whether it comes from my laptop or my Galaxy S10 phone.Calls using my Galaxy S10: If I receive a call on my Galaxy S10 while listening to music on my laptop (or my phone), the XM4 will pause the music and ring in the headphones. A simple double tap on the touch sensor and I can answer the call or reject it by holding a finger on the touch sensor. The quality of the audio during calls is excellent; I can hear very well and I'm told that the sound on the other side of the conversation is very good. I never tried them in a noisy environment or outside when the wind is blowing but Sony states that the XM4 will cancel most of the ambiant noise to keep the other side of the call clean.Features: I love the many features the XM4 offer. Here are a few features I particularly like: 1. When listening to music, I just have to take the headphones off and the XM4 will automatically pause the music thanks to the proximity sensor inside the left can. I simply have to put them back on for the music to start again. 2. When I listen to music and I want to talk to someone, I don't have to take them off, I just have to start talking and the music will automatically pause and the mics on the unit will make sure I can hear what's being said so I can carry a conversation without taking them off. Then, 15 or 30 seconds (configurable) after I stop talking, the music starts again. 3. Finally, the multiple commands I can use on the touch sensor such as volume up/down, next/previous song, fast-forward/backward and more. Another feature that is nice for those who want to use it is the integration with Alexa or Google assistant. However since I do not use any assistant, I cannot comment on this.Comfort: I have regular size ears so the cups surround them completely and do not put pressure on any part of my ears. I was able to wear them for 9 hours straight (while wearing glasses) with one short break in the middle for lunch and I felt no discomfort. Comparatively, the QC-35 have about the same size cup but the leather on the QC-35 is more comfortable than on the XM4.App: The Sony "Headphone" app is pretty good and complete, helping you customize your headphone sound and behavior very easily. You can configure an equalizer to adjust the sound to your specific preferences, customize the function of the second button on the left ear piece, turn on/off different feature of the XM4, update the firmware, and more. If your willing to give the app GPS location permission, you can have different configuration depending on where you are, home, office, commute, etc. This is a big one for me, I'm not forced to give GPS location permission to the app, contrary to the Bose Bluetooth headphone app. With Bose, if you don't give GPS location permission, you can't even pair your headphones! I won't comment on the location feature of the XM4 since I'm not using it but I'm happy I'm not forced to give this permission.Cons: I had to think hard to find any cons but here they are. 1. I cannot use the headphones while charging but this is minor since the battery life is so long and you can use them with the supplied 3.5mm cord but without the mic function. 2. The cushions on the QC-35 are more comfortable, softer than the ones on the XM4. I've read a lot of reviews mentioning problems with TV sound so I tested my MX4 with my Samsung Smart TV; the pairing was easy enough but the sound was constantly choppy so I would not recommend them if you want to watch TV with them.Summary: As far as I know, as of now these are the best wireless headphones on the planet! Great sound, feature rich and very comfortable but not recommended for TV watching.

Report
Brendox15.0 out of 5 stars
Same as the Vet!
Reviewed in Canada on May 25, 2023Verified Purchase
Advantage products (Advantage II) are my go-to flea treatments for both of my dogs.  When it comes tick season early to mid spring, I purchase the Advantix treatments.  They come in a bit cheaper on Amazon compared to what I used to pay at the vet and it is the exact same treatments for a lower cost.They are easy to use, you just take the cap off of the product, turn the cape upside down and place it onto the tip of the tube and twist, which breaks the seal and you're good to go!  Spread your dogs fur until you can see some skin and squeeze a little of the product directly to the skin.  I usually do this in about 4-5 spots along my dog's back until the tub is empty.I have been using this product for years and I can say with 100% certainty that it DOES work when it comes to fleas and ticks.  I live in the the Country in Nova Scotia and we have a large infestation of ticks every spring.  Once April hit, I was pulling 1-3 ticks off each of my dogs daily.  I am not into each dogs' second treatment and I haven't found a single tick since.Very strongly recommend not just Advantix but all Advantage products.  You will not be disappointed.Take note that I have heard from others that some dogs MAY take allergic reactions to these products, so always try a test site first before applying the full product.

title: PlayStation Portal Remote Player - PlayStation 5
description: Put Your PS5 in the Palm of Your Hand - PlayStation Portal Remote Player gives you access to the games on your PS5 over your home Wi-Fi*, letting you jump right into gaming without needing to play on a TV.    Play Your Game Collection - PlayStation Portal Remote Player can play compatible games you have installed on your PS5 console, including your favorite games for PS5 and PS4.**    Experience Breathtaking Immersion with DualSense Wireless Controller Features - Feel the incredible immersion of haptic feedback and adaptive triggers in supported games.****    Beautiful 8” LCD Screen - Take in every exquisite detail of your favorite games as they come alive on a brightly lit and gorgeous full HD screen.    60fps Capable at 1080p Resolution - PlayStation Portal Remote Player can deliver silky smooth gameplay at up to 60fps with high image clarity on its 1080p resolution screen.***    *PlayStation Portal Remote Player can stream compatible games installed on your PS5 console. PlayStation Portal Remote Player requires broadband internet Wi-Fi with at least 5Mbps for use. For a better play experience, a high-speed connection of at least 15Mbps is recommended. The quality and connectivity of your play experience may vary depending on your network environment. A PS5 console and account for PlayStation Network is required. The PS5 console must be connected to a broadband internet connection, powered on fully or in Rest Mode, and it must be paired with your PlayStation Portal Remote Player.    ** Games that require a VR headset (PlayStation VR or PlayStation VR2) or additional peripherals (other than a DUALSHOCK 4, DualSense, or DualSense Edge wireless controller) are not compatible. Games that must be streamed on PS5 using a PS Plus Premium membership are not compatible. Haptic feedback and adaptive trigger features available when supported by game.

Matt5.0 out of 5 stars
My favourite handheld system
Reviewed in Canada on March 7, 2020Colour Name: YellowStyle: ConsoleVerified Purchase
I really like the Switch Lite. I bought the yellow edition because I bought Lets Go Pikachu with it.  The system has a very bright and colourful screen.  I like using the DPAD to move around in games because it reminds me of the Super Nintendo.  I have heard people say that the analog sticks can have problems but I have not found any. I decided to buy this as Nintendo offers a 12-month warranty on the system. If the analog stick does have a problem in a few months, I can get it repaired for free.It is a very light system and easy to hold and use.  I bought a memory card for it but it comes with 32GB built in.  Nintendo offers a yearly subscription service that includes cloud saving for your games and a library of free SNES and NES games to play.  The subscription has a free trial right now and is not required to play games unless you want to play them online. Most of the games I have played are single-player and made to be portable, so I have not needed to play online so far.The only downside is that the Nintendo game cartridges are expensive to purchase, but there are some deals on Amazon and I was also able to rent some games from a local video store.  The upside is that the cartridges work great and can't get scratched like a CD so they last a lot longer.I thought about buying a regular Switch system but those sell for $400 plus tax and this unit was $259 plus tax, and I like to play my games in handheld mode.  My television has been acting up lately so this way I can play console quality games on my handheld and don't need a television.

Duncan Hannah5.0 out of 5 stars
One of the best devices I've ever used.
Reviewed in Canada on January 2, 2021Colour Name: GrayStyle: ConsoleVerified Purchase
I love the Nintendo Switch Lite. It's like a super Nintendo 3DS, but sadly lacking backwards compatibility, but I understand why they left it out. Would be hard to display 2 screens on the switch screen. My issues with the switch are with nintendo. They never discount their first party games (Not that I care as I only own 2 of them haha), their accessories are stupidly overpriced, and their obvious laziness in frame rates in switch games. How is it that Super Mario Odyssey gets 60fps but Fire Emblem Three Houses gets 30 fps? I love Three Houses but frame rate is important, even in a turn based rpg. If you're like me and you don't care much for games like animal crossing, ultimate, and mario odyssey, then you'll get more bang for your buck with this thing. It kinda shocks me how many people bought a switch just for animal crossing...like what? You spent $260 canadian dollars LET ALONE $400+ for a regular switch for ANIMAL CROSSING NEW HORIZIONS? What the hell...anyway I've bought a lot of games for this thing. While I would like higher performance in most of them, I'm content with being able to play these games conveniently on the go. Sure, laptops exist and I have a good gaming laptop for on the go gaming, but a switch allows you to go into a game faster than a laptop. Not because a switch is faster than a gaming pc haha no but it starts at the games menu asap, which is nice. I give the switch a 9/10, but the value fluctuates. A lot of people have gotten ripped off by nintendo here. I haven't, since I've only bought 2 full priced games, those being Three Houses and Breath of the Wild. I'm content with spending a full $80 Canadian plus tax on these games because they've given me hundreds of hours of content, and I have yet to complete both of them. However, when it comes to animal crossing which is stardew valley but shitty framerate and not finished, no thanks. Smash ultimate looks fun but I prefer melee (better game sorry but objective).I know that I've given this thing a lot of ****, but I have lots of praise to give it too. Being able to play Resident Evil 4 on the bus is mind blowing for me. Sure, you could use a laptop but that's less convenient. Bigger machine that you need a mouse/controller for, instead of switch/switch lite where it's all in one small, convenient package. Really cool. I just hate nintendo lolScrew Sword and Shield. Overpriced garbage for hardly anything. Way too easy too never buying it.

It doesn't have a huge selection of games when you're comparing it to things like Xbox one or PS4, but I literally only got it for a handful of games I already wanted anyway lol The battery life is a tad bit disappointing, but it does charge comparatively quickly. I would highly recommend getting a protective screen and a case since if you drop this, it's likely to show it - it's not a bad design, but it is a bit delicate. Altogether, great quality and exactly as addicting as I thought it'd be. This is a great console for kids too, not just adults like me who got addicted to Nintendo decades ago lol There are games on here for every age group. The only complaint I have (and the reason it's getting 4 instead of 5 stars) if that you have to pay to play online with anyone in games like OverWatch and animal Crossing,, so expect to play solo unless you're willing to pay extra.

user_reviews:
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
Don’t let faint likes discourage you
Reviewed in Canada on February 19, 2024Size: 70 count (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
First the LH strips- they will always be positive, that’s normal. Medium to light colour leading up to and after ovulation. However you will notice a huge difference in the colour strip when you have your LH surge, you won’t question it because the line will be darker then the other test line and then this means you’re going to ovulate within 12-36 hours. I did the deed everyday starting on cycle day 9 until and including cycle day 16 just to be sure. My cycles are typically 28 days long, sometimes 29 and I bleed for 6 days. On day 13 I seen my LH surge and I assume I ovulated day 14/15.HCG strips- I got my first and VERY faint postive cycle day 23, the next day again, still very faint. However the day after it got a little darker. I couldn’t tell a difference in days unless I wanted two days, which makes sense as hormones double every 48-72 hours. So if you’re testing everyday don’t set discouraged thinking it’s a chemical pregnancy because the line seems too faint. Mine didn’t get darker until cycle day 27 the day before “my period”. And even then, it could be darker, it’s still only medium pink. But I took a clear blue test to be sure and this was much darker and very clearly bright positive. Today is my missed period and I’m 4 weeks pregnant first try with these strips. Please remember that even a faint positive is a positive, it will slowly get darker but you won’t be satisfied with the darkness until after your period has been missed lol.

title: Kindle Oasis – With 7” display and page turn buttons - 8 GB, Wi-Fi
description: Our best 7", 300ppi flush-front Paperwhite display.    Adjustable warm light to shift screen shade from white to amber.    Waterproof (IPX8) so you can read in the bath or by the pool. Your Kindle has been tested to withstand accidental immersion in water.    Thin and light ergonomic design with page turn buttons.    Reads like real paper with the latest e-ink technology. user_reviews:
Derek Armstrong5.0 out of 5 stars
Incremental improvement over last, but still the best ereader for actual book reading
Reviewed in Canada on December 11, 2019Digital Storage Capacity: 32 GBConnectivity: WIFIColour: GraphiteConfiguration: Without Kindle UnlimitedVerified Purchase
I've had every version of the Oasis, and several previous Kindles, along with two Kobos. I dabbled with the Kobo Forma because I needed warm light -- and the last version of Oasis (before current one), sadly didn't have it. It's that important to a good reading experience. Fortunately, I came back because the Forma has uneven lighting, and the eco system just is weak. My library is hundreds of Kindle books, so I'm "stuck." It's  a good stuck, as I love the new Oasis 7" with warm light. It's handy to carry, really lovely to hold with the notch and the taper (you either love it or hate it. I love it.) If I'm picky, I'd say I prefer the 7.8" screen size of Forma, but with uneven lighting (also some noticeable flicker), it comes back to the 7" Oasis. In real life, once you sit down with a book, 7" is just as good, and smaller in the hand (which is great!) It's snappier too, although only a little bit, as compared to both Forma and my previous Oasis. Mainly, I love the even lighting, the auto dimming (although it's not always right on) and the must have for me -- warm lighting. I could never read with cold light for a long period of time, too fatiguing. What's the big dissapointment? Battery, if you leave Bluetooth or LTE on. Turn it off, it's days long (I read at least 3 hours a night). Turn it on, it's down in a day or two. For a real book-reader, you simply don't need it on, so turn it off, you'll be happier.You'll also be happier if you remember it's not a tablet. I have my older gen ipad for that, don't want this to be a tablet. Tablets should be tablets, readers should be readers. Tablets don't last long on batteries, and they are great with PDF documents, and so on — but book e-readers let you shut down the email, social media and other distractions and sink into a good book. I love that 32GB has enough room for thousands of books, audio books and some PDFs. It's all I need.Wish list? Next gen, make it 8", longer battery life, even snappier on page turns if possible (each gen of e-ink seems snappier). Keep those buttons, they're lovely, but you could drop the "click." I don't like the sponge-like buttons on Forma, but I like their silence when reading. Nits aside, it's a spectacular device, great to haul with you anywhere, small enough for your bag, hand, to carry all day, waterproof. Don't need speakers, bluetooth or colour. Is it worth it? Yes, if you're a big reader — say 1.5 hours a day or longer, where eye fatigue and distractions are factors. No, if you're a light bathroom reader (i.e. short sessions), stick with the tablet, or the cheapest kindle.

An Du5.0 out of 5 stars
I’m thrilled with the Oasis & I recommend it heartily!
Reviewed in Canada on April 21, 2021Digital Storage Capacity: 8 GBConnectivity: WIFIColour: GraphiteConfiguration: Without Kindle UnlimitedVerified Purchase
I have extensively used a Kindle (4G), with great pleasure, since 2011.Last December (2020), I felt I wanted to try one of the newer versions with a backlight, as my eyes are ageing. I chose the Oasis, despite it being the costliest of the Amazon line of readers. I have not regretted my purchase. It did take me a few weeks to acclimate myself to the new milieu, but that’s because I’m lazy and never read the manuals…The Oasis is a superior reading device. Extremely well made, it has the look & feel of a quality instrument. The screen is large & very well lit with adjustable levels of intensity & warmth. Side buttons, as well as a touch screen, permit easy access to all the software features you could want during a reading session. I love the dictionaries & access to Wikipedia, as I read a lot of science & history.Now, after several months of use, I simply love it & use it daily for hours at a time. You can’t go wrong with the Oasis, & Amazon has the largest selection of e-books I’m aware of, in both English & French. One negative aspect, however, is that Canadian libraries have not yet signed an agreement with Amazon, so one cannot borrow their e-books with this device. That’s a shame, but maybe it will change in the future.I do also recommend getting a cover to protect this fine reader. I chose a simple one ($20) with a flip-up front that doubles as a book stand when folded back on a table or a knee. Useful & very protective for an instrument that can last for decades.

I am extremely sensitive to blue light, so having that much control over the type of lighting and the brightness, while losing none of the readability, I absolutely adore. I like the fact I can turn the pages from the side, which means less fingerprints, and a more enjoyable, reading experience cause you don’t have to stop to get those fingerprints off.The screen is the perfect size not too big and not way to tiny. It’s also significantly lighter than you would expect which is fantastic. I’m always looking for something for those who love to read, but are getting up there in age and have issues reading novels in printed form. RoxieFairy5.0 out of 5 stars
They work!
Reviewed in Canada on October 22, 2023Verified Purchase
Why did I wait so long to make the no-more-fabric-softener jump? These are fantastic!What you need to know: I looked up many different products and read many reviews, and opted for this company. And I am so glad I did! These are not the tiny wool balls like many others sell. They are substantial and of great quality. Plus you get 6 of them!For me, 3 is plenty for a full load so it’s nice to have 3 extras if ever they need replacing, but so far they show no sign of that and I’ve been using them every load for the last 6 weeks. The clothes and the towels come out super soft and without static, it truly is impressive!Now about the scent. I did miss that fresh laundry smell you get from fabric softener, It’s hard to not have that for me.  So I experimented with essential oils and opted for a mix of lavander and lemon. I put a few drops in my fabric softener dispenser for the washing and a few drops directly on the balls for the dryer. It does the trick! If you find that too expensive or don’t like the EO scents, there are also good fragrance oils you can buy with fresh linen or cotton scents or any scent you fancy. They are usually used for making soap or lotions. I’ve tried them too and they also work just fine. Just remember to use only a few drops.I feel so much better and “cleaner” for having bought this product! Money saver and most importantly, a much more ecological choice. Thank you little sheep for the soft and durable  wool you provide, I just hope you’re not hurt in this process 🤞🏻🥺🤞🏻

Report
JB3.0 out of 5 stars
Great for puffing, useless for winter static
Reviewed in Canada on January 13, 2024Verified Purchase
I bought these for helping fluff my down or synthetic insulated coats when drying and they work well for that purpose, I'd give them 5 star for that. I also decided to try them out in a regular load of laundry instead of a dryer sheet and that's where I found them lacking. It's winter in Canada right now and relative humidity in my home is around 34%. Without a dryer sheet and using all 6 wool balls the amount of static electricity between my clothes was insane. It was like they were all velcroed together and I had to re-run on air fluff with a dryer sheet to get it under control. Because of the static the pet hair didn't come off in the dryer like it normally does so I had more work to do after it was dry. Maybe in a more humid environment these would work better, but as a replacement for dryer sheets (to deal with static) they were less than useless.So, for drying puffer jackets and such - 5 stars.General softness of clothes - 4 stars.Fighting static in winter - 0 stars.I'll try them again as a dryer sheet replacement in the summer months just to see if they improve but in winter, never again.

Do not hesitate to buy this

I bought this stroller in May of this year for my baby, who was six months at the time and weighed about 6 Kg. I had to go abroad urgently, and I needed a stroller that I could use across each transit. The stroller that I was currently using at the time was too big and would not be approved to take through the airport all the way to the flight gate, so I bought this one. Trust me, you need this stroller, especially if you are finding one that's light and sturdy to use at the airport. When returning back, I had three transit however when I arrived at the first transit, somehow the airlines messed up and sent my stroller with the baggage, which meant that I would get it at my destinations baggage claim.I was freaking out because to me the stroller seemed fragile, I didn’t think that it could survive another two transits and I know with the way that baggage is handled. I was expecting one of the tires to not be there or for the stroller to be broken. However, when I arrived back the stroller was perfectly fine. The tires run smoothly and the stroller is sturdy.I love that you can pull back the seat so that the baby can lay down. It is also very easy to open and close. Definitely worth buying. description: Braun thermometer is used by more pediatricians and mothers than any other infrared brand    The safest and most accurate method of taking your child's temperature    The small and soft speculum makes it ideal for infants    Disposable lens filters virtually eliminate the risk of transferring germs    Measures 2 x 6.5 x 1.5 inches (WxHxD); 9.6 ounces
nav: Health & Personal Care › Medical Supplies & Equipment › Diagnostics & Health Monitors › Thermometers › Ear
user_reviews:
TR5.0 out of 5 stars
One of the best Ear Thermometer- Easy to use, Professional Grade Accuracy, Takes guesswork out
Reviewed in Canada on October 3, 2020Verified Purchase
When it comes to Ear Thermometers, Braun is considered gold standard and regarded as benchmark for accuracy. My family doctor also recommends Braun. I have used Braun Thermometer for years and my old Braun is still working like charm for last 10 years. So when I needed to upgrade my thermometer, I decided to choose their top of the line Braun Thermoscan 7 Thermometer and I am quite pleased with this advanced thermometer. Thermometer is well designed and easy to use. All the buttons are easy to understand and most people would be able to figure out without even reading the manual.KEY FEATURES:PRE-WARMED TIP: One of the major thing that differentiates Braun from other cheaper brands is it comes with patented pre-warmed tip. The tip on other thermometers can cool the area where the reading is taken, which can lead to inaccurate readings. The tip on the ThermoScan is warmed before use, to ensure professional grade accuracy.EXACTEMP GUIDANCE SYSTEM: This feature ensures that thermometer is positioned in ear correctly and taking correct reading. This is confirmed by a beep and light.AGE PRECISION COLOUR CODED DISPLAY: This is one of my favourite feature on Thermoscan 7. This feature differentiates Thermoscan 7 from other Braun Thermometers such as Thermoscan 5. I didn’t know that definition of “fever” changes with age. On Thermoscan 7, you begin with choosing the one of the three correct age groups (0-3 Months, 3-36 Months and 36+ Months). Thermometer screen will glow Green, yellow or Red light which makes very easy to interpret the results. The coloured screen means that I don’t have to panic and search on Google what classifies as a fever. I’m able to just concentrate on looking after my kids.THE GOOD:(1) Professional Grade Accuracy(2) Large easy to read backlit display. Display with night light- perfect for reading at night time.(3) Quick and fast measurement(4) ExacTemp technology confirms that thermometer is properly positioned and taking accurate reading(5) Pre-warmed tip(6) Age precision technology completely takes the guesswork out of interpreting child’s temperature(7) 9 Memory allows to track results over the time.(8) Ejector button for easy lens-filter removal.(9) You change temperature scale from °F to °C.(10) Comes with storage cradleTHE BAD:(1) Braun Lens filter are on expensive side. Ongoing costs with lens filters is little high.OTHER OPTIONS:Fo Ear Thermometers, Braun is the brand I trust so if I have to compare Thermoscan 7 with something else it would be Thermoscan 5. Thermoscan has all the same technology to ensure accurate measurement, but it does not have Age precision Technology and Colour Coded Display. It also o does not have front panel display with light light.FINAL THOUGHTS:The overall design and feel of Thermoscan 7 is great. It’s easy to use, takes guess work out and makes it easy for novice users to take professional grade accurate readings every single time. It costs more but provides lots of peace of mind. Like my previous Braun I am confident it will last very long and only thing that will make me upgrade it again would be newer technology.

Report
Legally Red  ♡5.0 out of 5 stars
Consistent, reliable and fast 🤒
Reviewed in Canada on February 2, 2021Verified Purchase
This Braun thermometer is very straightforward to operate and is very easy to read and to interpret the results.  You start by covering the tip with a new disposable lens filter (A small portion of filters are included in this kit to get you started) After turning it on with the power button, you first select the age group of the child you are testing by pressing a few times on the ''Age precision button ''until you obtain the desired age group (the button looks like a baby crawling on all fours).Once the age has been selected, you just need to press on the ''temperature taking button'' which is at the top of the device (the button looks like a mercury thermometer).  You then insert the tip into the ear, and keep it there until you hear a beep, which will indicate that the thermometer has obtained the measured temperature.The thermometer screen will not only show the measured temperature in degrees, but the screen's background color will indicate if there is a fever or if the temperature is normal.  The screen will either be green (which means that there is no fever), yellow (which means there is a light fever) or red (which means there is a high fever).  It takes around 2:29 seconds to provide a reading.I have tested and compared the readings with my older trusty thermometer and both were consistently showing very similar results each time.  I have used it on myself and on my toddler, who really doesn't like having his temperature taken.  I did manage to successfully get accurate results multiple times without him making too much of a fuss.  Every time I use this thermometer, I really enjoy the fact that I don't have to double check any numbers to find out if he has a fever or not.  The color indicator confirms that for me.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase.  Would definitely recommend.If my review was helpful let me know by clicking on the ''Helpful'' button :) 👍🏻

The custom-designed AMD processor and RDNA 2 GPU provide stunning visuals, with support for ray tracing that adds a level of realism to games that is truly breathtaking. The inclusion of Game Pass further enhances the gaming ecosystem, offering a diverse and ever-expanding library of titles that cater to various tastes and preferences.The sleek and minimalist design of the console adds a touch of sophistication to my entertainment center. This is a great consul. After coming from a PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 4 pro it's nice to get back into the Xbox system. I had an original Xbox and an Xbox 360, but skipped the Xbox, one generation and got a PlayStation four and aforementioned PlayStation 4 pro. I had an OG PlayStation way back in the day, and though I looked at the PlayStation five, I found that the Xbox has a better selection at the moment. Yes, the PlayStation 5 does have some good exclusive games but the backwards compatibility with the Xbox so I will need to play some classic games like split second and others is a great thing. Sony only has backward compatibility to the PlayStation 4 though. There are only about 60 original Xbox games backwards compatible with the series X, but it's still pretty amazing and then there are so many Xbox 360 games that you can just plug in your old disk and play. Something you could never do on the PlayStation.The big feature that is so impressive here is the resume play function. To have seven or eight or nine games on the go all at once, and be able to switch back-and-forth between them at a whim with a delay of only seconds between swapping is an amazing thing. Well done Microsoft!

Report
Donovan3315.0 out of 5 stars
Xbox One X Perfected
Reviewed in Canada on November 15, 2020Platform for display: Xbox Series XEdition: Console OnlyVerified Purchase
The Xbox Series X addresses the Xbox One X's weakest point: speed. It has a powerful CPU in addition to its monstrous GPU and has built-in SSD. You'll be impressed with the speed from the get-go. The initial setup was super fast and it even allows you to copy settings from the cloud that it backed up from your previous console.You'll be up and running in no time, and if you are a Gamepass subscriber, you'll have great games to play such as Gears Tactics & Tetris Connected. You'll have to be patient though as they download or as you apply the Series X optimization patches. While the delay of Halo Infinite's launch left a big hole in the launch lineup, it did not really bother me as I have more than enough launch games to play. Yakuza Like a Dragon is quite fun and looks fantastic on the console. Tetris Connected, while not a graphical showcase, manages to look quite cool and flashy, and  is incredibly addicting with numerous online and solo game modes.The backwards compatibility truly shines and it is a joy going back to some of your favorite titles that perform better now with the power of the Series X. Forza Horizon 4 and Gears 5 never looked so good at 4K-60fps. The new controller is not a big change, but since I use the Elite 2 anyways, that didn't bother me all too much. I quite like how the new controller feels and it seems they made some minor yet meaningful tweaks to it overall. The bumpers seem more responsive to me and the share button is a useful addition.Looking forward to seeing what's next for this powerful console and I am very impressed with the overall package so far.  Cheers

Report
Dunhio5.0 out of 5 stars
IT'LL BURN YOUR PANTS OFF!!! WOOOOWEEEEE!!!
Reviewed in Canada on March 24, 2020Verified Purchase
I'm someone who grew up eating spicy foods, so when I order something "spicy" from Canadian restaurants, it barely tickles my throat. When my girlfriend takes a bite of my plate of food, she coughs and tears up from the spice level if I'm having a spicy dish.With that being said, Da Bomb made me feel like a human being with a normal spice tolerance again. I lightly coated a dry rib with this sauce and after eating all of the meat off of the bone, I proceeded to tear up and take some sips of water. I did not "freak out", but I definitely had to stop and try to collect myself while working through the pain for 4 to 5 minutes. My girlfriend got a kick out of it because she's never seen me respond this way to any hot sauce, ever, for over 8 years.Like others, we ordered this hot sauce because of it's notorious place as the 3rd last hot sauce on the show Hot Ones on YouTube. All the guests seem to respond to this hot sauce as being the one that really kicks them in the butt as they near the last of the wings.I actually have the final hot sauce from a couple of seasons back "The Last Dab Redux", which registers at multiples of spice levels higher than Da Bomb, but I can confidently state that Da Bomb is actually much hotter than The Last Dab Redux. The reason for this is Da Bomb is actually made with pepper extract as opposed to fresh peppers (like The Last Dab Redux). Pepper extract registers at a lower spice level in scoville units, but in reality, the heat is actually much hotter than in a fresh pepper.So, if you want to test your might against the hottest of the hot, I have not tried ANYTHING hotter than Da Bomb.May God have mercy on your rectum... and mine.The End.

All the guests seem to respond to this hot sauce as being the one that really kicks them in the butt as they near the last of the wings.I actually have the final hot sauce from a couple of seasons back "The Last Dab Redux", which registers at multiples of spice levels higher than Da Bomb, but I can confidently state that Da Bomb is actually much hotter than The Last Dab Redux. The reason for this is Da Bomb is actually made with pepper extract as opposed to fresh peppers (like The Last Dab Redux). Pepper extract registers at a lower spice level in scoville units, but in reality, the heat is actually much hotter than in a fresh pepper.So, if you want to test your might against the hottest of the hot, I have not tried ANYTHING hotter than Da Bomb.May God have mercy on your rectum... and mine.The End.
