description: WHAT IS CASTOR OIL? Castor Oil has been used for centuries as a beauty cabinet staple for skin, hair, nails, lashes, brows and more. It’s most famously used in Castor Oil Packs, an ancient self-care practice.    WHY CASTOR OIL IN AMBER GLASS, NOT PLASTIC? An amber glass bottle is a MUST with Castor Oil! Castor Oil is the ultimate carrier oil that can permeate and carry substances deeply into the layers of skin. Avoiding Castor Oil bottled in plastic reduces exposure to hormone-disrupting chemicals.    WHY CERTIFIED ORGANIC, EXTRA VIRGIN, & HEXANE-FREE CASTOR OIL? Opting for these varieties is crucial to avoid hormone-disrupting pesticides, herbicides and solvents like hexane    CAN I DRINK CASTOR OIL OR TAKE CASTOR OIL CAPSULES FOR CONSTIPATION? No, Queen of the Thrones Castor Oil is for topical use only. Taking Castor Oil orally is known to be a stimulant laxative, applying it topically with a Castor Oil Pack is a much gentler approach.    HOW DO I USE IT? Simply apply the Castor Oil to your skin, hair or nails; use it as a natural makeup remover, or a soothing massage oil. Pair it with your favorite Queen of the Thrones Castor Oil Pack for Liver, apply before dry brushing or body rolling, or combine it with other natural ingredients to create your own face masks, hair masks, exfoliating scrubs and more.

Report
Addicted but impoverished shopper5.0 out of 5 stars
Great to connect a camera or device with 5-pin MiniB USB female port to any USB 2.0 devices (like printers, hubs, laptops, etc)!
Reviewed in Canada on February 27, 2017Size: 1.8 MetersStyle: 1-PackPattern Name: CableVerified Purchase
I purchased this cable to connect my sister's new Canon PowerShot camera that has a 5-pin Mini B USB port, in order to connect it to peripheral devices such as her laptop, computer, printers, external hard drive, and memory card reader/writers with or without a USB hub. Suffice to say, if you want to connect your camera or other device with a 5-pin MiniB USB port to your printer, card reader or reader/writer, laptop, computer, external hard drive for USB 2.0/Type B, or USB 2.0 hub (or USB 3.0 hub downward compatible with USB 2.0 cables)...then look no further. Do not waste money to buy a cable that is specifically listed for your camera or other device (eg. USB 2 cable for Canon PowerShot SX540 HS)!This cable is to connect a female (hole) port into another female USB 2.0 port so it must have male (the piece that you fit into a port) ends on both sides. I began with no knowledge of USB ports, accessories, and devices, aside from knowing that there are different USB types for my laptop, cell phones, and tablet. I found some helpful review sites for USB information (including USB 3.0/Type A, USB 2.0/Type B, USB 3.1/Type C, micro-USB, mini USB, and Apple lightning ports), most of which link to Amazon. Just google/search for USB Guide or the specific USB port on your device "to USB 2/3" since most cables and adapters are labelled accordingly. You want to search for a cable, you must make sure that the ends that insert into ports are male, and the ends that you want to insert into are female.Another tip: I am fairly new to Amazon (~2 months of intensive shopping, after a few purchases years prior), and despite knowing that AmazonBasics items are an additional 20% off if you purchase more than one at checkout, I have forgotten to do so every time, including when I purchased this cable. If your buying this cable, you may want an AmazonBasics USB 2.0 extension cable (USB 2.0 male to female) or one of many AmazonBasics items available. I am not trying to advertise for Amazon; just trying to prevent someone from repeating my mistakes!I apologize if my information about different USB technologies is overly simplistic or un-informative because I have just begun to understand the complex world of ports, cables, hubs, and adapters; this is aimed to help people who have very little knowledge like when I shopped for this item.Thank you for reading my review (I appreciate this review community so I am trying to give back)!

C Wirt4.0 out of 5 stars
It's pretty fun
Reviewed in Canada on November 27, 2023Edition: Collector's EditionVerified Purchase
It's a fun game some of the story feels a little bit kind of I suppose sewn together like there are parts that don't feel like a part of each other at all like they were written for different game's. I was a bit disappointed with the lack of individual suit power's like the first game had. Okay onto the good the statue is really cool and if you like these interpretation of the characters it's really cool looking! The gameplay is fast and fun admittedly I would have enjoyed more punching people and webbing them up in the game as it's a short game with essentially a bunch of go here collect this then you get a bit of story or a boss fight my favourite of these was the section with Cletus Kasady who will very likely be Carnage in a later game. The very brief amount of time that you get to play as Venom is really cool though as you can go out of bounds as him and even ride a bicycle but back-up your save first because you have to go through some hoops to do this and I would not count on your save being dandy as a lion if you go outside of the game's normal parameters. The black suit has black webs which is cool but if you try to switch to the black or symbiote suits later on the gooey parts in its animations are white for some reason it does NOT switch back and forth after you get the Anti-Venom suit.

Report
Cloverstone5.0 out of 5 stars
• • • Not What I Expected • • •
Reviewed in Canada on February 22, 2022Style: BasicVerified Purchase
So I only recently purchased this shaver/de-piller and tried it out today for the first time. I wanted to test it out quickly and chose some new bamboo socks which I love but one pair has pilling from new slippers and new sweats. They're very intricately detailed on parts so I figured if would be a great place to experiment. Because of this, I opted for the spacer attachment (as most know who own bamboo socks, they are "looped" in tiny detail, all over.I don't know what I was expecting, last using this type of product many years ago that my parents had, a cheap drugstore brand and wasnt too impressive. Anyway, literally one swipe (on low) and ever single last imperfection was removed effortlessly, making them look brand new, I was actually taken aback as silly as that sounds. I then detailed both socks, and despite the very strong potential of snagging and ruining them, they came out beautifully, not a single tear and with being quite careful, it took me maybe a maximum of 2 minutes for both to be perfectly spotless.I am actually now really looking forward to revamping my hoodies (the main purpose of my purchase), plus throws and towels too.I spent a good amount of time researching which one to purchase and narrowed it down to three of them. One being over double the cost, zero customer support or warranty should a problem arise and no additional blades. The second, again no warranty, it had one extra blade, rechargeable yet a fair amount of reviews said it doesn't last more than 10 minutes. Which brought me to this model, it has three blades (two spares that come in a protective case, with 3 total it "should" be a long lasting product), the battery life appears to be good (from reviews), it has a sizable lint trap that's easily emptied (I can't imagine ever filling it up), the seller seems quite responsive and informative, and there's a 90 day 3rd party return/refund policy plus a 2 year warranty. It also comes with a small cleaning brush, as said a spacer, a protective cap, and a thin rope bag that fits everything in it...you only need to provide the two AA batteries.I feel this is a win, it's a great little gadget that is extremely useful and I anticipate will make many things looks like new again. 👌• • • Note: I plan to update my review once I have used this product long enough to fairly speak of battery life, performance on different materials and show the outcome, as well as overall durability.

Whistle3.0 out of 5 stars
Had it for a year then it stopped working
Reviewed in Canada on December 15, 2023Style: BasicVerified Purchase
I loved this fabric shaver when I first got it in 2022.  It breathed new life into several of my fuzz-covered garments.  Suddenly it started to slow down though.  I took it apart, cleaned it, and replaced the batteries, all to no avail. The motor isn't powering the device anymore.  I came back to Amazon to troubleshoot to see if I can fix it, but I think it's just done.  I would have given it a 5-star review when I first got it, but to die after such light use (I maybe used it on 10 tops in total) is unreasonable and wasteful.  I hate buying stuff that ends up in a landfill shortly afterwards.  I don't know if I got a dud, or if this is just a poor product.  I hope your mileage is better than mine.Edit:  Just wanted to report back to you, as the company reached out to me.  After some troubleshooting, my item was determined to be defective and they offered me a full refund.  They told me that they stand behind their product and offer a 2-year warranty.  I thought that was generous, as I had assumed that I was out of luck.  I am leery about repurchasing the same unit, but I am considering their upgraded lint remover that plugs in.  I changed my review from 2/5 stars to 3/5 to reflect the stellar customer service.  For the price, I think it's worth trying your luck on this unit if it is under warranty for two years after purchase.

title: What Do You Meme? Adult Party Game
description: How to Play: Compete with your friends and family to create the funniest memes. Do this by using one of your dealt caption cards to caption the photo card in each round.    Judge’s Choice: The winner of each round is decided by a rotating judge. Pro tip: pick your caption card to match the judge’s sense of humor.    The OG: This is the core game, so buy it first. You'll need it for all of our other expansion packs.    Designed for 17+: This game contains mature content and is designed for ages 17+. Encouraged to be played with 3+ players.    What’s Inside: Each What Do You Meme core game contains 435 cards. 360 of these are caption cards and 75 are photo cards. Printed on premium playing cards (thick with gloss finish); includes an easel and bonus rules, shrink-wrapped in a custom box.    More hilarity: We also make other party games inspired by pop culture. Check out our store for tons more good stuff.
nav: Toys & Games › Games & Accessories › Card Games › Dedicated Deck Card Games
user_reviews:
Mitch’s Fitgear5.0 out of 5 stars
Hilarious Fun for Adult Game Nights!
Reviewed in Canada on June 16, 2023Verified Purchase
I recently purchased the "What Do You Meme? Adult Party Game" for a game night with friends, and let me tell you, it was an absolute blast! If you're a fan of memes and enjoy a good laugh, this game is a must-have for your collection.The premise of the game is simple yet ingenious. Each round, a photo card featuring a popular meme is displayed, and players compete to come up with the funniest caption using their caption cards. The combinations are endless, and the results can be hilarious, especially when everyone's creativity and wit come together.What sets this game apart is its adult-oriented content. The captions can range from mildly risqué to downright outrageous, so it's definitely not suitable for younger players or those easily offended. However, if you're looking for a game to spice up your adult game nights and get everyone laughing uncontrollably, this is the game for you.The quality of the cards is excellent, with vibrant and clear images that capture the essence of the memes perfectly. The box is sturdy and well-designed, keeping all the cards organized and easy to access during gameplay. The rulebook is straightforward and easy to understand, so you can start playing within minutes of opening the box.I particularly appreciate the game's expansion packs, which provide even more cards and memes to keep the gameplay fresh and exciting. They offer additional variety, ensuring that you won't run out of new combinations anytime soon. While the base game alone is entertaining, the expansion packs take it to another level.In terms of gameplay, "What Do You Meme? Adult Party Game" truly shines. It creates a lively atmosphere filled with laughter, friendly competition, and plenty of unforgettable moments. The game is highly interactive, allowing players to showcase their creativity and comedic timing. It's a fantastic icebreaker and a perfect way to bring people together.Overall, I wholeheartedly recommend "What Do You Meme? Adult Party Game" to anyone looking for a hilarious and entertaining addition to their game collection. Whether you're hosting a game night with friends or attending a social gathering, this game will provide countless laughs and unforgettable memories. Just be prepared for a night of uncontrollable laughter and endless fun!

              Helpful


Report
Jason5.0 out of 5 stars
Great game and was a hit at our party
Reviewed in Canada on January 10, 2019Verified Purchase
Purchased this item for our annual Christmas party and it was most definitely a hit. The game is pretty straight forward and if you have ever played Cards Against Humanity than you know exactly what you are getting into.The main difference between this and Cards Against Humanity is this game uses pictures of memes instead of sentences. For those who have never played either, the concept is simple. A picture is pulled, everyone playing than must choose a card from their hand (each containing different sayings) that works best with the picture. The Person who turns it is, then reads all the cards and picks their favorites. That easy.  However, having a picture to reference makes a huge difference as I'll explain. One of the most frustrating things I have found with cards against humanity is that plenty of times the funniest card is chosen as the winner (more often than not the most offside card as well) regardless of how well it works with the question on the black cards. Meaning the card that worked the best with the question, and should have won, ends up getting trumped by the infamous offside funny cards. With "What do you Meme", this issue is addressed, as having something visual to look at seems to make players focus more on what goes best with it, which in my opinion makes the game more fun.  The other great thing about this game is they suggest you print out and add your own images, which puts a completely different spin on things. We added a bunch to ours and it definitely raised the hilarity factor. However be aware of what pictures you add. Especially if you use the adult content cards. Things can get awkward when you have to read an X-rated card while looking at a picture of your grandma.  To sum this up, I would most definitely recommend this game. It was a hit at our party and I had more than 1 person ask me where I got it from.Pros:• Tons of replay ability• Compact and easy to transport compared to some other games• Can add your own pictures!• Expansions available• Great for large groups• Incredibly fun to play with tons of laughsCons:• Not necessarily a con but more of a warning. Adult cards can be extremely "Adult" so maybe take them out before playing with the in-laws• Another warning that's not really a con. If you choose to add your own pictures, and I recommend that you do, be leery of what you add. As I mentioned it can make for some awkward moments with the wrong picture.

user_reviews:
J&T&A5.0 out of 5 stars
Best water bottle ever!
Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2024Colour Name: Shy MarshmallowSize: 24 ozVerified Purchase
I came across an article called "Stanley's are overrated. Get this water bottle instead". That link brought me to the Owala water bottle. I love how there is a chug spout plus an internal straw. There's no grabbing at a mouth piece with your hands. The internal straw is my favourite thing about this water bottle. The shape of the bottle is also comfortable to hold in your hand, even for people with petite hands. What I really appreciated about this water bottle was that there were little stickers (easy to remove and didn't leave sticky residue) on the parts of the lid to guide you how the cap works! I thought the stickers were cute and totally genius! Bottle and lid are easy to clean. I did order their specific cleaning brush but it hasn't arrived yet. My kids even are intrigued by this water bottle after purchasing their own Stanley's ("it's trending right now" was the answer to why they wanted Stanley's haha).  Extremely happy with this Owala purchase. It's helped me drink more water throughout the day as it keeps it nice and cold. It's also an adequate size. Not too big or small. Because it's leak proof when closed, you can throw it in your purse or bag without worrying about it spilling - can't do that with a Stanley! If you're looking for a reasonably priced water bottle with great function, absolutely get this one. Everyone in the family will be getting these as gifts this year!

Report
Me5.0 out of 5 stars
A great water bottle!
Reviewed in Canada on March 11, 2024Colour Name: Shy MarshmallowSize: 40 ozVerified Purchase
I purchased the 40 oz (1.2 litre) Owala FreeSip in Shy Marshmallow colour and I absolutely love it. The cover design of the lid which allows you to sip without any effort via the internal straw, or chug from the larger opening above the straw hole is amazing. I see why they patented this. What’s also very clever is that the internal straw tube attaches to the lid on an angle, so you are able to drink all of your water and leave none at the bottom of the bottle. Genius.The outside of the bottle is powder coated metal, which has a nice texture to it. I also purchased the boot in grey (the same grey as the lid on the Shy Marshmallow bottle). It solves the problem of the metal clanging on the table whenever you put it down. It also helps add some grip to the bottle. If you get the 40 oz bottle, I’d recommend the boot to make the bottle quieter, grippier and protected from scratches and dents. This bottle truly is leak proof, with a lock to stop the top from opening accidentally. I will throw this in my bag sideways right next to my laptop without concern as this is truly, actually 100% leakproof.Thanks to the triple wall insulation the bottle doesn’t sweat when you have cold liquids in it too, so you really don’t have to worry about liquids getting on anything. There are a lot of nooks and crannies to clean, but luckily it’s dishwasher safe. I highly recommend this bottle.

Abbas A. Idris5.0 out of 5 stars
5 Stars, But...
Reviewed in Canada on December 24, 2022Colour Name: BlackCustomer Package Type: Standard PackagingVerified Purchase
I give it a five-star review just because it is a Texas Instrument calculator, but I am shocked by how the quality of the Ti-84 Plus CE has deteriorated over the years. The first Ti-84 calculator I got was for school eight years ago. I used it all these years until last month when I accidentally dropped a monitor stand on it and broke it.In comparison to the 8-year-old one, this calculator looks cheap and low-quality. The old one has a glossy and smooth touch to its keypad. This one looks plasticky and of cheap material. The old one has an LED light that comes on when I plug it into the charger; this new one does not. All this started getting me worried if this was a knock-off product, but it came with a software license, which is a strong indication it might be genuine. Even the literature that came with it was printed on cheap paper using a printer that was running out of toner.Nonetheless, I like the product. It has a clear display that is easier to see even when I'm not wearing my glasses. Also, it is easier to use than the Ti Nspire versions. So, I am keeping it.

Vineet5.0 out of 5 stars
Towering Fun That Never Gets Old! 🏗️⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Reviewed in Canada on December 12, 2023Verified Purchase
I recently rekindled my love for classic games with Jenga, and it has quickly become a staple in our game nights. This timeless classic not only brings back fond memories but also delivers an unparalleled level of entertainment, easily deserving its five-star rating. Here's why Jenga Classic stands out:1. Simple Concept, Endless Excitement: 🤔🔝Jenga's brilliance lies in its simplicity. The game involves stacking wooden blocks into a tower and then strategically removing them one by one without toppling the structure. Despite its straightforward concept, the suspense and thrill of every move make it an addictive and engaging experience for players of all ages.2. Quality Craftsmanship: 🌳👌Jenga Classic is crafted with precision and durability. The wooden blocks are smooth, uniform, and easy to handle, ensuring a seamless gaming experience. The high-quality materials used in construction not only add to the game's longevity but also enhance the tactile pleasure of playing.3. Portable Entertainment: 🌐👜The compact size of the Jenga Classic set makes it the perfect travel companion. Whether you're heading to a friend's house, a picnic, or a family gathering, the game easily fits into the smallest bag, providing portable fun that can be enjoyed anywhere. It has become our go-to choice for impromptu game sessions.4. Multiplayer Fun and Strategy: 🤝🏆Jenga is a fantastic multiplayer game that encourages friendly competition and strategic thinking. As the tower becomes more precarious with each move, the tension rises, leading to moments of both triumph and suspense. It's the perfect recipe for creating lasting memories with friends and family.5. Timeless Entertainment Value: ⏳🎮Jenga Classic has withstood the test of time and continues to be a crowd-pleaser. Its timeless appeal makes it suitable for any occasion, from casual get-togethers to intense gaming nights. The replayability factor is incredibly high, ensuring that every game feels like a fresh and exciting challenge.In conclusion, Jenga Classic is a shining example of a game that transcends generations. With its simple yet engaging concept, quality craftsmanship, portability, multiplayer fun, and timeless entertainment value, it's a five-star addition to any game collection. If you're seeking a game that promises laughter, suspense, and hours of enjoyment, Jenga Classic is undoubtedly the towering champion! 🏗️⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

title: Breville Barista Express Espresso Machine, Brushed Stainless Steel, BES870XL
description: Note: 1)Too coarse a grind, too little coffee, or insufficiently tamping the grounds before brewing can all lead to inadequate pressure for a proper brew. 2)It is important to note that the amount of espresso extracted will vary depending on the grind size and amount and reprogramming may be needed when the size and amount are adjusted    The Breville Barista Express delivers third wave specialty coffee at home using the 4 keys formula and is part of the Barista Series that offers all in one espresso machines with integrated grinder to go from beans to espresso in under one minute    Dose Control Grinding: Integrated precision conical burr grinder grinds on demand to deliver the right amount of freshly ground coffee directly into the portafilter for your preferred taste with any roast of bean    Optimal Water Pressure: Low pressure pre-infusion gradually increases pressure at the start and helps ensure all the flavors are drawn out evenly during the extraction for a balanced tasting cup. Grind Settings: 16 precision grind settings    Precise Espresso Extraction: Digital temperature control (PID) delivers water at precisely the right temperature, ensuring optimal espresso extraction    Manual Microfoam Milk Texturing: The powerful steam wand performance allows you to hand texture microfoam milk that enhances flavor and enables creation of latte art    Espresso Machine with Grind Size Dial: Simple and intuitive, giving you control over the grind size no matter what type of bean you're grinding
nav: Home & Kitchen › Kitchen & Dining › Coffee, Tea & Espresso › Coffee Makers › Espresso Machines › Semi-Automatic Espresso Machines
user_reviews:
IDF5.0 out of 5 stars
AMAZING YOU WON'T REGRET IT
Reviewed in Canada on January 22, 2021Colour Name: Brushed Stainless SteelVerified Purchase
Between myself and husband we'd spend hundreds at Starbucks every couple months and I'd have a decaf long shot Americano with steamed heavy cream and sometimes even an extra long shot. Super picky about having amazing coffee. Once you go through the learning curve which, with the advice also  below, from another amazing customer review, you should get it down in about a couple days total. Once you have it down this coffee flavour and smoothness surpasses the best coffees I've had at Starbucks. Freshly ground coffee is the ultimate winner and it surpasses pre-ground easily so spend the extra moula and get the grinder! Your mouth will thank you :) The machine is amazing and beautiful and easy to operate once you read the instructions and look on you tube as to how to steam cream or milk exactly. You won't regret this coffee, I was using the same beans (Starbucks Espresso Decaf) pre-ground on a routine coffee maker and when put through this machine the flavour is so rich and smooth and it just lingers all over the inside of your mouth all over your tastebuds. Crazy. My mom is European and has had her share of coffees and espressos and I brought her a cup and she said it was the best coffee she's tasted, even better than the few she'd tried at Starbucks. Enjoy!Here's the review below I also used and I purchased those additions he mentioned all at once and it was super helpful and it made the experience so much smoother!1. I am a guy, who knew nothing about espresso machines before this. I am very mechanically inclined and don't usually read instructions. This was different - this machine is NOT self-explanatory and you NEED to read the instructions (which are well written, and even include a troubleshooting section). Don't get frustrated with this machine until/unless you have read (all) the instructions.2. This is not a 'stand-alone' purchase ... this machine costs around $500 (give or take), you need to invest another $100 right from the start (preferably at the same time) to get the most out of it, enjoy it to the fullest, and not get unreasonably frustrated by making your own lattes and mochas.3. The other things you REALLY should order at the same time (and all are available on Amazon) are:a. ($29) 100-pack disposable 20oz. cups with lids and sleeves (sold by Yes!fresh). Trust me, you want to get these. It's only $0.29 per cup and are far more convenient that trying to clean out a million dirty coffee cups from your car/office each week. These are worth twice what they cost in the long run. And when your friends are over, you need not 'loan' them a nice coffee cup to go (which you may never see again) - just give them a paper cup to take with them.b. ($5-15 for 25 oz. / $20-30 for 64 oz.) Torani syrups and sauces, AND the pump tops that go with them (always sold separately). IF you drink the same thing on a regular basis (like I do) such as a white chocolate peppermint mocha, buy the 64 oz. white chocolate sauce and not the smaller 25 oz. bottle.c. ($14) Amazon Basics Cotton Washcloth - 24 pack - grey (the grey matches the espresso machine, but the color doesn't matter). Again, trust me, you want a nicely folded stack of these sitting next to the machine - you will use 1 each time you make espresso, and then it will be dirty and needs to be washed. At my house (3 people using the machine) we bought two 24-packs because we make so much coffee - two 24-packs is not too many for our house (I'm thinking about buying a third pack).d. ($10 for pair of single shot size, $15 for pair of double shot size) Set of double-walled espresso shot glasses. Do NOT buy the rounded ones (ie: Cutehom espresso coffee cups) because they will not pour very well and drip all over the place (down the side) each time - very frustrating. Buy the JoyJolt Javaah Double Walled Espresso Glasses instead - you'll be glad you did in the long run. And, if you're planning to make mostly double-shot lattes/mochas, buy a set of Dragon Glassware 6 oz Espresso Cups (also double-walled) so that you don't have to keep fidgeting with the single shot cups to keep them in the right spot under the coffee dispenser. It's important to buy double-walled glasses for two reasons. First, it keeps the espresso hot while you're steaming your milk, second, it keeps you from burning your fingers when pouring the espresso into your coffee cup.e. ($15) Breville BCB100 Barista-Style Coffee Knock Box. Again, TRUST me, you want this right next to your machine - the coffee grounds will start piling up quickly and you don't want your portafilter anywhere near a garbage can. This thing is a must.4. Space requirements: This machine (and all that you want to go with it) will take some counter space - allow AT LEAST 34-inches of counter width to accommodate - slightly more is even better. You will from my picture, this is a 34-inch setup, and there is no room to spare.5. Making espresso. After you read the instructions, here are some tips that they don't include to help avoid frustration:a. When the beans are grinding, lightly knock on the top of the hopper lid (just like knocking on a door) so that the beans keep feeding down to the grinder (sometimes they get hung up - a light knock each time keeps this from happening). Do NOT overfill the portafilter (after tamping) or it will jam coffee grounds into the water outlet and could possibly damage the portafilter or locking guide. After the grounds are tamped down in the filter cup, the silver part of the tamper should be just hidden beneath the rim of the portafilter (the machine includes a tool you can use if you accidentally overfill the filter cup, but after a short while, you'll figure out how much to grind each time and the tool will not be necessary).b. You ALWAYS want to watch the pressure gauge when making espresso. It NEEDS to be in the dark grey area of the pressure gauge (and ideally in/near the middle of the grey area) during the brew cycle, otherwise you are not making good espresso - rather, you are making either watered down espresso (not enough pressure) or not enough espresso which is too rich (too much pressure). There are two key things that affect pressure: the fineness at which the coffee is ground (which is adjustable) and the volume of grounds in the portafilter (also adjustable). Although there is a one or two shot size setting, I have found it best to do two, 1-shot grinds, tamping down the grounds in-between each single-shot grind. I have the grind (volume) setting on the 4th click setting, and I have the grind (fineness) setting on either 2 or 3 (play around and see what gives you the best results). IF the pressure is too low, then either your coffee is ground too coarsely, or your have not tamped it down tight enough, or the filter is not filled with enough coffee grounds, or a combination of any/all of these things. IF the pressure is too high, then either your coffee is ground too finely, or you have tamped down the grounds too hard (tightly), or a combination of the two.c. IF using two, single-shot espresso glasses to collect a double-shot brew, keep an eye on them during the brew cycle and make sure they are centered under the espresso being dispensed (this can be avoided by using a double-shot size collection cup).d. IF making a mocha or other syrup/sauce drink, pre-mix the espresso and syrup in the glass and stir thoroughly before adding the steamed milk.e. Steaming milk is 1/2-art, and 1/2-science (seriously), and it does not come naturally. If you've never worked at a coffee shop and been trained to steam milk, do yourself a favor and watch a few good (short) YouTube videos on the proper way to steam milk. You will THANK yourself for taking 5-10 minutes on You Tube and learning the proper way to steam milk (and things to avoid). Understanding the steaming process will allow you to control the amount of foam on top and not make big mess.f. Before you steam your milk, VENT the steam wand to remove the residual water from the boiler line (you don't want a few teaspoons of water in your milk). Vent the line, then turn the steam off ... wait 5 full seconds ... then insert the steam wand into the milk, then turn the steam back on. Hold the handle with your left hand, and place your right hand underneath the stainless steel milk steaming cup, when the cup is too hot for your right hand to touch (I mean really to hot to hold), keep the steam wand in and start counting along with the pump (which sounds like a metronome in the background ... dit ... dit ... dit ... dit ...). For a semi-hot latte/mocha keep the steam wand in the milk for 30 double-dits (don't start counting until after you can non longer touch the bottom with your right hand ... "and-one, and two, and three" and so on until you get to 30 (the equivalent of 60 single dits). For hot (but still drinkable) count to 40 double-dits, and for very-hot, 50 double-dits. Anything above 60 and you risk burning the milk (which will ruin the flavor and you will need to toss it out and start over). When finished, turn the steam off, and remove the steam wand from the milk about 3-5 seconds before it finishes blowing steam (to avoid having milk sucked back up into the steam line).g. After you steam your milk, VENT the steam wand again to remove any milk that inadvertently got sucked up into the steam wand line and prevent any from making its way into the boiler. IF milk makes its way back into the boiler unit (because you failed to vent the line after use) you will DESTROY the boiler (permanently), in that, the milk cannot be cleaned out, will burn during the next use, and every cup of milk you steam in the future will have a burnt-milk smell/flavor - yuck! DO yourself a favor and vent the steam line religiously after each use - and make sure others who use your machine know that they can ruin it if they don't do so also! (there goes $500!)h. The bottom tray is easy to remove, empty and clean (comes apart in 3 pieces). You should empty this every 2-4 days of use because it fills up despite you not pouring liquid into it - reason is, each time you finish using the steam wand or hot water dispenser, the machine auto-vents out the line from the boiler into the bottom tray (sneaky little devil) ... so even though you don't realize it, it's filling up a little with each use. (Fun fact - the hot water dispenser can be used for instant hot water to make tea!).
Read more

For a semi-hot latte/mocha keep the steam wand in the milk for 30 double-dits (don't start counting until after you can non longer touch the bottom with your right hand ... "and-one, and two, and three" and so on until you get to 30 (the equivalent of 60 single dits). For hot (but still drinkable) count to 40 double-dits, and for very-hot, 50 double-dits. Anything above 60 and you risk burning the milk (which will ruin the flavor and you will need to toss it out and start over). When finished, turn the steam off, and remove the steam wand from the milk about 3-5 seconds before it finishes blowing steam (to avoid having milk sucked back up into the steam line).g. After you steam your milk, VENT the steam wand again to remove any milk that inadvertently got sucked up into the steam wand line and prevent any from making its way into the boiler. IF milk makes its way back into the boiler unit (because you failed to vent the line after use) you will DESTROY the boiler (permanently), in that, the milk cannot be cleaned out, will burn during the next use, and every cup of milk you steam in the future will have a burnt-milk smell/flavor - yuck! DO yourself a favor and vent the steam line religiously after each use - and make sure others who use your machine know that they can ruin it if they don't do so also! (there goes $500!)h. The bottom tray is easy to remove, empty and clean (comes apart in 3 pieces). You should empty this every 2-4 days of use because it fills up despite you not pouring liquid into it - reason is, each time you finish using the steam wand or hot water dispenser, the machine auto-vents out the line from the boiler into the bottom tray (sneaky little devil) ... so even though you don't realize it, it's filling up a little with each use. (Fun fact - the hot water dispenser can be used for instant hot water to make tea!).

Report
DAN CRESSWELL5.0 out of 5 stars
Great espresso machine with built-in grinder for the money.
Reviewed in Canada on August 21, 2019Colour Name: Brushed Stainless SteelVerified Purchase
I've had this almost two years now, so I figured it was time for a proper review.If you don't want to read my in depth review but just my quick opinion and are in the market for a semi-automatic espresso maker (with grinder!), you can't beat this machine for the money it costs (especially here compared to a department store).  It comes with a satisfactory grinder (anything better itself will cost you hundreds of dollars on its own), and an easy to use (and learn) espresso maker which makes good espresso, latte's, etc. (assuming you don't use garbage beans of course).  Its been nearly two years and I've yet to have a problem and still works just as good as it did the day I got it.I'll start with the cons, because there aren't many and they are very minor, picky issues.The grinder: I find the size setting to be slightly misleading.  I'd assume you could use the full range of grind sizes, but anything less than a 4 you'll have trouble pulling a shot with the proper pressure.  Over time I've found I've needed to reduce the grind size more and more, but that could be to poor (lack of) regular cleaning habits because I'm lazy.The pressure gauge.  There's an "espresso range" on it which you may think anywhere in that is OK.  Its not.  To get a good pull you'll need to make sure it starts around at least "12:30" and ideally about "1:00" if you treat it like a clock (pointing straight up would be 12:00).  Once you get a feel for the grind and how much tamp pressure to use, you'll be able to do this with regular ease after a couple weeks of use (assuming you mainly stick with one type of espresso).The port-a-filter.  Its not standard sized so it may be hard to replace.  No big deal.  Those interested in this probably have more "professional" machines anyways and aren't in the market for this.Now onto the good things:If you've never used a steam wand before, this is probably a good machine for you.  Enthusiasts may say its not good or powerful enough, but its great to learn on.  Its not a "double boiler" machine where you can froth milk and do the espresso at the same time, but for starter home use its great.  Those double boiler machines start at 2-3 times the price of this.  If you only make lattes for yourself a couple times a day (like me), its perfect.  Because its doesn't use a boiler, its a little slower.  That actually makes it EASIER to make perfect milk for the novice (also like me!).  By the time I'm done making a latte, I've probably spent about 3 minutes.  That's about 6 minutes out of my day which is quicker than waiting forever at st*rb*cks for something worse.The grinder: Its built in.  Enough said.  Clean it out once in a while and you'll be fine.Making espresso:  You can adjust the temperature within 4 degrees of 200f (the factory setting).  Adjust according to your taste and beans you are using (I'm not an expert, there's a ton and probably too much info out there on the subject).  I keep mine at 202 as it brings out slightly better flavor for the standard bean I use.  If you're using relatively fresh coffee beans, you shouldn't have much trouble pulling a decent shot.Maintenance/cleaning: its easy to use the cleaning cycle.  Don't buy the cleaning tabs or descaling solutions.  Buy Cafiza tabs as they will cost you a fraction of what the Breville ones cost for regular cleaning.  Dezcal can be bought for descaling also with the same cost difference.  The drip tray is dishwasher safe (top shelf).  I put mine in about every two weeks.  In between that, I give it a good rinse when the tray is full to get rid of any grime that may have built up.If I get 2 more years out of this, I'll be extremely happy.  I've already gotten back my return on investment.

Grand Theft Auto V is one of the best-selling and highest rated games currently out. This game has gotten millions of people excited, overwhelmed, and blown away by the amazing experience it offers. Throughout many hours of exploring the beautiful, vast, and very diverse city of Los Santos, I was completely overwhelmed by the quality and immense work put into the level design, structure, and storyline of the game.The online multiplayer experience known as "Grand Theft Auto Online" was also another great milestone in the development of the franchise. Grand Theft Auto Online offers even more fun and excitement in the game and truly sets a very different experience from the story mode. Grand Theft Auto Online contains a wide variety of character customization options, weapons, clothes, and a lot more. There is also a wide variety of structured game modes known as jobs which you can play to gain cash, job points, and rank up.Overall, I am very excited to own a copy of this game and I am very thrilled for upcoming changes and updates to the game. surpringly great
Reviewed in Canada on January 1, 2024Configuration: Fire TV CubeVerified Purchase
before buying this Amazon Cube Ive used a Shield and still have and use an Apple TV. I have been pleasantly surprised and how fast it is and at its picture quality. i used it in our upstairs bedroom via wifi and the Apple with our main TV wired. It loads both Netflix and Prime noticeably faster than the Apple TV. i do prefer the remote for the Apple TV over the Cubes but i really the Alexa integration and voice commands of the Cube. For the price its hard to beat and Amazon has done a good job over the years with the Fire TV products. Would recommend this product

Report
Ryan Fezzy5.0 out of 5 stars
Huge upgrade from Firestick 4K.
Reviewed in Canada on October 16, 2023Configuration: Fire TV CubeVerified Purchase
I am pretty nestled into the Amazon ecosystem. Previously I had a Firestick 4K. But over the past few months I noticed that it was getting very very slow and sometimes would crash. This is because the firestick 4K is getting pretty old now. So I ordered the fire Cube third gen and I am super happy with it. There is absolutely no lag in the UI or loading of high resolution video at all. Everything is really snappy and super fast. Content loads almost instantly. And the difference between the fire stick 4K and the fire Cube third gen is night and day. It is an absolutely beautiful design and it pairs really really well with my Echo Studio. In home theater mode the sound quality is absolutely mind blowing especially where Dolby Atmos content is applicable. Amazon did such a good job when they designed this new generation fire Cube. It has a USB port and an ethernet port. Although because this fire Cube has Wi-Fi 6E it is much much quicker internet through Wi-Fi over the ethernet which only supports up to 100mb/s speed. While over Wi-Fi 6 I was getting up to 400mb/s download. So in this case using Wi-Fi 6 is much faster than using the ethernet port. For anyone looking to upgrade from just the regular fire stick 4K it is definitely worth it. I can't speak for the 4K Maxx because I never owned that one. But I would imagine that it's still a huge upgrade. The fire cube is so much quicker than the fire stick. And it was a pleasant surprise. And the HDMI pass through that Amazon added on this generation is absolutely amazing and this was one of the best ideas that they have done yet. I love being able to pass through video from my Xbox or my gaming PC. It is so handy
Read more

taleo4.0 out of 5 stars
Perfect for my needs. Very fast.
Reviewed in Canada on February 2, 2024Configuration: Fire TV CubeVerified Purchase
Bought a new TV and couldn't stand the speed of the integrated apps. This works much better, and makes switching between apps and using the device so pleasant. I decided to go for the cube since I didn't already have an Alexa device in my room, and I love the voice commands. I'm able to control all my devices using it. Easily control the power and volume of the TV, quickly search for anything you'd like to watch, control other smart home devices, etc. There is a lot of ads on the home screen, but it is still a much nicer experience than the built in smart tv apps that most TVs come with. Worth getting one even if you have a smart TV.

Report
B.J. 1.0 out of 5 stars
New Generation is GARBAGE
Reviewed in Canada on September 16, 2023Configuration: Fire TV CubeVerified Purchase
I have 2 of the previous generation and they are wonderful. I bought this new one for my new Fire TV, which on its own does not need a cube or anything;  I bought the cube for 1 reason and 1 reason only; so that I can issue voice commands without having to locate the remote and press and stupid little button.Well, on this generation, the voice command capabilities are completely unreliable! Many times does not even here me speak, others it hears me, acknowledges my instructions, says ok, but then does nothing. THIS IS COMPLETELY USELESS TO ME!Well, I did what support asked, did a total reset of the box, hours of work to reconfigure all my streaming content. I even replaced the wireless with a wired one hoping that would fix ;it. NOTHIMG WORKS. IT IS COMPLETELTY UNREIALBLE. I ask Alexa do something, it does one of 3 things:1. Does not even acknowledge me2. Says, okay as if it is going to do it, and then does nothing3. Says, I don't know how to do that, when it was something I have asked to to do before many times over the last 4 years.Amazon, needs to got back and do a COMPLETE review of the server software, as it has become completely unreliable. I will not buy, nor promote this product to anyone again. In fact, I will advise anyone that ask, not to buy! I will look at Google Cast and if they have a more reliable product!

Report
Shawn5.0 out of 5 stars
Brings me back to my childhood. Love it
Reviewed in Canada on January 6, 2021Verified Purchase
Console gaming has come a long way from the original days of Nintendo and Super Nintendo. We now have console systems that can fetch over $1000 such as the #playstation 5. Thinking back to my childhood I remember my dad renting our first Nintendo system (we did not have tons of money to buy one). I remember setting it up for the first time as a 7 or 8-year-old. I can still remember the feeling of turning it on and listening to the sounds of the Super Mario music.Fast forward almost 25-30 years we now have the opportunity to relive those moments with our children. I and my wife limit our children to a certain amount of screentime a day but we still wanted to offer them the enjoyment that does come with playing video games. At the same time, we wanted value and what's better than something that brought us enjoyment as children.Nintendo released a retro classic console a few years ago. When it was first released I'm pretty sure you could pick it up for around $60 dollars and it pretty much sold out. Now you will find it for sale around the $300 dollar mark. Does that mean it's not worth it? I don't think so, and that's the reason this Christmas I purchased it for my kids.If you do searching for this retro system you will find many clones for cheaper but I wanted the authentic version from Nintendo that came with the 20+ most popular games such as donkey kong, Mario Brothers, Zelda, Contra, and so on.When it arrived I am not exactly sure what I was expecting but when I opened it a smile came over my face. It was a bit smaller than the original version but it looked the same down to the controllers. The one thing I did read in previous reviews is the controller cables were not that long so I opened to buy extension cables which I highly suggest. Gone are the days you need to sit 4 feet away from the TV, these extensions give you a good 10-foot reach.Installation was simple and easy and only requires a single HDMI cord from the console to the TV.Once I booted it up I saw a screen giving me 20+ options of games I played in my youth. To my surprise, the graphics had not been updated at all so it took a little bit to realize the grainy screen was the way it was "supposed" to be. Hours into playing (me and my wife) we were reliving our childhood once again... I could not forget that this was a gift for my kids though:)Once XMAS came around the kids were more than happy. They have been enjoying it for the last 2 weeks and now the music I came to love annoyed me haha. None the less great purchase :)

Enjoy your favorite apps like Netflix, Facebook, Disney+, Instagram, TikTok, and more through Amazon’s Appstore (Google Play not supported. Subscription for some apps required).    Stay connected - Download Zoom to make video calls to friends and family.    Get more done – Check email, update shopping lists, and set reminders. Use your favorite apps like Microsoft Office, OneNote, and Dropbox.    Thinner and lighter than previous generation. Screen made with strengthened aluminosilicate glass. As measured in a tumble test, Fire HD 10 is twice as durable as durable as Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 (2022).    Split screen – All-new feature for Fire OS that shows two compatible apps, like Facebook Messenger and Prime Video, open side by side for easy multitasking.
user_reviews:
LiveWire5.0 out of 5 stars
It's worth the UPGRADE from the prior release! AAA+
Reviewed in Canada on September 6, 2023Digital Storage Capacity: 64 GBConfiguration: Without Special OffersColour Name: BlackStyle: Fire HD 10Verified Purchase
This is now my second FireHD10 Tablet. My first was the 2019 variant and I already felt that was a fantastic value for money. Before I continue, I will preface this by saying this review may get a little long, but I really feel that many things about Amazon Fire products need clarification as there is just so much misinformation and even outright falsehoods dished out about them.. even from some “Reviewers” on this very page. I hope I can provide some beneficial points for anyone taking their time to go through this. Ok, lets begin...I hate to admit that I am a former Apple fanboy and I cannot stress how much I have come to rely on all of my new Amazon Fire & Smart Products. My first trial experience was picking up a FireHD8 along with a regular FireTV Stick when on sale during the July 2019 Canada Prime Day. Now, I have an additional 3 additional FireTV Sticks (4K versions), a Fire Cube, Echo Show 8,Echo Show 5, this brand new HD10 64GB 2021 variant along with my original HD10 and still growing! I could go on forever about all of my new hardware but the bottom line is that all of these Amazon Fire and smart products are an outstanding value in relation to competing products and can literally save you $1,000's over Apple products!!. If I were running multiple iPads and Apple hardware in my home in an attempt to try to recreate what I get out of my Amazon product ecosystem the cost would be more than what I have spent on Amazon gear by a factor of 7! This is no exaggeration.This newer HD10 really feels a lot “snappier” than my current 10inch and I already thought that was a great tablet. To me, the responses when using the newer HD10 are lightning quick. This of course is due in part to the newer model having an additional 1GB of memory bringing the total to 3GB vs. 2GB in the prior generation. Also, you can now add a whopping 1TB of additional internal Storage via use of your own optional microSD cards. Previously, this was 500GB in prior versions. The newer HD10 also has a slightly smaller footprint than previous with a thinner frame bezel all around the display screen. I like this touch very much.Another very welcome change is the shifting of the internal front facing camera to the upper center of the unit from its previous side position. During the age of Global Pandemics and so many of us now working remotely and “zooming” for multiple hours daily, this simple little change makes teleconferencing so much easier and more natural. You are no longer having to twist and contort getting yourself properly framed for a call. A very welcome change indeed.Also of note is the newer version has BlueTooth 5.0 vs. 4.2 in the 2019 variant and the rear camera has also now been bumped up to a 5 Megapixel unit from the prior 2 Megapixel one. Admittedly though, Fire HD’s have never had a particularly good internal camera but that may be completely irrelevent to many.If you are a Prime Member (and honestly if you regulary use Amazon how wouldn’t you be at this point at only $79 annually?) you cannot go wrong with any of these items as they are of course optimized for consuming Prime Video, Amazon Music and Prime Reading and will get you into Smart Home control and camera usage with minimal effort.As with prior thoughts on my previous HD8 and HD10, my only real gripe with Fire Tablets is that they don’t have GPS embedded, so they are therefore NOT suited for standalone external satellite navigation use...but I got over that! These are best suited for use within your home environment or taking on trips once you have locally downloaded all of the video, music and reading content to satisfy yourself or the wee ones while away. ((Unlike iPads, remember that you have a microSD slot on Fire Tabs allowing you to add up to 1TB of your own additional internal storage!))All in all, these are amazing pieces of hardware to satisfy the media consumption needs for your whole family. And, they make fantastic choices for giving to children for their “kids needs” because they are simple to operate, are relatively SAFE due to the ease at which you can set Parental controls and their buy-in costs relative to competing products is such that if your kids somehow manage to smash them.. and you know they eventually just might.. cuz...KIDS!,you are not going to cry too much about it. Now,try to say that about a $400 or $500 iPad!And now to a question that is on many a mind and the one relating to the most misinformation about these products...for all those who think these are “too restrictive” and wont let me do this or that... "waaaaaah... waaaaaah... waaaaah..", just take a close look at some of the app icon’s showing in my attached screenshot pics. It IS ABSOLUTELY POSSIBLE to unlock the Google Play Store with minimal effort! I included a shot of the screen image after applying the Google PlayStore on my newly unpacked Fire10 and just prior to starting to add Google store applications. Among other things I have been able to add Bell FibeTV,KODI, the official YouTube app, Ebay, Firefox, Home Automation apps, Microsoft productivity apps, Google apps and on and on. I have always been able to do this to ALL of my previous Fire Tabs as well. The ability to do this has always been available to you unlike what many out there try to claim. It is simply NOT true.But, having said that it may not even be necessary. If what you require out of a Tablet is to simply just be able to do things like access your Prime Video and Amazon Music streaming, read your Kindle books, or check your Facebook page, use Messenger, Twitter, TikTok, watch Netflix, Disney+, play some games, etc., etc.,You can already do that just with what is already available in the Amazon Store and pre-installed on the HD10. Just remember that you CAN add the Google Play Store in future if you choose to... Enough said!AAA+Edit:**Hint.. all you need to do to learn how to accomplish what I have I mentioned is to do a simple search with the following word string while in YouTube..”Install Google Play Fire HD”. All you need to know will be contained within the first one or two video hits you see. ENJOY!.Further, If you managed to make it this far and you learned something new or found this review to be beneficial, I will kindly make a request.. Please consider clicking the “HELPFUL” button to help advance this review. I obviously will not get anything out of this other than knowing that my ramble may have helped someone. HAVE A GREAT DAY!**
Read more

A great mid level tablet, but…
Reviewed in Canada on June 19, 2021Digital Storage Capacity: 64 GBConfiguration: Without Special OffersColour Name: BlackStyle: Fire HD 10Verified Purchase
Look  here’s the deal.. I’ve gone through IPads, cheap Chinese Android tablets, and now this Amazon Fire HD 10 64GB model. I’ve been through them all, all of my IPads are outdated and getting old. I also don’t feel like spending a $1000 bucks for a new iPad. So, not long ago I picked up a fire stick for my mother and was pretty impressed with the stick, so I decided to pick up this tablet. Because I got used to the Firestick, I felt right at home with the tablet given the Amazon ecosystem.I now have everything in this, including the Google play store, as well as Kodi, and many other APK programs as well that allow me to watch many great tv shows and movies. The picture quality is exceptional, the sound is terrific, and the battery is not half bad, I wish it could last just a tad longer, but I’m nitpicking.  The only thing I need for it now is a case, and then I should be good for quite a while.This is what I’ll say for others sitting in the fence. If you’re an Apple user you probably won’t like this ecosystem, however, if you have the ability and know how to install or side load apps, you’ll appreciate what this tablet has to offer, and it gives you more options than Apple IPads due to their closed operating system. I can also install an additional memory card in this tablet for memory beyond the 64GB’s if I ever want to. This tablet is capable of running the Google play store and any of the apps that you can get on there also, in the end this is running on an Android 9.0 Pie operating system, so it is android friendly.I think where people start to get disappointed is if they don’t understand how to side load apps or tinker with the tablet to customize it to their needs and wants. However, this is nothing a few YouTube videos can’t teach you, it’s not hard at all. I legit did my research before buying this tablet and it scored higher than Lenovo and many other cheaper and slightly more expensive tablet competitors.It’s a mid range tablet that to me gives you a serious bang for your buck. Also, keep in mind here too that you also have the option to do a payment plan, which is pretty much unheard of this day and age. So I paid $70 bucks on delivery and for the next 5 months I pay 48 bucks, that’s pretty cheap and basically monthly coffee money.Also, for parents reading this review, this is an excellent option for children and offers a safety parental mode for kids so they don’t get into any bad stuff. I’d strongly suggest getting the 64GB model so that you will be less handcuffed in regards to what you want to do with this tablet.With Apples skyrocketing prices and our economy in the crapper, this is a financially healthy substitute for some really cool entertainment as a tablet.P.S the photo I added to my comment shows the size of this thing, it’s night and day bigger than the others. I’ve read the negative reviews and the really bad ones are clearly from people expecting $1000 dollar high level tablet specs for $200 bucks, it’s just not going to ever happen and you can never please those people. It’s a great bang for your buck tablet.
Read more

user_reviews:
Natalie5.0 out of 5 stars
Peanut Butter is delicious!
Reviewed in Canada on March 1, 2024Flavour Name: Peanut ButterSize: 442 g (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
Not really on a fitness journey, I have tried others over the years having worked as a distributor for a couple MLM companies before. No matter what benefits there were, if I didn’t like it, I didn’t promote it or drink it because no matter the benefits I couldn’t get past the taste or texture. I really need to like it to actually drink it. So I was hesitant to try this one, recommended to me on Facebook. I reluctantly gave it a go, more so since I’ve seen recipes (besides drinking it) so I thought if anything I could use it in something else, like pancakes or something to get some extra protein. Anyways long story short, this stuff is good! No, I’m not a rep or anything for it. I just like it! It’s dairy free however I only have 2% cow milk in the house so I mixed it with that. I did 4ozs of milk and 1/2 scoop with 1/4 banana my first time. It was too sweet. I realized then that I didn’t need to hide the flavour this time (like others I’ve tried). So my second time I left out the banana and it was perfect.There is a little texture, like it’s not chalky at all however you know there is powder in it so it’s just a little bit. Nothing to stop you from drinking it. The peanut butter cup one is what I’ve tried so far. My kids also approve from the taste they both needed lol and that’s really saying something. I’d like to try another flavour, I wouldn’t want any flavour that’s sweeter than this one though. I like that you can try the smaller bag first and see if you like it.

user_reviews:
Ioan S.5.0 out of 5 stars
A Game Changer for My Kitchen!
Reviewed in Canada on October 11, 2023Style: 8 Quart 6-in-1Verified Purchase
The Ninja Foodi 6-in-1 8-qt. (7.6L) 2-Basket Air Fryer with DualZone Technology has completely transformed the way I cook, and I couldn't be happier with this appliance. It's a game-changer!First and foremost, the DualZone Technology is a brilliant innovation. With two separate baskets, I can cook two different dishes simultaneously, saving me time and effort in the kitchen. No more waiting for one batch to finish before starting the next. This feature alone has made meal prep a breeze.The 8-quart capacity is perfect for families. The baskets are roomy and well-designed, allowing for even cooking and a crispy finish, thanks to the air-frying capability.Speaking of air frying, the results are outstanding. Whether it's crispy fries, golden chicken wings, or perfectly roasted vegetables, the Ninja Foodi delivers consistent, restaurant-quality results every time. It's a healthier alternative to deep frying without sacrificing flavor or texture.The controls are user-friendly, and the preset cooking functions are a real-time save. Chris Hardcastle5.0 out of 5 stars
Made the leap from 3rd party Pods to the Real Deal and I'm glad I did!
Reviewed in Canada on July 4, 2021Verified Purchase
I had previously purchased blue tooth buds from a third party company on Amazon. I mostly used them for podcast listening, so I wasn't too picky about the quality of the audio. (I grew up listening to AM radio, so I'm not the pickiest when listening to spoken audio)Still, they broke down over time (one of the buds stopped working after a while) and I was left with the decision to buy another cheapie ($30-$40) set or perhaps buy something in a higher priced category.Already having a few Apple products, I decided to get these Apple AirPods.I am 100% satisfied with this purchase for several reasons:-The quality build of the pods is really good. Smooth, with just the right amount of weight to them.-The charging case is also quality. The way the unit opens and closes is very satisfying.-The fact that the case works with a wireless charging mat is an excellent feature-The feature where the pods turn off when they detect they have left your ears is super convenient-Can be paired with Siri for voice control of some features-Excellent battery life on the Pods and on the charging caseOverall, super happy with this product. I could have easily just purchased the cheaper brand again, but they would have broken down over time. One of the major differences between these Pods and other 3rd party pods I've used is that their connection is unrivalled. I live around some tall buildings and sometimes on windy days when I was out with the 3rd party pods, the connection would get caught off. With the Apple AirPods, this is a thing of the past.I have an Iphone and when I'm in the car and about to get out, the Iphone will disconnect from my car's bluetooth, and with the AirPods still in my ears, as I walk away from my car the Pods continue playing right where I left off. It's super convenient when listening to a good audiobook or podcast that gets to a good part right as you get home. The Pods come on and continue the audio seamlessly.The audio quality is good: I mostly use mine for listening to podcasts, talking on the phone, and yes listening to music. The voices come in crisp and clear with the right amount of voice. Music listening is fine: fans of bass-y music might wish the Pods had a little more punch. But for most everyday music listening, just running errands or at the gym, this will more than suffice.I also really like that you can charge the AirPods inside the case very quickly. I forget to charge them all the time but in the mornings all I have to do is put them in the case for about 5-10 minutes and then I have about an hour or more of listening time.Something that I found interesting before making this purchase but it did not deter me: the battery inside the Pods with regular use will last about 2 years. I expect that to be the case for me, maybe even a little sooner simply because I use them all the time.  But, for me it's a fair trade-off for the quality of the product.I've had these AirPods for just over 2 months and I love them.

user_reviews:
XZSr5.0 out of 5 stars
Great screen, Great build quality, Good camera, Good battery
Reviewed in Canada on March 18, 2023Style: S23 (new)Colour Name: BlackSize: 256Verified Purchase
I’ll be comparing it with the iPhone for the most part cuz I’m in Apple’s ecosystem for quite a while. For one, the base S23 is in the same price category as iPhone 14. Yet for the same money, it does not compromise on giving you the 120hz display, triple cameras, and the same chip as the S23+ and Ultra. This makes it very attractive for me as an apple user. Now the other notable feature is that it's INCREDIBLE light, way lighter than the iPhone 14 Pro (24% lighter)  while feeling very sturdy.The screen is great, the 1080p resolution is sharp enough that it's almost impossible to tell any pixels apart. And the 120hz refresh rate is a real difference maker, it's UNACCEPTABLE for me for have 60hz at this price point anymore especially you wanna keep the devices for years to come. Samsung does not cut corners here...Performance is great day to day, but still,  the CPU not as fast as Apple's A16 chip in benchmarks. However, the GPU is quite a bit faster than the A16. And because of this, it can handle the most demanding games like Genshin Impact with very high frame rates. If you tweak it using the official game plugins, it can hit almost 60fps on the highest settings for quite a while.The cameras are great. Again, hardware wise, there's no cutting corners, you get all three cameras. Samsung does not omit the telephoto camera here. And all three cameras are of good quality and the night shots are surprisingly good.Lastly,, the battery life is pretty adequate for its size. For me, it can go for a day on a single charge. 6-7 hrs screen on time.The good:1. Samsung promises 4 years of OS updates + 1 year of security update. This is very good for any Android phones. It just seams to me that Samsung pours a lot of loves into these devices this time...2. The phantom black S23 is gorgeous. The aluminum frame has a tiny purple hint to it. But it looks premium. I'd say it looks better than the green one and the graphite one that you could only order online. (Obviously, its a different calculus to compare it against the cream and lavender colours)3. The 8 Gen 2 chip inside is one of the more efficient ones over the past few generations, it stays cool and consumes less battery on average. It's a pretty major upgrade especially considering that most chips' performance is advancing very slowly these days.4. I am a fan of flat screen design with even borders all round, this is exactly it.The bad:1. There's no charger included, but it tops out at 25w so not a big deal anyway.2. The side button is a little extra wobbly, which isn't great.3. Adding fingerprints is slow as hell sometimes, very painful to use.4. 8GB of ram. The s23 doing alright today, but if you gonna live out that 5 years of support, that could be a bottleneck in maybe 3 years time.
Read more

Oli5.0 out of 5 stars
Sleek small phone that feels premium
Reviewed in Canada on March 20, 2024Style: S23 (new)Colour Name: LavenderSize: 256Verified Purchase
Bought this as an upgrade over my cheap but durable A13. Feels premium in comparison even though it is the "lower end" of the S23 range. Two days in, I find the screen is very vivid and it feels good in the hands. Just the size I wanted for a small phone. Thumbprint sensor is very conveniently located and easy to use, RAM and general processing is a very nice step up from my last phone. I bought purple because it was the cheapest colour on sale but found myself surprisingly enchanted by how nice it looked when I unpacked it, the frosted glass effect on the backing makes it feel fancier than it is. Restored the backup of all the stuff on my old phone through SmartSwitch and made a basically seamless transition. Heads up, it will not let you set it up without putting a SIM card in it, so make sure you've already got one when you're ready to start booting it up and aren't planning on acquiring one later. So far, so good!

However I wouldn't recommend this if you have a high end phone from the last year or so like the s22 ultra .  I dont believe it would have enough of an improvement to warrant paying the cost of this phone.If your phone is 3 years or older or not a higher end phone , I'd say if you have the funds which this s23 ultra does have a very substantial price tag , this could be a good investment in the long term.

I'm torn between a three and four star review.First of all, this is an amazing device. I was diagnosed with Paroxysmal A Fib and it has been a great help for keeping track of things. It has helped with anxiety related to having A Fib as when you feel funny you can take a reading and find out if you're in A Fib or not.However it has some pretty serious issues. First and foremost, there is a monthly fee that is $9.99 American (!) that is above and beyond the cost of the device. This was unwelcome news. You cannot see previous EKG readings unless you pay the monthly fee. You can't keep track of your readings without it. It is ridiculous. YOU CAN'T EVEN SCREENSHOT the readings to save on your phone, they specifically block the ability to do so! If there was a modest yearly fee I think I would be okay with it but nearly $15 Canadian a month to have access to your EKG readings is insane.Also, it seems to pick up background frequencies sometimes resulting in wonky readings that can look really freaky.Overall this is a handy tool if you can afford the monthly fee, otherwise it is a total pain in the butt to try to keep track of the EKG readings. You can email them to yourself but this is a pain.My sincere hope is that Kardia makes this product more affordable and either eliminates or greatly reduces the monthly fee. When I had the free thirty day trial I was very happy with the device, being able to see your past readings was very cool and very helpful. I could show them to my doctor and it was a really excellent tool. However without the ability to save the EKGs it has become a pain to show EKGs to my doctor. I have to email them one by one as they are taken and then later on print them and bring them to my doctor.

nav: Electronics › Headphones, Earbuds & Accessories › Headphones
user_reviews:
Dusky5.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing Noise Cancellation & Great out of the box sound.
Reviewed in Canada on February 24, 2022Colour Name: Midnight BlueStyle: WH1000XM4Verified Purchase
Sound Quality (5/5)These are the first headphones I've owned that when first listening to them I didn't immediately flinch and look for the nearest EQ. I'm no sound engineer, but definitely it has great bass and great quality for mids & highs.Noise cancelation (5/5)Although this is my first set of headphones that support this feature. I'm really blown away by it. I have an air purifier in my office, and even at medium setting. The fan is pretty noisy. But with these things on, I can barely hear it, and that's with no music/movie playing. But as soon as I turn on a movie or song, I seriously can't tell it's on.I read some people say they could hear a waterfall or something in the background. I can't hear anything other than silence, or what I'm listening to.Wireless/Wired (4/5)Being able to use the headphones with them powereoff with a wire, or have them connect wireless via bluetooth is an amazing feature. And it works really well!I was really surprised  however that I don't seem to be able to use this headset with the bluetooth of my main PC. It has a really think glass panel, so I'm wondering if it's not because of that. If you own a case with a glass panel, maybe double check with another set of bluetooth headse/earbuds to see how the conenction goes.Audio Delay/lag on Bluetooth (5/5)I own a mini laptop and it only has bluetooth 4.1. But for some reason when I watch videos or movies, I'm  virtually unable to tell whether there is lag. Unlike any other bluetooth earbuds I've owned. The delay is amazing. Obviously your mileage may vary, but it's something that drove me insane with my previous wireless earbuds. Don't have this problem here!Gestures (4/5)I wasn't really looking forward to the gestures pad. But it turns out to be working really well. Once in a while an action won't register. But it's really rare for me.Play/Pause on a PC can be a little weird though. One day I was listening to spotify while working, and then with the tab still opened I started watching youtube after work. And after pausing said video and unpausing it, using the headset. It ended up starting the playback of both my spotify tab, and my youtube tab.Comfort (4/5)First day I wore them I was a little concerned since, even though I have a small head. I felt like the headphones were pretty tight on my head. But after even just 2 days of use. It's already leagues better. Either I got used to it, or it's 'breaking in'.The cups are pretty comfortable. Wish they would be just a tad larger, not sure if I have big ears. But I can tell that part of my right ear touches the pad. And I'm wondering if I ever end up pulling a really long work, or gaming session if it'll end making my ear feel pinched. One of my older headsets did that.One thing that I was happily surprised was the weight of the headset. With such an impressive battery life and suite of features. I was expecting this thing to be rather heavy. Compared to a Corsair Void (probably a bad example) it's light as a feather.Pairing Headphones with 2 Devices (3/5)First thing, this feature is only possible via the headphone's native app. Meaning you can't perform this type of sync with the physical sync button. Once you have the devices regisered on the app, then you can enable a setting and select which 2 devices you want.On the topic of "2 devices", I guess Is should have read more on this feature. But I use 2 PCs at home, a media and a work/gaming PC. And I really would have liked to be able to on the fly, switch between audio of both. But it turns out that you can only connect to 1 phone, and something else. It can be 2 phones, but not 2 PCs.Included Accessories (3/5)The case it comes with is great. Hard-shell clam design, with some neat nook where you can shove the USB C charging cable, audio cable and airplane adapter thing. But as much as I like the quality and how it snuggly holds on to and protects the headphones. Not sure if mine is a fluike, but whoever decided to sew the elastic mesh bag on the 'bottom' part of the clam. Kind of silly.The audio cable is 'OK' if you use it for your phone. But if you want to use it for a PC you'll for sure either need an extension or a longer cable period. But at least it's a usesable lenght albeit a little conservative.But the USB type c charging cable. I hope you have a USB hub available. Depending on the case/setup you have. I'm pretty sure a lot of people wouldn't be able to use that cable to connect the headphones to their PC's back USB ports. Well you could do it, but depending on your case or setup. The headphones won't be able to rest on either the top of your case, or the desk/floor it's own. They'll end up dangling. (Which I think would be a bad idea.)
