Report
Benoit l.5.0 out of 5 stars
Super comfortable, top music quality
Reviewed in Canada on October 23, 2020Colour Name: BlackStyle: WH1000XM4Verified Purchase
I have a pair of Bose wired QC-35 so this is my base for comparison. I bought these because I was tired of having the cable in my way all the time.Context: I use the XM-4 mostly with my laptop but they're also paired with my Galaxy S10. The only noises I have in my environment are my wife sitting about a meter away from me in our home office and she speaks very loudly when she is in a virtual meeting (and she has quite a lot of them and the keyboard clicks. So, noise cancelling is mostly used for surrounding voice.Let's start with noise cancelling: The Sony XM4 have about the same noise cancellation quality as the wired QC-35 but the XM4 have a white noise that is a bit bugging me when I'm not listening to anything, just using them for noise cancellation while the QC-35 do not have a white noise and can cancel noise as well as the XM4. I mostly use noise cancellation because my wife is sitting about one meter away and she very often takes phone meeting and she speaks quite loudly. The XM4 and the QC-35 cancel about 60% of her voice so when I listen to music, even at low volume I don't hear her at all.Sound: The sound is a bit better than the wired QC-35. The bass is deep and all the frequencies are crisp and clear. I can hear every single instruments very clearly so I can enjoy my music better than ever before. These headphones should definitely be able to satisfy the most demanding audiophiles out there. Also they can play loud enough to damage your ear drums which is pretty good for wireless headphones. The sound is as good whether it comes from my laptop or my Galaxy S10 phone.Calls using my Galaxy S10: If I receive a call on my Galaxy S10 while listening to music on my laptop (or my phone), the XM4 will pause the music and ring in the headphones. A simple double tap on the touch sensor and I can answer the call or reject it by holding a finger on the touch sensor. The quality of the audio during calls is excellent; I can hear very well and I'm told that the sound on the other side of the conversation is very good. I never tried them in a noisy environment or outside when the wind is blowing but Sony states that the XM4 will cancel most of the ambiant noise to keep the other side of the call clean.Features: I love the many features the XM4 offer. Here are a few features I particularly like: 1. When listening to music, I just have to take the headphones off and the XM4 will automatically pause the music thanks to the proximity sensor inside the left can. I simply have to put them back on for the music to start again. 2. When I listen to music and I want to talk to someone, I don't have to take them off, I just have to start talking and the music will automatically pause and the mics on the unit will make sure I can hear what's being said so I can carry a conversation without taking them off. Then, 15 or 30 seconds (configurable) after I stop talking, the music starts again. 3. Finally, the multiple commands I can use on the touch sensor such as volume up/down, next/previous song, fast-forward/backward and more. Another feature that is nice for those who want to use it is the integration with Alexa or Google assistant. However since I do not use any assistant, I cannot comment on this.Comfort: I have regular size ears so the cups surround them completely and do not put pressure on any part of my ears. I was able to wear them for 9 hours straight (while wearing glasses) with one short break in the middle for lunch and I felt no discomfort. Comparatively, the QC-35 have about the same size cup but the leather on the QC-35 is more comfortable than on the XM4.App: The Sony "Headphone" app is pretty good and complete, helping you customize your headphone sound and behavior very easily. You can configure an equalizer to adjust the sound to your specific preferences, customize the function of the second button on the left ear piece, turn on/off different feature of the XM4, update the firmware, and more. If your willing to give the app GPS location permission, you can have different configuration depending on where you are, home, office, commute, etc. This is a big one for me, I'm not forced to give GPS location permission to the app, contrary to the Bose Bluetooth headphone app. With Bose, if you don't give GPS location permission, you can't even pair your headphones! I won't comment on the location feature of the XM4 since I'm not using it but I'm happy I'm not forced to give this permission.Cons: I had to think hard to find any cons but here they are. 1. I cannot use the headphones while charging but this is minor since the battery life is so long and you can use them with the supplied 3.5mm cord but without the mic function. 2. The cushions on the QC-35 are more comfortable, softer than the ones on the XM4. I've read a lot of reviews mentioning problems with TV sound so I tested my MX4 with my Samsung Smart TV; the pairing was easy enough but the sound was constantly choppy so I would not recommend them if you want to watch TV with them.Summary: As far as I know, as of now these are the best wireless headphones on the planet! Great sound, feature rich and very comfortable but not recommended for TV watching.

Report
Michael Frymus3.0 out of 5 stars
Its okay. Nice, but has its flaws
Reviewed in Canada on December 25, 2023Verified Purchase
A few things about this:1) The balaclava looks great. Dry fitting it, it also feels good. It's not thick and not the thinnest one either, but maybe more on the slightly thinner side. Putting on a hat or a helmet would not be an issue. When putting it on, it's comfortable. The lower part easily comes up and can be put down under the chin due to the stitching design. Other masks I've tried become too tight when I try to put it down under my chin, but not this one.2) The head piece is odd to me. When I put the balaclava on, I feel like I need to pull it down to stop just above my eyes, or else its way up my forehead. But, when I do this, the mask goes up a bit in the back, feels a bit weird, but manageable. Not that bad. But I feel like over time it would inch back up ever so slowly. So you may need to pull it down a tad every bit. So, the fit is a bit more on the smaller end I would say.3) The ventilation holes on the mask is nice, but I also think its not the best. When I had the balaclava on, and a pair of sunglasses, it instantly fogged up on the first breath. Would it be better with ski goggles? Not sure. With glasses, it was horrid. BUT, what did stop the fogging was by fixing where the holes in the mask were placed on your face. The holes are a bit too low, about 1/2-1" too low. I had to roll the top part of the mask higher up on my nose. When doing this, the air coming out of my nose or mouth released through the holes better, instead of partially though the fabric and the holes, which caused fogging. So, to stop the fogging, I rolled the top portion of the nose covering to prevent this. Basically, brining the nose/mouth holes up a bit higher. Unfortunately, you cant just put it up higher as it then covers your eyes, so you have to roll/fold over the top part. It looks weid from someone elses perspective, but stopped the fogging in my glasses.So, its hard to say if I like this or not. I dont hate it as it is one of the better designs I've used, but a bit annoyed with the nose/mouth hole designs. The head piece is manageable as I just pull it down a bit, and its fine, but the breathing holes are a bit more of an issue to me. Maybe Ill just keep rolling it up and deal with it, unless I find an alternative, or modify it a bit somehow

Jeffrey4.0 out of 5 stars
PSA TO MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!
Reviewed in Canada on December 13, 2023Verified Purchase
This balaclava is good quality, feels nice, and has no inherent issues as far as I can tell. However it's advertised as also fitting in motorcycle helmets - this is not the case (at least for me). I have a full face helmet (AGV K1-S) that is perfectly my size (snug as it should be), but it will absolutely not fit with this balaclava on, which is what I purchased it for. If the intended use for this product is to wear it underneath a helmet (at least a full face helmet), it will not fit unless your helmet is larger than your head for some reason.With that being said, if you are not a motorcycle rider with a full face helmet, this balaclava seems like an excellent choice.

Tori5.0 out of 5 stars
SEQUENCE is an absolute blast for players of all ages!
Reviewed in Canada on February 27, 2024Size: 10.3" X 8.1" X 2.31"Verified Purchase
SEQUENCE is an absolute blast for players of all ages! This game combines the perfect blend of strategy, excitement, and simplicity, making it an ideal choice for family game nights or gatherings with friends.The premise is straightforward yet engaging: players strategically place cards from their hand onto the game board, aiming to create a sequence of five chips in a row. It's a race to be the first to achieve this feat, but watch out for your opponents who will be working just as hard to thwart your plans! One of the best things about SEQUENCE is its versatility. It's easy enough for children to grasp quickly, but the strategic depth ensures that it remains challenging and entertaining for adults as well. This makes it the ideal game for families to enjoy together, providing hours of fun and friendly competition. Beyond just being a great source of entertainment, SEQUENCE also offers educational benefits. The gameplay actively develops STEM skills such as critical thinking, problem-solving, and strategic planning. Players will find themselves honing their abilities with each round, making it not only a fun pastime but also a valuable learning experience. With components designed for up to 12 players, SEQUENCE is perfect for large gatherings or cozy game nights alike. The game set includes everything you need to get started, from the folding game board and playing cards to the colorful playing chips. The clear and concise instructions ensure that everyone can jump right into the action without any confusion. Overall, SEQUENCE is a must-have addition to any game collection. Its combination of easy-to-learn rules, engaging gameplay, and educational value make it a timeless classic that will be enjoyed for years to come. Gather your friends and family, and get ready for a thrilling game night with SEQUENCE!"

description: Custom Three-Capsule Array Produces clear, powerful, broadcast-quality sound for YouTube, game streaming, podcasting, Zoom calls and music    CBlue VO!CE Software Craft the perfect broadcast vocal sound and entertain your audience with enhanced effects, advanced modulation and HD audio samples    Four Pickup Patterns Flexible cardioid, omni, bidirectional, and stereo pickup patterns allow you to record in ways that would normally require multiple mics    Onboard Audio Controls Headphone volume, pattern selection, instant mute, and mic gain put you in charge of every level of the recording and streaming process    Unique Positionable Design Adjust and pivot the microphone in relation to the sound source to optimize your sound quality    Plug 'n Play Set up the computer microphone in seconds with the included desktop stand or connect directly to a mic stand or boom arm and instantly start recording and streaming on Mac or PC
nav: Musical Instruments, Stage & Studio › Microphones & Accessories › Condenser Microphones › Multipurpose Microphones
user_reviews:
Ramon5.0 out of 5 stars
When not compared to studio or HIGH prices microphones it's stellar.
Reviewed in Canada on May 9, 2013Colour Name: SilverStyle: MicrophoneVerified Purchase
I bought this after dealing with an absolutely terrible $80 microphone and I've been completely satisfied with this microphone.The packaging was solid. There were no rattling parts and it had the "box within a box" packaging style that just assures it's survival of shipping. When I unpackaged this thing I was expecting some assembly to be needed. In other reviews I heard that it's almost a foot tall. However they tackled this in a very ingenious way. The microphone was just swiveled completely upside down on its stand making it super compact and pre-built.The stand itself is incredibly sturdy and keeps the microphone really stable, one thing I've noticed is that the microphone can still pick up the rumbling of my typing or other things on my desk, that being said it was never advertised any other way and why would you be typing while recording something?The microphone is great quality, its nice and heavy and sturdy and built with good materials. There is talk that the knobs seem fragile but I have to say that it's SUPER nitpicking. The volume knob in the front is the only one of the 3 that seems brittle but unless you try to pick up the mic with it or something I'm sure it's fine. The other knobs on the product are SOLID. I never really thought that knobs could feel more sturdy than sturdy but these ones do that.I've recorded a couple things so far and the quality of this mic meets the same quality as my friends $200 microphone. (I dont know it's name so I cant provide it (It isn't available on amazon.ca or .com anyways))The highs are crisp without making the recording squeal and the gain knob allows you to easily adjust its sensitivity for whatever recordings you're hoping to make. The stereo option is really cool though I haven't personally had any reason to use it other than to move around it going "wooooahoooooooaaaaaaaaaaoooooooooaaaahhhhooooo" and listening to it change around on my headphones. It maintains it's sound quality throughout all of its modes including stereo.Over all I'm incredibly impressed with this entire product. The sound is great, the quality of the hardware is better than expected, it's sturdy, the packaging was incredibly secure it has a plethora of input types, the stand is just as sturdy and quality as the mic itself and its design is great. Its slick and clean looking. Something you would be happy to have sitting on your desk.Get yourself a spring mount thing to get rid of any potential rattling of the surface it's sitting on and I assure you that if you have any low budget or hobbyist projects, this microphone can absolutely meet your demands.

BigBankClub5.0 out of 5 stars
5 Year Later Review
Reviewed in Canada on January 23, 2023Colour Name: SilverStyle: MicrophoneVerified Purchase
5 years later. Lots of hype over this mic. What did I learn.Highly suggest a boom arm. Having it sit on a table will not give you the most this mic has to offer.Learn the mic. Take the time to learn the settings. Test it with an audio recording software, many freeware options to try.Don’t talk to close - adjust your distance. Also adjust the mic gain & the recording level, to avoid any unneeded background sounds. Take the effort of setting up your environment.Ideal for voice narrations, podcasts (but adjust & test the quality), zoom calls (a headset would be better…mic sticks out in video & does create a lot of conversation.. likely asking you if you’re YouTuber…)Suggestions. Get software that works for you. So you can edit the recordings. This is audio, not video. You don’t need a powerful computer to edit audio.Spend the time with the mic & adjust the distance & recording levels.After 5 years with the mic, I can say it’s built strong, but it would been nice if recording software was including. The mic has weight too it & is built strong. Mine is 5 years old & still looks new.

Report
Biggly Wiggly4.0 out of 5 stars
Served me well but the size, weight and flawed 5/8" thread had me weary.
Reviewed in Canada on January 22, 2018Colour Name: SilverStyle: MicrophoneVerified Purchase
Great Condenser Microphone for all intents and purposes. Be wary: at the time of purchase refurbished models were the version with the 5/8" thread about 1/16" oversized. I had used this microphone on a boom arm and no 5/8" mic stand adapters would fit properly. A bit of teflon or plumbers tape mostly solves the issue but it is not fool proof. Did not feel safe having the microphone suspended upside down or horizontally and would not use an official blue yeti shock mount as it requires the 5/8 thread to fit snugly. I mainly used this for voice while streaming, over voip, and occasionally to record acoustically or through an amplifier.Pros: Sounds great and incredibly clear even without EQ. Instrument and amplifier recordings sound good. I'm no professional in that regard, but I was more than happy with the result. USB makes it easy to use without the need for a DAC or mixer. Cardioid pattern and gain knobs are easy to use and useful for different situations. Easy to monitor sound directly from the microphone via headphone jack. Doesn't feel flimsy or cheap, it's heavy and feels tough.Cons: As this is a condenser microphone it picks up everything. Fiddling with gain and input volumes will decrease ambient noise. This wasn't much of a problem until I decided I wanted a shock mount. Which brings me to my next con: It's big and heavy. Much bigger and heavier than it needs to be. To my knowledge no third party shock mounts will work with the yeti. It's size and build is so far from the industry standard for microphones that you are locked into Blue's ecosystem. Along with a flawed 5/8" thread I was unable to use a shock mount with the yeti and it picks up every rumble and tap I made on the desk. Did I mention it's big? It took up a lot of space in front of me which got tiresome.

Kailey5.0 out of 5 stars
Lovely scent
Reviewed in Canada on March 26, 2023Size: 100 ml (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
Ever since I smelled someone wearing this years ago it has been my go-to. When you spray it on it dosent spread everywhere and linger, it lingers for about an hour and then you can’t really smell it, but it keeps clothing smelling amazing if you spray it on a shirt or dress, I sprayed it on one of my hoodies and left it in my locker over spring break and when I came back the purfume smelled so good on it.It smells sweet at first but fades into something more “adulty” and sophisticated, I would say this perfume could actually work as a unisex scent such as some of the Calvin clein perfumes. I enjoy it and I would recommend!

title: The Legend of Zelda™: Tears of the Kingdom – Nintendo Switch
description: An epic adventure across the land and skies of Hyrule awaits in the Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom game for the Nintendo Switch system. The adventure is yours to create in a world fueled by your imagination.
nav: Video Games › Nintendo Switch › Games
user_reviews:
CullenJ5.0 out of 5 stars
Higher highs and lower lows than Breath of the Wild
Reviewed in Canada on December 13, 2023Verified Purchase
Tears of the Kingdom is an excellent game. The design is, of course, stunning. The gameplay is the same delightful formula as Breath of the Wild, but with a bigger map and even more ways to play around thanks to the new device building mechanics. I think the best way to summarize Tears of the Kingdom is that it has higher highs and lower lows than Breath of the Wild. The story is much better this time around, with the non playable characters actually involved in the story this time, and even slightly improved voice acting! The music is beautifully composed and performed. The map is, of course, much larger due to the sky islands and the depths. The sky islands have lots to discover with plenty of variety. In my opinion, the temples were much more fun than the divine beasts of Breath of the Wild. The new mechanics in this game are like being a kid with an infinite supply of Legos. You can make almost anything you imagine, and you can often use the new mechanics to find unique solutions to puzzles or quicker ways to defeat enemies. The game adds new enemies that helped keep the gameplay from feeling too repetitive (for the most part). I think the game did a better job rewarding players for completion/curiosity than Breath of the Wild. The ending was fantastic. Tears of the Kingdom is an excellent fantasy adventure that you won't mind getting lost in for hours.This game is not perfect, however. First of all, the size of the world is a problem in this game. For instance, the depths map is massive, but it doesn't have much variety. You can find some cool armor and his weapons from it, but it just feels like too much map for what it offers. The other major complaint that I (and many other players) have is that the sage powers you get for completing the main temples in the game are somewhat useless aside from helping you out in the final boss fights. Without spoiling things, they can be useful, but the way you use them is unreliable, leading to frustration. My other disappointment is that the shrine puzzles in this game are just not as clever as the shrines in Breath of the Wild. For almost all of them, the first thing I tried was the solution, and even finding the bonus chests in the shrines was too easy.In spite of the few shortcomings I've listed, Tears of the Kingdom is a high quality Nintendo game. I think the ambitious gameplay variety and the overall quality of life improvements over its predecessor easily make it worth buying. I think Breath of the Wild might be the better of the two games, but that's more of a testament to the brilliant work that Nintendo puts into the Zelda series.

Report
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
It's everything Breath of the Wild is, but better.
Reviewed in Canada on June 30, 2023Verified Purchase
Tears of the Kingdom is a sequel to Breath of the Wild, but it feels like more of a remake than an actual sequel. Sure, the story is set after the events of BotW, however the game functionally uses the same map, the same engine, and the same concepts and adds onto every single one of them.The story is better, the mechanics have been refined, the combat is given more layers with the fuse system, the amount of ways to complete an objective is astounding, and there's more to explore with the addition of caves, sky islands, and the depth caverns. The amount of content this game holds is legendary and will easily net you 100+ hours of gameplay. If you didn't play BotW, skip it and play this. If you did play BotW back on release, play this too! It's familiar, but new enough to feel fresh and exciting. I do hope however that the next Zelda game will use an entirely new map, because Nintendo has clearly exhausted themselves with this iteration of Hyrule.That being said, TotK is an incredible Zelda experience that rewards the player with creativity and player choice and is a definitive staple of the Switch library.

Report
Jason P5.0 out of 5 stars
Mind changed, pleasantly surprised
Reviewed in Canada on May 4, 2020Platform for display: SwitchEdition: StandardVerified Purchase
Originally I did not think this would be a game for me. A real life friend who I also play at lot of PS4 with kept going on and on about this game and eventually just handed the game cartidage for me to try.-Well I tried Luigi's Mansion 3 and I loved it. The game play is smooth, which makes it easy to see and make out objects.  The puzzles weren't overly difficult. Basically a Mario brothers game that ensures everyone can progress and move on Which is great because very few game developers take the time to think of the ageing game base, as well as making it inviting to those who are looking for a pick up game, which you can leave behind and not have to worry about "rust" time, since the controls are pretty simple to fallow and remember.I ended up buying this game 3 times.  Once for my self, and then the other two went to parents; who may have grown up during the budding video game era but had to work for a living and didn't have the time to play. So the game play for them was very enjoyable. It started off have to hear the "OH well I didn't grow up doing this like you" or some other excuse those who are more seasoned in life say when they're unsure of new tech/game. But with out a doubt they're both fell in love with the game.-The game is quick and easy to pick up, and is very user friendly. Plus I get the chuckle every time my mother sounds like The Joker off Batman when she sucks a new ghost into the vacuum, and then proceeds to trash talk her hubby. Personally I feel this is a worth it game, with out question.

Report
Anne C5.0 out of 5 stars
Don't be quick to judge, the scent really transforms with your body chemistry.
Reviewed in Canada on May 12, 2021Verified Purchase
I will have to update this review at some point as I have only been using it for 2 days and I've only been at home with family. My experience so far with this perfume has been interesting. I don't ever have a bad body odor so I can get away without showering few days, washing the important parts only lol. I found that on the first day, where I hadn't showered for almost 3 days, the scent lasted almost all day. I wonder if this is due to my own pheromones marrying the ones in this oil. Because I showered today, and put the oil on inside my wrists, behind my ears, my sternum and inside my elbows just as I had the day before but the projection of the scent only lasted an hour or two. HOWEVER. I want to talk about the scent itself. When I first got it I really didn't know what to think of it. I'm not really a fruity perfume kind of person, I prefer gourmand or earthy scents. I liked it in a way but it was almost sickly sweet to me at some times of me smelling it. I notice today I actually have really grown to like the scent, not just by itself but when I go to smell my wrists a few hours after applying I find the scent has mellowed and really transformed in combination with my own natural scent. It's not sickly sweet anymore, it almost has warmed a little, softened, and I find there is a smell that I can't quite identify that I really like and i believe it's the pheromone aspect mixing with my own. I know this isn't supposed to work on yourself and mainly others around you, but when I smell myself a few hours after applying I can really see how people would be drawn to the scent. Sniffing it out of the bottle probably not, but on the skin after a few hours it's so subtle and almost just enhances your natural scent. I will update this when I get the chance to test around others, but so far as just a perfume, for how little you use per application and how nice your body smells after putting it on, I think it's worth it.

Virginie4.0 out of 5 stars
Been trying this for a while….
Reviewed in Canada on August 29, 2022Verified Purchase
Okay so I bought this a couple of weeks ago and thought I should try it before writing a review because I saw a lot of mixed reviews on this… At first, I thought the smell was horrible ( kinda like the smell of public bathroom soap), but after wearing it for a couple of minutes, the smell fades and adapts to your own scent. I would say the dry down kinda smells like I just got out of the shower, smells a little floral and clean and the smell is light. I feel it amplifies your own smell so I started to like it more and more. I almost always wear it with another perfume on top ( because I like smelling good and wear perfume everyday and the scent of this one is not potent enough for me alone).Now for the pheromones part… I did notice something different when I’m wearing this. First, my hubby seems to be way more affectionate and he’s way more tactile ( holding my hand, hugging me etc) and he tends to tell me I look pretty and stuff like that even tho I’m wearing my pj’s… it is not drastic by any means but it kinda sparks his interest a little more than usual. I also noticed more people coming to talk to me or standing close to me when I’m wearing it in public and a lot more people looking at me, smiling at me etc. So to me it is very subtle and not crazy at all. Overall I like it.

description: Apple-designed H2 chip, the force behind AirPods Pro, pushes advanced audio performance even further. From smarter noise cancellation to superior three-dimensional sound and battery life, it improves on the best features of AirPods Pro in a big way.    Low distortion, custom-built driver and amplifier delivers crisp, clear high notes and deep, rich bass in stunning definition. Every sound is more vivid than ever.    Adaptive Audio dynamically blends Transparency mode and Active Noise Cancellation to deliver the best listening experience for you in any environment. Report
Adam5.0 out of 5 stars
New iPhone used and seriously impressed
Reviewed in Canada on November 25, 2023Style: USB-C ConnectorVerified Purchase
I was a Samsung android user for about 15 years and finally decided to make the switch to iPhone with the new 15 Pro lineup, as I love my  M1 MBP and I have been following Apple  products from afar since. Now that the 15 lineup is USB C, I decided to go all in on the Apple ecosystem.I am blown away by these airpods. Thankfully the second gens come with XS ear tips, because that's the only size that doesn't slowly push themselves out of my ear.But let me get to what I really love about these things:- the seamless transfer of connection between my M1 macbook pro and iPhone. It happens in about 1.5 seconds flat as soon as I begin playing audio/video on another device. And somehow it also knows when I don't need it to transfer?! I don't even know.-the charging speed of the pods themseld. I think I just popped them into the case for 10 mins, less than 15 for sure, and they jumped from 18% charge to 80% just like that.-transparency and noise cancellation. Remarkable and I use both depending on my environment. Haven't really found a use for Adaptive mode after a while, but that's ok. When you're walking on a busy street, noise cancellation is so soothing. Drowns out like 90-95% of the traffic sounds.-conversational awareness is great too, but I generally leave it off unless I'm in a grocery store or somewhere that I might need to interrupt the audio by speaking to someone for a few seconds. Only time I use it.- Con: they're super slippery! I have dropped the pods a couple of times because of this, especially when you get any skin oils on them, but no damage so far. I also just got a silicone cover for the charging case, in hopes that the pods don't just eject themselves when you drop the whole case on the floor. I think that fixed my concern in some quick tests from a 2 foot drop on carpet, because I've seen them eject from that height before.BONUS: These airpod pro 2s with USB C have a special feature that lightning cable pro 2s do not! Lossless audio, but this only applies to using them with the Vision Pro. I probably won't but the Vision Pro any time soon, but it's good to know that I will have that feature should I ever get them in the future.Buy these at full price or especially buy them when you see them 10-17% off. You will NOT be disappointed.

Report
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
The best earbuds I’ve ever owned
Reviewed in Canada on March 16, 2024Style: USB-C ConnectorVerified Purchase
I was using Google Pixel Buds Pro with my iPhone 11 for less than a year, and I was satisfied, until they stopped holding a charge last week. I was pretty upset when they stopped working because I use earbuds most of the day while I’m working, and even at home. This week I was reading reviews on several top quality earbuds and I was almost sold on Bose because I have always enjoyed the sound quality of Bose products, in my opinion they are one of the highest quality speakers in the industry. Bose and Apple AirPod Pro 2nd generation are nearly identical in quality and performance from the dozens of reviews that I read. The only reason I chose Apple is because I am an iPhone user, and the functions and features of these earbuds work seamlessly with iPhones. Where as, the Bose earbuds require an additional app to control the features on an iPhone, such as spacial audio, noise cancellation, transparency mode, etc. I also really like that the earbuds themselves, as well as the charging case are able to be tracked or located with Apple’s native FindMy app, this is huge, no more loosing my earbuds when I fall asleep while they are in use. Overall, I am very happy with this product, and I look forward to seeing how well the noise canceling system works on the shooting range, my shooting partner swears by his Airpod Pro 1st generation, so I can’t wait to see how 2nd generation compares.

user_reviews:
Justin5.0 out of 5 stars
Great console - very relaxing
Reviewed in Canada on August 4, 2017Colour Name: Black + TurquoiseVerified Purchase
I can't compare this to the older 3DS models but I love this thing so far. The build quality, battery life, and overall ergonomics seem really great. I got I'd say bigger hands and this thing feels fairly comfortable, my left hand gets a little cramped after extended play time, but it's not too bad. I didn't want the "wedge" 2DS model so this was well worth the wait and a good decision by Nintendo overall.So far I've played the Hatsune Miku game and Monster Hunter Ultimate 4. Being a PC gamer most of my adult life, I've been really impressed with how this console performs and plays these games. Sure, the graphics aren't AMAZING, but for a portable handheld it's a very relaxing way to play. It's also worth mentioning that since they sacrifice graphics, you get games with stellar gameplay and content. I can already tell I'm gonna get potentially hundreds of hours out of both Monster Hunter and Miku, both have tons of replay value and are just really fun to play (I've never played any other of the games in the series, so I can't compare).I'd say at this point this console alone for 3DS games has a solid 20+ exclusive titles to play, as well as an enormous DS library available (many of which are exclusive, never been ported, etc). Lots of remakes of DS games are coming out this year and next, some of the best games ever made in the past 10 years easily. Overall I'd highly recommend this console, it's an amazing companion to have as a PC gamer to change it up.

I purchased the New Nintendo 2DS XL about 6 weeks ago.  Shipping was great, as expected.I was never a fan of hand-held gaming, but bought this as something to do during work breaks and during long commute times.  I do not enjoy playing games on my cellular phone for the lack of actual buttons.  I'm a fan of JRPGs (Japanese Role Playing Games) and picked up Shin Megami Tensei IV and Etrian Odyssey V: Beyond the Myth.  I also picked up Super Mario 3D Land.The system is equipped with two screens and a stylus (one being a touch screen) and, in all honesty, I didn't think I'd enjoy it as much as I have.  The touchscreen, instead of being a gimmick, really excels as a tool supplementing gameplay in different ways, whether it be a way to access in-game inventory items on the fly, or displaying map information while exploring a dungeon; it is really neat.The stereo speakers are decent, although not very loud, but there is a headphone jack (no headphones included).  It comes shipped with a 2GB microSD card which you can upgrade later if you plan on connecting to WiFi and buying games from the Nintendo Shop.  If you're using Nintendo 3DS game cartridges you can save right to the cartridge.All-in-all, I'm very happy with this purchase.  Never been a fan of hand-held consoles and yet this little device has converted me.  Very entertaining.  Nice work, Nintendo!

Report
North of 40 Runner5.0 out of 5 stars
Get this game!! You will not regret it!!
Reviewed in Canada on April 5, 2021Style: Taco Cat Goat Cheese PizzaVerified Purchase
My wife and I bought this as a quick and fun game to play with our kids and friends. It did not disappoint!— What comes in the box: This game is literally a standard size deck of cards with different game images printed on them. The images consist of a “taco”, a “cat”, a “goat”, a piece of “cheese”, a piece of “pizza”, a “groundhog”, a “narwhal” and a “gorilla”. You also get a set of instructions for how to play the game, although I highly recommend watching a video online of how to play. Not because the game is difficult, because you will see just how much fun you will have.— Packaging: The packaging is a well made cardboard box with a magnetic “flip edge”. The box is small enough that you could pack it easily in a purse or small bag to take anywhere.— Card Quality: as previously mentioned, the cards are standard playing card size. The images printed on them are large, bright and colorful, which lends to the playability of the game. We have played the game several times and have not had any issues with the cards bending, becoming “dog-eared” or fading. The cards have a nice finish and could be wiped easily with a slightly damp cloth followed by a dry one, but you still need to be careful with them around liquids as the game gets quite animated ;) Overall, the cards seem durable and you can likely expect these cards to wear as you would a quality set of standard playing cards.— Playability: The game makers say this game is for ages 8+ and for a minimum of 2 players up to 8 players. I am quite confident that a 5 year old could easily play this game given the opportunity. It would likely be tough to play with more than 8 players due to space constraints and people’s ability to reach across the table, but if you needed to play with more than 8, I guess you could just buy a second set of cards.— How to play: I won’t go in to great detail here (watch a video, remember?) The name of the game is to get rid of all of your cards first. This game essentially involves players playing cards in succession and saying a word (either “taco”, “cat”, “goat”, “cheese” or “pizza”) and if the card laid by the player matches the word said by the player, all players have to slap their hands on top of the discard pile deck. The last one to get their hands down has to take all cards from the discard pile and add to their own pile of cards. There are other action cards as well, which is where more fun comes in, but again, watch a video.— Game hint: This game involves a lot of slapping on top of other peoples hands. We purchased a half dozen cheap oven mitts from our local Dollarama store, which helps when playing with younger kids or rambunctious adults :) it also looks and feels completely ridiculous, which again adds to the fun. Not a requirement, but an option.— Conclusion: If you are looking for a super fun and fast paced game to play with friends/family look no further. We literally cry with laughter every time we play this and it works well with both kids and adults. Dare I say, with the adults and a few adult beverages, it is even more fun.Get this game, you will not regret it!!!

After reading a few reviews of people complaining about the bad quality of this board game, I hesitated to buy it. However, the game seemed fun and the price on Amazon was lower than other stores so I decided to give it a try. I am very satisfied of my purchase. This game is so much fun and I had no problem with the quality of the board along with the different components that comes with it. I like that you spin a wheel of numbers instead of using a dice which makes it more interesting. I also really like that there are different paths you can choose from which gives more variety every time you play. The ending of the game is always different depending mainly on luck but also the choices you make. I enjoy answering the questions on action cards which makes the game more socially interactive. Even if it is a game of 4 players max, it was still fun with only 2 players. My only complains would be that the pegs are small, the bills are flimsy and the cards are very pointy on the corners. Just little details that could be improved but otherwise I recommend playing this board game with friends and family.

Report
Lucas B4.0 out of 5 stars
This is fantastic peanut butter, are the extra ingredients worth the flavour? Read on to find out.
Reviewed in Canada on November 15, 2019Size: 2 kg (Pack of 1)Style: SmoothPattern Name: Peanut ButterVerified Purchase
This peanut butter tastes excellent, is perfectly smooth and spreads easily. The taste is not to sweat or salty, it is just right. The peanut butter is perfectly consistent, even after being in the fridge for weeks, the oils will not separate and the consistency will remain the same. Peanut butter is very versatile, can be spread on toast, used in cookies, as a dip or even eaten on its own as my wife likes to do.If you take a look at the ingredients list, you will see 7 ingredients. These ingredients are combined to create this perfectly emulsified, great tasting, long lasting peanut butter. In the USA, anything with the label peanut butter has to contain at least 90% peanuts by law, otherwise it is called a ‘peanut butter spread’. In Canada, where peanut butter was invented (Montreal) no such law exists so the consumer does not know how much actual peanuts goes into the product.The second ingredient ‘soy bean oil’ is regarded as a healthy oil and is used to prevent the oils naturally found in peanuts from separating and rising to the top of the jar, like in natural peanut butter.The third ingredient ‘corn maltodextrin’ is a highly processed white powder that is used to thicken the peanut butter, reduce the fat content per serving and keep the texture of the product. It is made from processed corn, has a neutral taste and has less than 20% sugar, however it adds carbohydrates to the servings.The third ingredient is sugar, which most people already know is used to sweeten the peanut butter and improve the taste. Peanuts on their own have zero added sugar obviously (although naturally contains 70mg per 15g). This product adds 1 gram of sugar per 15g of peanut butter.The forth ingredient is hydrogenated vegetable oil. This is used to improve the taste, texture and improve shelf life of the product. In this product they take, cotton seed and rapeseed oil which are liquid at room temperature, and they add hydrogen atoms to it. These types of oil are known to negatively affect heart health, inflammation and blood sugar. So this is probably the worst ingredient in this product. Being listed between salt and sugar, we can assume that there is between 60 and 100mg of this ingredient added per 15g.The fifth ingredient is salt, which improves the flavor and everyone loves salt. Peanuts on their own have less than 3mg of sodium per 15 grams. This product has 60mg of sodium per 15g, so they add around 57mg per 15 grams of peanut butter.The sixth ingredient is mono and diglycerides. This is typically used to help water and oil blend, to improve consistency and texture in the peanut butter. This is created by taking animal fat or vegetable oil and subjecting it to heat and adding an alkaline catalyst in a chemical reaction to isolate these fats. They are generally regarded as safe.15 grams of plain peanuts is 85 calories. 15 grams of this product is 90 calories. So the extra 6 ingredients that are not peanuts only make up about 5 calories per serving. They do however create a very palatable experience. So is the taste of this product worth it to you over natural peanut butter? Let me know.

Louie P5.0 out of 5 stars
Beware ... it does not last unless you ?
Reviewed in Canada on June 9, 2023Style: Concentrator AttachmentVerified Purchase
My initial review was 5 stars as it's a great blow dryer. Then a 1 star review because it started to shut off and on after just 4 months of use. This was really frustrating and should not happen with a product in this price range. Other reviews have also mentioned theirs, having the same issues and or dying in less than a year.  I was feeling so frustrated and decided to contact Shark Customer Service to give them a piece of my mind. To my surprise, an amazing customer service rep DARCY was very concerned with my issue and was able to walk me through and resolve my issue over the phone.  Beware... it does not last unless ... you grip the round intake air grill (at bottom of the handle) squeeze and pull downward to slide over the cord. This exposes the metal air filter which needs to be cleaned at least once every month or two. My filter was almost completely blocked  causing the dryer not to work properly and shut off because of overheating. Shark backs the product up for 2 years from purchase. Thanks Shark and Thank you DARCY.  6 stars !!

Report
M.R.3.0 out of 5 stars
I wanted to love this
Reviewed in Canada on July 14, 2023Style: Concentrator AttachmentVerified Purchase
First off the packaging was definitely opened prior to reaching me.  Not sure if it was returned or opened in the warehouse but it did not appear to have been used. However, there was a huge blob of heavily scented shampoo on the outer box of the product which had to have been there when it was packaged into the box it was shipped in seeing as that box had residue of this shampoo on the inside of it.  I spent quite a bit of time wiping this off and it wore down the images on the the box by the time I was done.I held off a long time purchasing this product based on price.  It went on a tiny sale so I grabbed it.  I really wanted to love this but it did nothing for me.  I tried it many times, nothing worked; increasing the speed, increasing the heat level, holding the curling wands straight up and upside down, using on damp hair, hair with texture spray, second and third day hair etc.I found my hair consitstently getting caught between the drying attachments and the hand piece.  As for the curling wands, I couldn't even get them to grab my hair so I tried using it on damp hair.  While it did curl lightly and in small sections my hair became a frizzy mess by the time I was done.  Even using it simply as a hair dryer was not strong enough to keep my frizz from getting out of control leaving me to reach for my straightening iron as usual.It is deceptively lightweight until you start to use it and then it's super heavy if you have small hands as I do and cannot get a good enough grip on the hand piece. It is also quite loud and high pitched, I had to use it wearing earplugs.If you have thick hair that gets frizzy easily, this product may not be for you.  While my hair is not exactly short, I also feel you have to have a substantial amount of length to your hair to get whatever curl you can achieve to look decent. I have watched multiple influencers and tutorials of people with longer hair than mine use this product and the results are beautiful.  Sad it didn't work out for me.

user_reviews:
Gregg5.0 out of 5 stars
An Echo Upgrade for My Home Office
Reviewed in Canada on August 23, 2023Colour Name: CharcoalConfiguration: EchoVerified Purchase
Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)I recently added the Echo (4th Gen) to my home office, and I must say, it's been a fantastic addition. This isn't my first Echo device, and I'm confident it won't be my last. Here's why I love it:**Sound Quality (★★★★★):**The sound quality of the Echo (4th Gen) is truly impressive. Whether I'm listening to music, having a conference call, or simply asking Alexa for information, the sound is clear, crisp, and fills the room beautifully. It makes working from home a much more enjoyable experience.**Voice Recognition (★★★★★):**One of the standout features of this Echo is its exceptional voice recognition. Alexa understands my commands and questions perfectly, even in a room with some background noise. It makes managing tasks and controlling smart devices in my office a breeze.**Tech Support (★★★★★):**As an experienced Echo user, I've rarely needed tech support. However, it's reassuring to know that Amazon provides excellent customer support for its devices. Should any issues arise, I'm confident they will be resolved promptly.**Smart Home Hub (★★★★★):**The Echo (4th Gen) doubles as a smart home hub, which is incredibly convenient. I can easily control my smart lights, thermostat, and even my coffee maker with just my voice. It's a game-changer for productivity and comfort in my home office.**Overall Impressions (★★★★★):**This Echo (4th Gen) has exceeded my expectations and has become an integral part of my home office setup. It combines premium sound quality, efficient voice recognition, and the convenience of a smart home hub in one sleek device. If you're considering upgrading your office or home setup, I highly recommend giving this Echo a try.As someone who's had multiple Echo devices over the years, I can confidently say that Amazon continues to innovate and improve their products. I'm looking forward to what they come up with next, and I'm certain that Echo devices will remain a staple in my home.In conclusion, the Echo (4th Gen) is a stellar addition to my home office, and I wouldn't hesitate to buy more for other rooms in my house. It's a versatile and high-quality smart speaker that offers a lot of value for the price. If you're a fan of Echo devices like I am, you won't be disappointed with this one.

Report
Jean-P T.4.0 out of 5 stars
A few things could be improved
Reviewed in Canada on December 3, 2022Verified Purchase
I like Alexa devices in general ... I have at least 7 in my home ...This being said ..# Stereo pairingI tried pairing this one with my older echo to have stereo when listening to spotify but it was a bit complicated even for an IT guy.The problem was that 1 echo device was on the 2ghz band and 1 was on the 5ghz band.So Alexa complained that there were not on the same network but it's the same SSID and I think it should work fine anyway since they share the same network somehow.The workaround I found was to go in my router settings, use mac filtering to block my new echo device from 5ghz band.# When using my Samsung phone, Spotify steaming to Alexa does not always work, I press Play and there is no sound. It always works in the end but it's a bit annoying to have to re-try multiple times# There are a few things Alexa has issues understanding, like some songs she can't find on Spotify for no apparent reason, it would be nice to have an easy way to report these so they can get fixed. I tried playing some playlists on Spotify but Alexa would not recognize them. Also for some reasons sometimes we say "close light XYZ" (in french) and it won't work, sometimes it does. Sometimes we say "turn of light XYZ" instead and this works. It's not consistent.# When there is a power outage, often some lights can't be found by Alexa but they work in Kasa/Govee/etc. The workaround is to re-plug the plugs and to reset the switches but it's a bit annoying.# In the Alexa app, often when we add a device in a group, it removes another device from that group# There were notification sounds that we did not know why we got them and it was a bit annoying. Eventually I realized that it was when there was a "deal" on Amazon. I disabled it using the Alexa App and it seems fine now but I think this should be improved. Indeed, when I asked Alexa what why Alexa made a sound. she was not able to provide an answer. When looking at the history in the Alexa app, there was nothing about that "event". I think it's when I finally asked "do I have notifications?" that I was able to understand what was that sound. I think this should be replaced by Amazon Store alerts instead or on the phone notifications instead. Something you can look at instead of listening to. Visual instead of audio.# Sound is OK as long as you don't crank it up too much, I might buy the Echo Studio eventuallyUpdate 2023 : the alexa app on android is really due for a refresh, i have maybe 20 alexa supported devices in my house and the app feels quite outdated and slow, managing groups and rooms among other things can be quite painful .. troubleshooting network issues should also be improved

I purchased the Momentum 4s in a head-to-head comparison against the Bose QC 45 and the Technics EAH800. The Momentum had by far the best sound profile and superior eq adjustment via the app. Can connect to multiple sources at once, noise cancelling  during music and on calls only slightly behind the Technics, best in-call acoustics, and weight and build made them suitable to wear during activities.  I wanted headphones that would allow me to have important work calls even with my children making noise in the background and they succeed. I really enjoy the sound profile and find myself using them far more than I anticipated. Being able to toggle the noise cancelling on and off with a tap is fantastic.My single complaint is the headphones occasionally disconnect during calls requiring me to re-select them as the audio source on my phone. Hopefully this is addressed with a firmware update.

aaron 5.0 out of 5 stars
Great headphones
Reviewed in Canada on December 17, 2022Colour Name: WhiteVerified Purchase
Shockingly comfortable with a very good neutral sound profile. (probably the best wireless sound quality I've ever heard.) Also has an unbelievable battery life. I only have to charge these every other week at most, even with frequent daily use. The only flaws are with the gimmicky features that try to emulate the Sony headphones that we were all too 'cool' to buy instead.  The touch panels can be finicky in the cold and if you're sweating like the thiccboi/lady that we all are after the lockdowns, the ear sensor can sometimes think that youve taken the headphones off. This will make whatever is playing pause which will then make you have to go through the excruciating motion of tapping them once to play again.These are still borderline perfect headphones, but of course they had to have all the silly nonsense to appeal to the 17 people who talk to Siri...The ANC is solid but it's the one place that the Sony flagship headphones do outperform these. Its not really a feature that I'm hard for, but I guess if you're weirdly excited by it, you should for sure go with the Sony cans. The worst flaw by far is the fact that they took their very creative momentum design and made them look like all the other wannabe sony trendy headphones. Absolutely DEVASTATING for us hipster dorks. While the 10/10 sound quality and comfort does more than make up for no longer looking like a super cool and unique edgelord that "for sure appreciates music way more and has infinitely better taste than all these other normies", I did prefer the old design.But yeah. 10/10. Would blow $500 on headphones to listen to cringe podcasts again. Buy them, you won't regret it... And if you do regret it it's okay because you just die anyways. :D

Roger F4.0 out of 5 stars
A solid pair of cans in spite of
Reviewed in Canada on February 17, 2024Colour Name: WhiteVerified Purchase
Pros: Nice feel and aesthetic with really impressive sound quality listening to music and engaging in telephone conversation.  Automatic 15 minute shut off when idle is also a nice feature that extends battery life.  The fit on the head and ears is quite comfortable and can also be worn for extended periods of time without any major discomfort.  Active noise cancelling is good to very good at blocking out external noise while the transparency mode is quite transparent in terms of external sounds entering the headphones without taking them off.  The 60 hours of battery life on a full charge, which only takes 2 hours from empty is quite impeccable as well as a quick 5-10 min charge giving me 3-6hrs of playback!  The battery life is bar none the best there is for a Bluetooth headset at this point.  Cons: Bluetooth disconnect occurs more often than I like and the touch controls aren't always responsive but works more often than not.  The on-head detection can also be annoying as even the slightest adjustment of the right earcup will pause play.  You can turn certain features on and off in the app to help curtail some of the issues associated with the Momentum 4.  Another con is that they're not the most comfortable around the neck, although the most ergonomically sound way would be to fully extend the sliders and turn the cups towards the neck/clavicle area soft side down.  They also don't fold like the previous iterations of the Momentum; instead, the earcups swivel 180°  All in all, a solid pair of cans based on the price point which also comes with a decent 2 year warranty from the manufacturer!

Report
Hayden5.0 out of 5 stars
Read This Before Making Assumptions on This Game!
Reviewed in Canada on March 25, 2020Platform for display: Nintendo SwitchEdition: StandardVerified Purchase
DO NOT LISTEN TO WHAT ALL THESE OTHER PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT ONLINE PLAY, IT ISN'T THAT BIG OF A DEAL. I always loved the feel of animal crossing as a whole, and this game might be my favourite from the entire series. I only ordered the game yesterday and although to some people the game might start off a little slow, the customization options from the start with things like clothing, face paints, and more is really fun to toy around with. When starting off, character customization in terms of hairstyles and eyes, mouth etc. can be limited, but more can be unlocked later on. When starting the game, the player can choose from 4 randomly generated island types, and can also choose the name of the island, 2 other campers also come and live on your island at the start. You also get a native fruit to your island, these can be peaches, apples, cherries, oranges, and pears. These are randomly chosen. Right after starting the game and getting out of the main setup, I had made my sister register inside of the game, which was extremely easy (if they had a nintendo switch account already on the switch they could just load up the game on their account and create their character right away). Yes, only one switch is allowed per island, and this probably wont change. However, I do not see a problem with this at all. Up to 8 residents are allowed on one island at once, and the island size is more than enough for each resident to have their own space on the island. local play between players is also very easily accessible by opening the nook phone and selecting the “Call Resident” app, from there you can select multiple residents to play with together. When playing local play, the game always has a leader, which can do more things than a player, such as going into buildings, the camera follows them, accessing shops, etc. This doesn’t mean the other people playing are left out though, people can still use tools from their inventory, and they can still pickup items (which are stored in a box inside resident services). I don’t these limitations as much of a problem, since changing the leader is extremely easy and just takes a shake of a controller and a button. There is also complaints about the fact that players who aren't the first player registered on the island can’t progress through certain parts of the game, but it has been like that for countless animal crossing games, and it only makes sense since the first person to found that island is basically the leader. Overall it is amazing game definitely worth the wait and price, and I think most complaints are just over exaggerated.

user_reviews:
G5.0 out of 5 stars
Great for the price!
Reviewed in Canada on February 27, 2022Style: Soothing MotionsVerified Purchase
This bassinet works great for my son, but this won’t be for everyone. 5 stars because the cons aren’t “bad”, they’re just my preferences:PROS:- Easy to assemble and sturdy. It’s not moving easily when you’re getting your baby in and out- The vibration is subtle but noticeable. It puts my son right back to sleep when he is fussing.- the noise/music it makes works well for my son- the light/vibration system works on batteries and is detachable so you don’t even have to have it on there if you don’t want- deep bassinet, when baby starts to roll, there will be no fear of limbs going over the sides- you can turn a light that illuminates inside the bassinet to see your baby. I thought it was too bright for me, but I know some people really like it- stars light up on the ceiling and it’s cute- priceCONS- the vibration and sounds only last 30 minutes, so it’s enough to lull baby to sleep but you need to keep turning it back on or doing a quick “off on” to reset the timer- the mobile doesn’t spin or make noise- the mattress feels a bit like plastic (but if you buy those change pad covers, they work really well!)All in all it’s a great bassinet for the price :)

So I have over a hundred pounds of extra ballast and still it moves. IN any case, this is still the best of these lifelike punching bags around. The theory makes sense to me, but to be honest, I'm not positive it works 100% as advertised.  But the bottom line?  I use them now!When you washing machine does a rinse after the wash, does that not mean the machine gets cleaned out too?  Maybe.  But the idea of getting the machine cleaned out with a special product made for just that, is one that I now buy into.  Can I tell the machine is now cleaner?  No.  But, it makes me feel better!Our current washing machine is pretty new - maybe six or seven years old.  It has a "TubClean" function, that I have never used. I used the Instant Pot IP-DUO Plus 60 Electric Pressure Cooker the minute after I unpacked it. I made a great bone broth! The controls were easy to understand, and the operation was as simple as described in the manual. (Read the manual, especially if you are new to pressure cookers.) Clean up of the pot was also very simple, and easy. No crevices to un-gum, and wiping the interior and around the lid was effortless. There is a handy condensation trap, which didn't end up being needed this time. The stainless steel cook pot is very well made, and has a very thick gauge base, which allows for excellent, even heat diffusion. The manual pressure release / steam valve is easy to use. It's quite loose, but I looked on YouTube and it behaves the same in those videos. The valve worked as it should for my trials.I purchased the silicone storage lid separately.

I have been using my InstantPot every night since I got it, and it has made mealtime so much easier and delicious.I can take almost anything directly out of the freezer and prepare it in minutes and have it on the table in less than an hour, including prep and additional dishes.  It's quicker than going out for dinner, or ordering in, and so much healthier for you.  For example, I can take a roast directly from the freezer, brown the outside in a pan with some olive oil and garlic or onions  (while still frozen) then put the entire contents of the pan into the InstantPot, add a cup or two of water, set the time, and in 35 minutes, have a delicious pot roast ready and on the table.  Want gravy with that?  Set the pot to Saute after removing the vegetables and roast, and make your gravy directly in the InstantPot.  It is so easy to set, and safe to use with it's multiple safety features, you will wonder how you managed without it before.  Just like Grandma's pressure cooker, without the worry of overcooking or over-pressurizing, and it has so many multiple safeguards it's foolproof.  I'm expanding what I'm preparing in it every day, with thousands or recipes online, or in cookbooks dedicated to its use.  Well worth the investment, it paid for itself in less than two meals out.  It's a blessing for last minute guests, hurried days with the family or making weekends more relaxing knowing dinner is only minutes away.  One of the must have gifts of Christmas last year, I waited to get mine, but now I wondered why as it has made such a huge difference in preparing meals.  The best appliance in my kitchen.

I would invite people who write excellent reviews of this product to load it up with clean water, turn it on, and set it next to a regular fan. The difference is measurable but negligible. When you freeze the pads and put ice in the water the difference is somewhat less negligible. On a very hot day, this effect lasts roughly an hour.The fan in the unit is the cheapest part of the design. In my case, it's out of balance and makes the table shake a little. I expect it to fall apart any day now.Then there's the noise itself. Mine is so loud I can't sleep with it on, which is fine: I use a fan, which works just as well.It will not - Read this: NOT - cool a small room. It will cool a part of a small room, maybe the part you're sitting in. It is not "air conditioning": it is a crappy little plastic swamp cooler, and as the design execution is absolutely abysmal that its performance is equally abysmal.Not worth $15, much less this panic price they sent up to accommodate a particularly hot summer.TL;DR: crappy components, crappy design. description: This New fresh fragrance reveals a new facet of modern femininity    All our fragrances are 100% originals by their original designers    Packaging for this product may vary from that shown in the image above    This item is only valid for shipment in Canada    Scent opens with cool green leaf and fresh cut apple

user_reviews:
Jose Zerpa5.0 out of 5 stars
Incredible value for the money
Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2024Style: VoyageVerified Purchase
I was lucky to catch a killer deal for this cologne, for under $25 and blind bought it.I've got to say all the fuss about it is true. This is a wonderful cologne, very fresh, masculine and versatile.The opening is an alcohol blast that last only about a minute, and the you get notes of green apple and sea water, all very well balanced and done. Then you start getting soapy notes but not harsh at all. It's the smell of a freshly showered person. On top of that, it is very long lasting on skin, easily over 6 hours. Of course projection decreases over time, but if you wear it in a temperature controlled space like an office, other people are going to be able to smell you pretty much all day.I have owned other economical fragrances that are in the same category as Nautica Voyage (Blue Seduction, Ferragamo Aqua, Black Seduction, just to name a few) that are also nice, but Nautica Voyage is a much better blend and it smells more expensive than it is, in my opinion.Men of any age can pull this, from high school kids to mature men, this is a great choice for daily wear, in an informal setting and even for summer time dates. Definitely not for special occasions when you are dressing up, or when you want your presence to be noticed.

Nautica Voyage Eau De Toilette for Men: A Captivating Symphony of Freshness and Elegance
Reviewed in Canada on January 4, 2024Style: VoyageVerified Purchase
The Nautica Voyage Eau De Toilette for Men has proven to be a standout fragrance, offering a captivating blend of fresh, romantic, and fruity notes that effortlessly combine to create a scent profile that exudes sophistication.**Fragrance Composition (5/5):**The fragrance opens with invigorating top notes, featuring a harmonious fusion of fresh and fruity accords. The subtle sweetness of apple is complemented by the aquatic essence of water lotus, creating an uplifting and energetic introduction. The heart notes then unfold, revealing a delicate yet robust interplay of scents, leading to a warm and woody finish dominated by cedar.**Longevity (4/5):**The longevity of Nautica Voyage is commendable for an Eau De Toilette, offering a lasting impression without becoming overwhelming. The transition from the initial burst of freshness to the deeper, more complex base notes ensures that the fragrance remains relevant throughout the day.**Versatility (4/5):**The versatility of this fragrance is noteworthy. Its balanced composition allows it to seamlessly transition from day to evening wear. Erickson5.0 out of 5 stars
Smoother Gameplay feels Good Worth the 481$
Reviewed in Canada on October 3, 2023Verified Purchase
Product Came in good Condition, took me like 10-15 mins to install the Chip on a Asrock b45m Pro4 Board.was Planning on upgrading to the am5 motherboards with the ryzen 7 7800x3D but i was like 100 200$ short. seen the reviews for this chip and it looked promising, i think i will be using this chip for awhile until it dies out gonna buy a new motherboard in like a few days (AM4) just to get more power into the chip itself. dont think asrock b450m pro4 circulates a lot power for these sort of chips. but testing a few games with this chip with a 3080 amp holo its damn well smooth and impressive and a more relaxing feel and responsive and snappiness better then the ryzen 5600x i had in my rig to tie down with the 3080 amp Holo. a 50 to 70$ cpu fan can keep this beast around 70c thats on like heavy games like cod cyber punk etc might jump to 80's thats just on base clock of 3.4ghz did not attempt to OC this chip yet but on the box it says boost clock to 4.5 but imagine what a few extra ghz can do for u in game if its already running so nice on base clock. Main reason i have not yet attempted to OC this chip is because alot source said even the platform for this chip recommends not to OC the Chip, due to damaging the chip faster but dont they all say the same thing for every chip.. but OC at ur own Risk I guess but its a 10/10 for me and if u install this chip an you get a encrypted key error to Press y or N, for your bios Keys Press Y an your good to go.. i overthink the process thinking i was going to completely brake my pc. but either or answer is correct and still boots but the N answer just reboots u right back to the black screen asking u the same answer. the right answer ended up Being the "Y" botton so go ahead and press that for me and enjoy your CPU <3.

Report
Joseph5.0 out of 5 stars
The Noise Cancelling is amazing.
Reviewed in Canada on June 11, 2015Verified Purchase
Before these, I used Sennheiser NoiseGard on ear noise cancelling headphones. They worked somewhat, but nothing like these Bose over ear Noise Cancelling headphones. I travelled to Australia and back with these and they made a huge difference. On the final leg of my flight back home, I had a 3 year old girl with her mom sitting beside me. The 3 year old was not happy and she did her fair share of screaming. I just put these headphones on and turned up my music a little and it was like she was in a whole other section. I am so happy with these. Some have commented on the low end not being great, but for me, they were fine. I don't like having my music very loud, because I have sensitive hearing, so more base would likely be less enjoyable for me. One reviewer commented that his ears were larger and so he would have sore ears after a while. Although I wouldn't consider my ears large, I did notice that having them on constantly during a 12 hour flight, my ears did get slightly sore. However it was manageable.One thing I do find a bit of an inconvenience, is the size of the Airline adapter, which I needed to use on the Qantas flights. It sticks out farther than I would like. I actually broke mine on the flight back when I went to sit back down in my window seat. I have replaced it and even bought an extra. But I will have to remember to unplug the adapter from the chair before I get up from my seat. It would be nice if they made it more compact. I tried other airline adapters that are for stereo headphones, but they don't work, since the cable is designed with a microphone connection.I have a Samsung phone and at the time I purchased these, there was only the Apple version of these headphones available. (For the inline volume.) I decided to take a chance when Bose came out with the Samsung version and I ordered a replacement Samsung cable. It worked! So now I have one set of headphones with two cables that I can use on my iPad or my Samsung phone. So if you bought one version and want to use it on the other, you only have to purchase the appropriate cable from Bose.Dec 17, 2017 Update:I still take these on every flight I take. One other piece of information that could be useful to some. I sometimes need to take short haul flights on twin propeller planes and the engines on them are very loud. Before I had these, I tried using my Sennheiser headphones on these planes and they just weren't up to the task. They actually introduced their own noise, so I just reverted to using ear plugs on these flights. The Bose do much better than I would have expected. They don't reduce the sound as well as they do on a jet, but they reduce it from a deafening sound, to something more manageable. I wear them from the moment the engine starts to the moment the engine stops and my ears are much happier for it.

The game is straightforward to set up and get started, which is great for engaging younger players or those new to board games. Despite its simplicity, each game is a fresh challenge as you navigate the board and attempt to block your opponents while finding space for your own pieces.The game fosters critical thinking and spatial reasoning, making it not just entertaining but also educational, especially for children. user_reviews:
JS5.0 out of 5 stars
Instantly Turns Janes And Joes Into Pros!
Reviewed in Canada on January 2, 2019Size: 8QtStyle: Instant PotVerified Purchase




                    The media could not be loaded.
                



 I am an admittedly terrible cook when it comes to traditional means of using a stove and I imagine that my cooking is a slight step up from eating canned dog food, but the Instant Pot has entirely changed this.This thing is friendly for cooking dummies like myself.  There are tons of delicious recipes online that are easy to follow and once everything is in the pot, you simply start a timer and that's it. Once the timer is done, open the valve to release the steam and once the steam has released, dinner is served. There is literally nothing to screw up during the cooking process; it's simple and ingenious.The Instant Pot works by using pressure from steam to significantly shorten cooking times meaning more time for you to do other fun things like hanging out with your significant other, or watching TV, or both!  We've made 'fall off the bone' ribs in about 45 mins (including creating the sauté and taking into account warming up and steam release) that were comparable in taste to ribs that had been slow cooked for 4 hrs. We've also used it to make homemade soups as it takes much less time for the flavour in the ingredients in the soup to trickle into the soup vs traditional boiling over a stove. Chicken in ten minutes? You bet. Perfectly cooked hard boiled eggs in under 5 minutes and delicious cheesecake in under an hour (including steam release) were all no problem for even a simpleton like myself to make, and best of all, everything actually tastes great too!!  I've included pictures of a few of the things we've made using the Instant Pot.  Yes, all of the food pictures in this review were made using the Instant Pot!When it comes to cooking, there aren't too many things out there that are game changers, but an air fryer, a sous vide and an Instant Pot are, and if you happen to have all three, congratulations for having the trifecta of cooking greatness in your kitchen!PROS* So easy to use that even guys that literally can't cook (me) can look like a rock star. Once everything is in the pot, you set the timer and go. Once it's done, open the valve to release the steam and dinner is served. There literally is nothing to screw up and best of all, the food is delicious!* The Instant Pot significantly shortens cooking time of most things, freeing up your valuable time to do other fun things! :P* There are literally tons and tons of delicious recipes online. Guaranteed you will discover there are things that you can make in the Instant Pot that you never knew could be made in an Instant Pot.* Goodbye slow cooker. That was so the 70's.* Easy to clean. The pot is stainless steel and the lid can be removed and fully submerged. The seal on the lid comes off and replacement seals for the lid can be purchased when it eventually wears out.CONS* Too many models just make for mass confusion.  Have a look at my TIPS section for some help.* Expensive, so wait for a sale if you can as they do on sale, especially for big events like Boxing Day, Black Friday, etc.TIPS* Don't get too caught up with the "x-in-1" features. They just add a preset cooking time for a type of food to the Instant Pot and up the "in-1" number. You can just manually input the cooking time yourself.* The most important thing is determining the size of the Instant Pot that you need. For our family of 4, we went for the 8 quart esp. since the wife likes to make home made soups.* The Lux model does not have low pressure cooking while Duo models have both high and low pressure. Low pressure cooking is typically used to make delicate foods like yogurt, eggs and veggies. If you don't think you'll make yogurt, eggs or veggies in the Instant Pot, just get the Lux model which skips the low pressure. Pro tip: Cooking rice uses high pressure.* Take the Instant Pot outdoors to release the steam when doing a quick release or it will quickly smell up the house of whatever you're making. Use a glove or mitt to be safe.* When making a lot of food, esp. soups, mind the max line. If you want less chance to have a mess on the bottom of the lid, go an inch under the max line.* Be careful when releasing the steam.  I've included a video of what a fast release of the steam looks like.  You don't want your bare hand anywhere close to that hot steam.  Read the instruction manual!!!  Seriously, read it.
Read more
