rachelleme5.0 out of 5 stars
Love this hand held bidet
Reviewed in Canada on September 11, 2023Style: Brushed ModeVerified Purchase
I love this. I had read in reviews that some people were finding it leaks, so I have been sure that I always push the lever down after use, to close the valve. It has never leaked for me. I placed a little tray under the lever and toilet just in case, but in the 14 months that I've had it, it has not leaked.It wasn't difficult to set up. You turn off the water to the toilet. You unscrew the hose from the water to the toilet. You screw this device's hardware inbetween and reattach the toilet hose. I made sure to turn this so the lever points towards the front as opposed to the side. It's easier for me to just flip the water-supply lever up and down that way.It's not just for keeping yourself clean. Since my toilet is next to the bathtub, I have used it to rinse the tub after I've scrubbed it. I have also used it to clean dirty and dusty items that had a lot of grime. I just plunk the dirty storage container, the outdoor step stool, whatever, into the tub and hose it down with this. The flat lever on the nozzle easily controls the flow from soft to hard. Your water pressure would really be what ultimately determines how hard the spray will be, but my average apartment water pressure, flat lever pressed all the way down, is more than enough to sluice layers of dirt from a white plastic step stool that was left to disappear into the black hole that was my uncle's garden shed. It would have been good to film it for one of those "Satisfying to watch" videos you see on social media.And for your soft areas, you just don't press the flat lever on the nozzle very hard. Practice a little before using it on yourself if you're nervous.Before I got this, I had been using a long nozzled little watering can to clean off after the bathroom. Pandemic toilet paper shortages did not affect me at all. But this gadget means I don't have to constantly be refilling a mini watering can. I have a metal over-the-tank shelving unit and I hook the flat lever of the nozzle over one of the crossbeams instead of the hook provided in the box.It's such a great gadget that even though I don't need another one, I feel like getting another one anyway, just because I like it so much.

title: beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO 250 Ohm closed Studio Headphone for improved bass response, high frequencies are clear and differentiated, ideal for monitoring purposes
description: Closed over-ear headphones for professional mixing in the studio    Perfect for studio recordings thanks to their pure and high-resolution sound    The soft, circumaural and repalceable velour ear pads ensure high wearing comfort    Hard-wearing, durable and robust workmanship Made in Germany    Practical single-sided cable (3.0m coiled cable)
nav: Electronics › Headphones, Earbuds & Accessories › Headphones
user_reviews:
Graham5.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent Headphones
Reviewed in Canada on February 25, 2019Size: 250 OHMColour Name: GrayVerified Purchase
Wanted to review based off of my application as it was difficult to find any comments or reviews for how I would be using these headphones and there is a lot of negative reviews on the web on driving high impedance headphones off of home theater receivers. My use will primarily be off of my Marantz SR7009 receiver headphone jack for music, gaming, and movies/tv after the kids go to bed. I tested the 80ohm and 250ohm side by side in all scenarios and ultimately went with the 250ohm version as my receiver has no issues driving these headphones. In my opinion the 250ohm version sounds far superior then the 80ohm variant, much larger sound stage with excellent definition in particular at the high end. Both pairs are extremely comfortable to wear for hours on end and the build quality is superior to many other headphones even at higher price points.Live music and acoustic music hands down sounds better on the 250ohm version, the 80ohm version sounds noticeably flatter, however the 80ohm version can be driven louder due to the flatter highs which helps if you are looking for a little bit more bass out of these. On that note, the bass definition on these headphones is excellent and more then adequate for my listening preference, if you want a bass heavy headphone then go buy a pair of beats and sacrifice all other aspects of sound quality and stop complaining. Heavy metal/rock comes through great on these with no noticeable distortion at higher volumes and excellent definition in the mid range.Gaming with these is just fine, sound detail is amazing in particular on darker games like Resident Evil with lots of quiet creepy sounds coming through clear as day and first person shooters are just as good, albeit no built in mic. Movie dialog comes through sounding natural and overall no complaints here.  At $200 you will not find a better pair of headphones for a home theater type of application such as mine.

nav: Video Games › PlayStation 4 › Games
user_reviews:
James Y5.0 out of 5 stars
This is how GTAV was meant to be!
Reviewed in Canada on February 15, 2016Platform for display: PlayStation 4Verified Purchase
I originally picked up GTAV for PS3 on launch day and although that version was a fun and amazing experience, it was limited by PlayStation 3's hardware capabilities. Despite this, Rockstar managed to give us an excellent game and some excellent DLC content for two strong years.  In July of 2015, GTAV for PS3 finally reached the end of the road as the DLC pack "Ill gotten gains: Part 2" was the final DLC to be made available for last gen systems and if players wanted any more new DLC, they would need to switch to next gen systems like PS4/Xbox1.  Like most people, I didn't like the idea of essentially being forced to switch if I wanted to continue to enjoy the new DLCs for this game but I knew it had to be done as last gen systems are now obsolete and can't keep up hardware-wise.If you've played the last gen version and is undecided on whether or not you should upgrade to the next gen version, there are a few things to keep in mind: First, there is much more content on the next gen version. More missions, more weapons, more features, etc. In-game radio stations have more licensed music, there are more vehicles available and the game even has a full first-person mode.  Secondly, Rockstar continues to add new DLC to the next gen version. With last gen consoles, support from Rockstar is LITERALLY non-existent now for GTAO.  There's no more DLC and online public lobbies have more and more modders running wild. Next gen lobbies are still pretty safe.  Thirdly, this game supports Remote Play so if you own a PS Vita, you can now play GTAV on it (amazing, right?). Finally, if you invested a lot of time and effort into your GTAO's character(s) on last gen, you will be happy to know that you can cross-platform transfer your characters, progress and money to the next gen version and continue where you left off.  (EDIT: As of March 6, 2017, PS3 owners can no longer transfer their save data to PS4.)A minor downside to this game is that you must pay to play online whereas last gen GTAO was and still is completely free to play. This normally shouldn't be a problem considering most next gen owners usually have income to spend but if you're on a fixed budget or prefer not to pay for PSN+ services, then you're out of luck with playing online with this game.Overall, if you own a next-gen system and enjoyed GTAO of previous gen, you should consider upgrading to this game if you haven't done so yet. The extra content, missions, feaures and DLC makes this game well worth the price.

AUTOMATIC MOSQUITO LIGHT BULB FOR PEACE OF MIND - Set the anti mosquito camping light up next to you at night or during the day and enjoy a more comfortable space without the use of mosquito repellent outdoor spray. Indoor mosquito trap 24 hour peace of mind.    MOSQUITO ZAPPER OUTDOOR BULB WITH 4 LIGHT MODES - Each mosquito zapper camping light features 4 light modes that keep your indoor and outdoor space illuminated and guarded against pesky mosquitoes. 4 light modes: 20%, 50%, 100% brightness, and mosquito light outdoor!    DUSK TO DAWN MOSQUITO ZAPPER RECHARGEABLE BULB - The mosquito lamp outdoor bulb uses 5W to maintain a 16' x 16' bug-free perimeter for 15 hours, keeping you guarded against bites for longer periods. Mosquito trap indoor keeps mosquitoes at bay from dusk till dawn.    AN ELECTRIC BUG ZAPPER OUTDOOR BULB THAT GOES ANYWHERE - With a portable design, you can take the mosquito and flies zapper trap wherever you go for 24hr mosquito defense. Take the mosquito trap outdoor usb with you camping, set it up beside your bed, or use it while you sit and relax outside.    HANGING BUG ZAPPER OUTDOOR DESIGN - Suspend the mosquito zappers outdoor bulb on your patio, from the peak of your tent, or place it by your feet for close coverage. Boundery outdoor mosquito trap guards you against pesky mosquitoes throughout summer.    CHILDREN AND PET FRIENDLY OUTDOOR MOSQUITO ZAPPER - Unlike outdoor mosquito repellent which emit odorous chemicals, our mosquito catcher outdoor keeps mosquitoes at bay using only the effects of light and electricity. The best mosquito trap outdoor for households with kids and pets.
nav: Patio, Lawn & Garden › Pest Control › Insect Zappers
user_reviews:
Cindy Michalak5.0 out of 5 stars
Works as expected
Reviewed in Canada on July 21, 2023Verified Purchase
Live in Southern Ontario.  Bought these to take camping with us.  Tried it out in the backyard to see if it actually works.  I literally left it out all night to see what happened and to hopefully reduce the mosquito population in our backyard.  This is what it looked like in the morning.  I did the same the next night, at which point the battery died so needs to be recharged.  The light on it is extremely bright so would be good for playing cards or doing dishes in the dark while camping.  The UV light to attract mosquitoes is very dim but as you can see it obviously worked to attract the bugs at night to the lamp.  I bought a two pack so will be bringing those camping this summer.  Will write an update review when we return!  I haven’t cleaned it yet and there are no instructions on how to do that so I will need to Google and watch some videos on that in the future….

title: Nintendo Switch™ – OLED Model - The Legend of Zelda™: Tears of the Kingdom Edition

user_reviews:
Laura5.0 out of 5 stars
Good console
Reviewed in Canada on August 12, 2023Edition: OLED Console Zelda Special EditionVerified Purchase
I never owned a switch before so it is hard for me to comment in regards to past models. However, I found this to be a great console. I was a bit disappointed that it did not come with a copy of the Tears of the Kingdom at first. However I realize now it is quite a large game, and I can understand why it was not included. This is a nice looking unit, I am happy with the battery life which is probably an easy 10-12 hrs. I keep airplane mode on as much as possible, as I find the internet connection a hard drain on the battery. There is a bit of wiggle between the controllers and the screen itself, nothing too bad, I expect this is because the controllers are detachable. All in all, a good console.

Report
Oxfret5.0 out of 5 stars
I couldn't be happier.
Reviewed in Canada on July 6, 2023Edition: OLED Console Zelda Special EditionVerified Purchase
I'm not sure what people are complaining about the game not coming with this system for. It's only $10 - $20 more expensive than the basic Oled model. You really think your going to get a special addition system plus the game for $10-$20? Your dreaming. Or just very bad at math.The system is great, I wasn't a big fan of the controllers in the pictures, but I like them more in person. They are just not what I would normally consider my style, but they are very nice and well made. They have grown on me the longer I have them for. I love the metal backing, and the special design swirls. There is also a good amount of room in the doc to put a case on the system. There is actually so much room that you might want a case, I didn't actually like how lose it fit without one. But I'm happy to have the extra protective layer.Although, I did want to add, that there is a protective screen on this. Not a screen to peal off, an actual permanent screen protector. I was trying to get it off when I stopped to look it up because it was stuck on there so good. Do not remove this, but feel free to add your own protector on top.

Damon5.0 out of 5 stars

Reviewed in Canada on May 5, 2023Edition: OLED Console Zelda Special EditionVerified Purchase
This Zelda-themed console made a striking impact immediately out of the box. This is my first Switch, and I’m so happy I decided to buy this limited edition version. The Falafel Sultan!!5.0 out of 5 stars
Super nice!
Reviewed in Canada on April 30, 2023Edition: OLED Console Zelda Special EditionVerified Purchase
The Re-design for the OLED switch is quite nice. Coming from a first gen Switch to this is a nice little upgrade the kick stand is much more robust. The MicroSD port is in a much less awkward place. The back plate is now metal which is nice since it gives a good amount of weight to the overall system and feels good in the hands (I mostly play it in handheld mode) the joy-cons do not seem redesigned though so watch out for the same problems that plague the joy-cons.The dock was also redesigned. No longer is the back door hinged, but comes off entirely making it less awkward for plugging in the cables.The Ethernet port works perfectlyOverall the presentation is quite nice, as much as I wish that it was a bundle with the game, the amount of detail on this specific switch is really nice. They definitely took their time designing the artwork for both the console and the dock.

title: Echo Show 8 (2nd Gen, 2021 release) | HD smart display with Alexa and 13 MP camera | Charcoal
description: Alexa can show you even more - 8” HD touchscreen, adaptive colour, and stereo speakers bring entertainment to life. Make video calls with a 13 MP camera that uses auto-framing to keep you centered.    Stay in frame - Make video calls with a new camera that frames and centers automatically. Simply ask Alexa to call your contacts.    Make life easier at home - Glance at your calendars and reminders. Use your voice to set timers, update lists, and see news or traffic updates.    Manage your smart home - Look in when you're away with the built-in camera. Control compatible devices like cameras, lights, and more using the interactive display, your voice, or your motion.    Be entertained - Enjoy TV shows and movies in HD and stereo with Prime Video, Netflix, and more. Or ask Alexa to stream Amazon Music, Apple Music, or Spotify.    Put your memories on display - Use Amazon Photos to turn your home screen into a digital frame. Adaptive colour helps your favourite photos look great in any light.    Designed to protect your privacy - Amazon is not in the business of selling your personal information to others. Built with multiple layers of privacy controls including a mic/camera off button and a built-in camera shutter.
user_reviews:
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
or those invested in the ecosystem, it's an excellent addition, offering practicality, entertainment
Reviewed in Canada on February 4, 2024Colour Name: CharcoalConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase
The Echo Show 8 (2nd Gen, 2021 release) is a significant upgrade in the smart display category, blending the convenience of Alexa with enhanced multimedia capabilities. Here's a succinct review of its key features and performance:Design and Display: The Echo Show 8 maintains its compact, user-friendly design, making it a perfect fit for any room. The 8-inch HD screen offers crisp, vibrant visuals, making it ideal for video calls, streaming content, and browsing photos.Camera Upgrade: One of the standout upgrades is the 13 MP camera, which significantly improves video call quality. With auto-framing, the camera keeps you centered during calls, enhancing the overall experience when connecting with friends and family.Alexa Integration: Alexa's integration remains top-notch, allowing users to control smart home devices, ask for news updates, set reminders, and much more, all through voice commands. The responsiveness and accuracy of voice recognition have seen noticeable improvements.Sound Quality: The audio performance of the Echo Show 8 is impressive for its size, delivering clear, robust sound. Whether listening to music, podcasts, or during calls, the sound quality enriches the user experience.Privacy Features: Amazon has paid attention to privacy concerns, equipping the Echo Show 8 with physical shutters for the camera and a microphone mute button. These features provide peace of mind for users cautious about their privacy.Overall Experience: The Echo Show 8 (2nd Gen) is a well-rounded smart display that excels in connectivity, entertainment, and smart home management. Its upgraded camera, combined with the reliable performance of Alexa, makes it a compelling choice for anyone looking to enhance their smart home ecosystem.Rating: 4.5 out of 5 stars. The Echo Show 8 (2nd Gen) misses a perfect score narrowly due to its relatively unchanged design and the ever-present competition for more integrations. However, for those invested in the Alexa ecosystem, it's an excellent addition, offering a blend of practicality, entertainment, and smart home functionality.

Report
The Tech Guy5.0 out of 5 stars
Significant Improvements - This is the Best All Around Echo Display Speaker
Reviewed in Canada on June 21, 2021Colour Name: CharcoalConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase
If you are only going to buy one Echo Show speaker and are undecided on with Echo Show to buy … this is the One to Get!I already own a couple Echo Show 5’s and 8’s and use them everyday.  The echo Show 5 makes the perfect SMART Alarm Clock however the screen is too small and the camera resolution is so, so.  The echo show 8 is the Goldilocks of Smart Video Speakers.  It’s not too big, not to small …. it’s just right.You may be tempted to purchase an older cheaper Echo Show 8 Gen 1 speaker but I wouldn’t recommend it … the improvements to the new Echo Show Gen 2 speaker are significant and worth the marginal increased cost or waiting for if there is a delay when ordering.*** Gen 2 Improvements and Features … ***- Camera gets upgraded from 1MP in old version to 13MP in the new Gen 2 Version- The camera is not only higher resolution but much better in low light- Auto Tracking/Framing.This is a new feature that keeps you in the centre of the frame even if you move around when you’re on a video call.  It works really well.- Remote Viewing - Security Camera.This is the best new feature and it allows the Show 8 to be used as a security camera.You can remotely view the camera when you’re not at home so you can verify an alarm, check up on the kids or keep an eye on the baby-Privacy …a warning displays on the Echo show when someone is viewing the camera- The new camera has a much wider angle lens for wider field of view- New color controls and adaptive color correction- Motion Sensor …the camera detect motion and can now trigger rules and scenes, like turning on a light when you walk into the room.- The processor on the Gen 2 Show 8 is more powerful and noticeably faster.- Energy Saving … the new Gen 2 Echo Show will power down to save energy when not in use- You can watch Amazon Prime, Hulu, Netflix and Youtube (via Silk browser)- Environmentally Friendly … the new echo show 8 is made from recycled materials- Other new features include the ability to upload photos and backgrounds*** Gen 2 Disappointments … ***- White Cord ?  Since 2020 Amazon switched to all white power supplies and cords in all Echo devices regardless of their color.  I ordered the Charcoal Black Echo speaker and got a white cord and power supply.I can’t believe for $170 Amazon can’t provide a matching black power supply.  If you want a matching color power supply you’ll have to fork out another $25 and buy a third party Black power supply … also sold on Amazon … that’s ridiculous!- Bluetooth Only.  Amazon removed the 3.5mm audio jack from the back of the echo show- No support for Disney+ and awkward YouTube integration- No Full Screen Clock Display like the Echo Show 5- Seems to be More Ads than previous Echo Shows ... I don't know why?*** Recommendations: ***If you’ve never owned an Echo Show speaker before the New Echo Show 8 Gen 2 is the Best Echo Video Smart Speaker for the money and the one I’d recommend.If you already own an Echo Show 8 Gen 1 and are wondering if you should upgrade, the improvements to the camera alone are the biggest reason to consider upgrading.  The 13MP camera will provide a HUGE difference in video quality plus you get auto framing, remote viewing and motion trigger capability.  The faster processor, adaptive color correction and energy saving mode are also worthy reasons to upgrade.
Read more

Katrina 5.0 out of 5 stars
Dealt with my creepy crawling buddies
Reviewed in Canada on August 17, 2020Verified Purchase
We recently moved from the city to the country, to a home that had undergone renovations. I hadn't anticipated the amount of insects that had moved into the house along with us. I was looking for a natural solution to help mitigate all of the Asian lady beetles, ants, ear wigs, ticks and spiders, etc. inside the house. My dear mother suggested trying diatomaceous earth, so I purchased this bag (best value for the quantity - skip big box retailers all together because their prices just do not compare).I am so very happy with this product. I put it in a squeeze bottle with a narrow tip and squeezed sparingly wherever I saw bugs (corners of rooms, along windowsills, on the deck, at the thresholds of doors). After a few days, any insects I saw near the area I applied were gone. Worked especially well with earwigs and silverfish. I simply reapply as needed. Others mentioned to be careful with the use of diatomaceous earth and vacuum cleaners. I have a bagless vacuum cleaner (Dyson) and it seems to do okay with picking up any residual diatomaceous earth dust on the floors, which is handy.I have yet to try this product internally but since it is a ten pound bag, that will likely last me years and years, I imagine that I will eventually!

Les Nessman5.0 out of 5 stars
I love it
Reviewed in Canada on September 9, 2020Verified Purchase
I wanted an assassins creed set in Japan, but this game delivered that for me. First of all, what a gorgeous game and what a beautiful world. I was distracted by my surroundings most of the time. I usually skip some cinematics, but this game makes you watch them - I got used to this and it immersed me more in the story, and I got very attached to my character and my horse. This game made me feel real feelings much like Red Dead Redemption 2. I didn’t know I could write such a beautiful haiku. The set up of the world borrows much from the Assassins’ Creed franchise - an open world full of markers for you to explore. Some of the side things you have to do feel repetitive. Some of the houses I wandered through were too similar. They should have made unique items like Skyrim, instead of terming everything as just “supplies”. More random events would have been nice. Regardless, the quests are rich and rewarding and the fights are very fun. I very much enjoyed this beautiful game and i highly recommend it.

Michael5.0 out of 5 stars
Blown Away by Sony VR2 with Gran Turismo. Insane.
Reviewed in Canada on December 31, 2023Edition: PS VR2 HeadsetVerified Purchase
I am not your normal reviewer of video games - as I am not young. I have friends who enjoy sims and have dabbled with the idea, but after watching Ford VS Ferrari .. others ... then Gran Turismo I was intrigued by the PS5, and researched VR. After reading the Car and Driver article "We Review Sony's PS VR2 Headset That Turns the Couch into a Race Cockpit" I decided to jump in.The whole VR landscape is rather "muted" as the games are not that great. But Gran Turismo with VR is mind boggling. It is the perfect game.You feel like you are in the car - hence those who get motion sickness should not buy it. It is 1) simple to use 2) insanely effective versus going "hardcore" with a PC. It gets set up in moments and just works (I do not want to be tweaking). 3) Multiplayer is incredibleBlown. Away. Add a force feedback wheel and pedals and it is the perfect gaming scenario.The perfect application of VR - in a simple to use package.

Report
wjanthony4.0 out of 5 stars
Mind blowing gaming experience with Gran Turismo 7
Reviewed in Canada on November 6, 2023Edition: PS VR2 HeadsetVerified Purchase
This piece of kit elevate a great racing game into a memorable racing experience where you can see and drive the meticulously detailed cars in this game.(I cannot separate PSVR2 from Gran Turismo 7 as this is the only thing I use it for, but for that alone it is 100% worth it.)It was very easy to setup, works as expected and is comfortable with glasses, and the resolution and frame rate is crisp and smooth enough to make it feel very convincing. I did get some VR inserts to avoid scratching my lenses or the VR ones, but it's not essential at all. The headphones it comes with are also decent enough, and being in a sonic space adds so much to the experience too - so if you can add some of your own with noise cancelling, it adds even more to the immersion.I did find some nausea when jumping into the first couple of drives, and had to take it slowly to get used to it and within a day or two I was racing full races with no issue. Your mileage may vary obviously, so I recommend trying one first, in an environment where you can relax and take it slowly, to see if it's for you.

Hopefully it gets better.

I was a big fan of the first PSVR. There were a lot of awesome VR experiences that I enjoyed. However with the PSVR2, I don't see any new VR experiences for it. There are a few games, which I guess is the main purpose of this. I was kinda hoping for more. As far as the unit itself, it's good, Light does not get into where your eyes are, the lens for me does not seem to fog. I'm a little disappointed that I can't use the playstation headset with the PSVR2. You will have to use wired ear buds. It comes with one, so that is good. The image is really bright and sharp when watching a 4k youtube video. I played a PS5 game on it, it looked.. ok. It does not nearly look as good if I was just playing it normal on my 4K TV. If I don't plug a headset/earbuds to the PSVR2, you get no sound. While the original will then default to your normal sound setup, aka your TV, or a sound system. The follow up is suppose to build upon and improve from the original. It does in some ways, which I mentioned above, but fails in others. I really wanted to like it.. but I can't help but feel the original was a better experience. It's so expensive, I should return it, but I'm hoping it gets better..

Libra4.0 out of 5 stars
Hours of fun
Reviewed in Canada on May 6, 2022Verified Purchase
This is my first color Tamagotchi so I can’t compare it to the others (i.e., On/Meets, Smart, etc.). Unlike many other reviewers here, I personally like the touch buttons. There are a lot more things you can do on this device compared to the old Tmgc from the 90’s. I find that my character isn’t very needy which is great because I can leave it alone for hours while I’m working and not worry about it dying. I bought this when the price dropped to $66 (CAD), but have seen it at stores for $90. Pretty surprised by the price tag considering this is supposed to be a kid’s toy. For this price, they could at least give you a pair of batteries.

title: Nintendo Switch Pro Controller
description: Alternative way to play Nintendo Switch!    The Pro Controller can be used when the Nintendo Switch is either docked or undocked.    The Pro Controller can also be used in Tabletop Mode, allowing the Nintendo Switch to become the TV screen.
nav: Video Games › Nintendo Switch › Accessories › Controllers
user_reviews:
Jason5.0 out of 5 stars
The Pro-Controller is one thing and one thing only, a great controller
Reviewed in Canada on May 9, 2019Verified Purchase
I needed another set of controllers for the Nintendo switch and I was back and forth on which ones to choose. Should I get another set of Joy-Cons or the Pro Controller? The Joy-Con controllers are pretty amazing, use them as 1 unit, or separate them out. Track motion with them or connect them directly to the switch. What the Joy-Con controllers are capable of is impressive, but this multi-functionality comes at a cost. They aren't the most precise controllers nor the most comfortable, and once I used the Pro-Controller this became even more obvious.  The Pro-Controller is one thing and one thing only, a great controller. The buttons and sticks are more precise and give you much more control over the game. The grip is better and more comfortable and the layout is simply more intuitive. Playing some games almost felt like an entirely new experience as the added precision from the Pro-Controller made accomplishing some feats much easier than they ever were with the Joy-Con's. If you plan on any serious gaming I feel the Pro Controllers are a must. The Joy-Cons are serviceable and fine for some games, but the added control from the Pro Controller is worth it.Pro's:• Much more precision and control with the Pro Controller over the Joy-Cons• 40 hour battery life vs the joy cons 6• Much more comfortable in the hand than the Joy-Cons• Can be played while wired to the Switch Consol• Slightly cheaper than the Joy-ConsCon's:• The Joy cons are essentially two controllers, where the Pro Controller is only one• Heavier than the Joy-Cons. However, I felt this added weight actually helped with the comfort• No motion tracking or other functionality that the Joy-Cons haveThoughts:I would say unless you need 2 more controllers, or are replacing the Joy-Cons, go with the Pro Controller. Head to head in some games like Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, the player using the Pro Controller would have an advantage over the one using the Joy-Cons. The Pro is much more precise, comfortable and easier to use.

A5.0 out of 5 stars
This is An Absolute Must for your Gaming Experience......
Reviewed in Canada on December 3, 2018Verified Purchase
This is a great addition to include with your Nintendo Switch Console.  The Joy Cons and the Grip that is included with the Switch Console provide a suitable alternate to merge both Controllers together. However for any Gamer, especially an entry level or Hard Core Gamer, this is the Controller you need.  It is slightly bigger than the Controllers for other Game Brands but the feel, look and comfort is next to none.  I found it easier when playing either Mario Kart Deluxe and Lego Marvel Superheroes. This is not to imply the Joy Cons are not suitable for the Switch, they are great because there are Games that are designed specifically to use the Joy Cons either individually or collectively.  Again, the positives about this Controllers, and with the Joy Cons, it's quite versatile and anyone can use them.This Pro Controller is Wireless and includes a USB Cable to allow you to charge the device when required.  You can definitely play and charge the Controller at the same time however the cord is not significantly long enough; which would require you to sit closer to the Dock and TV screen.  Pairing the Controller is automatic and you choose directly from the On Screen Menu which Controller you wish to use.  The amazing part, you can swap between Controller and Joy Cons at any point during your Game.  This is a fantastic feature with the Nintendo Switch Console as well as the simplicity to toggle between Controllers.As described, the battery life is for approximately 40 hours and it is recommended to charge this Controller prior to using it for the first time. I'm in the habit of always charging my Controller as soon as I shut down my Switch.  This is no different when charging a Tablet or Smartphone; to keep is charged at all times.There was no lapse or delay when using this Controller in full game action.  The buttons and layout is beautifully arranged for the Player; I really applaud Nintendo because the buttons are raised and easy to press and maneuver.  Once I took it out from the box and held it; I automatically became accustomed to the feel and look of the Controller.  In addition, I was able to fully recognize the button configuration without having to look down after a very short period of time.Again, for any entry level or Hard Core Gamer; this is a definite must, you need for your Nintendo Switch. It will solidify your Gaming experience and make it more enjoyable.

I use it with baking soda to remove greasy or oily stains on clothes, it is quite effective!  I use first the sunlight soap on the stain  massaging it in, not rubbing  and then add the baking soda using  a soft small brush and working it in small circular motions on the stain. I do both sides of the garment, the top part and inside. Then wash it in lukewarm water and rinse in cold. If it is a stubbing stain, I let it dry (air dry) no dryer, the heat will set the stain. Usually the stain comes out on the first try. Sunlight soap is a good product, it has been around a long time. It has a nice lemon sent and the value for money is good. user_reviews:
Ginny5.0 out of 5 stars
Love the system
Reviewed in Canada on May 14, 2018Verified Purchase
Love the system. It’s too bad that most people don’t know about it and it hasn’t sold well. The Switch is still superior but for a 4-year-old device, it’s up there. If they ever make a Switch Mini, this is the perfect size. It’s got a library of great PSP games for sale on the store, plus all the good Vita games. Quite a few good PS4 games started their lives on the Vita, like Gravity Rush, Persona 4 Dancing All Night, Severed, Toukiden, etc.If you like games from Japan, you’ll have a blast here. It’s comfortable to hold and play with on long hours. Great battery life, in the range of 5-10 hours instead of 2-5 for Switch. I have both and I would say that the Switch is the hybrid console and the Vita a true portable console, in line with the 3DS but just way better graphics and resolution.

description: CLINICALLY PROVEN: Dandruff stays off your head & shoulders with this dandruff treatment shampoo that helps relieve itchy & flaky scalps. When using your regular shampoo and conditioner use twice a week between washes. Works on all hair types & gray hair.    KETOCONAZOLE: This dandruff relief shampoo is made with ketoconazole 2%, an effective ingredient that binds to your hair's natural protein to kill dandruff. Your scalp remains flake-free with the shampoo's thick lather & leaves hair manageable & shiny.    ITCHY SCALP: Dandruff is caused when scalp-cells regenerate at an accelerated rate faster than scalps can handle. With hormones, diet, stress & genes, dandruff can be fought with the clinically proven anti-dandruff shampoo Nizoral, with ketoconazole 2%.    DANDRUFF TREATMENT: Clinically proven Nizoral helps maintain a healthy scalp with the anti-dandruff shampoo that kills dandruff & controls itchiness & flaking. SELF-CARE SOLUTIONS: At Kramer Laboratories we focus on consumer needs to help provide innovative solutions to everyday healthcare problems. user_reviews:
Waleed Ansari5.0 out of 5 stars
WORKS LIKE MAGIC
Reviewed in Canada on March 28, 2023Style: ShampooSize: 120 ml (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
I have only used this product about 4 times since I received it on March 11th, 2023. I am a man, 24, and have also struggled with dandruff and dry scalp for over 10 years now.Day 1 (March 13) - Used the product for the first time, only a teaspoon and lathered it in, left it for about 5 minutes and then washed it out. After an hour, when my hair started drying, there was some dandruff in the middle of the scalp. But, there was a HUGE noticeable difference on the sides, and the flaking had reduced quite a lot!Day 2 (March 16) - Was advised to only use it twice a week, so I waited a couple days and in these days, the flaking started to come back because it's been a few days since I had used this shampoo again. After using the same process as Day 1, the flaking had been reduced once again, and my head was not getting itchy after a day or two either, and it didn't leave me head dry right after the shower either!March 19 - Used my other shampoo, instead of this one. Added conditioner after, and the flaking was still quite low, I thought it would resurface when I switched back, glad it didn't!Day 3 (March 21) - Started to use less of the shampoo at this time and was making a huge difference, as my scalp was clearing up and there was no sign of flaking or dandruff, which was already a miracle.Day 4 (March 25) - After this use is when I did not see a single spec of dandruff on my head and even after a couple days, my head is still clear. There is no itching or dryness of the scalp, which I am so thankful for.I would highly recommend this shampoo for people looking to combat their dry scalp, flaking, and dandruff. Like I said previously, I have been struggling with dandruff for over 10 years and have tried quite a few shampoos (natural or company-owned ones) and nothing has worked as remarkably as this one. Whoever came up with the formula for this, I would like to give you a hug because you have eased one of my major insecurities.EDIT (May 16th, 2023): Still going strong using the same bottle I purchased in March (sometimes once a week, sometimes twice a week) and haven't seen a spec of dandruff since. My head used to get itchy on the second day before I started using this shampoo and haven't had to scratch my head vigorously for a few months now. Will definitely be buying again when it runs out!!

I went with 4 weeks at 2 x per week. Here’s what each of those weeks were like for me. I massage it in with a silicone scalp massager and let it sit for about 4 minutes before rinsing if that matters.Week 1: unlike coal tar which I find softens the scale, this hardens it. My scalp felt tight and dry which was okay for the first wash but the second one was less pleasant. All the hardened scale started to flake off so I actually worked to brush my scalp and remove it but that was just making it raw and sore so I stopped and left it alone. I just had to shake out all the flakes often. My scalp felt very sore.Week 2: this was the worst week. I lost a bunch more hair than usual and the flaking was really bad. I started using my hairline on my forehead as my way of monitoring progress. After all the flaking at my temple in week 1, I figured it would start to slow down but it did not. I still had a lot of build up almost like it was coming back faster between each wash. At one point at work I brushed my hair between meetings and realized my scalp was bleeding.Week 3: better. I felt like most of the worst parts of my scalp had healed and the hairfall seemed done with. However I still had build up on my scalp and a kind of constant soreness. And a lot of flakes. My temple, which again, I felt should have been done flaking, was still going strong. Mind you, my scalp never flakes. I have a lot of build up / scale but it tends to be oily not flaky. Not so now.Week 4; that’s this week and honestly, I just have a really dry and sore scalp with lots of flaking after each wash. I don’t see it getting better. The same spot on my temple is STILL flaking. So is the rest of my head, but that’s my test case and it was far from the “worst” spot on my scalp prior to treatment. I’m just really surprised that every single day the same spot continues to have new flakes.Verdict: it’s not for me. I really gave this a proper go because I wanted a more permanent solution to my scalp issues. I don’t think this is doing what I need it to do. I have way more dandruff while using it than I ever did without it. Coal tar fully clears it up for me for three weeks with a single use so I’ll go back to that. It’s possible that I don’t have the same issue as others (I was only diagnosed with “scalp dermatitis” which they told me means they don’t know what’s up). So maybe this fungus approach just wasn’t the right one for me.

Report
K.A.5.0 out of 5 stars
It's a point and shoot with some SLR features.
Reviewed in Canada on July 16, 2019Colour Name: BlackStyle: BasePattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase
This is my first TG-series camera. I am coming from a DSLR, which doesn't play nice with my kayak on a number of levels. I bought this camera as a go-anywhere-do-anything camera, and to my surprise this is exactly what it is. It gives me some of the features of my DSLR, which is nice, but I kept running into the limits of the hardware. Still, most of the time I was able to get what I want.I was able to get some nice bokeh, though I wouldn't want to use this for portraits. Maybe with the teleconverter it would become a passable portrait camera, I don't know. I used it for landscapes, lots of landscapes, and it worked pretty well for that. I see some color bleeding and some vignette, but I wouldn't call those problematic. The lens is the equivalent of a standard zoom, so no bird-watching with this thing, and I doubt the teleconverter can do a whole lot to change that. I had a chance to play with the fisheye adapter for about an hour and it gave me just a slightly wider angle overall, but nothing I would call a must-have. This camera is amazing for macro photography, though: my few attempts at it all turned out stunning.Hardware is pretty sturdy, though the screen at the back scratches easily. GET A PROTECTOR! I am not particularly worried about the lack of an EVF as I wear glasses, though I seem to be alone to not consider this a problem. The screen is somewhat hard to see in bright sunlight, but I am able to manage. The camera survived salt water, sand, being tossed unprotected in my luggage, even being in my PFD while I kayak and perform stunts. I am quite pleased! It's the right tool for the job and it worked pretty well! The camera is small, the controls are sometimes hard to operate with gloves, but I don't see how a compact camera can possibly solve that issue: I guess Olympus can add a touchscreen, but touchscreens don't work well when water is involved.Now for the software. Argh the software!The Olympus RAW format is ORF and is mostly unsupported by anything. There is a plugin for Photoshop (not sure if Lightroom supports it, but I hear no), and that's about it. I got a once-in-a-lifetime offer to get the Adobe software for regular price, and that's the extent of the support I got from Olympus. What if I don't want to use Adobe stuff? There is no indication anywhere in the documentation how exactly I am supposed to integrate Olympus RAW with any photo processing workflow, including Adobe's which they promote so aggressively. Eventually I stumbled upon something called Olympus Workspace, which appears to do something close to what Lightroom does, but I ultimately settled on a third-party tool called Luminar. Luminar worked pretty well.I wish I had more choices! It's a shame a camera so well regarded and so respected (the TG-5 is practically the gold standard for camera for water sports) doesn't do more to be supported by photo-processing software out there.The battery life is on par with my DSLR! I can get several hundred pictures on a single battery charge! I also love the in-camera modes for panorama, HDR and focus-stacking. Neither of them are perfect, of course: the panorama mode is trying to stitch shots by tracking landmarks in your frame, but when it cannot find one right at the edge of the frame (e.g. it encounters the empty horizon), it gets hopelessly lost. Similarly, focus-stacking would sometimes fail for reasons I have not investigated yet.I hope this is helping someone.

Dell companion Thunderbolt 3 to DisplayPort cable supports the newest Dell computers with Thunderbolt 3; Display Port to USB C cable connects to monitors in the conference room or classroom; USB C to DisplayPort adapter cable is compatible with popular Dell models with Thunderbolt 3 portsincluding the Dell XPS 12 9250, 13 9350/9360/9365, 15 9550/9560, Latitude 5480/5580/7275/7280/7370/7480/7520/7720/E5570, Precision 3520/15 3510/5510/M7510, 17 M7710, Alienware 13/15/17    USB-C & Thunderbolt 3 port compatible with the MacBook, Macbook Air, MacBook Pro, iMac, iMac Pro, iPad Pro, Aspire Switch, Predator 15/17/17X, Chromebook Flip C302, Chromebook R13, Pixelbook 2, Pixel Slate Tablet, ROG GL/G5/G7/GX/Strix, ZenBook Pro UX501VW, Transformer 3 Pro, Surface Book 2, Gigabyte Aorus X5 15, X7 DT 17, BRIX/BRIX S, Razer Blade/Stealth/Pro, Samsung Notebook Odyssey, Notebook 9 15 Inch    DisplayPort to Thunderbolt 3 cable is also compatible with HP Elite X2 1012 G1/G2, Z1 Workstation G3, Spectre 13.3/x360, EliteBook 1040 G4/X360 G2/X 360 1020 G2/Folio G1, ZBook 17 /15 /Studio, Envy 27 All-in-One, Microsoft Surface Book 2, Legion Y720, IdeaPad Y900, Miix 720, ThinkPad P 50/70, T 470/470S/570, X270, X1 Carbon, X1 Yoga, Yoga 370/900/910, MSI Phantom Pro, Vortex G65, LG Gram 15Z970, Intel NUC6i7KYK, Toshiba Protege X20W, Sony VAIO S11, Samsung Galaxy S9/S9+/S8/S8+/Note 8

Soothing Toy or Entertaining Cuddle Friend
Reviewed in Canada on March 19, 2024Style: Otter - StandardVerified Purchase
At first, my child wasn’t interested in this toy. I tried using it from her being a fee weeks old, and at random throughout the first year. She finally started to enjoy this toy at around 16 months old, and it has become one of her favourite toys. She loves sotting and watching the little belly go up and down, with the sounds of breathing. She is entertained for quite a bit of time every time she plays with it. I would recommend this for parents, and suggest that if you aren’t seeing it helping calm or sooth your baby to sleep, or even as they grow still no interest, it may take time, and they may eventually love it as one of their favourites. Every baby is different, so it’s worth trying!

Translate review to EnglishMayonegg4.0 out of 5 stars
Better suited for older babies or toddlers
Reviewed in Canada on May 28, 2020Style: Otter - StandardVerified Purchase
I initially bought this for my 4month old son. I found it to be too big and heavy for him. I didn't' find the breathing mechanism helped at all for sleep. I ended up giving it to my 2.5-year-old who LOVED it.What I like about it:-Lighting - the otter emits a very soft, non-blue-light glow which I think is great and does not disrupt sleep.-Battery life - I purchased this 3 months ago and I've had to replace the batteries once, and it is used nightly.-very soft and cute washes well and still looks new.-The older child loves it.Drawbacks:-I agree with previous reviewers that the breathing mechanism is quite loud. I can hear it from across the hallway when my daughter engages the button in the night. She doesn't seem to mind.-While it's cute, I find it too large for younger babies, and even potentially dangerous for them in a crib. It's about the size of a cabbage patch doll.-The settings are on the inside of the otter - so if you need to or want to change volume settings, you have to do so before the baby is in bed, or you might wake up the baby with the strong velcro closure.- I also had a hard time getting the right settings working - it seems to be in demo mode at times...-Small children can open the velcro on the back and pull out the light and breathing mechanism box. My daughter does this in the night sometimes and uses the inside mechanism as a flashlight. It's safe, but still annoying to have her remove it constantly, then ask me to put it back inside.Overall, I think this is better suited to older babies or toddlers. My toddler's sleep has improved generally since this otter was introduced - she likes to take care of the otter and is comforted by the gentle glow and sweet songs.

title: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds
description: MPN: CTRPBZLE
nav: Video Games › Legacy Systems › Nintendo Systems › Nintendo 3DS & 2DS › Games
user_reviews:
Jason R.5.0 out of 5 stars
One of the best games for the 3DS.
Reviewed in Canada on November 14, 2016Verified Purchase
Along with Super Mario 3D Land, this is probably one of the best titles for the 3DS.  My son got a New 3DS and being someone that spent a fair amount of time gaming when I was younger and had all sorts of time on my hands I still try to find time to play games now and then but find it difficult to get into larger scale games but this one has been perfect for me.  The fact that I can just pick up the 3DS during the evenings and get through a "chunk" of A Link Between Worlds in a short period and reach a save point and put it down has meant that I've actually been able to enjoy it and keep coming back to it to make progress.I'm probably about half way through the game now and feel like the amount of content in the game, not even counting the optional grinds (finding the Maimai babies?).  It's very much a classic and approachable Zelda title and one that I felt instantly "at home" in regardless of the fact that a good portion of the game requires use of the "becoming two dimensional" mechanic - which I thought was going to be silly but really adds a thoughtful layer to the exploration and puzzle solving to this game.  Many of the three dimensional Zelda titles, I just couldn't stick with for whatever reason - and while I know titles like Ocarina of Time are highly regarded, for me, A Link Between Worlds is the perfect Zelda and I personally hope that they make more just like it.While save points are relatively plentiful and you do come across them often enough to avoid becoming too annoyed, I still would have preferred a quick save option so I could literally drop it on a whim, sometimes when you're in the middle of a dungeon you just have to trudge through it to avoid losing your progress (unless you are willing to just suspend the game until next time, not something that works well when you know your kid is going to want to pick it up and play something else).The game is also, arguably, too easy.  I have never actually died yet, and very infrequently had to rely on health restoring items.  In a sense the forgiving nature of making mistakes does help you just enjoy the other non combat options of the game without getting worked up about re-doing anything over and over (oh long gone are the days when I would be willing to play a game on maximum difficulty and re-do each section two dozen times).  Fall off a cliff?  You lose a measly half a heart for that mistake.  While there are some enemies that will take a sizable chunk out of your life if you run afoul of them, they are few and far between so far and in general very easy to avoid and none of the enemies do anything particularly intelligent.All in all, it is games like this that validate the continued existence of the 3DS and I would buy it again and would have still been happy if I had paid the full original MSRP for it.

Report
Jeffrey Valerio5.0 out of 5 stars
my friend pitched this mouse to me as we work on our computers 8+ hours a day
Reviewed in Canada on October 16, 2023Colour Name: GraphiteStyle: MX Master 3SVerified Purchase
....sad that i didn't know about this mouse earlier in life.I'm 6'3'' and have  a bigger than average hand. my main priority was searching for a mouse that was wide and comfortable enough. If a mouse is ever too small for me, my ring finger and pinky will feel quite uncomfortable by days end. The logitech M3S mouse did the trick. even though my pinky finger is 'floating' when using the mouse, the grip from the ring finger = no tried fingersThe customizability and re-mapping of buttons through the app is AMAZING. I feel like I'm taking advantage of my computer more with all the customizability. I feel like they could have added one or two more customizable buttons on the side. I'm always grimacing about which shortcut i should use for each dedicated button. but this is NOT A DEAL BREAKER.the matte feel of the mouse feels great in the handthe main magnet scroll wheel feels otherworldly and amazing, imo. strange sensation when you scroll and realize that it's only a magnet. if you're a fidget toy type of person, this wheel is the best thing in the world. you'll only only known when  you scroll on it.*** this is probably poor wording --- note that i left the setting to 'click' (like a traditional mouse scroll wheel) and then tried remapping this button to lets say, 'next music track'. Overtime and constantly clicking the button changed the scroll sensitivity from 'click' to 'smooth'. i haven't found a workaround to this issues. I just can't remap this button is all, but NOT A DEAL BREAKER.the side scroll wheel is welcomed. never had a mouse that has a second wheel, and i use it as master to control volume.i really thought of getting the logitech M2S cause it was half off at the time , but these following features made my decision to get the M3S:-USB-C - makes charging a breeze with one less cable type. though you wont be charging much with how long the battery lasts-the clicking is much much more quieter than the 2S. hearing keys typing all day on a keyboard is a lot over time. lessening the noise of the mouse was a welcomed feature to my home office-3S just looked much cleaner aesthetically compared to 2S. just a guess, but the 2S design choice made me think like it was going to get dirtier more faster over timeonly Con:-bluetooth connectivity can be an issue-M3S mouse lag is a real thing-Out of the box, I had to fiddle with all my 2.0 and 3.0 USB ports-Needed to check out online forums for a solution-realized that i had to use 2.0 USB port. 3.0 was making the mouse very laggy / stuttering on screen-i imagine all my other devices signals' are also interfering with this mouse-eventually got it to work though after trying every port. luckily i have several-if these connectivity problems persisted, i would have probably returned this mouse. but the mouse and features are also so good that i was also considering dealing with a lifetime headache just for the features. just saying9.5/10

user_reviews:
Mischa_C5.0 out of 5 stars
Powerful Vlogging Camera!
Reviewed in Canada on November 12, 2016Style: CameraVerified Purchase
This is my purchase of the year! It is a perfect camera for vlogging, very practical to bring everywhere with you, easy to operate, and lots of setting options. I film 95% of my vlogs indoors and it performs very well in low-light conditions and you can adjust the aperture setting to the point where a pitch black room can look like you are in a room with lots of natural light - it is insane! Auto-focus is quite fast and I love that you can adjust the background to get the blurry effect so it looks cinematic. I heard 50/50 reviews about sound quality and honestly...I think this camera has great quality. I tested it in a room where there is a lot of echoing while I was talking filming a segment and had my iPhone 6s and a voice recorder operating all at the same time. When I got home to compare the audio from all the devices, this camera picked up my voice the best. If you are that precise with your sound quality though, I would suggest you buying a separate cardioid microphone and just syncing your audio and video when editing. I have not had to do this yet as I really have not encountered audio issues. Please note that there is no external microphone jack - I know a lot of people ask about this. :-)I purchased this product in October - it arrived a week and a half earlier than the expected delivery date which was a huge bonus, however when I received the package there was a minor issue that I contacted the seller. They gave me some options on what I would like to do, which was quite accommodating. Customer service was great.I have not used the camera to its full potential yet, but I am excited to test it out more since I really only got to play with it for about a week.I hope you will find this review helpful!

Megz4.0 out of 5 stars
Works great! Have to get used to wearing it
Reviewed in Canada on June 28, 2022Verified Purchase
Overall I am very happy with the loop earplugs. It helps with my ADHD/Anxiety for the most part.Positives: It definitely helps reduce background noise. I'm still able to hear the very talkative dog down the street but it's quieter and I'm able to focus on what I'm doing. I went grocery shopping with my brother and it was really awesome in the sense that I didn't feel like there was so much going on around me. I have ADHD and when I walk into a grocery store I see everything, I think about each product and if I need it, I'm hearing people talking, etc. It's annoying and overwhelming but with the earplugs in it did reduce that a LOT. Not completely, but I felt less overwhelmed.I wear them when I'm sleeping, if I'm trying to focus on something during the day (mowing the lawn, working on comp, cleaning), passenger in the car.. it's helped my brain a lot.Negatives: As much noise it does reduce, it also makes it a bit harder to hear people close to me if there are other noises going on. You can still hear the noises you would normally hear just at lower levels. It's similar to when someone is talking to you. If it's in a quiet environment like home and I'm talking to my brother then that's fine, but when we went shopping and he was RIGHT beside me, it made it very frustrating that I had to ask him to repeat himself. That's only because of the other noises going on: music, people chatting, workers, etc. I did sometimes have to remove the earplug which wasn't a big deal but it did make me feel more anxious in the moment.Another negative is the loop earplug case. I have dropped it twice and both times it opens and the earplugs come out.I don't like that at all because I almost lost one (took a while to find it, I honestly didn't even realize the case fell until I was going to bed). Then they get dirty and I have to clean them. The case itself is very sturdy, it survived both falls but I don't like that it popped open so easily and my earplugs came out.

Report
Lauren5.0 out of 5 stars
Totally recommend - from a neurodivergent with noise sensitivity
Reviewed in Canada on April 6, 2024Colour Name: Experience FluxVerified Purchase
I've been seeing Loops on my social media feeds for months and in preparation for my trip to Nashville I finally bit the bullet and bought a pair. I was a little nervous reading reviews that they might fall out and I'd lose them, but I was delighted when I found that I didn't have that issue. I used my Loops while walking down busy streets with music playing in every bar; in bars at night; and at multiple concert venues. I found I could still hear everything really well, but the intensity of the noise was dampened. I was able to enjoy multiple nights out with loud music and people, which would normally be very difficulty for me, without getting overstimulated and needing to leave. For anyone who has noise sensitivity or wants to protect their ears at concerts/loud events, I would totally recommend the Loops.My one note is that when it isn't super loud, it can be hard to hear the people beside you when they're speaking to you. My Loops can't really filter the sound I want dampened vs the sound I don't, but it's easy enough to remove one if needed or to have the person speak up a bit. In very loud settings like crowded bars or music venues I didn't notice that problem.

title: Mattel Games UNO
description: The classic card game of matching colors and numbers.    Special Action Cards and Wild Cards for unexpected excitement and game-changing fun.    Use the Swap Hands cards to change hands with any other opponent.    Write your own rules for game play with the Customizable Wild cards.    Players take turns matching a card in their hand with the color or number of the card shown on the top of the deck.    Don’t forget to shout “UNO” when you only have one card remaining!
nav: Toys & Games › Games & Accessories › Card Games › Dedicated Deck Card Games
user_reviews:
Maanas Shah5.0 out of 5 stars
UNO - The Ultimate Family Card Game!
Reviewed in Canada on July 26, 2023Style: UNOVerified Purchase
As a long-time fan of card games, I recently had the pleasure of trying out the classic UNO card game, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations! UNO has been a staple in family game nights for decades, and I can see why it continues to stand the test of time.First and foremost, UNO is incredibly easy to learn, making it suitable for players of all ages. The simple rules allow young children to join in the fun, while the strategic elements keep adults engaged and entertained. It's the perfect game to bring together family and friends, fostering a sense of camaraderie and laughter.The game comes neatly packaged in a sturdy box, and the cards are of excellent quality, ensuring they withstand countless rounds of gameplay. The vibrant colors and iconic UNO logo on the cards add a touch of excitement to every hand.UNO's gameplay is fast-paced and thrilling. The objective is to be the first player to empty your hand, and along the way, you'll encounter various action cards like Skip, Reverse, and Draw Two, which can turn the tables in an instant! The wildly unpredictable Wild and Wild Draw Four cards add an extra layer of excitement, keeping everyone on their toes.One of the aspects I appreciate most about UNO is its versatility. The game can be adapted to suit different play styles and preferences. Whether you prefer a more relaxed match or an intense, competitive showdown, UNO can accommodate it all. Additionally, it's an excellent icebreaker for parties or a quick game during breaks.The UNO card game is an excellent tool for building essential life skills like critical thinking, decision-making, and planning. While it may seem like a simple game on the surface, it challenges players to strategize and anticipate their opponents' moves, all while managing their own hand.My only minor suggestion would be to include a scoring pad or a small notepad in the box to keep track of points during lengthier sessions, especially if you're playing with more than four players.In conclusion, UNO has truly earned its reputation as a classic card game. Its blend of accessibility, fun, and strategic depth make it a must-have addition to any game collection. Whether you're looking for a game to enjoy with family, friends, or even as an icebreaker in social gatherings, UNO is the perfect choice. I wholeheartedly recommend UNO to everyone, and I guarantee it will provide endless hours of laughter and enjoyment!
Read more

Liz5.0 out of 5 stars
Nails are doing great, hair is looking promising
Reviewed in Canada on December 6, 2020Verified Purchase
I’ve just about finished my first bottle of these, and I’m pretty satisfied with them so far.First and foremost, nails. I’ve always been a nail biter, but once I started taking these I set my mind to stopping and my nails have grown beautifully. They’re much stronger than they used to be, I remember at least one occasion where I knocked my nail and was shocked to find it hadn’t broken — before these vitamins, it definitely would not survived that impact.Because I’ve always been a nail biter, it’s hard for me to comment on growth speed (mine never had a chance to get very long. However, I’ve had friends remark that they’ve grown very quickly, so I guess that means they’re doing pretty good.As for hair, I think growth has sped up slightly in some places other than my head. Personally I don’t really care, especially since it’s winter I hardly notice. I would say, don’t worry about that too much — it’s not noticeable. I think my head hair growth has accelerated slightly, and I’m only one bottle in. It’s too early to comment on health: it takes months for a noticeable difference in hair health to develop, with vitamins that’s just how it is. I’m hopeful though.Importantly, I want to comment on acne. Picking these up, I was extremely concerned about whether or not they’d make me breakout. One of my friends eventually dropped these because she couldn’t deal with the acne anymore. For me, in the first week, I did break out for a few days, but it was over within a week. It’s also possible that my breakout was due to other things. Since then, I’ve noticed no real increase in my acne. I’m very happy about this. If acne is a concern for you, just remember that it’s not unusual for your body to take upwards of a month to adjust to these. It’s different for everyone, and I think it’s worth it for you to give them a chance.I find the flavour a bit... strange. It is extremely artificial, but very sweet. Most will like it (my boyfriend is always asking me for one whenever he catches me taking them). I honestly don’t mind it, but I certainly wouldn’t rave about it.Prices fluctuate on these a lot. Try to catch them when they’re on the low end. For me, I bought the bottle of 80 for 6.68 CAD. Pretty sure it went up around 3 bucks the day after I bought them.First time I bought them they didn’t arrive, had to wait 3 days for them to send out a new shipment of my order (free of charge). Pretty sure that’s my local carrier’s fault though, and the Amazon customer service was good as always.All in all, if you’re looking for a gummy to add to your daily routine and give your hair and nails some love, this is a very good candidate. user_reviews:
Brian Smith5.0 out of 5 stars
Best budget console on the market!
Reviewed in Canada on February 14, 2022Platform for display: Xbox Series SEdition: Console OnlyVerified Purchase
The Xbox Series S is the second Microsoft console I own since the 360. It comes with a 512-gigabyte hard drive and a wireless controller. Although there is no CD drive, the console is all-digital and allows multiple users to download and play their purchased games from the Windows Store. The only drawback is that if you want more storage space, you may have to buy an external hard drive. I recommend the Seagate brand with the Xbox logo on it.The resolution is set at 1440p and you still get decent quality. You may not notice much graphical difference on the other version, the Series X. Best of all, you can play the Xbox Series S on your computer monitor if you own the "Elgato HD60s+,"  the game capture device, if desired. From my own experience, I don't need an expensive television to get the best graphics, so I play it right from my I-Mac 2019 with the retina display monitor.If you are looking for a budget console and just want to play your games casually or with a game pass, then the Series S is right for you. With a sleek design look, the system is lightweight, small, and very easy to carry if you are going on a trip. Perfect for both new and hardcore gamers for this generation.

Report
Hi.Her5.0 out of 5 stars
Just what I was looking for!
Reviewed in Canada on July 11, 2022Platform for display: Xbox Series SEdition: Console OnlyVerified Purchase
It seemed impossible to find and buy these consoles for over a year until I got a notification that they were available for purchase on Amazon for the exact same price as the Microsoft store.I bought this before cloud gaming was good. Now that the Xbox team worked hard on perfecting cloud gaming, it's only gotten better. I am just a Gold member, but my room mate has Game Pass. I have daily played games downloaded directly to the drive, and most other games are available on cloud (though I do download them and them delete them from the drive or move them to my other drive that is not SSD).I don't have a new TV (in fact I still have a 'dumb' TV) and it's only capable of so much despite it being 4k UHD capable, games play flawlessly. One of my main games is OW and the new OW2. I have it set to have balance between performance and quality on both games and they both play without any issues and barely any latencies (thanks quality internet!).If you get the S series and have Game Pass you will not be disappointed. If you're looking for a bigger hard drive Get the Series X or buy a compatible SSD drive.This console is more than capable for playing everyday. I use it for everything, from playing games to listening to Spotify to watching my favorite series and shows on all the apps in 4k UHD. Never had any issues with the console what so ever.Also very easy to set up with any home systems you have. I use Google Home and can easily use voice commands to turn it on/off and load up any app or game.My ONLY issue are with the controllers. The new Series S/X controllers are great out of the box, but after 9-12 months of use they go bunk. If you use a wired head set expect it to stop working/start echoing/come in and out within the year. The bumpers don't last long either. I never throw it around and I keep it clean, and despite the up keep I still have issues. Good thing they go on sale often. I will never pay full price for the controllers because they just don't last in my experience.

arkay5.0 out of 5 stars
Powerful Semi-Gen Console!
Reviewed in Canada on November 16, 2020Platform for display: Xbox Series SEdition: Console OnlyVerified Purchase
I've have the Series S for a couple of days now and let me tell you, this is a perfect console for me. I've had the original Xbox and the Xbox 360 and even though I passed on the Xbox one (because of their first E3 presentation) and bought a PS4 instead I was hesitant going with Xbox again but they really improve ever since Phil Spencer took over the reigns of the Xbox division.first off, don't let the small size fool you. It's a pretty powerful and heavy/dense console.I'm still so amazed of how quiet it is compared to my ps4 (mind you it's a launch ps4 and surprised it's still alive)but as for the series S, it truly feels like a console unlike its bigger brother the series X which harkens more to a high end pc the series s fills that void left in me by the 360. it brings back so many good memories that it really is my favorite console to date.eventually I am planning on getting a PS5 for Sony games but as for Xbox games, if you don't have a 4K tv like me and you don't plan on upgrading you home system equipment then this is a perfect console for you. But be aware of the lower end GPU and the smaller hard drive space, but if you download one or two AAA games you still have enough room for a handful of smaller games.so in conclusion, I say this is a good product to buy if you can find it. if you want to wait it out and see if you want the X instead then go for it! you won't be disappointed!

description: ECHO POP – This compact smart speaker with Alexa features full sound that's great for bedrooms and small spaces. Small enough to blend in and mighty enough to stand out.    CONTROL MUSIC WITH YOUR VOICE – Ask Alexa to play music, audiobooks, and podcasts from your favorite providers like Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, Sirius XM and more. MAKE ANY SPACE A SMART SPACE – Easily control compatible smart home devices like smart plugs or smart lights with your voice or the Alexa App.    LIFE JUST GOT EASIER – Have Alexa set timers, check the weather, read the news, re-order paper towels, make calls, answer questions, and more. user_reviews:
The Tech Guy5.0 out of 5 stars
This is Amazon's Best Looking - Most Affordable Smart Speaker Yet
Reviewed in Canada on June 28, 2023Colour Name: Lavender BloomConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase




                    The media could not be loaded.
                



 The Echo Dot is the best selling and most popular Echo Speaker but if you're not a fan of the round spherical, baseball design then the Echo Pop is a much better looking more stylish smart speaker.  The Echo Pop also comes in more colors than the Echo Dot, so if color is your thing the Pop is Perfect for you.This review is broken down into two parts.  Part 1 is short and sweet, while Part 2 is more detailed.PART 1:The all new Echo Pop (2023) is a stylish looking speaker, available in several colors with similar sound to the Echo Dot, but not as loud.  Both the Echo Dot and New Echo POP are designed to be used in smaller rooms.  The Echo Pop sounds good for its size however there is minimal bass and it doesn't get very loud.  For better sound you can use 2 Echo Pops and Pair them in Stereo which greatly improves this speakers sound performance but at a twice the cost.  The Echo Dot (baseball looking speaker) sound slightly better but has other features such as tap gestures, temperature sensor and option for a built in LED clock display.The Echo Pop is perfect for someone who wants a slightly smaller speaker and wants added style, color and flair.  Both the Dot and Pop sound similar but the dot will go louder so the Pop is for small rooms and more of a convenience speaker for smart home control, timers, weather, etc ... as opposed to listening to music.Overall I like the Echo Pop a look.  I prefer the LOOK of the POP and like the color choices.  The sound is decent for it's size but a bit overpriced for a music speaker.  If you're buying a speaker for music get the larger, full sized Echo Smart Speaker.  The echo POP is perfect for kids where they can have their own colourful smart speaker that can't be turned up too loud so the music is blaring throughout the house.  Again as a small, personal speaker it's great.  Kitchens, bathrooms, bedrooms, and personal office desk speaker are the obvious choices for this stylish smart speaker.  The microphone is excellent and if you can pick it up on sale it's a great value priced Smart Speaker.  I would recommend and would purchase another one for use as a Stereo Pair when they are on sale.PART 2:I have owned all the Echo Speakers from the past decade.  In the product lineup the Echo Pop is in the middle between the Echo Flex and Echo Dot.  The Echo POP is bigger and sounds better than the Echo Flex but not quite as good as the Echo Dot.The Echo Pop looks better and is much more stylish than any of the other echo speakers.The microphones on the Echo pop are sensitive and work well even from across the room or when the music is full blast.The sound is good considering the size of the POP but it does lack bass and volume.  I was surprised that the Echo Pop did not distort too much at loud volume levels with lots of base.  That's partly because there is not a lot of bass with this speaker to begin with and it processes the sound to give you the most volume it can while cutting back the bass the louder you turn the volume up.MISSING FEATURES:The Echo Pop is $15 less than the Echo Dot, however you do give up a number of features and a bit of bass and volume for the price drop.  There is No Free Lunch here .... Yes the Echo POP is lower priced but it does not have the temperature sensor, EERO mesh Wi-Fi access point feature, tapping and touch features and the option for a clock.  The temperature sensor can be used to trigger home automation rules.  If you have an EERO Wi-Fi mesh network the Echo Dot 5th gen can be used as a wireless access point.  The tap and touch feature can be useful to tap to play or stop an alarm for example.  If you have any need or value for these features then the Echo Dot would be a better smart speaker choice.RECOMMENDATION:I think the Echo POP will become one of Amazon's Best Selling Smart Speakers, not because it sounds great, but because it looks so good and has decent sound for its size.  The vast majority of smart speaker users probably don't need the temperature sensor, EERO network integration and tap/touch capability.  Let's face it, most of us want to talk to our smart speaker and don't ever touch it.  I can't remember when I'm touched any of my smart speakers.  Voice commands are generally the way most of use will interface with our smart speakers.I would recommend the Echo Pop, especially if it goes on sale.  The sound from the Echo Pop is much better in stereo so if you can afford two, I would recommend buying two and hooking them up as a stereo pair.  While the Echo Dot is not Amazon's Best Sounding Speaker it may become the most popular ... time will tell.
Read more

The Echo POP is bigger and sounds better than the Echo Flex but not quite as good as the Echo Dot.The Echo Pop looks better and is much more stylish than any of the other echo speakers.The microphones on the Echo pop are sensitive and work well even from across the room or when the music is full blast.The sound is good considering the size of the POP but it does lack bass and volume.  I was surprised that the Echo Pop did not distort too much at loud volume levels with lots of base.  That's partly because there is not a lot of bass with this speaker to begin with and it processes the sound to give you the most volume it can while cutting back the bass the louder you turn the volume up.MISSING FEATURES:The Echo Pop is $15 less than the Echo Dot, however you do give up a number of features and a bit of bass and volume for the price drop.  There is No Free Lunch here .... Yes the Echo POP is lower priced but it does not have the temperature sensor, EERO mesh Wi-Fi access point feature, tapping and touch features and the option for a clock.  The temperature sensor can be used to trigger home automation rules.  If you have an EERO Wi-Fi mesh network the Echo Dot 5th gen can be used as a wireless access point.  The tap and touch feature can be useful to tap to play or stop an alarm for example.  If you have any need or value for these features then the Echo Dot would be a better smart speaker choice.RECOMMENDATION:I think the Echo POP will become one of Amazon's Best Selling Smart Speakers, not because it sounds great, but because it looks so good and has decent sound for its size.  The vast majority of smart speaker users probably don't need the temperature sensor, EERO network integration and tap/touch capability.  Let's face it, most of us want to talk to our smart speaker and don't ever touch it.  I can't remember when I'm touched any of my smart speakers.  Voice commands are generally the way most of use will interface with our smart speakers.I would recommend the Echo Pop, especially if it goes on sale.  The sound from the Echo Pop is much better in stereo so if you can afford two, I would recommend buying two and hooking them up as a stereo pair.  While the Echo Dot is not Amazon's Best Sounding Speaker it may become the most popular ... time will tell.
