Report
Liam T Bear5.0 out of 5 stars
Echo Pop, a good way to ease into Smart Homes.
Reviewed in Canada on July 15, 2023Colour Name: Lavender BloomConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase
Interestingly, despite being a 101 user when it comes to Smart technology and Amazon's speakers in general, I was surprised to see several huge bits of misinformation in the self-proclaimed "Tech Guy's" review -- stuff that's in the very first page of the little starter pamphlet.First, it does have touch controls. Touching the top acts as a snooze to an alarm, and the gesture is available in the Blueprints (like Extensions etc, except even easier, they let you easily chart out behaviour for your Pop using a single command or situation being met. It's a nice introduction to AI).Second, it does have EERO wifi extension built-in. Like the Dot, it still requires an Eero router to make use of this, but if you already have that set up, it's a nice way to double up both another speaker/microphone and extend your home wifi coverage.I'm new to Smart Homes and assistive devices, but not to tech or programming, so it was an easy transition for me. My place isn't very big, so a lot of Smart possibilities are nice but aren't yet things I feel I couldn't live without -- give me a few years and a handful of plugs, however, and we'll see what I can set up!What I specifically wanted the Pop for was the fact that it works seamlessly with Audible (both US and Canada), and I was tired of retrieving my phone from the tub after my single-brain-cell orange potato kept knocking it in while attempting to supervise my daily attempts at drowning myself from 3 inches away. He is an excellent lifeguard, except for when he falls in himself, and then it's everyone for themselves.I mistakenly read part of the information as "the Echo Pop is wireless" as meaning it had an internal battery that could be charged, and no, that is very much not the case. Since the brilliant electrician wired it so that the bathroom outlets are only turned on when the light is turned on, that's not so hot for the Pop as it needs to be continually plugged in. It's workable, and sounds a whole lot better than my phone's speakers, so I figure it will just have to deal with being hard restarted regularly. Since the boot-up time is fast, it's not really an issue unless you really wanted it as a portable speaker.I spent some time playing with and customizing its various features, which was easy. I was a little disappointed to not see YouTube Music as compatible, but I'm not really surprised with Amazon offering their own service. I was able to find plenty of Canadian content, including CBC news and radio, as well as a surprising flexibility in both temperature AND distance measurements as I'm a Gen-Xer who still uses Celsius and inches/miles. Don't ask, it's a thing.The little manual is also helpful for explaining what the different colours the light bar at the top of the unit mean -- it was yellow, which took me a bit to realize meant I had an Alexa-specific notification. I was able to listen to it and delete it without any problems, but this might explain why some people are having the light on all the time.Most important was a HUGE surprise -- that the Echo line will do accessible text-to-speech reading of Kindle ebooks. This is something that disappeared from Kindle units themselves ages ago, and as I have been steadily losing my vision for the past 20 years, it's a feature I have sorely missed. I switched to audiobooks about 10 years ago, but not all books are released in audio, they're significantly more expensive, and my Kindle library is huge and full of books I'd like to enjoy again.Having that accessibility feature returned has been incredible. I love my audiobooks, don't get me wrong -- I've found several performers I enjoy so much I follow them much like I follow favourite authors -- and text-to-speech is not even close to a replacement, but it's SOMETHING. I've been able to enjoy books I haven't read in years thanks to this, and I can do so without having to be controlling a screen-reader or setting up auto-scroll on my PC and the like.Sound quality wise, I love it. I have headphones at work and a set of decent earbuds while commuting/outside/errands, but I like to give my ears a rest (and batteries a charge) at home. I didn't realize just how much I was settling, sound-wise, until I started using the Pop. I like ambient noise as much as background music or news, and the Pop handles all of these without issue, meaning I no longer count daily steps within my own apartment due to needing to carry my phone everywhere.I also really like the fact that the Alexa app it works with lets you assign media streams to different bluetooth devices, fiddle with balance, and keeps multiple threads in memory so I can switch between ebook to audiobook to radio to music on one screen, or just via voice commands, and can resume any of the others where I left off with another command.Overall I'm pretty thrilled! I looked at more expensive options but in the end the Pop was exactly what I was looking for. It's lightweight but rugged enough to survive being knocked to the floor easily (not that my furry potato would EVER do such a thing), robust when I expected something fairly tinny, and is a really easy jumping-off point to Smart Homes as there is tons of information and easy to set up things from plugs to lights to door locks. The AI Blueprints section for building your own routines is extremely straightforward but also very open-ended. There's no temperature sensor in the Pop, but you can set things so that when home temp is over 23°C, it switches on a fan or little standing AC unit. When your alarm goes off, it also turns the kettle on. If it hears your dog barking, it can turn on some music or radio to help distract them and keep them company.So far no solutions for the potato, but hope springs eternal. He can no longer foil my plans entirely by laying completely on my phone or Kindle, however, especially not to muffle alarms, the jerk.Was the Prime Day price worth it to out-smart and out-stubbourn my cat?Oh, so very much so. Alexa forgives me for unplugging and replugging them in if I change rooms at this point, although they're likely exasperated I didn't just buy two -- which is probably what I should have done, and will likely do in the future. It'll still reset every time I turn the bathroom light off, but maybe I can put a smart light in there...

Dave Daley1.0 out of 5 stars
So much promise - so little delivery
Reviewed in Canada on October 18, 2022Configuration: Device onlyVerified Purchase
DEC 2022 Update.Well, they did it.  This device was below average, but they put new firmware on, and it's totally USELESS now.  I am looking for a Chromebook to hang on my wall to replace it, as we speak.  There is no more browser, which means some native apps, like Netflix and Youtube.  But now these two things have almost zero voice control, and the only way to work them is to use an on-screen mouse, which is way worse than it sounds.  Oh wait, you can BUY an "Echo Show Remote"... they keep reminding me.  Oh yeah, and youtube app.. ads are now unskippable.  Unlike in the browser.  So if you don't BUY youtube, you are stuck watching the godawful 3 to 10 minute ads.FROM BAD TO WORSE.I was REALLY excited about this device.  I mean, REALLY excited.  I pre-ordered it on the first day it was available.  I waited through delays, and was thrilled to get it the day after it became available.  It looked fine on the wall, and even though it seemed limited, I assumed that development was ongoing, and that it would get better.Well, one year on, and it hasn't improved one single bit.  I honestly don't think there is ANY development for this device - and that includes Amazon and Third Party.  And why would a third party develop for this platform?  You can only have a few plugins installed at any time, and Amazon uses almost all those slots, plugging its music and its sales platforms.It's not a very responsive device - touching the screen is very laggy, and to be honest, I wish voice control was better, because actually touching the device makes it much less desirable, due to fingerprints.  Some things that should be no-brainers, like idle slide-shows for example, work sometimes and not others.  Music services are useless.  You are going to have to use Youtube on the VERY laggy browser provided, and it runs poorly (to say the least).So what you essentially have here is a glorified Echo Dot, with a screen.  I had so many hopes for this device.  And it dashed them all.  And, as I mentioned earlier, there is no development, no updates on the device.  It feels like an abandoned platform.

Liam T Bear5.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent Customer Service, plus wow trans-friendly 😀
Reviewed in Canada on April 17, 2023Verified Purchase
When I first purchased this, I had been using a prevous generation battery-powered Satisfyer and was going through a ridiculous amount of batteries. Unfortunately, right out of the box this ine seemed to have very little suction.I considered chalking it up as a life lesson, but the 15-year warranty surprised me. I mean, nobody takes returns on any kind of toy like this (and I'm glad they don't!!), so I went ahead and contacted the seller.I wanted to let folks know the 15-year warranty is a real thing. The folks in customer service were fantastic, polite and friendly and extremely apologetic it didn't work! Their reported failure rate is less than 1% of these, but they sell so MANY (especially during the lockdowns, heh) that the 1-star reviews paint a very different picture. As people are more likely to post a negative review than a positive (I mean, if it works as expected, it just did its job, right?), and the numbers really are pretty skewed.I don't mean that the 1-star reviews are not real, they absolutely are! It sucks (or well, doesn't) when you spend money on something that doesn't work, and quite frankly is an embarrassing/taboo enough item most people are unlikely to contact the sellers about it.EIS is the manufacturer of Satisfyer, not just a reseller, so they absolutely know what's up and stand behind their products. I received not just an immediate refund, but also a replacement which was much more to my expectations. The customer service people I exchanged emails with were respectful, friendly, but definitely let you set the tone so they don't come off creepy or overshare-y. I didn't have to send pictures or answer questions, the refund came first, then the suggested troubleshooting because I had specifically asked for it.Customer Service is what happens when things go wrong. I'm honestly glad this happened, or I wouldn't have thought to chat with the people who make these cool products and who are very big on everyone having a great time, no matter what their body happens to be like.Additionally, the staff are extremely trans and non-binary friendly and answered questions for things that don't get posted on the site, like full dimensions of the openings, and have suggestions for other products in the line that have different shapes and sizes. I actually found out they sell different replacable head types, which was perfect for me! I've been on Testosterone for 3+ years now and my body is in a place where a lot of products I used to like (like rabbit-style vibrators) just don't work with my anatomy anymore, but neither do ones tailored for men's anatomy. I would have been grateful if there were just one or two options, as the way this works doesn't cause me any body dysphoria (just euphoria!), but folks were determined to make sure I had as many options as possible to work with and better information than I could get anywhere short of taking them out of the box in a store. Which is generally frowned-upon.(Stag Shops and Come As You Are in TO have a wall of unboxed demo units for exactly this reason, which is brilliant. Both sell this brand and are awesome companies. Everybody gets gold stars all around!)So the 15-year warranty is really a thing! They're discreet, very understanding, and absolutely will not make you feel embarrassed or small for being disappointed if things aren't knocking your socks off. They want you to feel great, and if that's not happening then they want to fix that however works best for you.If I wasn't just a fan from the products themselves -- and the advertising, omg -- I would be 100% sold for life based on their customer service.

user_reviews:
sleepytune5.0 out of 5 stars
the best portable console i've ever owned!
Reviewed in Canada on June 6, 2015Verified Purchase
i've been a huge nintendo fan for years and this is honestly such a revolutionary console.it's portable gaming with better-than-ever internet support, a huge online-friendly roster of games, eshop to download not only add-on software but entire games digitally, precise controls, sleek design that feels comfortable to hold, AND features not previously included on the original 3DS (built-in NFC amiibo support, c stick, Z shoulder buttons, better battery life, rearranged buttons for easier access to certain controls, micro SD card support, etc). truly the very best portable console on the market and i would highly recommend it for anyone considering getting a 3DS family system. it's a bit more expensive than the original 3DS XL, but the extra money is absolutely worth it for all of the improvements and added content.my system arrived on time and in perfect condition. i was a bit disappointed that the package doesnt come with a charger, but this shouldn't be much of a problem if you had previously owned a DSi or 3DS (the chargers are the same). you can also get generic chargers for these systems for around $15.as far as data transfer from previous consoles goes: because my first 3DS didn't have much data on it, transferring the data wirelessly from my old SD card to the micro SD card only took about a half hour, but i've heard that this can be tricker and more labor intensive for those with lots of data on the previous console (it may require unscrewing the back plate of the console to physically remove the micro SD card, plugging the card into a PC that has micro SD support, and dragging the files manually).overall, this is a 5-star system and i definitely recommend it to nintendo fans of all ages and experiences!

Anne E.5.0 out of 5 stars
Perfect Companion.......
Reviewed in Canada on February 26, 2024Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
I was the happy owner of a Kobo Aura One for a bit more than five years and very happy with the product.  It did, unfortunately, cease to function towards the end of year five .  I believe it was the battery as I couldn't get it to charge, even though I purchased a new charging cord.  The e-reader provided many, many hours of reading enjoyment and was definitely worth the initial cost of ownership.  I immediately decided that I had to purchase another e-reader.  After a bit of research I felt that the Libra 2 would be a good fit for me.  I was amazed at how quickly I was able to get reading again.  It was incredible to me that my previously purchased books had automatically been transferred to the new e-reader.  The Libra is very easy to navigate and I was up and running in no time.This has been one of my best and most valued purchases this past year.

Excellent view-ability from sunlight to pitch black bedroom conditions.My alluded to concern was with its suggested (by Kobo itself) inability to take advantage of the company’s own Kobo Stylo. I was quite disappointed about this until I found myself idling in the aisles of a dollar store (“Dollar Tree”) and spotted a fabulous stylo with four different functions: the requisite silicon tip for use on “all touch surfaces,” a ballpoint pen that peeks out at the twist of the cap; and the addition of two tiny and unobtrusive chrome buttons that activate a flashlight function and a piercing red laser suitable for presentations. AND instead of shelling out close to $90 for the incompatible Kobo stylo, this little gem of a stylo cost an extraordinary price of $1.50!!!Needless to say, this stylo was a steal and it helped establish my choice of the Libra 2 as a fine choice indeed.

Ontario Wine Guy5.0 out of 5 stars
Bought this to compare to Kindle
Reviewed in Canada on December 29, 2022Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
Where should I start.  I prefer this to the Kindle, but then the Kindle Paperwhite (PW) is just that bit easier on the eyes.The Kobo Libra 2 handles almost any file type, Kindle PW only MOBI.  Easy enough to convert a file or so, BUT I also don't like the file management scheme from Amazon. Buying an eBook on Amazon is easy enough, and voila it just appears on the Kindle PW, BUT you need to be internet connect to read those.  Minor annoyances.The battery life is good, days of reading before I need to recharge, and it charges rapidly.  BUT is does not like recharges from a portable battery charger at all. It will drain the thing and only have a bout 1/3 power.  Same device on the Kindle PW, the Kindle PW fully charges up leaving the portable battery with a little juice left.However, I like the page buttons on this better than tapping on the PW. I tend to jump pages on the PW sometimes, and the buttons prevent this.I like the page size on the PW a bit better, and as I noted the screen is easier on my eyes. The pages are a bit wider on the Kobo Libra 2, so its not easy to compare them from one device to the other.It's got no real drawbacks even compared to the Kindle PW, and I find the pluses of file type support, ease of file management, and the page buttons better and more useful features. If I had to choose, I would go with the Kobo Libra 2.

Amazon Customer1.0 out of 5 stars
Do not waste your money.  But something else.
Reviewed in Canada on March 19, 2021Style: SingleVerified Purchase
Updating my review three months in.  This product, after three months of very light usage, is no longer usable.  Sound quality for the person on the other end of the phone is awful.First review below from February belowThe product performs reasonably well but has its limitations.  I expected more from a product in this price range.Peering: It peers successfully with both laptop and phone simultaneously and does it very well.Listening Range: Have been able to wander away from the laptop and phone to a far distance, even to other floor and still hear the person on the other end.Talking Range: This is very different from the listening range.  It is much shorter.  It is also very inconsistent.  You can be 10 feet away and all is fine, then quality on the other end drops.  Only solution is to be right beside the laptop or phone.  Not being line of site also seems to impact the quality.  This is the most concerning limitation of this equipment.Battery: Reasonable.  It charges pretty quickly and six hours at 1/2 volume is pretty consistently achieved.Size: nice and small.Comfort: Very comfortable to wear over the ear.Volume Up and Down Buttons on the headset:  Not really useful.  Very awkward spot and stiff.  Adjusting while on the ear isn't something easily done.Overall the product is reasonable but overpriced because of the Talking Range limitation.  There are much cheaper single ear headsets with much better range but in a different form factor.

J.D.5.0 out of 5 stars
This collection is a wonderful holiday treat
Reviewed in Canada on January 15, 2017Verified Purchase
This collection is a wonderful holiday treat, especially to those children who've read the book (included) and/or have seen the video presentation on TV. The little elf (included) is an exact likeness of "Chippy" from that TV presentation and its fun to watch the family decide what name to give your new "elf". You can then go the website & register your new elf's name. While some parents have found that your new elf's present at various high up spots around the room where the Christmas tree is displayed helps with discipline, most have found that moving him around after the little ones are fast asleep is quickly noticed the next morning with the knowledge that the elf has indeed gone back to talk to Santa during the night. It's all fun & definitely will become an annual tradition that the children will cherish even after they grow up. I highly recommend this version to all families with young children not only for the quality of the elf but also for the large story book that's included with easy to read words and pictures. A wonderful collectible holiday treasure your family can enjoy year after year.

A Good Tablet For The Money
Reviewed in Canada on April 5, 2024Digital Storage Capacity: 32 GBConfiguration: Standalone Fire HD 8Colour Name: BlackStyle: Fire HD 8Verified Purchase
I just bought this Fire Tablet HD 8 12th generation on sale at a great price to replace my 2 year old Fire HD 8 10th gen model. Previously to buying into Fire, I've owned a string of iPads but for the price, I really can't fault these Fire tablets at all. I use it primarily for reading ePubs, streaming music, email and a bit of social media. It ticks all these boxes at a very reasonable price. I'm not noticing much difference in overall performance with the 12th gen over the 10th gen but at this price point and the 5 equal payments option, I couldn't resist. The setup with this new model was seamless and quickly restored all the settings from backups of my older model. With a simple install of play store, I was good to go. I bought the 32GB model and simply boosted storage with an inexpensive Micro SD card. The Fire HD 8 (12th Gen) meets my requirements.

Report
The 16 Bit Gamer3.0 out of 5 stars
What is it? Is it a bird? Is it a Plane? No it's an android tablet which is intentally held back.
Reviewed in Canada on May 10, 2023Digital Storage Capacity: 32 GBConfiguration: Standalone Fire HD 8Colour Name: DenimStyle: Fire HD 8Verified Purchase
I am going to preface this with the following. I have a Android Tablet and an iPad.I purchased this device for 1 and 1 reason only. To listen to Audiable.As an Android tablet, it is inoffensive. The buttons are not placed in a way I'd like making the top of the tablet very busy. But with the addition of a USB-C port and a headphone port more than makes up for it.From a "official" software experience wise, if you just want a device to entertain your kids with. Disney Plus, some books and Netflix. Then it's a cheap and "safe" buy, if you are OK giving Amazon your usage data.However the minute you try to use anything outside of Amazon's "ecosystem" it turns into a nightmare. Wanna read a Kobo Book or listen to a Audiobook from Google Play? Good Luck sideloading everything, or being force to use the browser to get some functionality.What's worse is that if you live in Canada, Audiable can't be found anywhere and refuses to install even if you figure out how to side load.However after too much time here is my steps to get this device... mostly usable.1) Install a F-Droid Client, (droid-ify my go-to), here you can install third party launchers (important for later), third party browsers, ePub readers for DRM-free books (KOReader FTW), and more if you so desire.2) On you F-Droid app, download Aurora Store. A open source Google Play client which makes side loading offical apps easy. You may want to sign in to the app with a Google Account if you want to search on it.3) On Aurora Store you can download pretty much anything else you needs (and keep it up to date), from Kobo, and Libby. Sadly Google Play books won't work since you are missing Google Play's frameworks, but with Adobe Digital Editions and VLC you can download and read Google Play books from the downloaded acm files from Google Play, and audio books can downloaded directly to your device.4) Now remember how I said that Audable doesn't work on the Fire Tablet, despite saying that it's the reason I got it. Well with a third party Launcher like Lawn Chair, you can see all the pre-installed apps Amazon didn't want Canadians to play with... including Audable.Now with all this said if you want to keep the device upto date, then you can't change the default launcher (-1 star), and the fact that amazon's own services are knee-caped which makes even the unbranded tablets look like a better deal (-1 star). It makes it hard to recommend.However it's easy to setup, and it comes from a reputable (both good and bad) company. So please do with this as you will.

title: Carcassonne : New Edition - A Board Game by Z-Man Games 2-5 Players - Board Games for Family 30-45 Minutes of Gameplay Games for Family Game Night For Kids and Adults Ages 7plus English Version
description: STRATEGY GAME - PLAN YOUR WAY TO VICTORY: Develop the landscape of a medieval fortress city one tile at a time. Whether blocking a city's growth or connecting with your opponent's road to share the points, Carcassonne provides plenty of ways to use your cunning and outsmart your opponents.    ONE STEP AT A TIME TILE-PLACEMENT GAME: Players fill in the countryside around the medieval fortified city, choosing from tiles that depict cities, roads, monasteries, and fields    each new tile creates an ever-expanding board on which players can then add their followers.    JACK OF ALL TRADES: Followers can take many different roles (knights, monks, farmers, or thieves) determined by the type of tile on which they're placed. Each role scores points differently, so you'll need careful planning to make the best use of your followers.    HOW TO ACHIEVE VICTORY: Players score points by having followers on tiles as features are completed. The player who makes the most strategic placements of tiles and followers will score the most points and win the game.    HIGH REPLAYABILITY: With its simple yet rich game mechanics and eighty-four tiles that can be configured into numerous combinations, Carcassonne appeals to beginners and veteran gamers alike. LOOKING FOR NEW ADVENTURES? Try our many expansions (Note: Expansions require Carcassonne Base Game to play). Average Playtime: 45 minutes.

Read before buying if you don't live in U.S
Reviewed in Canada on June 25, 2021Verified Purchase
If you're purchasing this from outside the U.S, the "final price" at purchase isn't the final price because the taxes and shipping fee hasn't been applied yet (it will do so once shipped, and then you'll see the charges in your bank account). This is not the company's fault, and it is something Amazon should make clear to their customers. At first I was upset at the seller due to my misunderstanding, but after communicating with them, they did their best to make sure I wasn't dissatisfied with the transaction. Before leaving a negative review, message the seller and I'm sure they'll try to help you out, especially if you're unsure about some of the details in their advertisement.The seller delivers on promise on what the phone comes with (although a nitpick, the battery was not near 80 percent). The screen has a noticeable scratch, which was to be expected. The delivery was quick and came next day. Mine came with freebies such as a screen protector and phone case. This product is worth the money, in my opinion.

Cleanse and Nourish Your Skin with CeraVe Foaming Face Cleanser
Reviewed in Canada on March 4, 2024Style: Face CleanserSize: 473 ml (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
For those seeking a gentle yet effective solution for cleansing oily and sensitive skin, look no further than the CeraVe Foaming Face Cleanser. This skincare essential combines a blend of essential ceramides, hydrating ingredients, and a rich foaming texture to deliver a refreshing and nourishing cleansing experience for men and women alike. Formulated with three essential ceramides (1, 3, 6-II), this cleanser works to restore and maintain the skin's natural protective barrier, helping to keep your skin healthy and resilient. By replenishing ceramides that are essential for retaining moisture and supporting the skin's barrier function, CeraVe ensures long-lasting hydration and protection against environmental stressors. The addition of hydrating Hyaluronic Acid and calming Niacinamide further enhances the efficacy of this cleanser. Hyaluronic Acid helps to retain skin's natural moisture, keeping it plump and hydrated, while Niacinamide soothes sensitive skin, reducing redness and irritation for a more comfortable cleansing experience. The gentle and foaming gel-to-foam texture of this cleanser provides a refreshing cleanse without stripping the skin of its natural oils. It effectively removes excess oil, dirt, and makeup without disrupting the skin barrier, leaving your skin feeling clean, refreshed, and balanced. Designed for normal to oily skin types, this fragrance-free and non-comedogenic formula is suitable for even the most sensitive of skin. Its non-drying and non-irritating properties make it an ideal choice for daily use, providing a gentle yet thorough cleanse that leaves your skin feeling soft, smooth, and nourished.

description: Made with and for Pro Gamers: G Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse is the result of two years of work with professional esports gamers, combing advanced technologies in an ultra-lightweight design    Light-speed Wireless: Pro grade performance overcomes the traditional limitations of wireless latency, connectivity and power to deliver a rock solid, super-fast 1 millisecond report rate connection    Hero 25K sensor through a software update from G HUB, this upgrade is free to all players: Logitech's most accurate sensor yet with up to 25,600 DPI and 10X the power efficiency of previous generation for the ultimate in wireless gaming speed, accuracy and responsiveness. user_reviews:
Gurpreet5.0 out of 5 stars
Precision Gaming Perfected - Logitech G Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse
Reviewed in Canada on January 7, 2024Style: G Pro MousePattern Name: Mouse onlyVerified Purchase
The Logitech G Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse has completely redefined my gaming experience, and I can't praise it enough. This esports-grade mouse delivers exceptional performance and a level of precision that's second to none.First and foremost, the design and build quality are top-notch. It fits my hand comfortably and feels like an extension of my arm during gaming sessions. The sleek black finish gives it a professional and stylish look.The wireless connectivity is flawless. I've experienced zero lag or interference, and the HERO sensor provides incredibly accurate tracking, with sensitivity settings that cater to a wide range of gaming preferences. The lack of cables not only reduces clutter but also gives me the freedom to move my mouse without restriction.The battery life is impressive, lasting through extended gaming sessions without needing frequent recharging. The lightweight design also contributes to fatigue-free gaming for hours on end.The programmable buttons and customizable lighting are fantastic features. I can tailor the mouse to my exact gaming needs, creating shortcuts and macros with ease. The RGB lighting adds a touch of personalization, making it easy to distinguish profiles or simply add flair to my gaming setup.The inclusion of additional mouse feet is a thoughtful touch. These ensure smooth gliding and precise control, enhancing the overall experience.In competitive gaming, every millisecond counts, and the Logitech G Pro delivers with its lightning-fast response time and low click latency. It's a mouse designed for esports professionals, and it shows in its performance.In conclusion, the Logitech G Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse is a masterpiece for serious gamers. Its precision, wireless freedom, and customization options make it a must-have for those seeking the edge in competitive gaming. It's a testament to Logitech's commitment to excellence in gaming peripherals. If you want a gaming mouse that's truly in a league of its own, look no further. Highly recommended!

Report
Jesse R.5.0 out of 5 stars
The optimal mouse in a competitive market
Reviewed in Canada on November 10, 2019Style: G Pro MousePattern Name: Mouse onlyVerified Purchase
Let me preface my review by saying I have gone through many mice before arriving at this one, and that I am an FPS player, so that will affect my preferences in a mouse.With that said, I don't think there is a mouse on the market better all-around than this one. There are some things some mice may boast over this, such as more side buttons, but everything other mice may have is for other uses. This is for the FPS gamer, and there is nothing more to want.The features are simple, but everything you need. The side mouse buttons are interchangeable so you can have them on the left or right, or both. This compliments the ambidextrous design well, and the option of having both could be useful for FPS games with many abilities (though I have not tried this yet).The weight is nothing short of amazing for a wireless gaming mouse. On the topic of wireless, I have had issues with previous wireless gaming mice (specifically the Razer Mamba), but none at all with this. I had no problems with my Logitech G305 either; Logitech's wireless is some of the best on the peripheral market. The battery life is even more impressive than the weight, able to last me around a week straight of constant use all day with a single charge. This is largely thanks to Logitech's Hero sensor, which is likely the best on the market right now, basically being a more efficient 3360.The appearance may be a bit on the plain side compared to it's latest rival: the Razer Viper, but it has a safe and comfortable shape, with buttons separate from the rest of the shell for better response and longevity. Admittedly the dpi button being on the underside of the mouse does make it impossible to make on-the-fly dpi adjustments, though that is very niche, and the button being out of the way may be a bonus to some.To sum up: the connection has, just like all Logitech mice, had no issues whatsoever. The weight is amazingly low even for a wired mouse. The buttons are perfect for FPS or casual use. The shape is plain, but safe and comfortable, and the battery life is superb with it's industry-leading Hero sensor. The market will catch up eventually, but I think this will be simply the optimal mouse (outside of moba games) for the foreseeable future.

Alex4.0 out of 5 stars
Premium mouse with some misses
Reviewed in Canada on December 4, 2022Colour Name: Classic BlackSize: Mouse + DockStyle: Viper Ultimate - WirelessPattern Name: Mouse + DockVerified Purchase
Bought at $100-ish on sale and used for work, web browsing and gaming for few days.Pros:+ This mouse feels amazing in your hand! The build quality is quite high as well and the design of the mouse is very nice.+ The mouse is also surprisingly light. For a wireless design you would expect a battery weight penalty but it doesn't seem to affect this model.As this is my first Razer mouse I have to say it left such a good impression I'd consider getting another mouse from them in the future.Cons:- The scroll-wheel .... yep, it's harder to roll the wheel due to increased resistance. This might not affect you as much in game as it may even prevent accidental weapon cycling, but for web and work this increased resistance on the wheel will become tiring.- The back/forward buttons on the side of the mouse conform with the shape of the mouse almost perfectly making them harder to detect with your thumb and harder to press too. It felt like I had to mash my thumb over the general area to activate the button. They would benefit greatly from a little catch lip or dot and different angle to make them easier to detect and press for sausage fingers like mine.Extra:~ RGB is underwhelming  (but you can see that in the pictures) due to having only the 1 area on the palm that lights up you will not have any visible light while the mouse is under your hand.~ Most mice out there uses a button on the top next to the mouse wheel to change the DPI on the fly, however this model places it on the bottom making it impossible to change rapidly unless you reprogram another button. Not a big deal for me and you can observe this in the pictures as well.Mouse mat warning: This mouse is as smooth as butter in a hot pan while using directly on desk and tracks accurately too. I think this model performs better on a smooth, hard surface. That being sais as I have to use a mouse mat for ergonomic reasons I felt the feet of the mouse catch and resist movement on my traditional, soft mat. I strongly suggest you to use it on a hard surface if you can.

Simply dip the pregnancy strip into the urine sample below the max line for 5-10 seconds, and take the strip out when the dye rises into the result window.    👉Easy to read: Read Pregnancy tests within 3 to 5 minutes after immersion; do not read after 5 minutes, so you can know for sure.    👌 Highly Sensitive: Pregnancy is detectable before the expected period. Two lines means pregnant and one line means not pregnant. No more guessing!    👩‍⚕️Experience peace of mind with Easy@Home. We are committed to provide high-quality products and excellent customer service.
nav: Health & Personal Care › Women's Health & Family Planning › Pregnancy Tests
user_reviews:
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
Don’t let faint likes discourage you
Reviewed in Canada on February 19, 2024Size: 70 count (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
First the LH strips- they will always be positive, that’s normal. Medium to light colour leading up to and after ovulation. However you will notice a huge difference in the colour strip when you have your LH surge, you won’t question it because the line will be darker then the other test line and then this means you’re going to ovulate within 12-36 hours. I did the deed everyday starting on cycle day 9 until and including cycle day 16 just to be sure. My cycles are typically 28 days long, sometimes 29 and I bleed for 6 days. On day 13 I seen my LH surge and I assume I ovulated day 14/15.HCG strips- I got my first and VERY faint postive cycle day 23, the next day again, still very faint. However the day after it got a little darker. I couldn’t tell a difference in days unless I wanted two days, which makes sense as hormones double every 48-72 hours. So if you’re testing everyday don’t set discouraged thinking it’s a chemical pregnancy because the line seems too faint. Mine didn’t get darker until cycle day 27 the day before “my period”. And even then, it could be darker, it’s still only medium pink. But I took a clear blue test to be sure and this was much darker and very clearly bright positive. Today is my missed period and I’m 4 weeks pregnant first try with these strips. Please remember that even a faint positive is a positive, it will slowly get darker but you won’t be satisfied with the darkness until after your period has been missed lol.

Report
Michael Gervasi1.0 out of 5 stars
If you buy on Amazon, expect a fake.
Reviewed in Canada on November 8, 2016Colour Name: Deep RedVerified Purchase
I was shipped a fake.  Not even a convincing one; L3 and R3 are extremely loud, there are huge dead zones on the left thumb stick, the plastic is flimsy and sharply cut and you can see through it so the LEDs inside can be seen from any angle instead of just through the little viewports for them, the color is wrong, and the RESET button is conspicuously missing; there's a hole for it, but no actual button.  As if that wasn't proof enough, SCPTool actually announced that I'd plugged in a fake DS3 when I hooked it up to my PC as it apparently can tell the difference.So I read some other reviews.  Lots of other reviews from people who got fakes, all from sellers with different names.  And then there are lots of reviews from people saying "Hmm, this color seems to be very cheap and flimsy compared to the other colors I've owned" -- Really, it's not that one color is more cheaply-made than another.  What happened is that you got a fake.  It looks like these sellers just pop up with a random name, ship out fakes until they're shut down, then re-open with a new name and scam more people.  I imagine the guys who shipped me this fake will be shut down, but another seller is just going to pop up and do the same thing based on what I'm seeing in these other reviews.At this point in the PS3's life span it won't be easy to find brand-new DS3 controllers.  But I recommend against trying to buy them on Amazon, because it apparently has the same problem as eBay: sketchy sellers shipping out counterfeit items hoping to scam you out of your money.

LuckyLucy4.0 out of 5 stars
best in mid-tier class phone/camera/clean android
Reviewed in Canada on September 8, 2022Colour: CharcoalVerified Purchase
Pixel 6a Cell Phone - CharcoalWriting this review on sept 2022 timeframe.  Bought two while it is on sale 50$ off.This is basically the BEST Cleanest clutter free android you can buy for 550$CAD.  It certainly has competition but simply put,  non Pixel phones are cluttered with bloatware.  The only phones in mid-tier that comes close are some offerings by motorola however i am continually disappointed in Camera performance for all motorola phones both in low light and with the speed of taking the shot.  With FAST updates and Android support ,  I think you should not look further and buy this phone.Folks complain about glass fingerprint sensor -- i do think it's improved quite a bit from all the updates.  Sept 2022 update also improves upon this.  If you have a front glass protector, you should enable the high sensitivity mode if necessary.  I personally have the Caseology glass protector and have no issues.  It performs on par with my old samsung note 10+ glass sensor.Battery life is average... nothing great.  Gets me through the day.Camera is basically the best on the Android  market at this price in my opinion.  I've used mid-tier  Samsung., Motorola, TCL, Huawei, Plus one.. .  theyre all strong contenders but I always preferred the photos coming out of Google camera with its computational photography.  It keeps getting better with updates and Google doesnt abandon the phone for 2-3 years after buying.  Other manufacturers are "one and done" and once you get the phone, its RARE to have any improvements (based on my own observations whilst owning those phones)A few things i wouldve liked to see:--I generally would have LOVED to have the wired earphone connector on ALL phones but alas, pixel has gone the way of Bt only (or usb adapters).--I'm also going to say I'm not super thrilled with glass back.  The phone NEEDS a case otherwise its slippery and fragile. .-- only offered in 128GB flash .  would have liked one of the two phones i bought , to have 256.  Of course Google phones never offer external SD card.Despite a few qualms I had,  I still consider this phone best in class.------------update:well? i love this device what can i say.  i ended up waiting for sales on this device AND/OR warehouse units.  BEST bang for buck  device in 2023 imo still.  Got THREE  now --  at around 300-350 per device, pixel google clean android experience. great price to spent on kids phones.

nav: Electronics › Headphones, Earbuds & Accessories › Headphones
user_reviews:
Alan G.5.0 out of 5 stars
Don't be afraid to replace the ear tips
Reviewed in Canada on November 21, 2021Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
It is a bit of a story but I hope this helps others if they also experience problems with the OEM memory foam ear tips.First impressions were bad.  So bad that I was right away thinking they need to be returned because I found them unwearable.  I could not get a comfortable fit with the foam ear tips that came with it.  After messing with them for a while I used the Sony headphone app to test all 3 ear tip sizes and it told me which size was best for each ear.  So I then used the app to adjust, test, adjust, test until I got a proper seal according to the app.  Every time I put them on I had to do at least 3 adjust until the app said I had a proper seal.  But it never felt right ... I heard too much outside noise even with ANC on ... and bass was missing --- both are indications of a poor seal.  But it was the best seal I could get with the best fitting tip, and they hurt my ears.They hurt my skin where the foam pressed and they never seemed to seal quite right.  I didn't look forward to using them, and I had to take them out after only about half an hour.  So at this point I was sure I would be returning them.But I had a 10 year old Sony DR-BT160AS wireless headphone so I took the very old and dated tips off them and put them on these XM4 and wow!  They were noticeably sealed properly and comfortable!  I used the app and they were sealed properly according to the app each time I put them on without any messing around.  The bass is noticeably the way the content should be.  And the noise isolation was very good even with the ANC off, and of course much better with the ANC on.I am now quite happy with them.  They are comfortable and sound quite good.  I can wear them as long as any other comfortable fitting ear buds now that I have gotten rid of those foam things.I plan to find some silicone tips that are perhaps more modern with better sound capability, but really, they sound quite good with these 10 - 15 year old silicone tips, and the sound isolation is pretty good.So my suggestion is this:If you find them uncomfortable, or not really blocking outside noise even though the app says they are sealed, then I would strongly suggest trying silicone tips - preferably from another set of ear buds that you know fit right.My other advice is you will need to mess with the sound equalizer and bass.  They sound quite unimpressive and dull in the default settings.  So take the time to adjust the sound to match your preferences.  Mine perked up nicely when I added a little "clear bass" to +3 and added some a small boost to 400 and 1k hz.OK, now about the XM4 ear buds:- They are extremely accurate so you will hear EVERYTHING in a song.  So if you have poor quality MP3 then you will hear that.  Years ago I recorded some old albums to MP3 and they were pretty good but vinyl has some pops and snaps, and they sure do stand out on the MX4.- As you probably read, you can control pause & next song & previous song --- OR --- volume up & volume down.  NOT BOTH.  Disappointing, and I think an error by Sony to not allow both controls at the same time.  My work around is that I have it set to pause & next song & previous song, and I use google assistant to control volume ... and the ear buds hear "hey google" almost every time, so it really is not a problem for me.  So now if I want more volume, then I say "hey google" and then "turn volume up" and it works good, but I still a work around on a bad decision by Sony.- I find "speak to chat" an interesting idea but it is not great.  I prefer to pause and turn on ambient sound to chat, and that way it doesn't constantly cut in and out.  Interesting concept but I think it needs more work to be practical.  The ambient sound turned to highest setting does allow you to talk.- DSEE Extreme (fix losses due to compressing music) seems to work decent but I do find it tires me a bit, so I am leaving it off for now.  Mostly it seems to add too much edge or sharpness.  But I am still getting used to these new earbuds, so later I intend to play with it a little more.Overall, I am very pleased with how they sound.  And that, above all else, is the most important thing.

Wilton5.0 out of 5 stars
No real flaws, just a really really good pair of ANC earbuds.
Reviewed in Canada on September 29, 2022Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
I am writing this review after having used the Airpods pro and wf100xm3 as my daily drivers for over a year.The noise cancellation is amazing. I have used expensive over-ear headphones that don't even come close to the noise cancellation these pair of earphones offer (mainly compared with the Momentum 3 wireless).I truly can't hear ANYTHING when commuting with low-volume music playing. The transparency mode is good, but nothing contests the Airpods pro transparency mode for me. Still great transparency though, I am just a little spoilt. Most things about the build quality also feel good. The hinge on the case is a little squeaky and not that tight feeling, but the earbuds and the rest of the case feel amazing. Nice matte finish, and quality. The case is definitely chunkier than the Airpods pro case but it doesn't bother me. The XM3 case did definitely bother me. The sound quality is great, really clean sounding with a nice bass. Paired with the noise cancellation it is truly next level. Really nice sounding. Much cleaner and balanced than the Pros and the 1000xm3. The controls are good, but since using the pros, I have never preferred touch controls. The pressure sensor on the pros are just unbelievably good. The controls are top-tier compared to other touch sensor buds, though. I've used the galaxy buds Pro as well as the 1000XM3s but these are by far the most responsive and quick. Comfort is great too, they fit in my ear really well and almost never fall off. The pros fit in my ear unbelievably well but these still fit in my ear great and don't get close to falling out. The XM3s never fit well in my ear and would fall out often. The battery life on these is AMAZING, 8 hours of ANC is truly a luxury. I remember, I woke up, put on the buds, and ate lunch, went to the gym, worked out, went to the library, studied, and went back home, and still had 30% remaining battery. I never took off the buds once. This is truly the biggest difference between the pros and these buds. The battery life is so noticeable and amazingOverall, Sony nailed this. They have everything. Best in class ANC, great comfort, amazing sound, responsive controls, great battery life, great transparency mode, amazing build quality.+ they look pretty stylish. Subjective though xD

Jessica W.5.0 out of 5 stars
Comfortable and Absorbent, Though Occasional Leaks: Pampers Swaddlers Size 6 Diapers
Reviewed in Canada on November 6, 2023Size: Size 6Style: DiapersVerified Purchase
As a parent of a spirited three-year-old, I have turned to Pampers Swaddlers Size 6 Diapers for their exceptional comfort and absorbency. These diapers offer a snug fit and reliable protection, but it's worth noting that occasional leaks do occur, especially for my active toddler.The fit of these diapers is commendable. The Size 6 Swaddlers provide a comfortable and secure fit, allowing my child to move freely without feeling restricted. The flexible waistband and leg cuffs create a gentle seal, preventing most leaks and ensuring my son's comfort during his daily activities.In terms of absorbency, Pampers Swaddlers perform well for the most part. They effectively absorb wetness and keep my child dry for extended periods, minimizing the risk of diaper rash and discomfort. The wetness indicator remains a valuable feature, aiding in timely diaper changes, though we have encountered occasional leaks despite our best efforts to change promptly.While these diapers have provided consistent overnight protection, my son's high activity levels sometimes lead to unexpected leaks during the day. Although this has been a challenge, the soft and breathable materials of the Swaddlers have proven gentle on my son's sensitive skin, which is a crucial factor in our diaper choice.The bulk packaging with 108 diapers in one box offers convenience and good value, ensuring we are well-supplied for our diapering needs. Despite the occasional leaks, the overall reliability and comfort of Pampers Swaddlers make them a practical choice for parents of active toddlers.In summary, Pampers Swaddlers Size 6 Diapers deliver on their promise of comfort and absorbency, making them a reliable option for most situations. However, parents of highly active toddlers should be aware of the possibility of occasional leaks. Despite this challenge, the diapers' softness and the wetness indicator provide peace of mind, making them a solid choice for everyday use. While not perfect, Pampers Swaddlers still offer a comfortable and convenient solution for diapering needs.

I did a lot of research before picking a TENS Unit.  The TENS 7000 came with high recommendations. Definitely paid for itself when I put for electrodes on my lower back and had an amazing massage and pain relief experience.  This unit is also recommended as a beginner's e-stim unit, but if you want to know about that, search Reddit.  All I can say is I am really happy I chose the 7000 unit.  The price is excellent value.There is a bit of a learning curve if you are new to TENS however the unit comes with a great manual and settings are individual to what you are using it for and per person.  A physiotherapist can help, or just look on YouTube!There unit comes with 4 pad electrodes.  They are good quality but will have a limited number of uses, considered buying some extra electrode pads or some conductive adhesive gel for reuse.  This is normal and these are considered consumables.I'm still on the included 9V battery, but I also bought some extra rechargeable 9V batteries.Totally pleased and enthusiastically recommend!

Arthur5.0 out of 5 stars
Have stood the test of time
Reviewed in Canada on November 11, 2023Size: 250 OHMColour Name: GrayVerified Purchase
I ordered about a dozen headphones in this price range from Amazon and meticulously tested them all. This was my favorite open-back set, so I returned the rest and committed to this one. I also kept the closed-back version, the 770s. I use them to listen to music while I work for about 6 hours a day, and I also use them to watch movies. I bought them over a year ago so I have put 2 or 3 thousand hours on them by now. They continue to work flawlessly and the sound quality remains phenomenal. They are also extraordinarily comfortable, I don't even realize I am wearing them.If you are debating between open-back and closed-back, I know how you feel. I wrestled with that dilemma too. However, I can honestly say that I've probably only used the closed-back 770s for maybe 10-20 hours compared to the several thousands of hours I've clocked on the 990s. In my mind, the only reason to use closed-backs is if you *require* noise cancellation. Open-back is a whole different experience, it really 'opens up' the sound so that it doesn't feel like it is just 'in your head'. I also like that I can hear people ask me questions from other rooms, I can hear appliance timers or alarms, etc. I can have a conversation with someone without taking them off. Open-back is the way to go unless to *need* noise cancellation.

Report
tmk1034.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing headphones, but the treble...
Reviewed in Canada on August 9, 2023Size: 250 OHMColour Name: GrayVerified Purchase
I've been on my audio journey for some months now, experimenting with different brands, driver types, connection types (bluetooth, aux) and frequency responses. Throughout this journey, all of the audio equipment I've used typically had a v-shaped tuning; extreme bass, recessed-to-the-ground mids, and treble high enough to feel like a needle is penetrating your ears. Again, this type of tuning is subjective to each individual, and I used to be a large subscriber to this type of tuning. However, a few months ago I decided to take a leap into the "neutral zone" and bought my first pair of iems... the Letshuoer S12's. Yes, I know, those iems are not AT ALL neutral/flat. If anything they're actually very v-shaped. The point is that this was my FIRST STEP, and at the time I thought the bass was actually "lacking" (for context, I had only had experience with Bluetooth earphones). So, once I decided to get headphones, I decided to get something even MORE in the "neutral zone"...So here we are. The DT990 Pro. To many, these headphones are it; the last stage in their audio journey. For me it was anyway. The bass isn't boomy, but punchy and accurate. The mids are not recessed/overpowered nearly as much as they are on the S12's. And the treble is... the exact same, of not more sibilant than the S12's? Okay, I won't lie, when I got these initially I thought that it sounded super flat. However, recently I decided to try out the ER4SR. Those are FLAT. I mean, they are "____". And while flat sounding doesn't equal "good sounding" and it's purely subjective, I've found that that flat sound is MY subjective taste. So now let's go back to these headphones, they sound amazing, but since I've now adjusted to the sound of the Etymotics, these sound a lot more sibilant and airy. Again, while this may be a good thing for some (and an objective good thing for making out subtle mistakes in audio production), it is no longer for me. So, since the purchase of the ER4SR, my up-to-date personal review of the sound goes like this:  Bass: Amazing! Not really much to complain about here. It does slightly overpower some vocals in some songs, but I'm only saying that because I know how more-upfront mids sound, so not really a complaint.  Mids: As I said, they do sound slightly recessed, but not enough to make it a complaint. It is very good, and all vocals sound full.  Treble: This is where I am a bit more critical, as you could probably tell be the text leading up to this part. It does seem to be a bit more sibilant and harsh in the treble compared to the ER4SR. And while that can cause problems like overpowering the midrange, it's all very subjective and varies person to person. Some people will think that the treble is too much, some will think the treble is perfect, and some might even say it's not enough (and I hope the people in the latter seek a priest to perform an exorcism). But I think the objective truth is that these aim to have a very "clinical" sound, which allows for a more meticulous analysis of music, meaning that the somewhat-harsh treble is therefore justified.So why 4 stars if it's all very subjective? Why not 5 stars? While the sound is amazing for the price, the 1 star loss is mostly a result of the comfort. The headband starts to feel like it's digging into my skull when I wear it for 2 or less hours, the pads feel kind of hard when they're clamped on each side of your head, and the circular cups HAVE TO GO. The thing that the MEZE Empyreans do for the earcups is such an innovative design (and no, I've never heard, let alone seen, the headphones in-person). Also, off topic, I decided to mod my pair of DT990 Pros so that I could use the 4.4mm part of my Fosi DS1 DAC and therefore have more power being inputted into the headphones. Also, the mod allows the cables to be replaced.In conclusion, I like to end my reviews with a out-of-5 star rating. However, since these headphones have a very clinical approach to their tuning, I thought I'd do something similar. So, I give these amazing sounding DT990 Pros a 4.4195037484950272649598737385957372626485947252848593627284958/5.

tmk103

4.0 out of 5 stars

                Amazing headphones, but the treble...
            


                
                    
                    
                        
                            Reviewed in Canada on August 9, 2023
                        
                    
                
            


            I've been on my audio journey for some months now, experimenting with different brands, driver types, connection types (bluetooth, aux) and frequency responses. Throughout this journey, all of the audio equipment I've used typically had a v-shaped tuning; extreme bass, recessed-to-the-ground mids, and treble high enough to feel like a needle is penetrating your ears. Again, this type of tuning is subjective to each individual, and I used to be a large subscriber to this type of tuning. However, a few months ago I decided to take a leap into the "neutral zone" and bought my first pair of iems... the Letshuoer S12's. Yes, I know, those iems are not AT ALL neutral/flat. If anything they're actually very v-shaped. The point is that this was my FIRST STEP, and at the time I thought the bass was actually "lacking" (for context, I had only had experience with Bluetooth earphones). So, once I decided to get headphones, I decided to get something even MORE in the "neutral zone"...So here we are. The DT990 Pro. To many, these headphones are it; the last stage in their audio journey. For me it was anyway. The bass isn't boomy, but punchy and accurate. The mids are not recessed/overpowered nearly as much as they are on the S12's. And the treble is... the exact same, of not more sibilant than the S12's? Okay, I won't lie, when I got these initially I thought that it sounded super flat. However, recently I decided to try out the ER4SR. Those are FLAT. I mean, they are "____". And while flat sounding doesn't equal "good sounding" and it's purely subjective, I've found that that flat sound is MY subjective taste. So now let's go back to these headphones, they sound amazing, but since I've now adjusted to the sound of the Etymotics, these sound a lot more sibilant and airy. Again, while this may be a good thing for some (and an objective good thing for making out subtle mistakes in audio production), it is no longer for me. So, since the purchase of the ER4SR, my up-to-date personal review of the sound goes like this:  Bass: Amazing! Not really much to complain about here. It does slightly overpower some vocals in some songs, but I'm only saying that because I know how more-upfront mids sound, so not really a complaint.  Mids: As I said, they do sound slightly recessed, but not enough to make it a complaint. It is very good, and all vocals sound full.  Treble: This is where I am a bit more critical, as you could probably tell be the text leading up to this part. It does seem to be a bit more sibilant and harsh in the treble compared to the ER4SR. And while that can cause problems like overpowering the midrange, it's all very subjective and varies person to person. Some people will think that the treble is too much, some will think the treble is perfect, and some might even say it's not enough (and I hope the people in the latter seek a priest to perform an exorcism). But I think the objective truth is that these aim to have a very "clinical" sound, which allows for a more meticulous analysis of music, meaning that the somewhat-harsh treble is therefore justified.So why 4 stars if it's all very subjective? Why not 5 stars? While the sound is amazing for the price, the 1 star loss is mostly a result of the comfort. The headband starts to feel like it's digging into my skull when I wear it for 2 or less hours, the pads feel kind of hard when they're clamped on each side of your head, and the circular cups HAVE TO GO. The thing that the MEZE Empyreans do for the earcups is such an innovative design (and no, I've never heard, let alone seen, the headphones in-person). Also, off topic, I decided to mod my pair of DT990 Pros so that I could use the 4.4mm part of my Fosi DS1 DAC and therefore have more power being inputted into the headphones. Also, the mod allows the cables to be replaced.In conclusion, I like to end my reviews with a out-of-5 star rating. However, since these headphones have a very clinical approach to their tuning, I thought I'd do something similar. So, I give these amazing sounding DT990 Pros a 4.4195037484950272649598737385957372626485947252848593627284958/5.

Ronelio Matthew Ramos5.0 out of 5 stars
Genuine Earbuds, Very Comfortable and Extremely Clear with Active Noise Cancelling
Reviewed in Canada on March 31, 2024Verified Purchase
I bought these to upgrade from my old Samsung Galaxy Buds (1st Gen) and I was on the fence of which ones to replace them with. After comparing all the new headphones, I decided to pick these up (Buds2 Pro) and I have been very happy with them. The sound quality is extremely clear and the Active Noise Cancelling works sublime and feels very comfortable. In conjunction with my Samsung phone, the Wearables App lets me fine tune all the options I wanted in customizing the capabilities of these buds. There are tons of ways to play around with the headphones but I do love having them on a 'dynamic' EQ setting. I would highly recommend anyone that is on the fence to pick these headphones up.I also brought these from the eKings seller for $157 and they are indeed genuine.The box was still correctly sealed and showed no signs of tampering.

Colin Chevrier5.0 out of 5 stars
I Love This Monitor
Reviewed in Canada on May 4, 2021Model: LC49G95TSSNXZASize: 49 inchVerified Purchase
My current laptop doesn't have the power to push this monitor to it's limits but the picture is amazing. There is a lot of space to have multiple windows open which helps while I'm working.There are no defects with my monitor so it seems the quality issues with earlier units have been resolved. I have been using it for several weeks and don't see any dead pixels. There is no light leakage as has been mentioned by others.The monitor throws a lot of heat since I use it continuously all day. I don't think this will be an issue in my office but it might make a small room quite warm.Windows sometimes tries to use the headphone pass-through as the speaker source but it's easy to change the output back to my headphones or speakers. I don't know if this is a Windows quirk or not but it's not a big enough issue for me to spend time trying to fix.The price of the monitor is a little high but mine is worth every penny. I no longer have to tab between windows or scroll left or right in a window to see all the content. The Samsung Easy Box app lets you switched between predefined layouts and snap your windows into position. You can also adjust the size of the zones to fit your needs.

Report
Milez5.0 out of 5 stars
Awesome but some things to know.
Reviewed in Canada on December 7, 2020Model: LC49G95TSSNXZASize: 49 inchVerified Purchase
I read online forums and watched all the Youtubers for 3-4 months before purchasing this monitor. My two worries were scaling applications easily like a two monitor setup, and if a 2060 video card could push hard enough to play games as 30X0 series video cards are nearly impossible to find at the time of this review. There's a downloadable app called PowerToys with a something called "Fancy Windows" that allows you to divide up the screen very easily for productivity apps and it's actually glorious for me. I have 3 apps divided up evenly on the screen and there is lots of real-estate for it at the native 5140x1440. I had thought that I would have to run the 2060 video at 1080p, but have been surprised that by turning down to medium settings in games I can 70-90 fps in top titles at the full native resolution. I know most people would prefer to see over 100 fps, including me, but whether it's g-sync or something else, it feels smooth and is truly incredible. Far Cry 5, Witcher 3, Doom Ultimate, Battlefield 4, Battle Front 2, Elder Scrolls online all look great with minimal to no stretching at the sides. Fallout 76 is a mess as it has terrible support for Ultrawide. I only had to turn one game down to 1080p and I honestly cannot really tell. RTX is unusable dropping even Quake RTX down to 13 fps but it was never a great option on a 2060 anyway. In terms of the monitor itself. HDMI sound is not working. I'm deciding if I want to try a firmware update to fix this. I'm not sure it's that important to me. HDR is great in games and most games see it and turn it on without needing to turn on the dismal Windows implementation of HDR. The colour is great and the whites are very white. I didn't know what I was missing with my old ASUS gaming monitor. I definitely recommend this to a gamer that is savvy with their tech. If you are not a tech type and are uncomfortable with changing resolution settings and fixing glitches when you change the wrong setting, you might want to wait until there is better windows and game support for these.

Report
Reviewer123504.0 out of 5 stars
Great all-around mic
Reviewed in Canada on May 2, 2017Colour Name: BlackoutStyle: MicrophoneVerified Purchase
Some microphones are designed to be right up to your mouth and drop off sharply with distance.  This is not that.  This picks up the whole room.  It's not that one is better than the other, but that's what this does, and it does it well, so if that's what you need (but only if that's what you need) this is going to be great.  On minimum gain, there is no noticeable self noise in the recordings, and at full gain, it is present but not an issue unless you need a perfectly clean source, like recording music, etc.  The sensitivity, especially at full gain is amazing. Like I said, it really does pick up a room, and even things outside it on occasion.  If you are a singer, you won't need* to be all that close to this. If you are quite powerful, you might have to be even over a foot away to not clip.  *I say "need" but "be able to" could be swapped in here depending on how you view this...I find the sound quality to be very good.  I don't have a ton of reference for this but it seems neutral and clear.Blue advertises this as plug and play ("driverless") and it is.  It even works plugged into a Raspberry Pi 3.  Very easy to setup and use.The pickup pattern selector is a cool feature.  You are not bound by having just one kind of mic with this - it can be cardioid, omnidirectional, "front and back", and even stereo.  Personally, I find the rear muting of cardioid vs omnidircetional to be minimal at best, but you've still got the choice between an omnidirectional mic, and a true stereo (and boy does it work) at the flick of a switch.  Very cool.This also offers a built-in 3.5 mm jack for you to plug in headphones.  They will playback anything the mic receives with zero lag, which is great for monitoring.  They will also playback anything you want from the computer since you can select the mic as an output/playback device in the OS's sound settings.  The volume of each of these is independently controllable in sound settings as well.  Finally, the built in amp is decently powerful, able to go much louder than my onboard audio.  With the Yeti at about 25% it's already matching or beating my onboard at 50%, and that's a level I can't imagine anyone needing to exceed (that said this will obviously vary by headphone).But here is where we get into all my (rather minor, but plentiful) complaints:> On the topic of the 3.5mm jack, the internal DAC is not great.  At moderate to high volume, background hiss is rather noticeable with nothing playing.  I also find subjectively that after listening to music for a long time (many hours), it just starts to get on my nerves.  Neither this nor the hiss is something that happens with my onboard audio, even at higher volumes.> The switch for pickup pattern on the back is rather tight and hard to turn> The knobs on the stand that you tighten to hold it in place aren't the easiest to get tight either.  I mean, it's easy enough to get it good enough that the mic won't move around on you, but they could definitely have been better> The mic on/off button creates a pop when used, and the light stays on flashing when it is off, and is on solid when on.  The on behaviour makes sense but I'd like it to just go off when it's off.  Yes, then you wouldn't be able to tell it even has power, but you should be aware of whether its plugged in or not.> Finally, the mic volume in sound settings seems to move around sometimes.  It's almost like the mic will turn itself down if something is too loud or turn itself up if it's quiet.  This might sound good in theory but there are reasons you wouldn't want that.

Report
Joe904.0 out of 5 stars
Compact & easy to use
Reviewed in Canada on May 24, 2023Style: AirFly ProVerified Purchase
This arrived shortly before we flew and enabled my wife and I to listen to the on-board entertainment system using our own Air Pods.  I found it easy to set up and ready to use for two pairs of Apple Air Pods.  Other wireless earbuds or over the ear headsets should work as easy.  Having read other reviews I did set these up prior to flying - just in case of any difficulties.  The Airfly Pro comes in its own draw string cloth pouch and in pretty compact.  Also in the box was a USBA to USBC connector for recharging the power.  Sound quality is good with no noticeable latency.  I haven't yet tried this in the car as a Bluetooth device but will do in time.  If travelling on some European airlines you will need to acquire the two pronged adapter to plug in to the airline entertainment system and the Airfly then plugs in to that.  I purchased the Airfly in white but it can be purchased in black too.  If there is any deficiency in this I would suggest it is the lack of battery level indicator.  It is slated to have a 25 hour battery life and I charged mine ahead of travelling but I've no idea how long it takes to fully charge or indeed how much power remains after an 8 hour flight.

Report
Melanie5.0 out of 5 stars
Great sound for such a small device
Reviewed in Canada on November 22, 2020Colour Name: CharcoalConfiguration: Device onlyVerified Purchase




                    The media could not be loaded.
                



 HIGHLIGHTS of the new Echo Dot1) The response time is a little faster than on its predecessor. That said, I don't know if it's me, but I feel like Alexa can't hear me as well as on my gen3.2) Great new spherical shape.3) I really like the new location of the light which is now located at the bottom of the device. I find it more visible since it illuminates the surface on which the device is placed.4) The sound is "richer" with a little more bass and a wider angle of sound diffusion.5) The installation is very easy, 5 minutes and it's done!WEAKNESSES1) The CHARCOAL echo comes with a WHITE power cable... we agree that it's not very aesthetic... in any case, I don't like it. If I chose a black color it's because there was a reason, wasn't there?2) The power supply box is still as big as ever! Come on! it takes two power outlets wide...3) The buttons are really ugly and look cheap compared to previous generations. They're made out of some kind of plastic and are a little bit raised. I definitely preferred the smooth and flat buttons of the Echo Dot 3.4) Needs a few updates to improve the French Canadian version.I mainly use the Echo Dot to listen to my music on my sound bar. It's the functions, stop, pause, up/down the sound, put the sound at 3 to 7, next, who's that artist, add that song to my playlist, etc. that make my music listening experience much more enjoyable. No need to change tabs, or get up, everything is controlled by voice! Really convenient the voice technology combined with a subscription such as Amazon Music, Deezer and/or Spootify to listen to your music.SOUND | Compared to the Echo Dot 3rd generation, this one (4th gen) has a slightly improved sound. Probably this spherical style allows for a greater angle of sound diffusion. Rather than being propelled only upwards as on the 3rd gen, it diffuses both upwards and forward. In any case, if you don't like the sound of this dot, you can always pair your device with your sound bar/home theater. Personally, that's what I do, so sound quality is not a big concern for me. Having said that, I think it sounds really good for an alarm clock sized device! Also, the sound is much louder and richer than on the Echo Dot 3rd Gen no matter what some people say.IN SUMMARY | It can be used as an alarm clock, a timer, a calendar reminder, a calculator, help you fall asleep at night, answer your questions, give you quizzes, etc. There are so many things that can be done with this device that it is impossible to list them all here! Also, if you have other types of smart equipment, such as light bulbs, smart plugs, etc. you will surely find your own connection with this Echo Dot.
Read more

Sim Kaur5.0 out of 5 stars
The best !
Reviewed in Canada on December 5, 2023Size: 6QTStyle: Vortex PlusVerified Purchase
The Instant Vortex Plus 6-in-1 Air Fryer is a versatile kitchen appliance that allows you to easily air fry, roast, broil, bake, reheat, and dehydrate your favorite foods. With its 6-quart capacity, it can accommodate larger batches, making it suitable for families or gatherings.This air fryer features six one-touch programs, making it incredibly easy to use. Simply select the desired cooking function, and the air fryer will automatically adjust the temperature and cooking time for optimal results. Whether you want crispy fries, juicy roasted chicken, or perfectly baked cookies, this appliance has got you covered.One of the key benefits of the Instant Vortex Plus is its ability to air fry food without the need for excessive oil. It uses hot air circulation to cook your food, resulting in crispy and delicious dishes with up to 95% less oil than traditional deep frying methods. This makes it a healthier alternative for enjoying your favorite fried foods.In addition to air frying, the Vortex Plus can also roast, broil, bake, reheat, and dehydrate. This means you can cook a wide range of dishes, from succulent roasts to mouthwatering desserts. The included rotisserie basket and spit allow you to easily prepare rotisserie-style chicken, kebabs, and more.The Vortex Plus features a user-friendly control panel with a digital display, allowing you to easily adjust the cooking time and temperature. It also has a built-in timer and automatic shut-off function for added convenience and safety.Cleaning up is a breeze with the Instant Vortex Plus. Its removable parts, including the cooking trays and rotisserie basket, are dishwasher safe, making maintenance and cleanup quick and easy.Overall, the Instant Vortex Plus 6-in-1 Air Fryer is a versatile and convenient kitchen appliance that allows you to cook a variety of delicious and healthier meals. With its user-friendly features and multiple cooking functions, it is a great addition to any kitchen.

Report
4Jays5.0 out of 5 stars
I now understand the hype
Reviewed in Canada on November 11, 2022Size: 6QTStyle: Vortex PlusVerified Purchase
First impressions: Unopened damaged box looked like there might be some damage inside but product was ok, no doubt due to secure packing. It’s much larger than I had envisioned. It’s well made.It’s easy to clean the basket and inner tray with a bit of soapy water. I made sure not to immerse the basket. Wiped interior and exterior with a damp paper towel. Not much of an instruction booklet but luckily it’s very intuitive to use. Simple operation to change temp from °F to °C and to change presets. Ran an initial test run to break it in. Unlike many other users, there was only a very faint plastic smell on first use (during the test run) that dissipated quickly. I also did not find it to overly loud as some reviewers claimed. There is a hum, which you’d expect from any appliance with a fan, but it’s certainly not what I found to be loud.Display is large and easy to read. Controls are intuitive. Tried a small batch of (Costco) fries - Airfry 20 minutes @400°F. Next time will reduce time to 18 minutes. Very crisp!! Lovely colour. I’m impressed. Super easy clean up with soapy water. I can envision multiple ways to use this appliance everyday. Bonus: rapid preheat, doesn’t heat up the house like an oven, relatively quiet, quick and even cooking, easy non-stick cleanup.Very happy with my purchase. And the price was reasonable although it increased immediately (within minutes) after I bought it and fluctuates wildly from week to week. Nonetheless, I bought 2 more to set aside as gifts.
