wayne olstad5.0 out of 5 stars
Very easy to cook with!!
Reviewed in Canada on March 15, 2023Size: 6QTStyle: Vortex PlusVerified Purchase
I had been watching for a lower priced Instant Pot air fryer for a few weeks and finally ordered a discounted returned Instant Vortex Plus 6 in 1 air fryer. Best thing I`ve done for a quite a while! It was delivered on schedule just yesterday. After a good soapy warm water clean and an hour of dry time (I didn`t wash the control panel) - I plugged it in without any food in it, and yes there was plastic odor, let it heat up to 380 for 5 minutes, then shut it off, pulled the pan out, set in aside for 6 hours. Then ran it again empty 2 times, pulled the pan and let it all cool. Not much odor at that point. Then made toast. All good. Then put 4 frozen pork chops in and set on air fry 350 for 10 minutes, Then raised temperature to 380 for 15 minutes. Checking at several intervals to make sure they were not burning, and flipped them half way through. The result was perfectly delicious chops. And so easy clean up. Wipe and rinse. I am used to the controls on an Instapot presser cooker and find the air fryer controls simple and easy to adjust. By the way, this is the 3d air fryer I have had. This one is by far the best ever. Highly recommend this appliance.

Report
Peter S5.0 out of 5 stars
Gotta love the Buttblaster 3000
Reviewed in Canada on March 9, 2023Colour Name: Gold and WhiteVerified Purchase
We were away in Egypt, where every toilet had a little built in nozzle at the back of the bowl, and a progressive valve handle to turn on the side.  Very practical, very civilized.  Much better than doing the pants-around-the-ankle waddle to a free standing bidet (what were the French thinking?).When we got home, we started looking for something to replicate that experience.  This model was the cheapest, and had the best description, with dimensions and pictures showing the valve and water channels. Lacking a memorable name, we dubbed it the "Buttblaster 3000".This device is just as effective as the built-in models in Egypt.  Flow is easily regulated and the controls operate intuitively.  Powerful enough (if you turn it right up) for a truly memorable experience. Blasts Klingons better than James T Kirk ever could, and it is well targeted to hit the bullseye sitting in a comfortable normal position (at least on our throne). Nozzles retract behind the shield to protect from enemy fire when not in use.Negatives are minor.  According to my wife, the aim of the forward gun is almost the same as the rear, and requires personal repositioning to acquire its target. Its lighter spray is somewhat redundant given the adjustability of flow.  Also why are the provided spacers 3/4" thick when the device only lifts the seat about 1/4". Easily solved with some hard foam pad I had around the house.Do yourself a favour, install one on your throne.  Life will be fresher, the sun will shine brighter, you'll save on rash cream and your underwear will thank you.

user_reviews:
M.P.5.0 out of 5 stars
Best Sound Profile in TWS
Reviewed in Canada on September 22, 2023Colour Name: Platinum silverVerified Purchase
If it weren't for having the FXM4s, I'd rate this the best TWS product out there.  However, the 4s did have the advantage in 2 areas - better bass/low-end warmth, and better ANC.  I've A/B'd them extensively.  BUT, the new FXM5s have several advantages - form and fit being number one.  Secondly?  The stock sound profile is absolutely incredible - and offers more an "audiophile" tuning profile than the warm, fuller XM4s do.  This is not a bad thing - in fact, it's so good - I can't use the GEQ that comes with the new connect app - the stock sound is outstanding.Are they worth the price?  Not if you own the XM4s.  If you managed to see the once-in-a-while 20% discount?  More than likely yes.  If you truly love incredible sound and detail and clarity and precision in TWS format??  Most certainly yes.  The sound and new form make up for all other discrepancies.Note:  Batteries are draining equally between buds, no issues there.  Connect app works seamlessly.  They sound amazing - but they come at a price and they're not perfect.  Yet.

But they had excellent fit and grip. Basically you just put it in your ear and twist it and it locks in place, the more you twisted it the more secure it got, was perfect aside from a litle disconfort that you got used to. Harry4.0 out of 5 stars
1 month review

Passive noise canceling of the foam is excellent, even better than a earplug.... except it's uncomfortable to me.  After switching to a silicone alternative (AZLA SednaEarfit MAX standard) there's barely any passive noise canceling left.  Also surprisingly the ANC is very weak, it's heavily reliant on passive noise canceling to block out noise.  There's barely any silicone eartips with mesh on the market.  Noise canceling is next to nothing if you don't use foam.The battery is excellent, 9 hours playtime if I don't use any of the battery hungry settings.  Those are ANC, dsee extreme, and prioritize quality.  The playback hours I'm getting is about 75% of their claimed hours.  Which is still a lot.

I never really tried other remedies other than persistent cleaning and clipping the nails down to remove the fungal nails at the end.  Several applications needed on dry clean toes, but after a month, with trimming my toenails to cut off the old fungal bits, I looked down it was all gone.  The new toenail growth was clean and clear and pushed out the fungus as it grew and didn't replace any healthy nails with infected bits.  and It also works well on other skin irritations, if I get a flare up of dry itchy skin on my legs in a re-occurring spot, I apply this cream and it reduces redness and itchiness.  I have no doubt that it will work decently for every application that it advertises, as long as your skin type responds normally to the ingredients in the cream.

Report
Milspec Consulting Ltd.1.0 out of 5 stars
Intensionally misleading marketing
Reviewed in Canada on October 20, 2023Verified Purchase
The first time I bought this product, I was travelling in the US and the Maximum Strength worked very well.  This time, I purchased it from home on the Canadian Amazon site.There are 2 big issues with this product and the company, both concern intentionally misleading advertizing.The company sells two versions, "Regular Strength" and "Maximum Strength".  The only difference in the label is that the Maximum Strength version says Maximum Strength in tiny letters in the little red bar below the product name.1.  The product on the Amazon site clearly says Maximum Strength and it's more expensive than the regular, so one would think that are buying the version shown here.  The product I received did not say Maximum Strength.  When I contacted the manufacturer, they said they cannot sell the Maximum Strength version in Canada.2.  The label and documentation shown for this product clearly says "Maximum Strength".  However, when I showed the product to some friends and to my Pharmacist, they also thought it was the Maximum Strength because name reads "emuaidMAX."  However, because product the name is so large and says "emuaidMAX", people don't see the tiny words in the little red bar below it and think they are buying the maximum strength version when they are not.I checked other Canadian pharmacies and websites and they all advertize the same Maximum Strength product as Amazon - however, when I investigated, it turned out that they only carry the regular version.If it's true that the company KNOWS they cannot sell the Max Strength version in Canada, then the only reason I can think of for advertizing it like this is to intentionally mislead trusting people who, because of the label and price difference, believe they are buying what they are seeing.

title: Drysol Clinical Strength Antiperspirant | Available With Best Clinical Strength Protection (20% Extra Strength Solution 37.5ml)
description: STRENGTH PROTECTION: It is the most effective clinical strength antiperspirant available with the best clinical strength protection. Unlike other brands that offer clinical strength protection, the Drysol family of truly clinical strength antiperspirants has always been the market leader in helping patients suffering from excessive sweating.    DRYSOL IS CLINICALLY PROVEN: Drysol is the only clinically proven first-line therapy in Hyperhidrosis and Excessive Sweating. Drysol with Aluminum Chloride Hexahydrate (ACH) reduces perspiration 98% of the time and provides 30% reduction in sweat volume. The regular, so called, “clinical strength” brands can’t compare.    BETTER FORMULATION: Drysol has Aluminum Chloride Hexahydrate (ACH) not aluminum zirconium that is found in most regular so-called “clinical strength” brands. ACH is a larger molecule which is clinically proven to be the most effective active ingredient in forming a plug that blocks sweat output.    BETTER OPTIONS: Only Drysol offers different strengths and formats to use all over the body, not just the underarms that the so-called “clinical strength” brands treat. Excessive sweating can affect many parts of the body with a range of severity. The Hyperhidrosis Disease Severity Scale (HDSS) is a diagnostic tool that provides a qualitative measure of the severity of the patient’s condition using a scale of 1-4.    BETTER RESULTS AT A FRACTION OF THE COST: Drysol is the most economical clinical strength antiperspirant in the market today. Apply once a day and then once every 72 hours thereafter. Drysol provides wetness protection within 48 hours, and one bottle can last up to 4 months! Drysol lasts 2-3x longer than the so-called “clinical strength” brands.

I do a lot of canoeing which finds me in and out of the water a great deal with the use of water shoes.  The end result has been the odd blister on the heels of my feet.  Moleskin has been my go to product for years, but in a moisture environment I found it adhering to my skin for only relatively short durations, so always adding more.  A long distance hiker I follow on YouTube mentioned this product as being effective in all conditions, so gave it a try.  His advice was correct, as it stayed where I applied it, even with countless water entries into the canoe.  I have used it on several occasions now, and find it the most effective stuff.  I suppose duct tape could have worked in a pinch, but this is a fabric based product, and I feel its texture works better in what I would call a bandage application environment.

title: PlayStation 5 Console - Disc Edition [Model 3005720]
description: Lightning Speed - Harness the power of a custom CPU, GPU, and SSD with Integrated I/O that rewrite the rules of what a PlayStation console can do.    Stunning Games - Marvel at incredible graphics and experience new PS5 features. nav: Video Games › PlayStation 5 › Consoles
user_reviews:
Mario Williams5.0 out of 5 stars
New console is big, fast, quiet, and I love it.
Reviewed in Canada on December 3, 2020Verified Purchase
I preordered the console in September about an hour after the Sony event finished streaming and it was delivered to me on November 16.It is certainly a chonk of a console but was very easy to get the stand on (I have it vertical), and setup was very quick and easy. I was soon transferring my saves from the cloud onto the console. It runs very quiet which is great compared to my PS4 which sounded like a small jet taking off.The controller is great. It's a little larger and heavier than the PS4 controller but you get used to it rather quickly. The haptic feedback is awesome and is definitely an interesting sensation. I love the feel of the controller as the textured backing and handles gives a good grip. The built in mic and speaker work just fine, though I still find the sound to be a little on the quiet side, even after maxing out the volume setting and friends say I sound a little echoey.My only issues I had at the beginning were that none of the USB slots worked to charge controllers in standby mode. It would charge fine if the console was turned on but I usually plug in my headset and controller overnight. With the recent update however, this problem has been alleviated and now charges the controller in standby, but I noticed it won't charge my PS4 gold headset in any of the USB ports. I have the dongle plugged into the back and that works but it won't charge, in standby or when it's on. Unsure if this is  glitch or the console doesn't recognkze the PS4 headset hardware?I've only played a few games, currently demon's souls, miles morales, astro's playroom, apex legends, fall guys, and no man's sky. The PS5 games look amazing and now that I have a better console, no man's sky looks and runs so much better. The load times are very quick and jumping in and out of a game are fast and easy.Overall, I love this new console and am very pleased to have purchased it. Not only will new PS5 games be amazing to play but older PS4 games I have yet to play will benefit from various upgrades due to the hardware.
Read more

The Playstation 5 met all my expectations and to everyone out there who is saying that it is too expensive, I challenge you to build a computer with the same specs at this price. It would appear some developers have done some 'behind the curtains' optimization for the new system. I would wait on the Xbox Series X until some of the exclusives come out next year, there's really no point in buying it. But if you can get your hands on a PS5, be sure you do, it's awesome! About the microphone: for those of you who don't know, the PS5 has a built-in microphone in the controller. This is enabled by default, ensure the first thing you do when you get your system is mute it in the system settings.

Report
Tiffany5.0 out of 5 stars
Colic/Milk allergy
Reviewed in Canada on April 7, 2014Verified Purchase
If your infant suffers from colic or a milk allergy, this is what they need. My infant started having long bouts of crying and knees drawn up to his chest when we brought him after being born. After a week of this, I brought him to my family doctor and she said he probably was colic and there really isn't much you can do. My sister bought me Alimentum ready to feed and within a day or two his colic subsided. On day three he started having blood in his stools. After two days of some blood, he was admitted. It was his bowels clearing themselves of his milk allergy. He stayed on Alimentum ready to feed for about two months. I then realized you cannot purchase Alimentum powder form in Canada, so I slowly introduced Nutramigen ready to feed into his bottles (mixed the two). He tolerated the Nutramigen ready to feed so I kept him on this until he was 3 months old. At three months of age, I slowly introduced Nutramigen powder. He is doing great now. If your baby suffers from long bouts of crying it is not normal. Do not listen to your doctor if they tell you you cannot do much for colic. It is worth the money to try them on a hypoallergenic formula. If it wasn't for my sister, I would still be feeding him milk formula. Nutramigen is the best type because it has DHA and ARA for brain and eye development. Alimentum does not have this in their ready to feed and you cannot purchase the powder form in Canada.

nav: Home & Kitchen › Large Appliances › Washers & Dryers
user_reviews:
Brent Lidstone5.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing machine, but probably only for handy people
Reviewed in Canada on January 13, 2024Colour Name: BlueVerified Purchase
Let me get straight to the point here: Amazing machine, but probably only for technically minded people. What I mean is that it can be hard to set it up properly so that it works smoothly and steadily.FIRST OFF It will shake vigorously (especially in spin mode) so you need to attach it to something firmly. If you don't it will flail wildly and fall off your counter. HOWEVER you should note: There is a way to load the spin dryer properly that makes a HUGE difference! I've noticed if you just chuck stuff into it, it'll shake violently. But if you load stuff so that its lining the sides of the basket, with everything evenly spaced around the sides, it will shake MUCH less. I believe this is extremely important information everyone should know about. It makes a massive difference.Now that being said, I used double-sided tape to attach the feet to something and that is working great for me. However, if you just tape it right to a solid surface connected to your house, it will vibrate that part of your house pretty loudly. So if you're in a cramped apartment building you might not want to do that. What I did is I double-side taped it to a smooth wood board, and then put that on top of an old t-shirt (which is on the counter beside my bathtub). So this way the board can vibrate a lot without making a ton of noise. I also have a shelf on the side so it's impossible for it to fall off the counter - you'd likely also want some kind of extra blocker or support.Once you have it well set up with shake supports and rags or vibration and whatnot, its fine. You can absolutely turn it on and walk away - I have been every day. But I have mine well set up to be able to do so. I can see reviews from other people where they said they can't leave it unattended or they have to hold it the whole time - that's obviously just because they 1) didn't know how to securely attach it down to something to stop the shaking, and 2) didn't know that you have to load the spin dryer basket a certain way in order for it to not shake. Not that people can be blamed for this - the instructions don't even mention any of this.There's also the matter of attaching the hose itself. If you're lucky then the rubber-ended side of the hose will stretch over your bath faucet and it should be easy. But it might not. For me I had to unscrew the bath faucet tip and place the hose inside with a tiny rubber gasket over the hose to make a seal (So its a lot of work to re-attach it if it gets yanked out.. but I live alone and I don't really use the bath faucets.) But anyway keep in mind that it's possible a trip to a local hardware store, to buy little rubber gaskets or faucet adapters, MIGHT be necessary if you want the hose attachment to work properly.So my review is I highly approve, but you should understand what you're buying. If you're expecting a simple "out-of-the-box" experience, you might consider looking at one of the smaller and simpler types of these machines. This one is rather heavy-duty as far as portable washers go and thus its gonna require more set-up. But it also washes like a BEAST. This thing gets my clothes so clean it is amazing. The actual process of using it is a joy. Once you have it set up and working it's amazing. But unless you're the sort of person that has an easy time putting together IKEA furniture, this might not be the best fit for you.
Read more

Not that people can be blamed for this - the instructions don't even mention any of this.There's also the matter of attaching the hose itself. If you're lucky then the rubber-ended side of the hose will stretch over your bath faucet and it should be easy. But it might not. For me I had to unscrew the bath faucet tip and place the hose inside with a tiny rubber gasket over the hose to make a seal (So its a lot of work to re-attach it if it gets yanked out.. but I live alone and I don't really use the bath faucets.) But anyway keep in mind that it's possible a trip to a local hardware store, to buy little rubber gaskets or faucet adapters, MIGHT be necessary if you want the hose attachment to work properly.So my review is I highly approve, but you should understand what you're buying. If you're expecting a simple "out-of-the-box" experience, you might consider looking at one of the smaller and simpler types of these machines. This one is rather heavy-duty as far as portable washers go and thus its gonna require more set-up. But it also washes like a BEAST. This thing gets my clothes so clean it is amazing. The actual process of using it is a joy. Once you have it set up and working it's amazing. But unless you're the sort of person that has an easy time putting together IKEA furniture, this might not be the best fit for you.

Jason R.4.0 out of 5 stars

There isn't much to say about it, it's a USB-C PD charger that let's me take a proper charger with me when I travel without digging in the rats nest of cables around my TV to extract the charger the Switch came with from the dock.  It's clearly made well, you know that no corners were cut in terms of safety (something which I have become more keenly worried about when it comes to no-name chargers without any real certifications), and the price especially when on sale is pretty fair by Nintendo accessory standards considering it can be used to charge other things as well.In fact, this charger charges my phone just as well if not faster than the charger that came with it.  This is particularly nice when travelling because it means one less charger/cable set to pack when you're taking your Switch with you provided your phone uses USB-C and supports USB-C PD.  The actual charger brick is a little bit bigger than most phone chargers but doing double duty makes it worth bringing.The only thing that would have been an improvement is if the charging cable were not permanently attached to the wall wart, which would have made it more flexible for using the cable for other things or changing up the length (no need for such a long cable for travel, for example).

Mr. Le5.0 out of 5 stars
A must get nostalgic system.
Reviewed in Canada on September 25, 2022Edition: SNESVerified Purchase
I was so hyped when they announced this. I had already collected the NES classic edition so this was a necessary get for me. It comes with 2 controllers (big upgrade compared to the NES classic edition, which only came with 1 controller), 1 HDMI, and 1 power micro-usb plug and cable. The controllers are pretty much the same except for the fact that my hands have grown since I last played a SNES system. The 21 games that are included are Contra III: The Alien Wars, Donkey Kong Country, EarthBound, F-Zero, Final Fantasy VI (one of my favourites), Kirby Super Star, Kirby's Dream Course, The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past (another personal favourite), Mega Man X (one of the best SNES games ever), Secret of Mana, Star Fox, Star Fox 2 (never released in NA before), Street Fighter II Turbo: Hyper Fighting, Super Castlevania IV, Super Ghouls 'n Ghosts, Super Mario Kart, Super Mario RPG (another favourite of mine), Super Mario World, Super Metroid, Super Punch-Out!!, and Yoshi's Island. Some of these games I've spent hours playing as a kid. It's been super fun just to relive my childhood. Very nostalgic. If you can get your hands on one for a decent price, I would recommend getting it!I can't wait for the N64 classic edition to be released!

Report
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
Worth it for the Controllers Alone
Reviewed in Canada on October 25, 2018Edition: SNESVerified Purchase
I've been using SNES emulators for many years and they all have shortcomings.  This one works nearly flawlessly.Here are some details about how this differs from other emulators:1.  Emulation is nearly flawless.  That means sprite layers, audio, responsiveness and framerates are perfect.  I only say "nearly" because I haven't played through every SNES game completely, and since this is technically an emulator (not using original Ricoh CPU and chipset) there is bound to be some difference.  But I have tested many games - games that others thought worked fine on SNES9X etc. but I found unacceptable.  Everything I have tried works perfectly.2.  Instead of loading a Rasp Pi or other computer and using it's (sometimes) clunky interface, this machine boots instantly to simple, fast game load screen.  Don't underestimate the importance of haste and ease of use.  Gaming is supposed to be fun - not just a novelty hacking project.3.  Controllers are original.  It's difficult to overstate the importance of that.  There are thousands of knock off SNES controllers out there, and none come close to the perfection of this controller.  I could probably fly a space shuttle or perform brain surgery if a SNES controller was my way of doing so.4.  While the Classic ships with only those 21 (mostly good) games, Nintendo has given us all the most wonderful easter egg by making it EXCEPTIONALLY EASY to hack, allowing you to add ANY OTHER GAME YOU WANT.  I did it in about 15 minutes, and I am prone to headaches with such things.  No ugly modified OS - same as stock, but with more games - complete with box art just like the stock games.  Gorgeous.I'm not a Nintendo fanboy, but I do think the SNES is peak of console gaming, and even though it's sad to think that the game industry is so creatively depleted and overrun with adolescent fantasy violence that we are satisfied to hand them money for simply re-releasing their old console, the fact is this system blows all the new systems away.  If Nintendo gave up on new systems and just kept manufacturing and supporting the SNES Classic, that would be a major improvement in gaming.

"circledrag"5.0 out of 5 stars
Great nostalgia trip! Just don't pay more than $100 for one!
Reviewed in Canada on October 6, 2017Edition: SNESVerified Purchase
I was able to buy one where most other retailers were sold out. I did need to have a Prime Membership though but it was available for 10 minutes, enough time for me to sign up to get one. Shipped over the weekend and got it on Monday before noon. Great product even though I already have a Raspberry Pi and it can do 1080p in emulation as opposed to 720p which the SNES CE does.Don't pay more than $100 for this though as there will be more on the way from Nintendo. These scalpers are pretty stupid. They're going to do their best to keep up stock through the end of the year and will also be re-releasing the NES Classic Edition in 2018 but I would rather have this SNES CE. With some technical know-how you'll soon be able to mod it and add more games (including NES games). There is a great selection of games on this (most of which I already own the original cartridges for) and you can't really beat the presentation and the quality of the controllers (although the controller cords, HDMI and power cords could have been a lot longer like the original SNES).The main reason I bought this was to have a legit copy of Earthbound which is my favourite RPG of all time. All that said, if the Super Famicom or European edition of the SNES were available for the same price and the controllers had concave X & Y buttons I probably would have gone with one of those instead simply based on the design alone. One of the strangest omissions in the lineup for this is Super Mario All-Stars and Chrono Trigger (even though I've never really played it), I'm also surprised they didn't include any of the Final Fight games or Super Street Fighter II instead of Street Fighter II Turbo. Wild Guns, Super Double Dragon, NBA Jam, Mortal Kombat II and TMNT: Turtles In Time would have been great to see as well.It would have been nice to have Game Genie or Game Shark support but we all know they're note gonna allow that, especially since they'd have to get permission from companies they've tried to block from selling their products.

title: Bose QuietComfort 20 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones, Apple Devices, Black
description: Compatible Devices: iPhone, iPad and iPod models    Included Components: QuietComfort 20 headphones, Apple devices, 3 pairs StayHear tips (S, M, L), clothing clip, rechargeable lithium-ion battery (built-in), USB charging cable, carrying case    Ideal for iPod, iPhone and iPad. Usb cable is 30.5 cm long    Noise cancelling reduces surrounding distractions, letting music stand out    Aware mode lets you hear what's around you when you need to, at the touch of a button    Exclusive TriPort technology and Active EQ help deliver lifelike, digital-quality audio    Stay Hear Plus tips provide long-lasting comfort plus stability. :Rechargeable lithium-ion battery. Charging time - 2 hours. Battery life - 16 hours per full charge
nav: Electronics › Headphones, Earbuds & Accessories › Headphones
user_reviews:
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
Great for air travel
Reviewed in Canada on April 5, 2020Style: iPhoneColour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
As far as noise-cancelling ear buds go, Bose are the best on the market for sure.  But, there are still limitations with ear buds. I had an off-brand pair before these and they are way better for sound quality, noise cancellation and WAY better for battery life.I use them mostly for air travel. The sound quality is the best, perfectly crisp and rich. When the volume is up, I hear things in songs I've been listening to forever that I never knew were there. They completely cancel out engine noise. They mostly cancel out people talking but I found there are some voice frequencies that get through, though faintly.  Unfortunately, if there is baby crying nearby, that frequency gets through also.  It's much more faint but it's not gone.  Turning up the music fixes this, but I like to keep my music low so I can sleep. This is still much better than any others I've used and I am very happy with them. For FULL noise cancellation, I think you need to go to headphones but I have no interest to travel with those or try to sleep on a plane with them on.  Highly recommend the Bose earbuds.

Report
Ted Grav5.0 out of 5 stars
The best solution for a quiet night's sleep.
Reviewed in Canada on May 14, 2019Style: iPhoneColour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
These headphones are expensive, but oh so worth the price if you value sleep. The noise cancelling is quite amazing and the only solution I've found that can block a snoring partner, loud traffic or noisy hotel air conditioners enough to allow for a restful nights sleep. They are much more comfortable (and more effective) than earplugs and stay in all night. When turned on without input sound they emit a low level white noise, which, it turns out is very relaxing to fall asleep with.The only complaint I have is the control/battery box which is too close to the headphone jack. When plugged in to a device, it dangles awkwardly. Particularly difficult if you are plugging in to a phone that is in your pocket. Since I mostly just use these during the night as noise blockers not plugged in to a device, this hasn't been a big issue for me, but if I used them as my main portable headphones I could see it being one.Battery is good, it easily last me through 2 - 8 hour sleeps.

Report
Some random4.0 out of 5 stars
I like them quite a bit but have some critiques
Reviewed in Canada on February 19, 2021Style: AndroidColour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
I come from the world of competitive gaming and these things are pretty essential for anyone playing at the professional level. So I know a lot of people who have them and most people speak really highly of them. I didn't buy them for gaming, however. They can do the job for gaming, but if you want an optimal gaming experience, use a good quality headset.Where these really shine for the average person is if you travel a lot and need noise cancelling. That's why I bought them. I travel a fair bit and these are definitely clutch for travel. Planes and trains in particular, these are really, really good. I don't recommend them for walking around on the street or while driving because you need to hear at those times to stay safe. They are also reasonably useful when you are sharing a space with people having conversations or watching tv. Not perfect, but pretty good. I think it's more just the limitations of active noise cancelling technology these days rather than the QC20s themselves that make them less than perfect for this.For music, I've been pleased with them. Not blown away by any means though because I have a number of pairs of actually really good headphones, both open-backed and closed-backed. These have good noise isolation with the shape of the rubber earbuds and they sound pretty good when they're not 'turned on'. The key thing to note about them is the 'on' switch doesn't just engage the noise cancelling.... it literally enhances the music quality quite a bit. The music becomes louder and the lows are way more prominent. With them 'off', they still sound good and I feel good listening to them 'off'. I can still enjoy music like that, it's just a different experience with them turned 'on'. Music is fuller and richer when they are 'on' and they can sound a bit dull and flat when they're 'off'. The reason I am going on and on about this is because they will potentially run out of battery on you at some point if you leave them 'on' all the time. You could also leave them 'on' by accident and walk away, coming back to a pair of earbuds with no noise cancelling. The reason I bought these over wireless earbuds that are roughly the same price is that even if they do run out, they're still good as standard in-ears. If your wireless earbuds run out of battery you have to put them away and wait for them to charge. If you're in an area where you really could use some music, noise isolation, or to make a phone call, you'll wish you had wired in-ears like these.My main complaints with these are that the sound could maybe be a bit more impressive at this price range, they're sort of an old product at this point and have been on the market at the same price for a LOOOOONG time, and that the earbuds themselves feel a bit cheap and plastic. They buds are super lightweight as a result of this plastic so it's kinda hard for me to hold this against them because the light weight means you can wear them for really long listening sessions comfortably. I just worry that they might shatter at some point by accident. They feel that delicate. I also returned my first pair because I heard something like a spring loose in the right bud when releasing the right side bud after pushing it in my ear. I thought that was a factory defect and that the buds would die on me at some point. The replacements I got have the same issue in the right earbud but it's less pronounced this time so I'm just going to keep them and see how it goes. Not really confidence inspiring on the quality of them, though. I sort of feel like I'm waiting for that right ear bud to die on me.If you've seen the other reviews out there, hopefully this one added to those a little bit. This is by no means a comprehensive review of these things. I just figured I would add a few things that typically don't get covered in the reviews you find on the internet about these things.Overall, I would recommend them for certain people - those that travel a lot and want an uninterrupted listening experience even if the battery dies. I'd also recommend them to competitive gamers that have to wear white-noise headphones on stage to prevent listening to the casters and audience. Those are really the only people who I think will get a big benefit from these.

Andrew Davies5.0 out of 5 stars
Never Lose Your Valuables Again!
Reviewed in Canada on January 7, 2024Style: 1packVerified Purchase
As someone who often rushes out the door and misplaces things, the Apple AirTag has been a game-changer for me. Here are my detailed thoughts:Ease of Use: The AirTag is incredibly user-friendly. Setting it up was quick and hassle-free. The integration with my iPhone is seamless, making it easier than ever to keep track of my belongings.Functionality: Its primary feature, the tracking and sound-triggering capability, has saved me countless times. Whether it's my keys or my wallet, a quick glance at my phone and selecting "Play Sound" helps me find my lost items in no time. The accuracy is impressive, and the sound is loud enough to hear even from a distance.Design: Typical of Apple products, the AirTag has a sleek, minimalist design. It's small and discreet, making it easy to attach to or slip into anything I'm afraid of losing.Reliability: I've used it multiple times in various situations, and it hasn't failed me yet. The peace of mind knowing that I can find my keys or wallet at a moment's notice is invaluable.Versatility: After experiencing its usefulness with my keys, I've added another AirTag to my wallet. It's comforting to know I have this level of tracking for my most important and often misplaced items.Conclusion: The Apple AirTag is an essential for anyone who finds themselves frequently misplacing items. It's a small investment for the convenience and time saved in not having to search for lost items. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking to simplify their life and reduce daily frustrations.Rating: 5 stars

This bed is quite comfortable.  Set up is a breeze.  Just unzip and stretch out the frame, plug it in.  Then select your desired firmness, it has 3 levels and turn the dial to inflate.  It’s really very quick about 3 minutes and not overly noisy.  So far the bed has been quite good at maintaining it’s air pressure during the night and having the extra height provided by the frame makes it so much easier to get in and out of bed, especially sleeping beside a partner than a traditional air bed (mattress).  Putting the bed away is also quite easy, turn the dial to deflate, then the sides of the bed fold in on themselves.  Fold up the frame and zip back into the bag.  The bag is roomy and we have found the bed goes back in quite easily.  So far very happy with this purchase.

title: Insta360 ONE X2 360 Degree Waterproof Action Camera, 5.7K 360, Stabilization, Touch Screen, AI Editing, Live Streaming, Webcam, Voice Control
description: The Pocket Camera Crew: With just one device, shoot first in every direction with super 5.7K 360 capture and then choose your favorite angle later. Or pick just one lens with Steady Cam mode for ultra-stable wide angle footage.    FlowState Stabilization: Better-than-ever stabilization and horizon leveling algorithms keep your shots steadyno gimbal needed.    Invisible Selfie Stick: Shoot with the Invisible Selfie Stick and then watch it disappear in your edit. Capture easy drone-like angles and third-person perspectives with the flick of a wrist.    IPX8 Waterproof: Insta360 ONE X2 is waterproof to 10 meters (33ft). Take it out in a rainstorm or surfing without a case.    In the Box: 1x Insta360 ONE X2, 1x Charge Cable, 1x Battery, 1x Protective Pouch and 1x User Guide.
nav: Electronics › Camera, Photo & Video › Video › Action Cameras
user_reviews:
Kiwi5.0 out of 5 stars
Awesome little beast.
Reviewed in Canada on February 20, 2021Style: StandaloneVerified Purchase
Okay I've been using the X2 once or twice a week for the past 2 months. Mostly for skiing, some car stuff, but mostly skiing.The pros:1) Small, compact, and easy to use. I can operate it in the freezing cold with my ski gloves on which has been a huge plus for someone who skis where it's regularly -20C. the screen is easy to navigate and if you set it correctly, it's just a quick button hit to start & stop.2) The Battery - not to drop names, but my other action camera would die in the freezing cold or if it was running at full steam in the sun within 3-5 minutes. This thing? No problem. I've shot 10+min long timelapses in freezing weather and the thing is fine. It's seriously impressive. This was my biggest worry.3) The durability. I've whacked it on trees (wouldn't recommend), dunked it in snow and dropped it onto a cliff off a chairlift (whoops! I'm an idiot). The thing has survived it all. I've broken and fixed the pole more often than the camera. My skis are more banged up than this thing, and they've never seen a rock before.The Cons:1) The videos take a long time to edit. I do it on my phone because the phone app is much better than the computer app. I have experience with video editing so it's not too too hard, but I can see it being challenging for some. Going into 360video though, you should expect to spend more time on editing than regular videos. There are way more possibilities with 360 post-process reframing, but it will take time.2) When in low light, stills from videos will not be that crisp, and you should expect that. The stills from videos in bright light are fantastic (seen in the last 2 photos posted) but low light isn't GREAT.Overall - I would 100% recommend. It's an incredible little camera and for the price it can't be beat!
Read more

What I like most is that you can reframe after you film, all the different angles quite easily.Battery life is pretty good - I don't worry about not having enough juice for a whole day shooting, and I just bring a battery pack in case I need to recharge while shooting.My one complaint is that the voice command seems very finicky, it stops recording thinking you said "stop recording" even though no one said that - I had to disable this feature, which is unfortunate as this was one of the main features I was looking to use.  A word of caution, please ensure you test this out before the amazon return period runs up, I have just missed the return period by a few days as I was dealing with technical support, and it looks like I will have to send the unit back instead of using the quicker amazon exchange.

Great camera, so-so app

The camera itself is fantastic, great picture quality, solidly built, plenty of accessories, pretty easy to use and intuitive.. love that it blurs out the selfie stick, makes for some wild videos/pictures that leave people scratching their heads, although it sometimes leaves a very visible line where it tries to 'stitch' the video together and somewhat ruins the shot.The app (iOS) on the other hand, is borderline unusable at times, it's crashed many times on me, takes forever to render videos, has a steep learning curve, the AI doesn't always allow you to move the view as you'd like, forcing you to make multiple view point changes to get the desired effect. It's a real pain in the nuts at times.. Not to mention their PC software is hidden behind a paywall and I couldn't get the free version to work, despite having a powerful gaming PC.I wish editing didn't use AI all the time, I want to be able to manually pan the camera and do things without AI analyzing and doing it for me.Do your homework, look up many videos on how to use the app and the camera is worth it. That goes for all 360 cameras, but especially so ANY Insta360 ones..

If you are considering purchasing this wireless sound system, please take note of some specific details regarding its connectivity. user_reviews:
Scorpio5.0 out of 5 stars
Fantastic mic however by no means recommended for everyone
Reviewed in Canada on August 24, 2022Style: SM7BVerified Purchase
Beware:If there's anything I've learnt by using this mic is that it's not for everyone. Nor is it for anyone who understands it's purpose and how it works let alone the little caveats that come with it. This is a studio grade mic. It's expensive. It requires you to know what you are doing to set yourself up properly for your intended use. By no means this is an entry (plug and play) mic for anyone out there, even less so for anyone who intends to use it for commentary (looking mainly at all of you who want to make youtube videos and streams). Do keep in mind that this mic shouldn't ever be your first pick, not at this price point and not without a good knowledge because you will be disappointed.If your intentions are to do commentary and broadcast, there are far more affordable options that you can tweak to sound like this one.If your intentions are musically inclined then this may be a better option for you however not the first either.In any case keep in mind that this is a VERY quiet mic, it takes a good amp to drive it. It's not a plug and play mic, you have to EQ it to your intended use (not that you can't just use it as is, just won't give you the results you are seeking). It certainly is very pricey due to the quality, branding and popularity - there may be just as good options out there for you to look at.Actual review:I've tried and used a fair share of mics for various purposes and went up the ladder until I could finally buy this one. All I can say is that it's damn worth it. In the year or more I've had it, it served me fantastically and I genuinely can't find any complaints. When it comes to music, this thing makes all the instruments I've used pop which is a pleasure to listen to. Highly suggest this product but only if you read what I've said up there in the beware.

Christopher B. C.5.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing microphone! Great upgrade from the AudioTechnica AT2020.
Reviewed in Canada on March 29, 2024Style: SM7BVerified Purchase
I was using my AudioTechnica AT2020 for 2-3 years, and it did the job perfectly. However, I did hand it off to a family member, and settled to finally trying out the Shure SM7B I had heard so many great things about. Not disappointed at all!The quality is amazing. I had watched a few videos to compare it to other "high end" microphones, and it is difficult to see the difference at that level, but I still wanted to make the move for a microphone with an amazing reputation such as this one. I set mine up with a Scarlett Focusrite 2i2 4th Gen interface, and, so far, it's been amazing! Any "issues" that I thought I was having were easily fixed by simply googling about it and watching a few YouTube videos to help me set it up properly. Greatly recommend!If you are having the same issue I was with it only playing in the left channel (left ear) alongside a Focusrite Scarlett interface, make sure to try out the following steps:a) Download your audio interface's drivers, as well as Focusrite Control 2 (at the time of writing this).b) Restart your PC.c) Go to your Windows Sound Settings.d) Go to Recording.e) Find your microphone (i.e. Analogue 1 + 2), right-click it and go into Propertiesf) Go to Advanced and change it to 1 channel rather than 2 channels (I personally use 24 bit, 48000 Hz (Studio Quality)).If that did not work, good luck troubleshooting!

Chris B.5.0 out of 5 stars
It's amazing.
Reviewed in Canada on January 16, 2021Style: SM7BVerified Purchase
From what I read, the only negative reviews are from people who have zero or very little knowledge of how a microphone works. It's actually embarrassing to see their "review" and to have so many "helpful" likes on them. The mic is incredible. I use it for recording YouTube videos. In order from my mouth to the computer I have the SM7B on the PSA1 boom arm connected to an XLR cable connected to the Fethead connected to the Focusrite 2i2 which connects to my laptop. Some people claim the Fethead should be connected to the mic side but it makes no difference at all. When called out about this, they say it's not the Fethead's fault but cheap XLR cables. So I plugged in some Amazon Basics XLR cables and it works fantastic with the Fethead on the Focusrite side. People like to just spew non-sense for the fun of it. One piece I didn't mention is the Shure A26X 3" Extension Tube. I have this hooked up between the mic and the psa1 boom arm. This piece is optional but if you search for that piece on YouTube, you will see why you may like to have it. I paid around $20 Canadian for it. The mic sounds absolutely fantastic for professionally made YouTube videos and cuts out a lot of the background noise. I also had the SM57. The background noise is about the same but the quality of the SM7B is better. It also gives you options to help make it compliment your voice unlike the SM57 or SM56. Those are both fantastic mics, but you can't beat the SM7B and it looks so much cooler than having that massive ugly grey windscreen on it that you have to buy for the SM57. Just take the cash hit and invest in this setup. It's brilliant.

Reviewed in Canada on March 26, 2022Style: SM7BVerified Purchase
Where do I begin?  This mic is legendary, and that signature, warm rich sound capture is what I believe launched my audiobook narration career! I have a mid range, rather sibilant and naturally plosive  voice. I tried a lower priced podcast style mic, but it didn’t really complement my voice, even with eq and enhancement during mastering.I was not getting any response to my auditions, so after himming and hawing about the price, and reading endless reviews here and elsewhere, I pulled the trigger and bought this mic.Wow! A match made in heaven! This mic was made for my voice. I started recording auditions with it, and bam! I got my first audiobook job, with several other interested offers! Was it the mic, and its signature warm sound that complemented my voice?  Maybe.. !You will need a cloud lifter like a Fethead, which I use to get some real good gain into your interface.This extra gain keeps the noise floor down, so you don’t have to ram the levels up to get good db into your daw.Also, this mic has amazing emi and rfi rejection.  Very low noise, compared to the lower priced podcast mic I used previously, which I had to remove hum noise from in post with a denoise plugin. Even in less imperfect recording areas with some room reverb, this mic can tame that. Great background rejection.Love this mic, thanks Shure! Awesome product.

Words cannot describe the change in performance.I thought my 9600k was still a decent chip before I upgraded. Now I see although it was decent, I was missing a lot. My rtx 2080 super didn’t get upgraded this year but I’m sure it’ll need to by next year as it’s now always peaked at 100% in games. While my gpu works a sweat trying to not burn itself to the ground, this 13600k sits around 20-30% usage and around 50 degrees Celsius in most situations.Depending on the motherboard, you may want to tweak “CPU lite load” settings. My MSI mobo defaulted to mode 12 and was causing overheating issues due to current. Now dialed back to mode 9, I have lost no performance what so ever, I actually gained almost a thousand extra points in cinebench by not letting it get hot.Overall I’m very happy and would highly recommend this cpu to anyone.

Worse than Samsung Galaxy S10?
Reviewed in Canada on October 18, 2023Style: S22Colour Name: BlackSize: 128Verified Purchase
I upgraded from an S10 to this and honestly don't notice much improvement. Almost feels like a step backwards in some ways:-  The face recognition is a nice feature when it works, but since I wear hats it tends to throw off the face recognition feature. Nonetheless I do really like this feature and am hoping on newer models they will work to strengthen this.- The fingerprint scanner I can't comment too much on since I put a tempered screen protector on my phone because with my S10 I broke the screen when I dropped it and that's why I had to upgrade. So I didn't want to go through the same ordeal with this phone and opted to protect the screen. I think this is making the fingerprint scanner a bit shoddy so opted for facial recognition to reduce dependence on this.- I feel like the battery life is the same as the S10 which was disappointing since I was hoping this generation would be slightly better. I'm even questioning if maybe the battery life is worse?....but maybe there are some new apps working in the background I'm unaware of that are draining the battery. I also find it takes a bit longer to charge than my S10. They didn't include a phone charger (only the USB-C cable), but I do still have my charger from my S10 so I use that to charge this phone. I really hope Samsung and Apple start including chargers back into their phones again. They seem to really be cheaping out on their phones while forcing us to pay more for less.- The camera quality is definitely better than the S10, but can't say if it's worthwhile enough to switch to the S22 if your S10 is still going strong.- They removed the headphone jack and also does not come with a pair of headphones.....again Samsung and Apple are cheaping out again and forcing consumers to pay more for less.- I really miss the heart rate sensor from my S10. They removed this from all models going forward (S20, S21, S22, & S23). I really enjoyed this feature since I suffer from a bit of anxiety and I would use the heart rate monitor to measure my heart rate when I was feeling anxious and then focus on my breathing to bring it down. This has saved me in so many social situations and it's really unfortunate they decided this was worth removing going forward in order to push their terrible smart watches that no one wants.Overall I am not too impressed with this phone but am hoping it will at least last me 3-4 years and hopefully by that time Samsung is able to deliver a phone that feels like a true upgrade and maybe even bring back the heart rate monitor…..please.

Report
Rj Achacoso5.0 out of 5 stars
It's expensive...but I think it's definitely worth it if you have the budget!
Reviewed in Canada on January 24, 2021Verified Purchase
It's been a while since I've used an XBOX controller (still have my XBOX 360), but after picking this up, I immediately remembered why I loved using these controllers over PS's Dualshock: the build quality and the heft. To be fair, I'm making comparisons to the DualShock 3 on my PS3, and things have probably changed since then, but there's is still a noticeable difference.First off, the weight of this controller really gives it a substantial feel in the hand, so it doesn't feel like you're holding a flimsy piece of plastic in your hand. Second, the hard, rubberized soft-touch plastic that they use is REALLY nice in the hand, and while I think it'll eventually wear out with heavy use, it still feels way better than any PS controller I've ever held. As for the buttons and joysticks, they also carry on the sense of quality. The joysticks are rubberized and have a knurled design on them which helps with grip and the concave design means your thumbs won't slide off them very easily. The triggers feel like you're pressing INTO them rather than just pressing them like conventional buttons, which feels cool with FPS and arcade games. Even though I don't use the metal triggers on the bottom, they do feel nice and it's convenient if I ever need to use them (which I will eventually when I start playing more PC games)As for battery life, I started using it out of the box and so far it's still not dead, so I trust that this controller won't die quickly. The case that comes with it includes an extra set of controls to switch out the default ones, as well as a magnetic stand that holds the controller in place, which is very fancy dancy!As for connectivity, there's definitely latency or delayed input between pressing a button an it registering on the screen when using Bluetooth, but it's not enough to distract or bother me to the point where it becomes unplayable. If you think it'll bother you, I suggest getting the XBOX Bluetooth adapter, since I've heard online that it does help a bit with latency (or just plug it in directly to your PC/XBOX).Extra niceties: it uses USB-C for charging and connectivity, so if you already use USB-C for your phone (or in my case, my phone and my laptop), you can rest easy knowing that you don't always have to carry the included cable with you (I personally use an existing USB-C to USB-C cable when plugging the controller into my laptop).NOTE: make sure you update the controller via plugging it into your PC if you're going to use this on your Android phone. If you immediately connect it you your phone the first time without updating it, the buttons won't be properly mapped to your game, but instead will navigate around your phone (exit the game, change apps, open the Search bar, etc.).
Read more

Charge seems to last a really long time as well.Occasionally I accidentally hit the paddle buttons, but this is a pretty minor quibble.What's a more annoying thing is you can't program other buttons to be the back button on a normal Xbox controller.  I play Rock Band a lot, and overdrive is deployed by pressing that back button, so I'm still stuck with using the actual back button on the controller instead of being able to reprogram it to another button.  TBF it's not mentioned in the description that you can program buttons to be the back button, so fair enough, but still annoying.

Harrison1.0 out of 5 stars
A great controller, but the build quality is absolutely Abysmal
Reviewed in Canada on November 5, 2019Verified Purchase
Edit* I would not recommend buying this controller. I am currently trying to get my second one replaced, and they are not responding it under warranty. These controllers do not last longer than 6-8 months before you have stick drift or button failure issues. Disappointed in Microsoft for their build quality and support quality.I received my elite controller yesterday morning, as usual, Amazon's shipping is great!This review is going to be aimed more at those who owned the original Elite Controller. Although I'll try and make it work for everyone.For some context, I have had multiple of the original elite controllers. I didn't have any of the issues with the bumpers breaking or the grips peeling. My issue was the sticks starting to drift. My first one lasted me a year and a half, then the second one I had replaced via the warranty after about 8 months. I sold the third one a few days before I received this one and it was still working fine after about 14 months.This controller feels SOLID. The last one felt pretty good compared to regular controllers, but this one feels amazing compared to even the original elite controller.Let's start with the new features.My favorite thing about this controller over the original elite controller is the charging dock. You can remove it from the carrying case for those wondering. I have it sitting on my bedside table so I can have my headphones plugged into it while I watch TV late at night. Now my controller will be fully charged at the beginning of every day!The new adjustable tension in the thumbsticks is pretty fantastic. I no longer over compensate my aiming as much when I'm playing a FPS! It is super easy to adjust with the provided tool, however if for some reason you lose it, you can adjust it with something you find around the house like a tiny screw driver or maybe even a steak knife.The third profile that they added will be nice. I'm sure I'll start playing more than two games at some point... But even if I don't, maybe I'll set up a multi media profile, which leads me to my next point.The new paddle functions! Like the original elite controller, you can customize what button does what and remap different buttons. However, there are a couple of new functions with this! You can now map functions such play/pause, record and screenshot, and even volume control of the TV.With these new paddle functions, they also added the ability to map a button as the shift key. This allows you to map a second button to each function.The paddles themselves seem to be a lower profile than the original elite controller. They don't stick out as far and they are more comfortable in your hands.The only con for me so far, is that the joysticks they provided don't all have two. The dome top thumbsticks and the tall thumbsticks only have one of each, so you can't put two on your controller.The provided USB type C cable is great quality aswell.Overall, I'm very please with this controller. At $230 dollars it will not be worth it for most people to buy. However, if you think the price tag is worth it for a exceptional controller, then you will not be disappointed.

S.M. Family5.0 out of 5 stars
Great cooler, great price!
Reviewed in Canada on March 19, 2024Style: PA120 SEVerified Purchase
Installed this to replace the Wraith Spire cooler for my R5 3600, brought the temps right down to normal! Keeps idle temps around 35C in a 22 degree room at 20% fan speed, which is nearly silent. Under full load, fans at 100%, keeps temps below 60C. All of this using the included thermal paste, so don't bother with any other brand of paste unless you really need the extra 5% dissipation. Only complaint is that the springs on the mounting bracket make it hard to feel if you've caught the screw or not, if the studs on the bracket were another 5mm the studs could catch without compressing the spring and make it much easier to install. But since every cooler is like that, can't complain. 10/10 cooler! Will update in a month or so if the performance degrades.

LiveWire5.0 out of 5 stars
Is it worth upgrading from prior Regular 1080pFireSticks?.... YES! A+
Reviewed in Canada on October 15, 2021Verified Purchase
I almost find this hard to believe but this is now my 6th FireStick! My first trial experience with Amazon Smart and Streaming products was picking up a regular FireTV Stick along with an HD8 Tablet when on sale during the July 2019 Canada Prime Day and we now have these all over the house in addition to the “regular” 1080p one I first purchased in 2019 which is now at a weekend property. I recently also picked up the brand new 4K “Max” variant for my main Home Theatre, but that is a lot more money than this 4K version. I wanted this Stick being reviewed to retire that original 2019 one and have a better 4K version of the stick to replace it. That brings us to the question “is THIS another new 4K version”? Well, it is and it isn’t.....I was a bit confused when I first saw this listing as it appeared around the same time as the launch of “Max” but there is also another 4K Firestick listing that is several years old (with 30,000+ reviews on it!) I thought, is this one another NEW 4K stick I was not aware of? Well, after scrutinzing all the specs and details, this version appears to be exactly the SAME as the other 4K listing (from what I can tell) other than the fact that it has been refreshed with a updated Alexa remote that now also has 4 dedicated “1-click” access buttons for certain services. My current 4K sticks released several years ago have the “normal” remote (see comparison pic). I will touch on this refreshed remote control first....I now find I really like the newly redesigned remote! It’s still very familiar with the same same size and footprint of my prior remotes, but at first glance I was actually annoyed by the inclusion of the quick access buttons for 4 pre-set services as these are set in stone and NOT changeable to something else. But then I thought these are services I ACTUALLY USE!, so its very convenient for my household. The 4 hotkey buttons are for direct access to Prime Video, Amazon Music, NetFlix and Disney+. I believe that US 4K Sticks have a “Hulu” button in place of Amazon Music button on the Canadian retail version, but that would make sense as Hulu is now a huge service down South.Well, so how about this newer 4k Stick “Refresh”?... Keep in mind that I am really just basing my comparison on “upgrading” from an older regular 1080p only FireStick which is what I am doing here. There are some extra benefits from going from a 4K the new 4K “Max” as well, but the Max is $30 more so it is hard for many to justify that price point difference. So, lets look at this “newish” 4K Stick...This 4K stick basically includes all of the same accessories as prior FireSticks. You get a USB power cord with a charging wall/power brick, an HDMI extender dongle (which is very handy in situations where you need to reposition the stick due to space issues in the back of you TV, batteries to power the remote, and the refreshed Alexa enabled remote as already noted.SetUp is very easy as with all prior generation FireSticks. Once pluggIed into power and you turn on your TV you will be met with the Update screens within a few moments. You just need to take a few minutes to follow the simple on screen prompts to log into your network for the first time, and then after entering your Amazon account details the updates will complete and you will be given the option of sending over all the apps you already had setup on your prior Sticks. You will also be able to set it to work to your TV in moments during this same processs and from there on, the FireStick remote will be able to turn you TV on and off, raise, lower and mute Volume. Easy Peezy!If you are a NEW FireStick user it will be basically the same process, but you will also be prompted to set up an new Amazon Account in order to get going. Setting up a new Amazon Account is absolutely FREE! If you are a concerned parent you will also be able to easily setup Parental Controls during this initial process.Remember, you do NOT necessarily have to be a PRIME MEMBER to be able to get good use from a FireStick as there are all sorts of Free Apps you can download from the Amazon Store across many Interests and Genres. But being a Prime member opens up an whole other World with this as FireSticks are optimized for using Prime Video and Amazon Music Streaming services. But of course all the other big services (both free and subscription based) are there including YouTube, Netflix, ATV+, Disney+, etc., etc.In a simple summary, the 4K version of a Firestick is blazingly fast vs. My regular 1080p Stick. You can really notice the huge performance difference when surfing through the GUI menus and searching. As a FireStick user for several years now, I can certainly sense the difference between the two. There are times when there is a subtle lag or hickup if you will when clicking through the items in the Menus or searching. Don’t get me wrong, the basic 1080p Stick is a very good video streaming device, but the 4K variant just simply feels more “snappier” with much quicker user interface responses. A simple difference in specs makes all the difference. While the 1080p has basically the same CPU/GPU combination as the 4K stick,  the 4K actually has more memory... 1.5GB of RAM vs. 1GB in the 1080p version. While that may not sound like a lot, it certainly makes a big difference in the overall performance and a more pleasant and seemless overall viewing experience.All in all, I am very happy to have picked up the 4K FireStick “refresh”. I wanted a better 4K stick to replace my original 1080p version and at only a $10 or so difference between the two, I feel this decision is a no-brainer. The 4K variant also offers Dolby Vision/HDR over the 1080p Stick for those with a need for that in better home theatre or media room setups with displays that support that. I feel the 4K Stick really enhances our viewing experience over the basic 1080p Stick and I highly recommend the new both existing 1080p FireTV users as an upgrade and new users alike. (Please note that there is also a “Lite” version of the Firestick. This is basically the same as a 1080p Stick but has an “economy” remote which does not have the ability to control any TV functions. I personally would stay away from the “Lite” altogether unless unless your are OK with juggling multiple remotes for basic TV watching)Edit: And for those who are adventurous, despite what some say, you can in fact easily get more Storage on any FireStick with a simple splitter cable (avaialble on Amazon) that will allow you to power the stick as usual via USB as well has being able to insert a USB memory stick.. need 32GB? More?.. Just search YouTube to see how as are many videos on the subject. But, what do I need that for you ask? Well, the 4K Firestick makes an EXCELLENT video GAMING device! Again, lots of YouTube vids you can find with the answers. Have a Great Day!

I recently also picked up the brand new 4K “Max” variant for my main Home Theatre, but that is a lot more money than this 4K version. I wanted this Stick being reviewed to retire that original 2019 one and have a better 4K version of the stick to replace it. That brings us to the question “is THIS another new 4K version”? Well, it is and it isn’t.....I was a bit confused when I first saw this listing as it appeared around the same time as the launch of “Max” but there is also another 4K Firestick listing that is several years old (with 30,000+ reviews on it!) I thought, is this one another NEW 4K stick I was not aware of? Well, after scrutinzing all the specs and details, this version appears to be exactly the SAME as the other 4K listing (from what I can tell) other than the fact that it has been refreshed with a updated Alexa remote that now also has 4 dedicated “1-click” access buttons for certain services. My current 4K sticks released several years ago have the “normal” remote (see comparison pic). I will touch on this refreshed remote control first....I now find I really like the newly redesigned remote! It’s still very familiar with the same same size and footprint of my prior remotes, but at first glance I was actually annoyed by the inclusion of the quick access buttons for 4 pre-set services as these are set in stone and NOT changeable to something else. But then I thought these are services I ACTUALLY USE!, so its very convenient for my household. The 4 hotkey buttons are for direct access to Prime Video, Amazon Music, NetFlix and Disney+. I believe that US 4K Sticks have a “Hulu” button in place of Amazon Music button on the Canadian retail version, but that would make sense as Hulu is now a huge service down South.Well, so how about this newer 4k Stick “Refresh”?... Keep in mind that I am really just basing my comparison on “upgrading” from an older regular 1080p only FireStick which is what I am doing here. There are some extra benefits from going from a 4K the new 4K “Max” as well, but the Max is $30 more so it is hard for many to justify that price point difference. So, lets look at this “newish” 4K Stick...This 4K stick basically includes all of the same accessories as prior FireSticks. You get a USB power cord with a charging wall/power brick, an HDMI extender dongle (which is very handy in situations where you need to reposition the stick due to space issues in the back of you TV, batteries to power the remote, and the refreshed Alexa enabled remote as already noted.SetUp is very easy as with all prior generation FireSticks. Once pluggIed into power and you turn on your TV you will be met with the Update screens within a few moments. You just need to take a few minutes to follow the simple on screen prompts to log into your network for the first time, and then after entering your Amazon account details the updates will complete and you will be given the option of sending over all the apps you already had setup on your prior Sticks. You will also be able to set it to work to your TV in moments during this same processs and from there on, the FireStick remote will be able to turn you TV on and off, raise, lower and mute Volume. Easy Peezy!If you are a NEW FireStick user it will be basically the same process, but you will also be prompted to set up an new Amazon Account in order to get going. Setting up a new Amazon Account is absolutely FREE! If you are a concerned parent you will also be able to easily setup Parental Controls during this initial process.Remember, you do NOT necessarily have to be a PRIME MEMBER to be able to get good use from a FireStick as there are all sorts of Free Apps you can download from the Amazon Store across many Interests and Genres. But being a Prime member opens up an whole other World with this as FireSticks are optimized for using Prime Video and Amazon Music Streaming services. But of course all the other big services (both free and subscription based) are there including YouTube, Netflix, ATV+, Disney+, etc., etc.In a simple summary, the 4K version of a Firestick is blazingly fast vs. My regular 1080p Stick. You can really notice the huge performance difference when surfing through the GUI menus and searching. As a FireStick user for several years now, I can certainly sense the difference between the two. There are times when there is a subtle lag or hickup if you will when clicking through the items in the Menus or searching. Don’t get me wrong, the basic 1080p Stick is a very good video streaming device, but the 4K variant just simply feels more “snappier” with much quicker user interface responses. A simple difference in specs makes all the difference. While the 1080p has basically the same CPU/GPU combination as the 4K stick,  the 4K actually has more memory... 1.5GB of RAM vs. 1GB in the 1080p version. While that may not sound like a lot, it certainly makes a big difference in the overall performance and a more pleasant and seemless overall viewing experience.All in all, I am very happy to have picked up the 4K FireStick “refresh”. I wanted a better 4K stick to replace my original 1080p version and at only a $10 or so difference between the two, I feel this decision is a no-brainer. The 4K variant also offers Dolby Vision/HDR over the 1080p Stick for those with a need for that in better home theatre or media room setups with displays that support that. I feel the 4K Stick really enhances our viewing experience over the basic 1080p Stick and I highly recommend the new both existing 1080p FireTV users as an upgrade and new users alike. (Please note that there is also a “Lite” version of the Firestick. This is basically the same as a 1080p Stick but has an “economy” remote which does not have the ability to control any TV functions. I personally would stay away from the “Lite” altogether unless unless your are OK with juggling multiple remotes for basic TV watching)Edit: And for those who are adventurous, despite what some say, you can in fact easily get more Storage on any FireStick with a simple splitter cable (avaialble on Amazon) that will allow you to power the stick as usual via USB as well has being able to insert a USB memory stick.. need 32GB? More?.. Just search YouTube to see how as are many videos on the subject. But, what do I need that for you ask? Well, the 4K Firestick makes an EXCELLENT video GAMING device! Again, lots of YouTube vids you can find with the answers. Have a Great Day!

Cons: I believe it is good at most of western languages. Japanese is only supported Asia language. Please don't get wrong. The problem is only the "number" of language support. Eva Blaskovic4.0 out of 5 stars
Good Quality Protein with Stevia, Only 2g Sugar
Reviewed in Canada on September 13, 2023Verified Purchase
Sept. 2023. This is a good product with stevia instead of sucralose or other artificial sweeteners, as well as both whey protein isolate and concentrate. It could stand to be a bit less sweet. There are no unnecessary additives and "junk" ingredients. I find this protein very effective when I train with heavy weights. The price has gone up a lot. It now comes in a bag instead of the plastic container, which is okay except that the ziplock is defective and the two sides will not fit together to close. I'm using three metal clips to keep the bag closed, but it is not airtight. I do recommend this protein for people who can consume whey (and I hope the ziplock closure defect gets fixed).Update Oct. 2023: After I received my LeanFit, which at the time of purchase had shown the photo of the tub, I noticed more differences compared to the bag version (see photo). Fewer BCAAs and protein, more sugar. Also, soy is listed on the bag ingredients (possibly for allergen purposes), which the tub does not have. Several years ago, there was an organic version of the tub. That disappeared, but now the next change is that the bags have slightly different ingredients, with more sugar and less protein. It's still a good product, but this trend is disappointing. Also, many Amazon product photos are updated to include a disclaimer that the actual product received may not be exactly like the photo. If the actual product shipped does not include the same ingredients or amounts, how do we know what we're buying if it is not accurately shown in the photo or stated in the text? Fortunately, the photo of the bag now does appear for a different listing, so it's accurate.
Read more

Seamless Connectivity: Elevating My Studio with Cat 6 Ethernet Cable
Reviewed in Canada on February 19, 2024Size: 25ftColour Name: WhiteVerified Purchase
As the owner of a jewelry design and fabrication studio that spans the realms of traditional craftsmanship and cutting-edge digital creation, reliable and fast internet connectivity is not just important—it's essential. Streaming my design processes, uploading high-definition content, and ensuring my equipment communicates seamlessly requires a network setup that can handle high data volumes without faltering. That's where the Cat 6 Ethernet Cable 25 ft White Flat has made an indelible impact on my studio's operations.The immediate difference in internet speed and stability upon upgrading to this Cat 6 cable was astounding. Previously, I wrestled with intermittent connectivity issues, especially during live streams or when transferring large 3D design files. Those issues vanished, replaced by a smooth, uninterrupted flow of data that has enhanced every aspect of my work, from design to delivery.The flat design of the cable is a boon for my studio, where space is at a premium, and aesthetics matter. Running the cable along walls and under carpets discreetly keeps my workspace organized and clutter-free, maintaining the clean, professional look important for client consultations and content creation. Additionally, the inclusion of clips and RJ45 connectors ensured a hassle-free installation, allowing me to establish a secure, stable connection in minutes.The versatility of this cable has also been a significant advantage. Connecting routers, modems, PCs, gaming consoles, and even directly to some of my more advanced design equipment has demonstrated the cable's capability to support a wide range of devices. This flexibility ensures that as my studio grows and evolves, my network infrastructure can easily adapt to new technologies and equipment.Moreover, the reliability of the Cat 6 Ethernet Cable has provided peace of mind. Knowing that my studio's connectivity is underpinned by a high-speed, stable network allows me to focus on my craft and business without the added stress of technical glitches. Whether I'm live streaming a wax carving session, uploading detailed engraving tutorials, or sending large files to clients, I can do so with confidence, supported by the superior speed and reliability that this cable offers.In summary, upgrading my studio with the Cat 6 Ethernet Cable 25 ft White Flat has been a transformative experience. It has not only improved the technical aspects of my work but has also contributed to a more efficient, professional, and aesthetically pleasing workspace. For fellow creators, designers, and anyone in need of dependable, high-speed internet connectivity, I cannot recommend this cable highly enough. It's a small investment that pays dividends in reliability, speed, and peace of mind, ensuring that my studio stays connected to the world.
