Brian5.0 out of 5 stars
It Just Works
Reviewed in Canada on January 5, 2021Verified Purchase
I've been using the Snore Guard for probably close to fifteen years and it has been a life changer. I'm sixty-five years old now but I had become a loud snorer from around my mid thirties.  I used to snore so loud that my wife would go sleep in the guest bedroom and our neighbours would often tell her that they could hear me snoring when they were sitting in their back yard. Very embarrassing! As well, even though I had never been diagnosed with sleep apnea, I used to wake up a few times a night trying to catch my breath or just from the sound of my own snoring. I also have had sinus problems since I was a teenager which got worse as I got older and that probably contributed to my super loud snoring.The Snore Guard worked for me immediately. The first few nights I used it my wife woke me up a couple of times every night because I wasn't snoring and she wanted to make sure I hadn't passed away in my sleep. When I say this cured my snoring, it really cured my snoring to the point where it didn't just reduce my snoring, it completely eliminated it. I noticed right away that I wasn't waking up in my sleep gasping for air and I definitely woke up feeling like I had just had a great night's sleep. It was also a really great feeling putting my head on the pillow and being able to breathe freely. The only drawback was that I did notice that my jaw was a bit sore at first but it wasn't painful, it was just a sensation that went away for me after three or four nights. It becomes so comfortable that I usually don't even realize it's in my mouth. And it's not so cumbersome that I can't kiss my wife before going to sleep.The recommendation is that this device be replaced every three to six months, but I've always used the same one for @ two years or more. When not in use I keep it in a cup of Listerine mouth wash that I replace every week and I brush it just like my teeth every night. That keeps it fresh and clean and I have never had a problem with sores in my mouth or anything like that. I have bought one of these for numerous relatives and there isn't one who didn't thank me for turning them on to this device.If it sounds like I love the Snore Guard, it has literally changed my life for the better. I just can't recommend it highly enough!

Report
Spotty Dog5.0 out of 5 stars
Works and performs just as described, just buy it
Reviewed in Canada on June 7, 2022Size: 13" - 30"Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
I bought this with some trepidation after reading some of the negative reviews. Ignore the negative reviews (likely operator error on install). This arrived well packaged, all components safely packed in the master carton. Instructions are clear and easy to follow. Just take your time and you can do it without assistance. I installed two identical 24” monitors. Initial plan was to use the clamp to desk method and I started down that path until finding the clamp won’t fit on back of my desk due to the privacy panel is too close to the edge of the desk. Ok, so the other option is to drill a hole through your desk and mount it that way. Admitted I was not crazy about the idea of drilling a hole, however no issues (again just take your time, put painter’s tape on the desk before you drill down to protect the top, drill slowly). Instructions are clear on how to modify the clamp for this install. The only caution here is the instructions tell you to use a 3/8” drill bit for the hole. I found it was too snug so I had to go back with the drill the bit and gently just slightly widen the hole a little and ended up with a perfect fit. I would not just move to next largest drill bit, you will likely end up with too much play in the hole which will affect your satisfaction, you do want that to be a snug hole.After installing the monitors, you will need to use the provided Allan keys to possibly loosen and then tighten some or all of the joints in both monitor arms after you install and get the monitors at right height and viewing angle. My monitors fit perfectly together with virtually no gap between the two. Height might be out .5 mil but so close I did not worry about trying to adjust it and it is not even noticeable they are virtually same.I couldn’t be more happy with this purchase, worked perfectly for my home office setup. You should make note that depending on your situation and how you bend the two monitor arms, you may need to allow for a gap between your desk and the wall. That is simply a function of the angle of the monitor arms that you configure, it is not a flaw with the product.Don’t hesitate buying this product, it is as described and works flawlessly.

title: MEATER Plus | Smart Meat Thermometer with Bluetooth | 165ft Wireless Range | for The Oven, Grill, Kitchen, BBQ, Smoker, Rotisserie
description: 165ft Long Range Model: 100% WIRE-FREE that's perfect for outdoor cooking. The first truly wireless smart meat thermometer. Monitor your cook using the FREE app available for iOS (10.3 and later) / Android (5.0 and later) smart phones and tablets. Smart phone not included in the package.    2 Sensors, 1 Probe: Dual temperature sensors can monitor internal meat temperature up to 212 Deg F and ambient / external temperature up to 527 Deg F simultaneously. Dishwasher safe.    Guided Cook System: Walks you through every step of the cooking process to guarantee perfect and consistent results. You can also set up custom alerts / notifications based on temperature and/or time. Advanced Estimator Algorithm: Can estimate how long to cook and rest your food to help plan your meal and manage your time.    Connectivity Suite: Monitor your cook from a phone or tablet over Bluetooth. Extend your range Using MEATER Link WiFi and MEATER Cloud to use Alexa and monitor your cook from a computer.
nav: Home & Kitchen › Kitchen & Dining › Kitchen Utensils & Gadgets › Thermometers › Meat
user_reviews:
Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
Fantastic Product!
Reviewed in Canada on April 4, 2021Verified Purchase
I don't often write product reviews but felt compelled todo so on this one.  I read a lot of the reviews here prior to buying this and they are truly polarizing.  People either love it or hate it.  There are a lot of negative reviews which caused me to pause before deciding to buy it.  First and foremost, I bought the Meater Plus (50m range), from Amazon Canada, in March 2021.  Secondly, my intended use for this product is not something hard core like a smoker, a fire pit, or a pig roaster and I've never owned a product like this before so perhaps my bar isn't as high as other reviewers.  Until now, all I've ever used is a plain, cheap, and simple analog thermometer that displays ambient temp and internal temp.  My intended use cases for this product is for roasts in the oven and everyday BBQ outdoors, right outside my house.  I want to limit the number of trips back and forth to check the meat (taking time and disturbing the ambient temperature) and am hoping to improve the consistency of my cooks (perfect internal temperature).  Living in Canada where I BBQ in the winter, opening the lid to the BBQ to check the meat is detrimental to the heat and makes it very challenging to produce good outcomes consistently.I just had the opportunity to use the Meater Plus for the first time at Easter.  I roasted a turkey and a ham in the oven it it performed very well.  I had my analog thermometer in the meat along with the Meater and can validate that they were taking the same measurements (ambient and internal temperatures) within a couple degrees from one another.  In terms of the range, I didn't really push the limits on this one since it was indoor roasting but I can say that the App stayed connected the entire time (5+ hours) and I was all over my house with my SmartPhone.For the cooking time, I followed the App's directions closely and it produced excellent results with the two roasts being juicy and tender.  The App itself is awesome!  In addition to the estimated cook time, which takes a lot of the guess work out of planning the oven logistics for a large holiday meal, I also love the charting capability which taught me a thing or two about my convection oven and how it is inconsistent and inaccurate with it's heating.  I also really like the configurable alerts.  I used one such alert on the ham to remind me when to add my glaze before the end of the cook.  For BBQ, I intend to add additional alerts for ambient temperature rising and falling suddenly in the BBQ to alert me immediately to flare ups on the grill or running out of propane.Full disclosure, as I said above, I did not push the limits on the range nor did I try the range extending feature with multiple smart phones over WiFi.  I also have not yet tried this probe in an outdoor BBQ to test the connectivity through the exterior walls and the BBQ itself.  I will amend this review once I try it and report back.  I'm hoping the Bluetooth alone will be adequate and I won't need to leave another phone near the BBQ while I'm cooking.Lastly, on initial setup, I noted that many reviewers here reporting the probe not connecting at all despite being right beside the charging box.  I also encountered that issue when first opening the product, and was stumped for a little while, but ultimately realized that the charging box comes with a small piece of paper between the battery cathode and the connection in the box to ensure the battery stays new.  The downside of this is that the probe itself is not charged when you first open the product despite the fact that the box is fully functional using it's brand new battery.  So if you're having a hard time connecting it initially (flashing red light on the box), remove the paper from the battery compartment, place the probe back into the box and simply let the probe charge for a few hours.So far, I give this 5 stars.  Some will say that it's a too pricey but, for me, it's worth the price if it gives me more data and has the built in intelligence to estimate the cook time.  In the end, it hits all the requirements for me by allowing me to focus my time on other meal prep and/or socialize with guests while relying on the app to feed me real time alerts including telling me when the meat is ready to come off the heat.
Read more

Report
KEN LEE5.0 out of 5 stars
Superb meat thermometer that will ensure you never waste an expensive cut of meat ever again
Reviewed in Canada on December 26, 2023Verified Purchase
It's not the most intuitive thing to use. Just so you know, the base needs to be pretty close to the probe at all times and the phone needs to be connected to the base. My Meater is very prone to losing connection. It's mostly just annoying as the app saves all progress even after losing connection, so a quick reset fixes it.But the recipes and the system it gives you to cook virtually any meat, be it turkey or chicken or any cut of steak / roast, is almost perfect. I've made multiple ribeye steaks, striploin, and yesterday did a full 4kg prime rib over 6 hours of cook time. I've never once before made perfect medium rare prime rib that's fully cooked throughout. Sure, I'm not professional chef, but it's nice not wasting $100 worth of meat and having a meal that everybody is raving about.The recipes provided by Meater in the app are great with awesome videos and step by step instructions, as well as reasoning for each step. But you don't have to use it if you know the temps you need to reach and the proper techniques to cooking meat. I've used it to learn how to roast meat low and slow and the results are just divine every time.The temps are completely accurate. The done-ness every time I've used it has always been perfect too, right down to the resting time. There's even graphs inside the app so you can track the oven air temperature (which fluctuates quite a lot surprisingly), and internal meat temperature. Estimated cooking times are the best too.It's given me some really good insights on how much to adjust cook time for when you're opening the oven every 30 minutes to baste the meat. No more guessing, so it's always consistently perfect. No need to rely on any archaic methods like pushing in the meat or stabbing with a knife then using your gut feeling.I really think if you spend a lot of time cooking expensive meats or roasting birds / meats for half a day, you need to get one of these.The only downsides are this doesn't work on thin cuts of meat (the instructions say not to use this if the probe cannot be completely inside the meat) and the app has a lot of disconnects. But other than that it's a very solid recommendation!

This rendered several of the pieces useless until I took a small blade and carved out the excess plastic inside.The green stick pieces are prone to bending and weakening since they're hollow and flimsy.Overall, I definitely would not buy this. There must be a higher quality version out there from a more reputable brand.

Darrell Ibach5.0 out of 5 stars
Perfect Addtion to a small TV.
Reviewed in Canada on July 26, 2016Style: TV Sound SystemVerified Purchase
I have a small (32") Samsung flat screen tv that, needless to say has very poor sound.  I bought that size TV to fit in a wooden cabinet that was made for an old model, non flat screen tv.  I needed a sound bar to improve the sound that also fit in this cabinet.  The Bose Solo 5 fit the bill perfectly and I couldn't be happier.  It is really hard to find something in this size range, but best of all, the sound is better than I expected for such a small unit.  I should mention that I am hearing impaired and wear hearing aids in both ears. I often have trouble understanding dialogue from TV speakers and even some Sound Surround 5.1 systems give me trouble.  The Bose Solo 5, however, provides very clear voice recognition, even without using their dedicated voice mode. If you have a small TV and want to improve the sound using a small sound bar,  I highly recommend the Bose Solo 5.

It looks great

It gets 4 stars because its battery doesn't last 8 hours like it says & the cord isn't long enough to leave it stationary & plugged in all the time. I had to buy an extension usb cord for it. I don't mind if I have to keep it plugged in as it's a bedside lamp, but I had to plug it in to charge every other night when I first got it. I definitely don't have it on for four hours a night, so if you're looking for longevity keep it plugged in. Also, the buttons on the remote don't always respond on the first try but they haven't stopped responding altogether, so that's fine. It'd be much better with a longer black cord so it's not as visible & more easily kept plugged in if necessary.I do love it on my Bastet stand though. I keep it on the orange setting & it's a perfect glow with the colours of my walls.Note: even on the white setting at the brightest illumination it's not very bright. If you want a bright lamp this may not be for you. I find it a very soothing & relaxing glow. The photo shown is at its brightest on the orange setting.

Amazon Customer5.0 out of 5 stars
Great bed, but not a beginner project!
Reviewed in Canada on February 21, 2024Size: Queen VerticalVerified Purchase
This project took me 4 full days to put it together.  It is not a minor project and it requires tools and skills.  This is not a beginner project.  The hardware kit, which is just over $300, is only a small part of your expenditure.  I bought 4x8 sheets of finished maple plywood and all the pieces the instructions told me I needed at Home Depot and spent another $900.  I had the plywood cut at Home Depot as the cut sheets are included in the instructions.  Getting it cut on their panel saw was easier than doing it on my table saw, it took about a half-hour and cost me $20.  The instructions provided with the hardware are great, and there are videos to follow on the Internet at YouTube.  Read the instructions and watch all of the videos before you even start, it will save you troubles.  The bed is great and gives us a lot of extra space in our spare bedroom.  It's very sturdy and easy to open and lift up when finished.  The bed pictured is the vertical Queen sized bed.

Averst5.0 out of 5 stars
Get this while it's at its original price point!
Reviewed in Canada on March 18, 2023Verified Purchase
Well, there's really not much I can say about this console is that it's definitely worth the buy! If you'replanning on buying a PS5 get it while it's at its original price point. This console sells out inevitably fast.If you plan on using this console on a 1440p monitor; it works very well and looks great even with the 120hz. I have yet to try 4k but I'm sure that works great without any problems. The only problem I have with plugging it into my monitor is that I can't get audio out of the monitor through the HDMI cord for some reason, so I have to resort to plugging a 3.5 audio connection into the controller which is no problem.The setup process is dead simple which was nice since I haven't owned a PlayStation console since 2012. And especially since this console sells so quickly once you get your hands on one it's nice to show off lol.Otherwise, if you're looking for a great plug and play console even for the PlayStation exclusives is what made me buy one go for it. We don't know how long it's going to take for them to port all their games over to PC, might take years for them to come over.

What's Inside: Includes 240 Inbox cards and 300 Reply cards plus instructions    Brought to you by What Do You Meme?: We also make other party games inspired by pop culture. I almost wish I could buy the flavours individually so I don't have to get cherry.  Reminds me of medicine.They take a while to freeze in the box, so if you are in a hurry, take them out of the box for quicker freezing.The only thing I don't like is the sharp edges to the plastic, but you get that with any snack like this.Keep an eye on the price as most of the time it's cheaper here, but in the spring and early summer, the grocery stores have this on sale for way less.

nav: Toys & Games › Bikes, Scooters & Ride-Ons › Push Ride-Ons
user_reviews:
Samantha T.5.0 out of 5 stars
Best toy ever
Reviewed in Canada on December 25, 2016Colour Name: BlueVerified Purchase
We just put the kiddos- ages 2 years and 9 months - to bed this Christmas night and my husband has since, been playing with the plasma cars.  While he found them enjoyable, he did have a couple of recommendations.1) Please add a cushion. He is starting to feel his age and his keister is tender.  Perhaps, it's the padded chairs at work - if he chose to sit in a plain plastic chair it would be easier but, for all your 25+ year old plasma car enthusiasts, a cushion option would be lovely.2) They're too short. Now, they're a great height for the children who we bought them for - a perfect height, I'd say.  My husband, however, is 5'7 and apparently, finds them too short. He has a cramp (so do I but it's in the form of a headache caused by trying not to laugh at him). He'd like an extra-tall option for the same enthusiasts who would like a cushion.3) He would also like a motor - a little one, though (I'm so sorry, PlaSmart).  Apparently, it is very difficult to get over the bumps in the floor and a motor would help him glide with ease.  Personally, I think he could use the cardio workout but as he lay on the floor, holding his rump, cramped up from the short car and breathing heavily from the workout - perhaps, he should just accept that he should let the kids play with their own toys and he can go play with his PS4 instead!Yes, there's my review - this thing is more fun than a PS4 and my husband is willing to cause himself bodily pain to glide across the floor yelling "wheeee", possibly waking up the true owners of these toys - the children. 100% worth every penny for such a great product!

The multiplayer experience is seamless, providing endless opportunities for friendly competition and shared laughter.Additionally, the game's regular updates and downloadable content (DLC) have kept the experience evolving, introducing new challenges and characters. If you're looking for a game that combines thrilling races with iconic characters, Mario Kart™ 8 Deluxe is the perfect choice.

Report
Laurie4.0 out of 5 stars
Capturing Memories: My Experience with Fujifilm Instax Mini Film Multi-Pack
Reviewed in Canada on February 19, 2024Size: 60 ExposuresColour Name: WhiteVerified Purchase
As a multi-faceted creator in the realms of jewelry design, 3D modeling, and crafting, I often find myself documenting my creative process and sharing snippets of my life with my audience through vlogs and streams. Recently, I decided to give the Fujifilm Instax Mini Film Multi-Pack a try to add a touch of instant nostalgia to my content. While the experience has been overall positive, there are a few aspects worth considering.On the positive side, the convenience of having 60 exposures in one pack is undeniably practical. Whether I'm capturing candid moments in the studio, behind-the-scenes footage at crafting events, or simply documenting my daily life, having an ample supply of film on hand ensures that I never miss a moment. Plus, the compact size of the Instax Mini film makes it easy to carry around, allowing me to snap photos on the go without lugging around bulky equipment.Moreover, the instant gratification of seeing physical prints develop right before my eyes adds a charming element to my content creation process. There's something special about holding a tangible photo in my hands, instantly evoking memories and emotions that can't quite be replicated with digital images. The vintage aesthetic of the Instax Mini prints also adds a nostalgic flair to my vlogs and streams, enhancing the visual appeal of my content.However, there are a few drawbacks to consider. Firstly, the cost per exposure can add up, especially when compared to digital photography. While the convenience and novelty of instant film are undeniable, it's worth weighing the cost against the value of physical prints, particularly for creators on a budget.Additionally, the image quality of Instax Mini prints may not meet the standards of professional photography. While the retro aesthetic is part of the charm, the colors can sometimes appear washed out or overly saturated, particularly in low-light conditions. This is something to keep in mind for creators who prioritize image quality in their content.In conclusion, the Fujifilm Instax Mini Film Multi-Pack offers a fun and convenient way to add a touch of nostalgia to my content creation process. While the cost and image quality may not be ideal for professional use, the instant gratification and charming aesthetic make it a worthwhile addition to my toolkit. For creators looking to infuse their content with a dose of vintage flair and spontaneity, the Instax Mini film is definitely worth considering.

title: Anker 20,100 mAh Portable Charger, Ultra High Capacity Power Bank with 4.8A Output and PowerIQ Technology, External Battery Pack for iPhone 15/15 Plus/15 Pro/15 Pro Max, iPad, Samsung Galaxy, and More
description: The Anker Advantage: Join the 10 million+ powered by our leading technology.    Ultra-High Capacity: Weighs as little as a can of soup (12.5 oz) yet charges the iPhone 6s seven times, the Galaxy S6 five times or the iPad mini 4 twice.    Full-speed charging technology Anker proprietary technology Ultra high-speed charging was realized by PowerIQ (detecting connected equipment and optimizing current) and VoltageBoost (detecting cable resistance and automatically adjusting output voltage).    Certified Safe: Anker's MultiProtect safety system ensures complete protection for you and your devices.    What You Get: Anker PowerCore 20100 Portable Charger, Micro USB cable, travel pouch, welcome guide, our fan-favorite 18-month warranty and friendly customer service. Lightning cable for iPhone / iPad sold separately.    Weight: Approximately 356 g    Size: Approx 166 x 58 x 22 mm
nav: Electronics › Cell Phones & Accessories › Accessories › Chargers › External Battery Packs
user_reviews:
Josh Levinson5.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent portable charger when Quickcharge and travelling ultra light are not important
Reviewed in Canada on June 22, 2016Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
As an avid nature photographer, I often find myself off the grid, with no or limited access to power sources for charging my phone, camera, and other portable electronic devices. A friend of mine recommended the Anker portable charging devices, so I decided to give them a try. Here I will review the PowerCore 20100.PACKAGING: I’m not usually one to care about how a product is packaged (as long it isn’t damaged in transit) - but I have to say, Anker has done a superb job packaging this thing. Maybe not quite at the Apple level, but not too far from it. As soon as you open the box, you get the impression this is a premium product.BUILD QUALITY: I’m extremely impressed with the build quality of this product, especially given its very reasonable (dare I say low) price. It feels very dense and solid, while not being unreasonably heavy. At 358 g + 10 g (pouch) + 14 g (cable), this may be getting a bit heavy for hiking/backpacking trips, but is quite lightweight for just about anything else (car/plane travel, car camping, etc.). Speaking of the pouch, this is probably the best soft carrying pouch I’ve ever seen included with an electronics product. It’s made of a nice lightweight mesh, which is lined internally with a thin foam padding that gives added protection against bumps and drops. The USB A ports seem to be of really nice quality, and have a great feel to them when you insert a USB plug into them. This model has two USB ports, allowing charging of 2 devices (at up to 2.4A each) simultaneously - this is a very nice feature to save time when multiple devices need to be charged. The device has a small 4-light LED indicator that provides information on the current charge level, which is very useful for knowing how much juice is left in the battery pack. While not charging or being charged, pressing a small button on the side of the device will activate the LED indicator. The only minor complaint I have is that plugging a cable into the micro USB port is a little more resistant and finicky than I’d like.CHARGING: When using this device to charge my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge (3600 mAh battery), I get an average charging rate of about 1.3 minutes per % (so about 130 min. to fully charge the phone). This rate is similar to what I get from standard (non-fast charge) 2A wall chargers. The PowerCore has the capacity to fully charge the phone just under 4 times, which is expected given the 60-70% efficiency quoted by Anker on their website. In terms of how long it takes to recharge the PowerCore itself, it takes about 11.5 hours to go from empty to full (using a 2A USB charger). One nice feature to point out is that there is no on/off switch - when you plug in a device, it starts charging, and when you unplug it, it stops. So no need to worry about forgetting to turn the charger on or off.PROS:- Very well built, and seemingly durable- Reasonable weight, given the charge capacity- Good length micro USB cable and excellent quality carrying/storage pouch included- Charge level indicator- Charges devices at a good rate- Does not need to be switched on/offCONS:- Time to recharge the PowerCore 20100 is somewhat on the long side, making things a bit tricky. For example, if you wanted to charge overnight, you’d need to start it charging a couple of hours before going to bed, and leave it charging for a couple more hours after waking up - this is a bit awkward.CONCLUSION: Overall, I’m very impressed with this product. It appears to be a high quality product that offers a great set of features. No, it doesn’t have Quickcharge capability (either for charging or for being charged), but given its low price, it offers excellent value. Unless Quickcharge is important to you, I would highly recommend this battery pack to people looking for a super convenient way to charge their electronic devices while travelling.PICTURES: Among the attached pictures, I’ve included one of the PowerCore 20100 beside a credit card, and another of it beside the PowerCore 10000, to give a relative sense of size.
Read more

Report
Mike Cheng5.0 out of 5 stars
One of The Best Portable Chargers, EVER!
Reviewed in Canada on April 14, 2016Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
This is probably the best battery pack and I was lucky enough for Anker to send me one. Let me explain why! When you first get this portable you're presented professionally with a small box containing the power bank, micro USB and nice looking case. It's really considerate when a company such as Anker include a pamphlet that makes sure the customer is satisfied and doesn't have any problems. The power bank itself is noticeably heavy but for how much mAh it holds, it's definitely worth it. It can charge my Nexus 5 about 6 times by itself and could probably charge an iPhone 6 around the same amount of times. The charging speed on this is amazing as well. If your phone doesn't support Qualcomm's Quick Charge 2.0 then you definitely need to get this. Examples of phones would be the Nexus 5 and iPhone's. It charges extremely fast, charging my Nexus from 0-100% in about 50 minutes to an hour. That's amazing considering it doesn't support quick charge 2.0. I used ampere to measure the amount of amps travelling through the cable and it's usually around 1500mAh which is a very high speed. The portable bank itself charges in about 8 hours from being dead which may seem long until you consider, as stated before, how big the actual battery is. The material on the portable bank is a nice matte feeling black that is nice to hold in the hand. One issue I encountered with this choice of material is that it scratches easily but it does come with a carrying case that would protect it from such damage. There are 2 USB ports so you can charge 2 devices at once and it uses 4 LED's to determine how much power is left. 4 on meaning 80-full and 1 while blinking meaning dead or soon to be. If you're not satisfied with your product for any reason Anker is nice enough to include a crazy long warranty where they'll try to work at an agreement with you. Whether that's sending you another one because your's was defected our just plain out giving you a refund. Anker is highly considerate to their customers and that's one of my favourite things about them. Overall I think anyone who has a phone with a bad battery such as mine should consider this. You won't be able to carry it in your pocket but at least you'll have more power then anyone beside you!

HYDRAGLYDE MOISTURE MATRIX: Attaches and forms a cushion of moisture across the surface of the lens. Creates a barrier to help prevent deposits and remove dirt.    PLATINUM NEUTRALIZING DISC: Only to be used with the provided case that contains a neutralizing disc, turning the hydrogen peroxide into saline. Do not rinse lens directly without neutralizing.    DIRECTIONS: Fill lens case with solution to the indicated line. Place the top into the case with the secured lens inside. Let lens soak for at least 6 hours in the case to fully neutralize.

Report
Ryan C.4.0 out of 5 stars
Great Card For The Price!
Reviewed in Canada on March 13, 2024Verified Purchase
Not much to say about this card. I've trusted in MSI's GPU products for a lifetime, and they have never let me down.The MSI RTX 4060 Ventus is a great card overall on a budget. It's miles better than my old MSI GTX 1070 TI DUKE. Without Ray Tracing enabled, all games can be played very well in 1080p with maxed out settings. Once you get into Ray Tracing, and anything over 1080p you can take a performance hit, but games for the most part still perform really well if you have the correct settings. The power consumption is very low on the new series as well, which is great. It's very light weight, and it will not sag on your motherboard.Haven't had any real issues with it yet, but two things are worth noting. The first is that I think I'm going to have to warranty it, because one of the fans sounds like it might have a bad bearing. The second is that in some games with high usage I'm getting coil whine and it can be loud at times, like in HellDivers 2. This is normal, and I'm wearing headphones when gaming so it's not really a problem.

I have long and thick hair with unmanageable curls. Straightening them has been a task and time consuming and often not very long lasting.First off normal straightening irons took me at least an hour to do my entire head and not completely straightened. To do a very good job usually required someone to do the back of my head.With this my hair was straightened in about 20 minutes and giving it an extra 10 minutes made my hair extra straight and also soft.The bush doesn’t get extra hot so I can get it close to my head. And I have no fear of burning my hand when I can’t quite see what I am doing in the back of my head. The only thing that gets very hot is the hair (probably why they give you that glove with it to catch your hair) since I use a wide comb to both section my hair and catch the hit strands this makes the entire process much faster.Also helps that I don’t need to go over the same strand of hair 5-6 times. This one I don’t even need it to be at the highest temps and the most unruly strand still looks decent after two pass and a third for good measure.Other note worthy thing is that my hair has remained very straight for many days even if I had a pony tail for a few days I can comb it out and it still looks pretty good.And if need be I can plug it the straightener and give my hair a quick “brush” and that settles down even the bump of the pony tail in about 5 minutes.I purchased it from seeing a bunch of adverts all over social media and really wasn’t expecting much.  I wasn’t even sure it would be a nice experience as some that I have tried basically was ripping my hair and breaking the hair causing more damage than anything.My hair not only is not being brittled but is left silky and smooth after using.  Well worth it for me.

RubberCheese5.0 out of 5 stars
Solid performance; runs cool except under load
Reviewed in Canada on July 24, 2023Style: Processor OnlyVerified Purchase
This processor performs well and is a solid performance upgrade from my old i7-6700K. According to HWMonitor, the CPU package hovers around 15W power consumption doing desktop tasks (web browsing / email / Office).Compared to my i7-6700K (video card and PSU unchanged; new motherboard, ram, and heatsink&fan):- System power consumption at idle and doing desktop tasks is about 5W higher than my 6700K in normal mode, or about 15W lower in “eco” mode in my motherboard’s settings- Synthetic benchmarks (3dmark CPU Profile) indicate 2x performance for single-core processing and 4x performance for maximum threads- Real-life video encoding is roughly 3x faster using PowerDirectorNote that this LGA1700 socket is known to allow some bending (this causes poorer contact with heatsink which may cause throttling). This can be remedied by installing a pressure plate (I bought a Thermalright LGA1700-BCF for around $12).If you don’t need a built-in GPU, consider the i7-13700KF; the built-in GPU is nice to have but not always worth the premium. If you also don’t plan to overclock, consider the i7-13700F.

Report
Alex5.0 out of 5 stars
One of the best within this price point - but NOT ideal for bassheads
Reviewed in Canada on November 18, 2016Colour Name: BlackStyle: WiredPattern Name: HeadphoneVerified Purchase
I have quite a few headphones to compare and the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x excels in clarity, mostly in mids and highs. It is meant for studio use and that means it does not artificially alters the sound source and thus this is not a headphone for baseheads. The sound signature is pure, cristal clear, with competent bass, but not overpowering the other frequencies. This is not going to rumble your head with the sub-base that you can not hear but only feel. But that is not to say that the bass is not good, because it is - just do not expect extra bass added to your tracks. What you can expect instead is to rediscover your favorite songs, with added clarity, resolution and details. Treeble and midrange are as good as you can get for this price point, and the only other eadphone I like better at this price point, precisely because it has a warmer signature, with more pronounced bass, is thie V-Moda Crossfade M-100. So, despite preferring the signature of the M-100, which is more powerful and impactful, with that deep sub-bass that rumbles your head, the M50x is an amazing headphone that has mode forward and crital midrange and treeble than the M-100, whch has become my favorite benchmark for this price point.As far as build quality, the M50x is well built and feels solid in your hand, but that is achieved due to the use of good quality plastics and metal on some key parts only. It does not feel premium, just feels well built. Kind of 7 out of 10 score at most. It is not meant to withstand the harshness of professional DJ work, instead is more focused on critical listening on studio environment, and I think it can easily handle this type of duty, but I also think it would not last very long in the hands of professional DJs, which are always throwing around their gear. But, the M50x is not meant for DJs, I am just mentioning this to make a point that the quality of the build is good, but is not excellent by any means.The M50x is very comfortable to use and the ear pads have enough room to completely go around your ears, so there is no discomfort of having your ears pressed by the ear pads on some parts. It is very comfortable indeed.Hope this shor treview helps and in the end, it is very hard to regret buying this headphone - expect for bassheads I would say.

Report
Julie4.0 out of 5 stars
Great unless you have a big head
Reviewed in Canada on October 24, 2023Verified Purchase
See first about a new revision:There has been a silent revision that people have measured to affect the sound (partly because of a change in the pads). It doesn't necessarily sound worse now, but the bass is slightly louder (a plus for open backs IMHO) and the treble peak has been lowered slightly, which was something people previously complained about so it seems like the new revision improves things. Some have described it as how it would've sounded when EQ'd to flatten the response. There have been some material changes, with the top pad covered in cloth now (unnoticeable unless you're bald) instead of velour and the earpads are softer (a plus in my book). Silent revisions aren't great because measurements by review sites like Rtings are no longer accurate but the changes to the sound seem like good ones here.Sound quality is good for the price with a much flatter sound profile than most headphones (including the bass, a rare thing in cheap open backs).Comfort is decent, apparently better on the new revision because of the softer pads although the clamping force is pretty tight so people with big heads may not find them comfortable. I have a normal sized head and don't feel any discomfort.The cable is another thing that was changed in the revision and I'd say it's a great cable. Not overly long (I wouldn't have minded a longer one though) but it's very soft and doesn't keep its shape. I've actually never had anything with such a soft cable. Feels like a big noodle. The end was changed to a screw on 6.5mm adapter that you can remove to get a regular 3.5mm jack.Overall I really like them. I think my choice not to go with the HD6XX from Massdrop/Sennheiser was a good one, especially with the price difference when buying from Massdrop from Canada (customs, shipping, etc)

Report
K S5.0 out of 5 stars
Get These For the Imaging and Soundstage
Reviewed in Canada on October 27, 2023Verified Purchase
After thoroughly listening to these headphones for a week I'm ready to put together my thoughts. The headphone having a neutral sound signature have excellent sound quality, the lows, mids, and highs produced by these headphones are extremely clear. I had high expectations for the sound clarity and they definitely meet them, however, the difference is not huge when comparing to an also capable pair of headphones that cost less than this. I appreciate the more realistic tones of instruments in the treble range and enjoy the "texture" of vocals that is emphasized due to the flat sound signature. I do not feel that the flatness affects enjoyment of music at all. Overall these headphones are better in clarity than typical consumer audio but that is not the reason to consider them.What really makes these headphones stand out though is how well it does for instrument separation. They have an outstanding ability to resolve every instrument and separate vocals just like the musician intended. The perceived soundstage from the open back design provides a really immersive experience that had me hooked from the first listen. It really is that good.I would also like to note that some reviews point out the bass lacking a little, I did not find that to be the case. The bass has great extension and control in songs that intend on emphasizing the bass, although, it is still not as loud as some headphones that focus on the bass. As someone who enjoys good bass in music, I was impressed by their performance.In some online communities there seems to be an observation that there had been some cosmetic design changes to these headphones such as the headband. Although I cannot comment on the sound difference, perhaps my experience of the bass was a factor of these changes.

 Attention all coffee lovers! I recently acquired the Philips 3200 Series Fully Automatic Espresso Machine with LatteGo Milk Frother, and let me tell you, it's a game-changer! This incredible machine has taken my home coffee experience to new heights of excellence, and I couldn't be more thrilled with its performance.  The video represents the time from power on to latte in hands. (roughly 3mins)First things first, the LatteGo Milk Frother. Oh, what a marvel! With just a touch of a button, it effortlessly transforms ordinary milk into a velvety, creamy froth that rivals the best cafés in town. Whether you're craving a silky latte or a frothy cappuccino, this milk frother delivers perfection every single time. Plus, it's a breeze to clean, so you can bid farewell to those tedious milk residue battles.Now, let's talk about the espresso brewing capabilities of the Philips 3200 Series. Prepare to be amazed! This machine boasts a fully automatic system that takes care of every step of the coffee-making process, from grinding the beans to brewing a rich, aromatic cup of espresso. The aroma that fills the room as the machine works its magic is simply delightful, setting the mood for a truly delightful coffee experience.One of the standout features of this machine is its customizable settings. With a few simple adjustments, you can personalize the strength and volume of your coffee to suit your individual taste preferences. Whether you prefer a mild morning pick-me-up or a bold espresso shot that can rival the best café in town, the Philips 3200 Series has got you covered.And let's not forget the user-friendly interface. Navigating through the various options and settings is a breeze, even for those of us who are not tech-savvy. The clear display and intuitive controls make it a joy to operate, ensuring that you spend more time savouring your coffee and less time figuring out complicated instructions.Lastly, maintenance is a breeze with this machine. It features an automatic cleaning cycle that keeps everything running smoothly, and the removable parts are dishwasher-safe for added convenience. With the water filtration system, you can bid farewell to the hassle of frequent tedious cleaning routines and spend more time enjoying your delicious cup of joe.In conclusion, the Philips 3200 Series Fully Automatic Espresso Machine with LatteGo Milk Frother is a coffee enthusiast's dream come true. From its exceptional milk frothing capabilities to its customizable settings and user-friendly interface, this machine delivers coffee perfection with every cup. Whether you're a seasoned barista or a coffee lover looking to elevate your home coffee game, I wholeheartedly recommend the Philips 3200 Series. Trust me, it's worth every penny!So go ahead, indulge in the ultimate coffee experience. Your taste buds and caffeine-loving soul will thank you. Cheers!

Report
Eric 885.0 out of 5 stars
Simple and Fast to make cappuccino every morning
Reviewed in Canada on August 21, 2021Verified Purchase




                    The media could not be loaded.
                



 if you are considering this machine, I would like to share some of my experiences with you, pre-owner and new buyer. You might knew those tricks if you’ve read the manual.  my Little Summary of “Press and hold for 3 seconds” with the following buttons under “Power Off” are able to change some hidden feature settings …. suits  EP3241/54  1) Aroma = Water Hardness Soft1>Hard4.  2) Quantity = Water Temperature Low>default>High.  3) Aqua = Activate Aqua-Filter.  4) Calc = Auto-off timer 15/30*/60/180mins.  5) Espresso = Restore factory setting.  6) Coffee = On/off panel Beep Sound.  this LatteGo automatic espresso machine is super easy to make cappuccino under 3 mins from power On. and Super easy to clean up too. It’s make noise but not really loud enough to wake anybody in the morning. It’s gave me really fast, tasty and creamy espresso as always.  if you knew how to use “Bypass” feature …  “Press and hold 3’s ” on the “Pre-ground/Aroma” to bypass the grinder on Latte Macchiato can easily get “Hot Milk only” and same way to get “Foam Milk only” on Cappuccino.  so far, for the past 5 months I just have to refill coffee beans and fill up the water tank at the Front side when it’s empty.  Do “Maintains it” just take a minute to drain the drip tray and empty the bin after every use, and also took about 5-10mins to rinse the brew unit weekly.  Wait 5 seconds to “Reset the built-in counter” when took out the Drip tray under Power On as always. Otherwise it’s will keep LED remind you to empty the bin after every 8-10 shots.  The coffee spout is adjustable to fit most travel mug not taller than 16cm which is big plus to me.  And all beverages are able to program it’s own quantity size from 50-250ml but at least larger than the default size. all details is on the manual.  be cautious with the Aqua-filters, it’s needs to be fully filled water and lets bobbles completely out before installation, otherwise you may get trouble with the water intake cause by the air block.and the running cost, according to the manual that Aqua-Filter needs to be replace every 3 months or every 95L of water ( >1,000 cups), It’s means I need to replace Aqua-filters x4 per year. That’s about 25cents per day for Filters and each shot of the 10g coffee beans cost about10-20cents. Total is just Less than $2 per day for me to make 6-8 shots espresso daily. (I like Melitta and Lavazza beans both not oily) Lastly, For the past 5 months I did once filter change already and did descaling once just follow with the Philips you-tube instructions step by step easily. the machine still works very great.

It doesn't help speed up the process necessarily so much faster, but as we all know, not a lot of stuff does. What's great about them though is they do help a bit, and when you put one on it REALLY camouflages the sore! Nothing is worse than a huge red mark on your lip! This thing makes it actually hard to see. My only reason for the 4 star, is the adhesive. This is something that will stick to the sore well. You have to be careful taking it off. I wait till I am in the shower and the water will gently take it off. You don't want to aggravate the sore more.  But where mine is located, the patch will go a little on the skin and a little on the lip. Once you talk, sip a beverage, yawn, the part that should stick to your lip doesn't stay. Jo4.0 out of 5 stars
For the Audiophile, probably not for the casual consumer
Reviewed in Canada on May 2, 2022Verified Purchase
Pros: This DAC-Amp is a legend in the r/headphones subreddit and the overall headphone/IEM audiophile community for a reason. It is lightweight, fairly convenient to use, measures well, sounds subjectively fine, and is CHEAP. As someone who owns the U12t, IER-Z1R, and is planning on buying the EE Odin and the Elysian Annihilator, I use the Apple dongle 99% of the time I am outside. Spend your money on IEMs and headphones, not the source.Cons: For non-audiophiles, this is a $9 bulky add-on that Apple randomly required you to buy by removing the headphone jack all those years ago. Use TWS or earbuds with a lightning connector at the end of them. It's a lot more convenient. Also, the build isn't the best and I have broken many dropping my phone. While you can reinforce them so they don't break (check the subreddit mentioned above for details), you shouldn't have to do that in the first place.Conclusion: For those of you looking to join the audiophile community, welcome! Buy this and a Chifi IEM and enjoy your music! Don't worry about the source. For those already deep into the community like me, you probably don't need a random internet stranger telling you how good the Apple dongle is. It's a legend for a reason. For those who don't care much about audio, this probably isn't for you. TWS have become significantly cheaper and will always be more convenient. As an audiophile with an iPhone though, I will continue using the Apple dongle until the day I am burried with one.

description: Changeable stick modules and stick caps: Aim and move with precision by swapping in fresh stick modules so you’re always playing with equipment that’s in great shape. Plus, three types of changeable stick caps help you stay comfortable in-game without sacrificing grip or stability. Batt5.0 out of 5 stars
Seems nice, if the buttons don't wear out.
Reviewed in Canada on December 5, 2023Verified Purchase
Everything seems to be exactly as expected based on the product information and everyone's reviews. Bought it, put some anti-sweat gloves on, and hopped into a FFXIV ultimate raid. Felt like a good controller. My controller that came with the console started getting stick drift and after doing some ball-park math I realized that I probably spent $800 on PS4 replacement controllers, so hoping that this investment is a money saver in the long run.Of course, not every PS4 controller died to the Dreaded Drift, some actually had the buttons wear out, and I started Frankensteining the varying components from multiple controllers together. Like at one point I had the buttons from one that had screwed up shoulder triggers and the sticks from another that wouldn't charge because the usb port was mucked up pulled out to fix one with a good port/battery and shoulder triggers when the buttons went mushy and the stick started drifting. Hoping that a nearly $300 controller won't get mushy buttons, that would be ridiculous and embarrassing for Sony.I do distinctly enjoy that all of the screws holding the PS5 controllers (even the normal ones) are covered up and won't be exposed to sweat. Human skin oils and sweat are basically the most damaging thing besides literal acids or actual fire for practically anything, and I've had far too many PS3/PS4 controllers be irreparable because when I went to pull the screws out, they just desintegrated. I'm sure this was annoying even for Sony, or they wouldn't have bothered fixing it. If this gets mushy buttons and I have to pull the buttons out and replace them, I'll be back to edit this.

Report
Jason 5.0 out of 5 stars
My SCUF lasted 5 months before repair 1 of 2.  The Edge controller is Quality
Reviewed in Canada on May 3, 2023Verified Purchase
This review is for the Edge controller but like many I looked at SCUF controllers also when deciding on what to purchase.  This is my experience with both controllers.I purchased a SCUF controller and ignored the quality concerns that others had voiced. I figured that with the high volume of sales, some faulty units were inevitable. Even when I discovered that SCUF only offers a 6-month warranty, I remained optimistic. Unfortunately, after just five months, the right trigger failed, and it took almost three weeks to repair - longer than the 12 days I was initially told it would take. Then, only a month later, the right stick began to drift. The controller quickly became unusable, rotating uncontrollably at the start of every Call of Duty match. After two failures in seven months, I couldn't justify spending an estimated $80 on another repair.When I received the SCUF controller, I expected it to be a PlayStation 5 controller with extra back buttons and customization options. However, I soon realized that it was an inferior product with cheap aftermarket buttons. Even SCUF's warranty page states that it will fail in six to eight months if you play for six hours a day, like any other controller. In contrast, I have PS4 controllers that have undergone three battery swaps and still work perfectly, as well as PS5 controllers that haven't failed in any way since their release.The Sony Edge controller, on the other hand, exudes quality the moment you hold it. Although I've only had it for a week, I'm confident that it will last as long as my other PlayStation controllers. If I do encounter stick drift, I can replace the part myself for about $40. Additionally, configuring the controller is straightforward and comes with two types of back buttons which is great. In my opinion, the Sony Edge is the clear choice.

So after contemplating to spend $400 + on a wheel and pedal Logitech - Thrustmaster only to research and find it’s half baked compared to DD wheel I came to the decision to purchase the EDGE.And for formula 1 ‘23 what a controller compared to the DualSense.Pros:Hard shell case and can charge while inside.Lengthy USB C cable braided. Be sure to take care with these cables. Very good quality. Try and roll them up the way they came or avoid twisting.I tried the paddles to play like shifters however muscle memory is an issue. I may try again and orientate downshift on the right and up shift on the left as acc and upshift and the vis versa are hard to coordinate. For now back to X 🔲 Also if you reverse the orientation of the paddles you can extend them further towards your palm.Comes with a nice locking mechanism to keep the provided wire in the controller. I don’t really think this may be useful as I have a 5 year old. Huge tripping hazard and the controller will go flying.Love the caps they come in various styles and lengths. This is great as finding the correct hight means your thumb doesn’t have to travel as far and precision can be greatly increased. I already have a cap that adds hight but I’ve maxed it out on the left stick and enjoy the amount of control it provides.The removable and replaceable joysticks are the best positive from Sony. Another reason over the wheel (I’ve already gone through two controller with heavy game use) I also find myself gripping the controller and left stick to find the precision. Old habits. Now to change the Stick I can swap and use the right one and then purchase a replacement. Save over buying a new controller.The trigger limiters are nice. I attempted to stiffen the brake trigger but I found I like the length of my break pedal similar to real world car.Apart from the hardware the software support of the controller is great. Right out of the box you can check and eliminate natural dead zone in the controller sticks. 3-5% is normal.There is also customization for stick responsiveness. Thinking linearly you can adjust the line to reflect how fast or how slow and how soon you want the responsive to be. My sensitivity curve is set to quickYou can also adjust the travel for the trigger in the software and the deadzone for that exact feel you want on the break or the accelerator.Cons.The battery seems to be an issue, I’ve discovered while researching. To combat this use the provided USB cable for power and communication as much as possible.You will prolong the longevity of your battery, just be sure to use the battery once in a while. You can also adjust the lights, force feedback and mic volumes to improve batter time and life.Set your communication from the controller to USB rather than Bluetooth. There is natural input lag in both, but direct connection is still the best way for data transfer.Other than that so far no cons. If you are an avid user of the PS5 I suggest purchase this controller instead of a wheel for your entry into F1 ‘23 unless you have the $$$$ for a DD wheel like Fanatec. Unfortunately they are the only company that will make direct drive wheel for PS5. And in my opinion and preferance a non DD wheel is half baked.
Read more

Sarje3.0 out of 5 stars
Cappuccino good, Mocha bad.
Reviewed in Canada on October 18, 2022Style: Instant CappuccinoFlavour Name: French Vanilla CappuccinoSize: 454 g (Pack of 1)Verified Purchase
In regards to the instant cappuccino mix: This mix is so good! I tried it years ago and was iffy about buying it, but I'm very glad I did. I think they have improved it since the last time I had it. The taste is great. It’s not too sweet, and the mix dissolves completely, so there are no gritty granules left. And I add a small amount of half n half cream after stirring in the water. I think ill be buying this on a regular basis. It has cut down on my Starbucks trips! So I'm also saving money. That’s a win win! To make it more coffee flavored I add a teaspoon of the Maxwell House instant coffee to three tablespoons of the cappuccino mix. Add water and cream until it tastes just right.However, the reason Im only giving this three stars is in regards to the Tim Hortons mocha mix. When I try to leave a review for the mocha, it brings me back to the review I left for the cappuccino. So I guess I can only leave one review for both products. Which is unfortunate. Because I would have given the cappuccino mix five stars and I would’ve given the mocha one star. So that’s how we get to the three star rating.The mocha comes in a box and inside the box you have eight packets of individual servings. You put it in a mug you add your hot water you can add some milk if you want, but it tastes horrible. It tastes like im adding terrible hot chocolate and terrible coffee together and you get this dark brown gritty mixture that is not good at all . I do not recommend the Tim Hortons instant mocha mix. Do not buy it.

Interdental brushes are not a replacement for flossing, but an added way to keep your teeth free of plaque.However, I am not a fan of the yellow/moderate brushes for wider gaps between my teeth.  Three times, the wire brush has snapped off from its base.  The wire doesn't have enough flexibility or it needs to be stronger.Replacing these brushes these yellow brushes that don't last long enough, could become costly at this rate.

Report
Shopper854.0 out of 5 stars
Fun if you're willing to purchase add-ins
Reviewed in Canada on December 19, 2023Style: Squishy MakerVerified Purchase
I bought this for my daughter's 7th birthday. The kit comes with curling ribbon (useless), 2 packs of tissue paper confetti (also useless- why would anyone think this would be good in liquid?), and 2 packs of plastic, shiny confetti (useful). So, most of the decorative elements were very cheap and throw-aways. Even though all of the promotional images of this toy show brightly colored squishies, it does not come with any type of coloring- that was disappointing. To make this more fun and a lengthier activity, I would suggest having food coloring and additional glitter + add-ins. I bought a variety pack of add-ins on Amazon which included multiple types of glitter, plastic beads, confetti in various shapes, foam beads, and clay/polymer shapes- advertised as slime add-ins. This toy wouldn't have been nearly as fun without the additional items I purchased- my daughter loves thinking of themes and adding tons of glitter, confetti, and a few drops food coloring to her squishies. The first two we made did bust within an hour of play- I started noticing tiny holes where the insides were leaking through and they eventually burst open. They were also leaking through the top, as the included clips do not create a great seal, especially if your child keeps picking up the squishy from the end of the balloon, stretching out the twisted clipped part. I found that tying the end of the balloon in a knot was much more effective, and was more fun to squish without the hard plastic clip. It does take some practice to tie the balloon however, my fingers often hurt after a few tries of stretching the balloon enough to get a knot. The next 2 squishies we made were smaller (used the small size rather than medium), and gave my daughter instructions to not step on them anymore- those squishies are going on 3 weeks with no leaks! We store them in plastic bags just in case. These are a pain to clean out of carpet- make sure your child knows to put them into a bowl or bag after play!I do not find it that messy as compared to a lot of craft kits out there, unless of course your squishy bursts. Otherwise, all the things go inside the inflated balloon, you tie it up, and done. Not much clean up. Overall, a fun concept, and my daughter really loves it!
Read more

Report
Brittany C.5.0 out of 5 stars
It works!!
Reviewed in Canada on March 4, 2021Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase
Fully charged in half an hourCame fast and I thin 2 days through prime shipping which is always awesome, the faster the better!Box is great, accessories are great. To first use it you must charge it, a full charge only takes 30mins, yeah pretty sweet!! It’s a bit noisy but that doesn’t bother me much. I had to do thin sections bc if I went with bigger my hair would get stuck when I pulled down on the trimmer. How it works is you open the clamps, start at the top of your head, squeeze and slowly pull down til you reach the end. At this point there should be a few hairs so you can see that it’s working. Instantly noticed a difference after doing one section, it felt lighter and softer and looked better. My only complaint is that it needs to do a better job of containing the hair as there were little pieces all over my clothes and in the sink leaving me with that poking feeling. Overall I’d give this product 5 stars. It’s worth every penny and will save you money in the long run because you won’t have to go to a hair dresser to get your hair trimmed all the time and it doesn’t compromise length so that’s a bonus!

Dani Cornish5.0 out of 5 stars
A Game-Changer for ADHD Focus
Reviewed in Canada on April 3, 2024Verified Purchase
As a parent of a child with ADHD, finding effective tools to help manage distractions and improve focus has always been a priority. That's why I was thrilled to discover Loop Quiet Earplugs, and they have truly been a game-changer for both my daughter and myself.Initially purchased for my daughter, who struggles with ADHD-related sensory sensitivities, the Loop Quiet Earplugs quickly became an indispensable tool in her daily routine. The ability to drown out extra noise in the classroom or office environment has significantly improved her ability to concentrate and stay focused on tasks at hand. The difference in her attention span and productivity has been remarkable since incorporating Loop Quiet Earplugs into her daily routine.Inspired by my daughter's positive experience, I decided to try Loop Quiet Earplugs for myself, and I have been equally impressed with the results. As someone with ADHD, I often find myself easily distracted by background noise in busy environments. With Loop Quiet Earplugs, I can effectively block out distractions and create a quieter, more conducive workspace that allows me to focus on the task at hand.One of the standout features of Loop Quiet Earplugs is their effectiveness in reducing noise without completely blocking out all sound. This allows for a more natural listening experience while still providing the benefits of noise reduction. Additionally, the earplugs are comfortable to wear for extended periods, making them suitable for all-day use.While the performance of Loop Quiet Earplugs is exceptional, I do have one minor suggestion for improvement: a better case for storage and portability. A sturdier case would help ensure that users always have their Loop Quiet Earplugs on hand when they need them, whether at school, work, or on the go.In summary, Loop Quiet Earplugs are a must-have for anyone seeking to improve focus and concentration in noisy environments, particularly individuals with ADHD. Their effectiveness, comfort, and convenience make them an invaluable tool for managing sensory sensitivities and enhancing productivity. With just a small improvement to the case, Loop Quiet Earplugs would be the perfect solution for anyone in need of quiet, focused concentration.Pros:- Effective at reducing noise and improving focus- Comfortable for extended wear- Suitable for individuals with ADHD and sensory sensitivities- Allows for natural listening experienceCons:- Case could be sturdier for improved portabilityOverall, Loop Quiet Earplugs have been a game-changer for both my daughter and myself, and I highly recommend them to anyone looking to enhance focus and concentration in noisy environments.

                    The media could not be loaded.
                



 The loop quiet earplugs do great for what they are for. The packaging was great, well designed and gives a kinda premium unboxing experience. It’s great how it includes 4 different ear sizes too otherwise this would not fit me, and many other people. Once I found my size I put them on and they felt a little bit weird in my ears. I decided to see how they felt when I was laying down, and that also felt weird. I eventually got used to the feeling and these have been super comfortable since then. I love how these come with a case to hold them since these would be very easy to lose if they did not have one. The earplugs also do not come off unless you do it yourself so you don’t need to worry about them falling out. I would rate it five starts but I did have some. Minor complaints. Firstly the ear tips were difficult to put in when changing sizes and secondly the it is difficult to open the carrying case and you need to put the earplugs in a very specific position to fit in the case. They get rid of most of the noise around me but I can still hear the louder noises at a decreased volume. I will definitely recommend these to friends and family since these are the best earplugs I have ever used.Pros:-comfortable to wear even when sleeping-comes with different ear tip sizes- has case so to keep  the earplugs together-they are waterproof and can be cleaned by putting them under the sink-keep most sounds out and makes very loud sounds more quiet-great build qualityCons:-rubber band loop on case is very weak-difficult to take off and put on the ear tips-a bit overpricedOverall these are fantastic earplugs and work better than the other options out there. If you need earplugs than these will be your best option.
